ï»¿The Unclassed

by

[George Gissing]97-george gissing CHAPTER I

SCHOOL

There was strange disorder in [[Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford 's schoolroom]252-miss rutherford 's schoolroom , wo nt to be the abode of decorum . True , it was the gathering - time after the dinner - hour , and [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford [herself]98-miss rutherford was as yet out of sight ; but things seemed to be going forward of a somewhat more serious kind than a game of romps among [the children]253-the children . There were screams and sobbings , hysterical cries for help ; some of [the little girls]254-the little girls were crowding round an object in one corner of [the room]255-the room , [others]256-others appeared to be getting as far away from it as possible , hiding [their]256-others pale faces in [their]256-others hands , or looking at [one another]257-one another with terrified eyes . At length one more thoughtful than [the rest]258-the rest sped away out of [the room]255-the room , and stood at the bottom of the stairs , calling out [[her]98-miss rutherford teacher]260-her teacher 's name as loud as [she]98-miss rutherford could . A moment , and [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford came hastening down , with alarmed aspect , begging to be told what was the matter . But [the summoner]261-the summoner had turned and fled at the first sight of [the lady]262-the lady 's garments . [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford darted into [the schoolroom]263-the schoolroom , and at once there was quietness , save for half - choked sobs here and there , and a more ominous kind of moaning from the crowded corner .

" Gracious goodness , [children]3150-children , what is it ? Who 's that lying on the floor ? [Harriet Smales]99-harriet ! What ever has happened ? "[264-the cluster of children]

[The cluster of children]264-the cluster of children had fallen aside , exposing a strange picture . On the ground lay [a girl of twelve]265-a girl of twelve , [her]265-a girl of twelve face deadly pale , save in the places where it was dabbled with fresh blood , which still streamed from a gash on the right side of [her]265-a girl of twelve forehead . [Her]265-a girl of twelve eyes were half opened ; [she]265-a girl of twelve was just recovering consciousness ; a moan came from [her]265-a girl of twelve at intervals . [She]265-a girl of twelve had for support the lap and arms of [a little girl]266-a little girl , perhaps two years younger than [herself]265-a girl of twelve . Heedless of the flowing blood , [this child]267-this child was pressing [her]267-this child pale cheek against that of [the wounded one]268-the wounded one , whose name [she]265-a girl of twelve kept murmuring in pitiful accents , mixed with endearing epithets . So unconscious was [she]265-a girl of twelve of all around , that the falling back of [the other children]269-the other children did not cause [her]265-a girl of twelve to raise [her]265-a girl of twelve eyes ; neither was [she]265-a girl of twelve aware of [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford 's first exclamations , nor yet of the question which was next addressed to [her]265-a girl of twelve by [the horrified schoolmistress]270-the horrified schoolmistress .

" How did it happen ? Some of [you]271-the other pupils run at once for [a doctor]3151-a doctor [Dr. Williams]100-dr. williams in [Grove Road]1-grove road Oh , quick ! [Ida Starr]101-ida , how did it happen ? "[101-ida]

[Ida]101-ida did not move , but seemed to tighten [her]101-ida embrace . [The other pupils]271-the other pupils all looked fearfully hither and thither , but [none]272-none ventured to speak .

" [Ida]101-ida ! "[98-miss rutherford] repeated [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford , dropping on [her]98-miss rutherford knees by [the two]273-the two , and beginning to wipe away some of the blood with [her]98-miss rutherford handkerchief . " Speak , [child]3152-child ! Has [some one]3153-some one gone for [the doctor]3154-the doctor ? How was it done ? "[98-miss rutherford]

The face at length turned upon [the questioner]274-the questioner was almost as ghastly and red - stained as that it had been pressed against . But it had become self - controlled ; the dark eyes looked straight forward with an expression marvellously full of meaning in [one so young]275-one so young ; the lips did not tremble as [they]276-they spoke .

" [I]98-miss rutherford did it , [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford . [I]98-miss rutherford have killed [Harriet]99-harriet . [I]98-miss rutherford , and [nobody else]3155-nobody else . "[98-miss rutherford]

" [You]98-miss rutherford ? How , [child]3152-child ? "[98-miss rutherford]

" [I]98-miss rutherford killed [her]99-harriet with the slate , [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford ; this slate , look . "[98-miss rutherford]

[She]98-miss rutherford pointed to a slate without a frame which lay on the floor . There were sums worked on the uppermost side , and the pencil - marks were half obliterated . For a moment [the schoolmistress]277-the schoolmistress 's amazement held [her]98-miss rutherford motionless , but fresh and louder moans recalled [her]98-miss rutherford to the immediate necessities of the case . [She]98-miss rutherford pushed [Ida Starr]101-ida aside , and , with the help of [a servant - girl who had by this time appeared in [the room]255-the room]278-a servant - girl who had by this time appeared in the room , raised [the sufferer]280-the sufferer into a chair , and began to apply what remedies suggested [themselves]281-themselves . [The surgeon]282-the surgeon , whom [several of [the children]253-the children had hastened to seek , only lived a few yards away , and [[his]282-the surgeon assistant]285-his assistant]283-several of the children had hastened to seek , only lived a few yards away , and his assistant was speedily present . [Harriet Smales]99-harriet had quite recovered consciousness , and was very soon able to give [her]99-harriet own account of the incident . After listening to [her]98-miss rutherford , [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford turned to [the schoolchildren , who were now seated in the usual order on benches]286-the schoolchildren , who were now seated in the usual order on benches , and spoke to [them]286-the schoolchildren , who were now seated in the usual order on benches with some degree of calm .

" [I]98-miss rutherford am going to take [Harriet]99-harriet [home]3157-home . [Lucy Wood]102-lucy , [you]102-lucy will please to see that order is preserved in [my]98-miss rutherford absence ; [I]98-miss rutherford shall only be away twenty minutes , at the most . [Ida Starr]101-ida , [you]102-lucy will go up into [[my]98-miss rutherford sitting - room]3158-my sitting - room , and remain there till [I]98-miss rutherford come to [you]102-lucy . All take out [your]102-lucy copy - books ; [I]98-miss rutherford shall examine the lines written whilst [I]98-miss rutherford am away . "[98-miss rutherford]

[The servant , who had been despatched for a cab]287-the servant , who had been despatched for a cab , appeared at the door . [Harriet Smales]99-harriet was led out . Before leaving [the house]288-the house , [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford whispered to [the servant]289-the servant an order to occupy [herself]98-miss rutherford in [the sitting - room]290-the sitting - room , so as to keep [Ida Starr]101-ida in sight .

[Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford , strict disciplinarian when [her]98-miss rutherford nerves were not unstrung , was as good as [her]98-miss rutherford promise with regard to the copy - books . [She]98-miss rutherford had returned within the twenty minutes , and the first thing [she]98-miss rutherford did was to walk along all the benches , making a comment here , a correction there , in another place giving a word of praise . Then [she]98-miss rutherford took [her]98-miss rutherford place at the raised desk whence [she]98-miss rutherford was wo nt to survey [the little room]291-the little room .

There were present [thirteen pupils]292-thirteen pupils , the oldest of [them]292-thirteen pupils turned fifteen , [the youngest scarcely six]293-the youngest scarcely six . [They]292-thirteen pupils appeared to be [the daughters of [respectable people]295-respectable people]294-the daughters of respectable people , probably of [tradesmen in [the neighbourhood]297-the neighbourhood]296-tradesmen in the neighbourhood . [This school]298-this school was in [Lisson Grove]2-lisson grove , in [the north - west of [London]3-london]299-the north - west of london ; a spot not to be pictured from [its]298-this school name by [those ignorant of [the locality]301-the locality]300-those ignorant of the locality ; in point of fact [a dingy street]302-a dingy street , with a mixture of [shops]303-shops and [private houses]304-private houses . On the front door was a plate displaying [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford 's name , nothing more . [That lady]305-that lady [herself]305-that lady was middle - aged , grave at all times , kindly , and , be it added , fairly competent as things go in the world of [school]306-school . [The room]255-the room was rather bare , but the good fire necessitated by the winter season was not wanting , and the plain boarding of the floor showed itself no stranger to scrubbings . A clock hanging on the wall ticked very loudly in the perfect stillness as [the schoolmistress]277-the schoolmistress took [her]277-the schoolmistress seat .

[She]98-miss rutherford appeared to examine a book for a few moments , then raised [her]98-miss rutherford head , looked at the faces before [her]98-miss rutherford with a troubled expression , and began to speak .

" [I]98-miss rutherford wish to know who can give [me]98-miss rutherford any account of the way in which [Harriet Smales]99-harriet received [her]99-harriet hurt . Stop ! Hands only , please . And only those raise [their]310-pupils hands who actually saw the blow struck , and overheard all that led to it . [You]3159-you understand , now ? One , two , three seven altogether , that is quite enough . [Those seven]3160-those seven will wait in [the room]255-the room at four o'clock till [the others]3162-the others have all gone . Now [I]98-miss rutherford will give [the first class]3163-the first class [their]3160-those seven sums . "[98-miss rutherford]

The afternoon passed Very slowly to [teacher]309-teacher and [pupils]310-pupils alike . When the clock struck four , work was put away with more than the usual noise and hurry . [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford seemed for a time to be on the point of making some new address to [the school]311-the school before [the children]253-the children departed , but eventually [she]98-miss rutherford decided to keep silence , and the dismissal was got over as quickly as possible . [The seven witnesses]313-the seven witnesses remained , solemnly seated at [their]313-the seven witnesses desks , all anxious - looking .

" [Lucy Wood]102-lucy , "[98-miss rutherford] [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford began , when the door was closed and quiet , " [you]102-lucy are [the eldest]3164-the eldest . Please tell [me]98-miss rutherford all [you]102-lucy can of this sad affair . "[98-miss rutherford]

There was one of the seven faces far more discomposed than [the rest]258-the rest , [a sweet and spiritual little countenance]315-a sweet and spiritual little countenance ; it was tear - stained , red - eyed ; the eager look , the trembling lips spoke some intimate cause of sympathy . Before [the girl]316-the girl addressed had time to begin [her]316-the girl answer , [this other]317-this other , [one]318-one would have said in spite of [herself]318-one , intervened with an almost agonised question .

" Oh , [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford , is [Harriet]99-harriet really dead ? "[317-this other]

" Hush , hush ! "[262-the lady] said [the lady]262-the lady , with a shocked look . " No , [[my]262-the lady dear]3165-my dear , [she]99-harriet is only badly hurt . "[262-the lady]

" And [she]99-harriet really wo n't die ? "[320-the child] pleaded [the child]320-the child , with an instant brightening of look .

" Certainly not , certainly not . Now be quiet , [Maud]103-maud , and let [Lucy]102-lucy begin . "[320-the child]

[Lucy]102-lucy , [a sensible and matter - of - fact girl]321-a sensible and matter - of - fact girl , made a straightforward narration , the facts of which were concurred in by [[her]102-lucy companions]322-her companions . [Harriet Smales]99-harriet , it seemed , had been exercising upon [Ida]101-ida for some days [her]99-harriet utmost powers of irritation , teasing [her]101-ida , as [Lucy]102-lucy put it , " beyond all bearing . "[102-lucy] The cause of this was not unknown in [the school]311-the school , and [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford remembered the incident from which the malice dated . [Harriet]99-harriet had copied a sum in class from [Ida]101-ida 's slate [she]99-harriet was always copying from [somebody]324-somebody and [the teacher]325-the teacher , who had somehow detected [her]99-harriet , asked [Ida]101-ida plainly whether such was not the case . [Ida]101-ida made no reply , would not speak , which of course was taken as confirmatory evidence , and [the culprit]326-the culprit had accordingly received an imposition . [Her]99-harriet spleen , thus aroused , [Harriet]99-harriet vented upon [the other girl]327-the other girl , who , [she]99-harriet maintained , ought to have stoutly denied the possibility of the alleged deceit , and so have saved [her]99-harriet . [She]99-harriet gave poor [Ida]101-ida no rest , and [her]99-harriet persecution had culminated this afternoon ; [she]99-harriet began to " call [[Ida]101-ida 's mother]3166-ida 's mother names , "[99-harriet] the result of which was that [the assailed one]328-the assailed one suddenly snatched up [her]99-harriet slate , and , in an uncontrollable fit of passion , struck [[her]99-harriet tormentor]329-her tormentor a blow with it upon the forehead .

" What did [she]3166-ida 's mother call [[Ida]101-ida 's mother]3166-ida 's mother ? "[98-miss rutherford] inquired [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford , all at once changing [her]98-miss rutherford look curiously .

" [She]3166-ida 's mother called [her]3166-ida 's mother [a bad woman]3168-a bad woman . "[98-miss rutherford]

" Was that all ? "[98-miss rutherford]

" No , please , [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford , "[103-maud] put in [Maud]103-maud eagerly . " [She]3166-ida 's mother said [she]3166-ida 's mother got [her]3166-ida 's mother living in [the streets]3169-the streets . And it is n't true . [[Ida]101-ida 's mother]3166-ida 's mother 's [a lady]3171-a lady , and does n't sell things in [the streets]3169-the streets ! "[103-maud]

[The teacher]325-the teacher looked down and was silent .

" [I]325-the teacher do n't think [I]325-the teacher need ask any more questions , "[325-the teacher] [she]325-the teacher said presently . " Run away [home]3157-home all of [you]101-ida . What is it , [[my]325-the teacher dear]3165-my dear ? "[325-the teacher]

[Maud]103-maud , [she]103-maud was about eleven , and small for [her]103-maud age , had remained behind , and was looking anxiously up into [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford 's face .

" May [I]103-maud wait for [Ida]101-ida , please , "[103-maud] [she]103-maud asked , " and and walk [home]3157-home with [her]101-ida ? [We]3176-we go the same way . "[103-maud]

" Not to - night , [dear]3177-dear ; no , not to - night . [Ida Starr]101-ida is in disgrace . [She]101-ida will not go [home]3157-home just yet . Run away , now , there 's [a good girl]3179-a good girl . "[98-miss rutherford]

Sadly , sadly was the command obeyed , and very slowly did [Maud Enderby]103-maud walk along [the streets]3169-the streets homeward , ever turning back to see whether perchance [Ida]101-ida might not be behind [her]103-maud .

[Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford ascended to [[her]98-miss rutherford sitting - room]332-her sitting - room . [The culprit]326-the culprit was standing in a corner with [her]326-the culprit face to the wall .

" Why do [you]101-ida stand so ? "[325-the teacher] asked [the teacher]325-the teacher gravely , but not very severely .

" [I]325-the teacher thought [you]101-ida 'd want [me]325-the teacher to , [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford . "[325-the teacher]

" Come here to [me]325-the teacher , [child]3152-child . "[325-the teacher]

[Ida]101-ida had clearly been crying for a long time , and there was still blood on [her]101-ida face . [She]101-ida seemed to have made up [her]101-ida mind that the punishment awaiting [her]101-ida must be dreadful , and [she]101-ida resolved to bear it humbly . [She]101-ida came up , still holding [her]101-ida hands behind [her]101-ida , and stood with downcast eyes . The hair which hung down over [her]101-ida shoulders was dark brown , [her]101-ida eye - brows strongly marked , the eyes themselves rather deep - set . [She]101-ida wore a pretty plum - coloured dress , with a dainty little apron in front ; [her]101-ida whole appearance bespeaking a certain taste and love of elegance in [the person who had the care of [her]101-ida]335-the person who had the care of her .

" [You]335-the person who had the care of her will be glad to hear , "[98-miss rutherford] said [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford , " that [Harriet]99-harriet 's hurt is not as serious as [we]3181-we feared at first . But [she]99-harriet will have to stay at [home]3157-home for some days . "[98-miss rutherford]

There was no motion , or reply .

" Do [you]101-ida know that [I]277-the schoolmistress am quite afraid of [you]101-ida , [Ida]101-ida ? [I]277-the schoolmistress had no idea that [you]101-ida were so passionate . Had [you]101-ida no thought what harm [you]101-ida might do when [you]101-ida struck that terrible blow ? "[277-the schoolmistress]

But [Ida]101-ida could not converse ; no word was to be got from [her]101-ida .

" [You]101-ida must go [home]3157-home now , "[277-the schoolmistress] went on [the schoolmistress]277-the schoolmistress after a pause , " and not come back till [I]277-the schoolmistress send for [you]101-ida . Tell [[your]101-ida mother]3184-your mother just what [you]101-ida have done , and say that [I]277-the schoolmistress will write to [her]3184-your mother about [you]101-ida . [You]101-ida understand what [I]277-the schoolmistress say , [[my]277-the schoolmistress child]3185-my child ? "[277-the schoolmistress]

The punishment had come upon [her]101-ida . Nothing worse than this had [Ida]101-ida imagined ; nay , nothing so bad . [She]101-ida drew in [her]101-ida breath , [her]101-ida fingers wreathed themselves violently together behind [her]101-ida back . [She]101-ida half raised [her]101-ida face , but could not resolve to meet [[her]101-ida teacher]260-her teacher 's eyes . On the permission to go being repeated , [she]101-ida left [the room]255-the room in silence , descended the stairs with the slow steps of [an old person]339-an old person , dressed [herself]101-ida mechanically , and went out into [the street]340-the street . [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford stood for some time in profound and troubled thought , then sighed as [she]98-miss rutherford returned to [her]98-miss rutherford usual engagements .

The following day was Saturday , and therefore a half - holiday . After dinner , [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford prepared [herself]98-miss rutherford for walking , and left [home]3157-home . A quarter of an hour brought [her]98-miss rutherford to [a little out - of - the - way thoroughfare]342-a little out - of - the - way thoroughfare called [Boston Street]4-boston street , close to [the west side of [Regent 's Park]5-regent 's park]343-the west side of regent 's park , and here [she]98-miss rutherford entered [[a chemist]344-a chemist 's shop]345-a chemist 's shop , over which stood the name [Smales]99-harriet . [A middle - aged man of very haggard and feeble appearance]346-a middle - aged man of very haggard and feeble appearance stood behind the counter , and [his]346-a middle - aged man of very haggard and feeble appearance manner to [the lady]262-the lady as [she]262-the lady addressed [him]346-a middle - aged man of very haggard and feeble appearance was painfully subservient . [He]346-a middle - aged man of very haggard and feeble appearance spoke very little above a whisper , and as though suffering from a severe sore throat , but it was [his]346-a middle - aged man of very haggard and feeble appearance natural voice .

" [She]262-the lady 's better , [I]346-a middle - aged man of very haggard and feeble appearance thank [you]262-the lady , [madam]3186-madam ; much better , [I]346-a middle - aged man of very haggard and feeble appearance hope and believe ; yes , much better . "[346-a middle - aged man of very haggard and feeble appearance]

[He]346-a middle - aged man of very haggard and feeble appearance repeated [his]346-a middle - aged man of very haggard and feeble appearance words nervously , rubbing [his]346-a middle - aged man of very haggard and feeble appearance hands together feverishly the while , and making [his]346-a middle - aged man of very haggard and feeble appearance eye - brows go up and down in a curious way .

" Might [I]346-a middle - aged man of very haggard and feeble appearance see [her]262-the lady for a few moments ? "[346-a middle - aged man of very haggard and feeble appearance]

" [She]262-the lady would be happy , [madam]3186-madam , very happy : oh yes , [I]348-i am sure , very happy If if [you]262-the lady would have the kindness to come round , yes , round here , [madam]3186-madam , and and to excuse [[our]3189-our poor sitting - room]3190-our poor sitting - room . Thank [you]262-the lady , thank [you]262-the lady . [Harriet]99-harriet , [[my]348-i dear]3165-my dear , [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford has had the great , the very great , goodness to visit [you]262-the lady to visit [you]262-the lady personally yes . [I]348-i will leave [you]262-the lady , if if [you]262-the lady please h'm , yes . "[348-i]

[He]348-i shuffled away in the same distressingly nervous manner , and closed the door behind [him]348-i . [The schoolmistress]277-the schoolmistress found [herself]277-the schoolmistress in [a dark little parlour , which smelt even more of drugs than [the shop itself]351-the shop itself]350-a dark little parlour , which smelt even more of drugs than the shop itself . The window looked out into [a dirty back - yard]352-a dirty back - yard , and was almost concealed with heavy red curtains . As the eyes got accustomed to the dimness , [one]318-one observed that the floor was covered with very old oil - cloth , and that the articles of furniture were few , only the most indispensable , and all very shabby . Everything seemed to be dusty and musty . The only approach to an ornament was a framed diploma hanging over the mantelpiece , certifying that [John Alfred Smales]104-john alfred smales was [a duly qualified pharmaceutical chemist]354-a duly qualified pharmaceutical chemist . A low fire burned in the grate , and before it , in a chair which would probably have claimed the title of easy , sat [the girl [Harriet Smales]99-harriet]355-the girl harriet smales , [her]99-harriet head in bandages .

[She]355-the girl harriet smales received [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford rather sulkily , and as [she]355-the girl harriet smales moved , groaned in a way which did not seem the genuine utterance of pain . After a few sympathetic remarks , [the teacher]325-the teacher began to touch upon the real object of [her]325-the teacher visit .

" [I]325-the teacher have no intention of blaming [you]262-the lady , [Harriet]99-harriet ; [I]325-the teacher should not speak of this at all , if it were not necessary . But [I]325-the teacher must ask [you]262-the lady plainly what reason [you]262-the lady had for speaking of [[Ida Starr]101-ida 's mother]3192-ida starr 's mother as [they]3193-they say [you]262-the lady did . Why did [you]262-the lady say [she]3192-ida starr 's mother was [a bad woman]3168-a bad woman ? "[325-the teacher]

" It 's only what [she]3192-ida starr 's mother is , "[99-harriet] returned [Harriet]99-harriet sullenly , and with much inward venom .

" What do [you]262-the lady mean by that ? Who has told [you]262-the lady anything about [her]3192-ida starr 's mother ? "[99-harriet]

Only after some little questioning the fact was elicited that [Harriet]99-harriet owed [her]99-harriet ideas on the subject to [a servant girl in [the house]288-the house]357-a servant girl in the house , whose name was [Sarah]105-sally .

" What does [Sarah]105-sally say , then ? "[98-miss rutherford] asked [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford .

" [She]3192-ida starr 's mother says [she]3192-ida starr 's mother is n't respectable , and that [she]3192-ida starr 's mother goes about with [men]3195-men , and [she]3192-ida starr 's mother 's only [a common street - woman]3196-a common street - woman , "[316-the girl] answered [the girl]316-the girl , speaking evidently with a very clear understanding of what these accusations meant . [The schoolmistress]277-the schoolmistress looked away with a rather shocked expression , and thought a little before speaking again .

" Well , that 's all [I]277-the schoolmistress wanted to ask [you]99-harriet , [Harriet]99-harriet , "[277-the schoolmistress] [she]277-the schoolmistress said . " [I]277-the schoolmistress wo n't blame [you]99-harriet , but [I]277-the schoolmistress trust [you]99-harriet will do as [I]277-the schoolmistress wish , and never say such things about [any one]3197-any one again , whoever may tell [you]99-harriet . It is [our]3198-our duty never to speak ill of [others]256-others , [you]99-harriet know ; least of all when [we]3198-our know that to do so will be the cause of much pain and trouble . [I]277-the schoolmistress hope [you]99-harriet will very soon be able to come back again to [us]3198-our . And now [I]277-the schoolmistress will say good - bye . "[277-the schoolmistress]

In [the shop]361-the shop [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford renewed to [the chemist]362-the chemist [her]98-miss rutherford sincere regret for what had taken place .

" Of course [I]98-miss rutherford can not risk the recurrence of such a thing , "[98-miss rutherford] [she]98-miss rutherford said . " [The child who did it]3200-the child who did it will not return to [me]98-miss rutherford , [Mr. Smales]106-mr. smales . "[98-miss rutherford]

[Mr. Smales]106-mr. smales uttered incoherent excuses , apologies , and thanks , and shufflingly escorted [the lady]262-the lady to [[his]106-mr. smales shop]364-his shop - door .

[Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford went [home]3157-home in trouble . [She]98-miss rutherford did not doubt the truth of what [Harriet Smales]99-harriet had told [her]98-miss rutherford , for [she]98-miss rutherford [herself]98-miss rutherford had already entertained uneasy suspicions , dating indeed from the one interview [she]98-miss rutherford had had with [Mrs. Starr]107-mrs. starr , when [Ida]101-ida was first brought to [the school]311-the school , and deriving confirmation from a chance meeting in [the street]340-the street only a few days ago . It was only too plain what [she]98-miss rutherford must do , and the necessity grieved [her]98-miss rutherford . [Ida]101-ida had not shown any especial brilliancy at [her]101-ida books , but [the child]320-the child 's character was a remarkable one , and displayed a strength which might eventually operate either for good or for evil . With careful training , it seemed at present very probable that the good would predominate . But the task was not such as [the schoolmistress]277-the schoolmistress felt able to undertake , bearing in mind the necessity of an irreproachable character for [[her]277-the schoolmistress school]370-her school if it were to be kept together at all . The disagreeable secret had begun to spread ; all [the children]253-the children would relate the events of yesterday in [[their]253-the children own homes]372-their own homes ; to pass the thing over was impossible . [She]98-miss rutherford sincerely regretted the step [she]98-miss rutherford must take , and to which [she]98-miss rutherford would not have felt [herself]98-miss rutherford driven by any ill - placed prudery of [her]98-miss rutherford own . On Monday morning it must be stated to [the girls]373-the girls that [Ida Starr]101-ida had left .

In the meantime , it only remained to write to [Mrs. Starr]107-mrs. starr , and make known this determination . [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford thought for a little while of going to see [[Ida]101-ida 's mother]3166-ida 's mother , but felt that this would be both painful and useless . It was difficult even to write , desirous as [she]98-miss rutherford was of somehow mitigating the harshness of this sentence of expulsion . After half - an - hour spent in efforts to pen a suitable note , [she]98-miss rutherford gave up the attempt to write as [she]98-miss rutherford would have wished , and announced the necessity [she]98-miss rutherford was under in the fewest possible words .

CHAPTER II

[MOTHER]375-mother AND [CHILD

Ida Starr]101-ida , dismissed by [the schoolmistress]277-the schoolmistress , ran quickly homewards . [She]101-ida was unusually late , and [[her]101-ida mother]377-her mother would be anxious . Still , when [she]101-ida came within sight of the door , [she]101-ida stopped and stood panting . How should [she]101-ida tell of [her]101-ida disgrace ? It was not fear that made [her]101-ida shrink from repeating [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford 's message ; nor yet shame , though [she]101-ida would gladly have hidden [herself]101-ida away somewhere in the dark from every eye ; [her]101-ida overwhelming concern was for the pain [she]101-ida knew [she]101-ida was going to cause one who had always cherished [her]101-ida with faultless tenderness , tenderness which it had become [her]101-ida nature to repay with [a child]378-a child 's unreflecting devotion .

[[Her]101-ida home]379-her home was in [Milton Street]6-milton street . On the front - door was a brass - plate which bore the inscription : " [Mrs. Ledward]108-mrs. ledward , [Dressmaker]3201-dressmaker ; "[101-ida] in the window of the ground - floor was a large card announcing that " [Apartments]3202-apartments "[101-ida] were vacant . The only light was one which appeared in [the top storey]380-the top storey , and there [Ida]101-ida knew that [[her]101-ida mother]377-her mother was waiting for [her]101-ida , with tea ready on the table as usual . [Mrs. Starr]107-mrs. starr was seldom at [home]3157-home during [the child]320-the child 's dinner - hour , and [Ida]101-ida had not seen [her]377-her mother at all to - day . For it was only occasionally that [she]101-ida shared [[[her]101-ida mother]377-her mother 's bedroom]385-her mother 's bedroom ; it was the rule for [her]101-ida to sleep with [Mrs. Ledward]108-mrs. ledward , [the landlady]386-the landlady , who was [a widow and without children]387-a widow and without children . The arrangement had held ever since [Ida]101-ida could remember ; when [she]101-ida had become old enough to ask for an explanation of this , among other singularities in [their]388-their mode of life , [she]101-ida was told that [[her]101-ida mother]377-her mother slept badly , and must have the bed to [herself]377-her mother .

But the night had come on , and every moment of delay doubtless increased the anxiety [she]101-ida was causing . [Ida]101-ida went up to the door , stood on tiptoe to reach the knocker , and gave [her]101-ida usual two distinct raps . [Mrs. Ledward]108-mrs. ledward opened the door to [her]101-ida in person ; [a large woman , with pressed lips and eyes that squinted very badly]390-a large woman , with pressed lips and eyes that squinted very badly ; attired , however , neatly , and looking as good - natured as [a woman who was at once landlady and dressmaker]391-a woman who was at once landlady and dressmaker could be expected to look .

" How 's ' t [you]320-the child 're so late ? "[108-mrs. ledward] [she]108-mrs. ledward asked , without looking at [the child]320-the child ; [her]377-her mother eyes , as far as one could guess , fixed upon [the houses opposite]393-the houses opposite , [her]377-her mother hands in the little pocket on each side of [her]377-her mother apron . " [[Your]320-the child mother]3184-your mother 's poorly . "[377-her mother]

" Oh , then [I]101-ida shall sleep with [her]3184-your mother to - night ? "[101-ida] exclaimed [Ida]101-ida , forgetting [her]101-ida trouble for the moment in this happy foresight .

" [Dessay]109-dessay , "[108-mrs. ledward] returned [Mrs. Ledward]108-mrs. ledward laconically .

[Ida]101-ida left [her]101-ida still standing in the doorway , and ran [stairs]394-stairs . [The chamber]395-the chamber [she]101-ida went into after knocking and receiving permission to enter , according to the rule which had been impressed upon [her]101-ida was [a tolerably - furnished bedroom , which , with [its]396-a tolerably - furnished bedroom , which , with its bright fire , tasteful little lamp , white coverlets and general air of fresh orderliness bright fire , tasteful little lamp , white coverlets and general air of fresh orderliness]396-a tolerably - furnished bedroom , which , with its bright fire , tasteful little lamp , white coverlets and general air of fresh orderliness , made a comfortable appearance . The air was scented , too , with some pleasant odour of a not too pungent kind . But the table lacked one customary feature ; no tea was laid as it was wo nt to be at this hour . [The child]320-the child gazed round in surprise . [[Her]320-the child mother]377-her mother was in bed , lying back on raised pillows , and with a restless , half - pettish look on [her]377-her mother face .

" Where have [you]101-ida been ? "[377-her mother] [she]377-her mother asked querulously , [her]377-her mother voice husky and feeble , as if from a severe cold . " Why are [you]101-ida so late ? "[377-her mother]

[Ida]101-ida did not answer at once , but went straight to the bed and offered the accustomed kiss . [[Her]320-the child mother]377-her mother waved [her]101-ida off .

" No , no ; do n't kiss [me]377-her mother . Ca n't [you]101-ida see what a sore throat [I]377-her mother 've got ? [You]101-ida might catch it . And [I]377-her mother have n't got [you]101-ida any tea , "[377-her mother] [she]377-her mother went on , [her]377-her mother face growing to a calmer expression as [she]377-her mother gazed at [the child]320-the child " Ai n't [I]377-her mother [a naughty mother]3204-a naughty mother ? But it serves [you]101-ida half right for being late . Come and kiss [me]377-her mother ; [I]377-her mother do n't think it 's catching . No , perhaps [you]101-ida 'd better not . "[377-her mother]

But [Ida]101-ida started forward at the granted leave , and kissed [her]377-her mother warmly .

" There now , "[377-her mother] went on the hoarse voice complainingly , " [I]377-her mother should n't wonder if [you]101-ida catch it , and [we]3205-we shall both be laid up at once . Oh , [Ida]101-ida , [I]377-her mother do feel that poorly , [I]377-her mother do ! It 's the draught under the door ; what else can it be ? [I]377-her mother do , [I]377-her mother do feel that poorly ! "[377-her mother]

[She]101-ida began to cry miserably . [Ida]101-ida forgot all about the tale [she]101-ida had to tell ; [her]101-ida own eyes overflowed in sympathy . [She]101-ida put [her]101-ida arm under [[her]101-ida mother]377-her mother 's neck , and pressed cheek to cheek tenderly .

" Oh , how hot [you]101-ida are , [mother]375-mother ! Shall [I]101-ida get [you]101-ida a cup of tea , [dear]3177-dear ? Would n't it make [your]101-ida throat better ? "[101-ida]

" Perhaps it would ; [I]101-ida do n't know . Do n't go away , not just yet . [You]101-ida 'll have to be [a mother]3208-a mother to [me]101-ida to - night , [Ida]101-ida . [I]101-ida almost feel [I]101-ida could go to sleep , if [you]101-ida held [me]101-ida like that . "[101-ida]

[She]101-ida closed [her]101-ida eyes , but only for a moment , then started up anxiously .

" What am [I]101-ida thinking about ! Of course [you]101-ida want [your]101-ida tea . "[101-ida]

" No , no ; indeed [I]101-ida do n't , [mother]375-mother . "[101-ida]

" Nonsense ; of course [you]101-ida do . See , the kettle is on the bob , and [I]101-ida think it 's full . Go away ; [you]101-ida make [me]101-ida hotter . Let [me]101-ida see [you]101-ida get [your]101-ida tea , and then perhaps it 'll make [me]101-ida feel [I]101-ida could drink a cup . There , [you]101-ida 've put [your]101-ida hair all out of order ; let [me]101-ida smooth it . Do n't trouble to lay the cloth ; just use the tray ; it 's in the cupboard . "[101-ida]

[Ida]101-ida obeyed , and set about the preparations . Compare [her]101-ida face with that which rested sideways upon the pillows , and the resemblance was as strong as could exist between [two people of such different ages]402-two people of such different ages : the same rich - brown hair , the same strongly - pencilled eye - brows ; the deep - set and very dark eyes , the fine lips , the somewhat prominent jaw - bones , alike in both . [The mother]403-the mother was twenty - eight , [the daughter]404-the daughter ten , yet the face on the pillow was the more childish at present . In [the mother]403-the mother 's eyes was a helpless look , a gaze of unintelligent misery , such as one could not conceive on [Ida]101-ida 's countenance ; [her]101-ida lips , too , were weakly parted , and seemed trembling to a sob , whilst sorrow only made [the child]320-the child close [hers]320-the child the firmer . In the one case a pallor not merely of present illness , but that wasting whiteness which is only seen on [faces accustomed to borrow artificial hues]407-faces accustomed to borrow artificial hues ; in the other , a healthy pearl - tint , the gleamings and gradations of a perfect complexion . The one [a child long lost on weary , woful ways , knowing , yet untaught by , the misery of desolation]408-a child long lost on weary , woful ways , knowing , yet untaught by , the misery of desolation ; the other [a child still standing upon the misty threshold of [unknown lands]410-unknown lands]409-a child still standing upon the misty threshold of unknown lands , looking around for guidance , yet already half feeling that [the sole guide and comforter]411-the sole guide and comforter was within .

It was strange that talk which followed between [mother]375-mother and [daughter]413-daughter . [Lotty Starr]110-lotty that was the name of [the elder child]414-the elder child , and it became [her]110-lotty much better than any more matronly appellation , would not remain silent , in spite of the efforts it cost [her]110-lotty to speak , and [her]110-lotty conversation ran on the most trivial topics . Except at occasional moments , [she]110-lotty spoke to [Ida]101-ida as to one of [her]110-lotty own age , with curious neglect of the relationship between [them]415-them ; at times [she]110-lotty gave [herself]110-lotty up to the luxury of feeling like [an infant]416-an infant dependent on another 's care ; and cried just for the pleasure of being petted and consoled . [Ida]101-ida had made up [her]101-ida mind to leave [her]101-ida disclosure till the next morning ; impossible to grieve [[her]101-ida mother]377-her mother with such shocking news when [she]101-ida was so poorly . Yet [the little girl with difficulty]418-the little girl with difficulty kept a cheerful countenance ; as often as a moment 's silence left [her]418-the little girl with difficulty to [her]418-the little girl with difficulty own reflections [she]418-the little girl with difficulty was reminded of the heaviness of heart which made speaking an effort . To bear up under the secret thought of [her]101-ida crime and its consequences required in [Ida]101-ida Starr a courage different alike in quality and degree from that of which [children]3150-children are ordinarily capable . One compensation alone helped [her]101-ida ; it was still early in the evening , and [she]101-ida knew there were before [her]101-ida long hours to be spent by [[her]101-ida mother]377-her mother 's side .

" Do [you]377-her mother like [me]101-ida to be with [you]377-her mother , [mother]375-mother ? "[101-ida] [she]101-ida asked , when a timid question had at length elicited assurance of this joy . " Does it make [you]377-her mother feel better ? "[101-ida]

" Yes , yes . But it 's [my]101-ida throat , and [you]377-her mother ca n't make that better ; [I]101-ida only wish [you]377-her mother could . But [you]377-her mother are a comfort to [me]101-ida , for all that ; [I]101-ida do n't know what [I]101-ida should do without [you]377-her mother . Oh , [I]101-ida sha'n't be able to speak a word soon , [I]101-ida sha'n't ! "[101-ida]

" Do n't , do n't talk , [dear]3177-dear . [I]101-ida 'll talk instead , and [you]377-her mother listen . Do n't [you]377-her mother think , [[mother]375-mother dear]3213-mother dear , [I]101-ida could could always sleep with [you]377-her mother ? [I]101-ida would n't disturb [you]377-her mother ; indeed , indeed [I]101-ida would n't ! [You]377-her mother do n't know how quiet [I]101-ida lie . If [I]101-ida 'm wakeful ever [I]101-ida seem to have such a lot to think about , and [I]101-ida lie so still and quiet , [you]377-her mother ca n't think . [I]101-ida never wake [Mrs. Led ward]111-mrs. led ward , indeed . Do let [me]101-ida , [mother]375-mother ; just try [me]101-ida ! "[101-ida]

[Lotty]110-lotty broke out into passionate weeping , wrung [her]110-lotty hands , and hid [her]110-lotty face in the pillow . [Ida]101-ida was terrified , and exerted every effort to console this strange grief . The outburst only endured a minute or two , however ; then a mood of vexed impatience grew out of the anguish and despair , and [Lotty]110-lotty pushed away [the child]320-the child fretfully .

" [I]403-the mother 've often told [you]377-her mother , [you]377-her mother ca n't , [you]377-her mother must n't bother [me]403-the mother . There , there ; [you]377-her mother do n't mean any harm , but [you]377-her mother put [me]403-the mother out , bothering [me]403-the mother , [Ida]101-ida . Tell [me]403-the mother , what do [you]377-her mother think about when [you]377-her mother lay awake ? Do n't [you]377-her mother think [you]377-her mother 'd give anything to get off to sleep again ? [I]403-the mother know [I]403-the mother do ; [I]403-the mother ca n't bear to think ; it makes [my]403-the mother head ache so . "[403-the mother]

" Oh , [I]403-the mother like it . Sometimes [I]403-the mother think over what [I]403-the mother 've been reading , in the animal book , and the geography - book ; and and then [I]403-the mother begin [my]403-the mother wishing - thoughts . And oh , [I]403-the mother 've such lots of wishing - thoughts , [you]377-her mother could n't believe ! "[403-the mother]

" And what are the wishing - thoughts about ? "[403-the mother] inquired [the mother]403-the mother , in a matter - of - fact way .

" [I]403-the mother often wish [I]403-the mother was grown up . [I]403-the mother feel tired of being [a child]378-a child ; [I]403-the mother want to be [a woman]3216-a woman . Then [I]403-the mother should know so much more , and [I]403-the mother should be able to understand all the things [you]403-the mother tell [me]403-the mother [I]403-the mother ca n't now . [I]403-the mother do n't care for playing at games and going to [school]306-school . "[403-the mother]

" [You]403-the mother 'll be [a woman]3216-a woman soon enough , [Ida]101-ida , "[110-lotty] said [Lotty]110-lotty , with a quiet sadness unusual in [her]110-lotty . " But go on ; what else ? "[110-lotty]

" And then [I]403-the mother often wish [I]403-the mother was [a boy]3219-a boy . It must be so much nicer to be [a boy]3219-a boy . [They]3219-a boy 're stronger than [girls]3221-girls , and [they]3219-a boy know more . Do n't [you]403-the mother wish [I]403-the mother was [a boy]3219-a boy , [mother]375-mother ? "[403-the mother]

" Yes , [I]110-lotty do , [I]110-lotty often do ! "[110-lotty] exclaimed [Lotty]110-lotty . " [Boys]3224-boys are n't such a trouble , and [they]3224-boys can go out and shift for [themselves]3224-boys . "[110-lotty]

" Oh , but [I]101-ida wo n't be a trouble to [you]403-the mother , "[101-ida] exclaimed [Ida]101-ida . " When [I]101-ida 'm old enough to leave [school]306-school "[101-ida]

[She]101-ida interrupted [herself]101-ida , for the moment [she]101-ida had actually forgotten the misfortune which had come upon [her]101-ida . But [[her]101-ida mother]377-her mother did not observe the falling of [her]101-ida countenance , nor yet the incomplete sentence .

" [Ida]101-ida , have [I]110-lotty been [a bad mother]3226-a bad mother to [you]101-ida ? "[110-lotty] [Lotty]110-lotty sobbed out presently . " If [I]110-lotty was to die , would [you]101-ida be sorry ? "[110-lotty]

" [Mother]375-mother ! "[377-her mother]

" [I]110-lotty 've done [my]110-lotty best , indeed [I]110-lotty 've done [my]110-lotty best for [yon]3228-you ! How many [[mothers]3229-mothers like [me]110-lotty]3230-mothers like me would have brought [you]3228-you up as [I]110-lotty 've done ? How many , [I]110-lotty 'd like to know ? And some day [you]3228-you 'll hate [me]110-lotty ; oh yes , [you]3228-you will ! Some day [you]3228-you 'll wish to forget all about [me]110-lotty , and [you]3228-you 'll never come to see where [I]110-lotty 'm buried , and [you]3228-you 'll get rid of everything that could remind [you]3228-you of [me]110-lotty . How [I]110-lotty wish [I]110-lotty 'd never been born ! "[110-lotty]

[Ida]101-ida had often to comfort [[her]101-ida mother]377-her mother in [the latter]425-the latter 's fits of low spirits , but had never heard such sad words as these before . [The poor child]426-the poor child could say nothing in reply ; the terrible thought that [she]426-the poor child [herself]426-the poor child was bringing new woes to be endured almost broke [her]426-the poor child heart [She]426-the poor child clung about [[her]101-ida mother]377-her mother 's neck and wept passionately .

[Lotty]110-lotty shortly after took a draught from a bottle which [the child]320-the child reached out of a drawer for [her]110-lotty , and lay pretty still till drowsiness came on . [Ida]101-ida undressed and crept to [her]110-lotty side . [They]429-they had a troubled night , and , when the daylight came again , [Lotty]110-lotty was no better . [Ida]101-ida rose in anguish of spirit , torturing [herself]101-ida to find a way of telling what must be told . Yet [she]101-ida had another respite ; [[her]101-ida mother]377-her mother said that , as it was Saturday , [she]101-ida might as well stay away from [school]306-school and be [a little nurse]432-a little nurse . And the dull day wore through ; the confession being still postponed .

But by the last post at night came [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford 's letter . [Ida]101-ida was still sitting up , and [Lotty]110-lotty had fallen into a doze , when [the landlady]386-the landlady brought the letter [upstairs]434-upstairs . [The child]320-the child took it in , answered an inquiry about [[her]101-ida mother]377-her mother in a whisper , and returned to the bedside . [She]320-the child knew the handwriting on the envelope . The dreaded moment had come .

[She]320-the child must have stood more than a quarter of an hour , motionless , gazing on [[her]101-ida mother]377-her mother 's face , conscious of nothing but an agonised expectation of seeing [the sleeper]438-the sleeper 's eyes open . [They]439-they did open at length , and quickly saw the letter .

" It 's from [Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford , [mother]375-mother , "[101-ida] said [Ida]101-ida , [her]101-ida own voice sounding very strange to [herself]101-ida .

" Oh , is it ? "[110-lotty] said [Lotty]110-lotty , in the hoarse whisper which was all [she]110-lotty could command " [I]110-lotty suppose [she]101-ida wants to know why [you]101-ida did n't go . Read it to [me]110-lotty . "[110-lotty]

[Ida]101-ida read , and , in reading , suffered as [she]101-ida never did again throughout [her]101-ida life .

" [DEAR MRS . STARR]107-mrs. starr , [I]101-ida am very sorry to have to say that [Ida]101-ida must not return to [school]306-school . [I]101-ida had better leave the explanation to [herself]101-ida ; [she]101-ida is truthful , and will tell [you]107-mrs. starr what has compelled [me]101-ida to take this step . [I]101-ida grieve to lose [her]101-ida , but have really no choice . [I]101-ida am , [yours]107-mrs. starr truly ,[101-ida]

[H. RUTHERFORD]112-h. rutherford . "[112-h. rutherford]

No tears rose ; [her]101-ida voice was as firm as though [she]101-ida had been reading in class ; but [she]101-ida was pale and cold as death .

[Lotty]110-lotty rose in bed and stared wildly .

" What have [you]101-ida done , [child]3152-child ? what ever have [you]101-ida done ? Is is it anything about [me]101-ida . "[101-ida]

" [I]101-ida hit [Harriet Smales]99-harriet with a slate , and covered [her]99-harriet all over with blood , and [I]101-ida thought [I]101-ida 'd killed [her]99-harriet . "[101-ida]

[She]101-ida could not meet [[her]101-ida mother]377-her mother 's eyes ; stood with head hung down , and [her]101-ida hands clasped behind [her]101-ida .

" What made [you]101-ida do it ? "[110-lotty] asked [Lotty]110-lotty in amazement .

" [I]377-her mother could n't help it , [mother]375-mother ; [she]99-harriet [she]99-harriet said [you]101-ida were [a bad woman]3168-a bad woman . "[377-her mother]

[Ida]101-ida had raised [her]101-ida eyes with a look of love and proud confidence . [Lotty]110-lotty shrank before [her]101-ida , clutched convulsively at the bed - clothes , then half raised [herself]110-lotty and dashed [her]110-lotty head with fearful violence against the wall by which the bed stood . [She]110-lotty fell back , half stunned , and lay on the pillows , whilst [the child]320-the child , with outstretched hands , gazed horror - struck . But in a moment [Ida]101-ida had [her]101-ida arms around [the distraught woman]442-the distraught woman , pressing the dazed head against [her]101-ida breast . [Lotty]110-lotty began to utter incoherent self - reproaches , unintelligible to [her]110-lotty little comforter ; [her]110-lotty voice had become the merest whisper ; [she]110-lotty seemed to have quite exhausted [herself]110-lotty . Just now there came a knock at the door , and [Ida]101-ida was relieved to see [Mrs. Ledward]108-mrs. ledward , whose help [she]110-lotty begged . In a few minutes [Lotty]110-lotty had come to [herself]110-lotty again , and whispered that [she]110-lotty wished to speak to [the landlady]386-the landlady alone . [The latter]425-the latter persuaded [Ida]101-ida to go [downstairs]445-downstairs for a while , and [the child , whose tears had begun to flow]446-the child , whose tears had begun to flow , left [the room]255-the room , sobbing in anguish .

" Ai n't [you]101-ida better then ? "[448-the woman] asked [the woman]448-the woman , with an apparent effort to speak in a sympathetic tone which did not come easily to [her]110-lotty .

" [I]449-the other 'm very bad , "[449-the other] whispered [the other]449-the other , drawing [her]449-the other breath as if in pain .

" Ay , [you]101-ida 've got a bad cold , that 's what it is . [I]448-the woman 'll make [you]101-ida some gruel presently , and put some rum in it . [You]101-ida do n't take care of [yourself]101-ida : [I]448-the woman told [you]101-ida how it ' ud be when [you]101-ida came in with those wringin ' things on , on Thursday night . "[448-the woman]

" [They]3236-they 've found out about [me]110-lotty at [the school]311-the school , "[110-lotty] gasped [Lotty]110-lotty , with a despairing look , " and [Ida]101-ida 's got sent away . "[110-lotty]

" [She]101-ida has ? Well , never mind , [you]101-ida can find another , [I]448-the woman suppose . "[448-the woman]

" Oh , [I]110-lotty feel that bad ! If [I]110-lotty get over this , [I]110-lotty 'll give it up God help [me]110-lotty , [I]110-lotty will ! [I]110-lotty 'll get [my]110-lotty living honest , if there 's any way . [I]110-lotty never felt so bad as [I]110-lotty do now . "[110-lotty]

" Pooh ! "[448-the woman] exclaimed [the woman]448-the woman . " Wait a bit till [you]101-ida get rid of [your]101-ida sore throat , and [you]101-ida 'll think different . [They]451-they talked till [Lotty]110-lotty exhausted [herself]110-lotty again , then [Ida]101-ida was allowed to re - enter [the room]255-the room . Another night passed , and in the morning [Lotty]110-lotty seemed a little better . [Her]110-lotty throat was not so painful , but [she]110-lotty breathed with difficulty , and had a cough . [Ida]101-ida sat holding [[her]101-ida mother]377-her mother 's hand . [She]101-ida reached [Islington]10-islington without difficulty , and among [the bustling and loitering crowd which obstructs the corner]461-the bustling and loitering crowd which obstructs the corner at [the Angel]8-the angel , found some one to direct [her]101-ida to [the street]340-the street [she]101-ida sought . [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock was [an accountant]468-an accountant .

[She]101-ida rang the bell , and [a girl]469-a girl appeared . Yes , [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock was at [home]3157-home . [Ida]101-ida was told to enter [the passage]471-the passage , and wait .

A door at [her]101-ida right hand as [she]101-ida entered was slightly ajar , and voices could be heard from the other side of [it]472-it . One of these voices very shortly raised itself in a harsh and angry tone , and [Ida]101-ida could catch what was said .

" Well , [Mr.]3246-mr. What's - [your]3246-mr. - name , [I]101-ida suppose [I]101-ida know [my]101-ida own business rather better than [you]3246-mr. can teach [me]101-ida . It 's pretty clear [you]3246-mr. 've been doing [your]3246-mr. best for some time to set [the people]3247-the people against [me]101-ida , and [I]101-ida 'm damned if [I]101-ida 'll have it ! [You]3246-mr. go to [the place]3248-the place on religious pretences , and what [your]3246-mr. real object may be [I]101-ida do n't know ; but [I]101-ida do know one thing , and that is , [I]101-ida wo n't have [you]3246-mr. hanging about any longer . [I]101-ida 'll meet [you]3246-mr. [there]3249-there [myself]101-ida , and if it 's a third - floor window [you]3246-mr. get pitched out of , well , it wo n't be [my]101-ida fault . Now [I]101-ida do n't want any more talk with [you]3246-mr. . This is [most folks]3250-most folks ' praying - time ; [I]101-ida wonder [you]3246-mr. 're not at it . It 's [my]101-ida time for writing letters , and [I]101-ida 'd rather have [[your]3246-mr. room]3251-your room than [[your]3246-mr. company]3252-your company . [I]101-ida 'm [a plain - spoken man]3253-a plain - spoken man , [you]3246-mr. see , [a man of business]3254-a man of business , and [I]101-ida do n't mince matters . To come and dictate to [me]101-ida about the state of [[my]101-ida houses]3255-my houses and of [[my]101-ida tenants]3256-my tenants ai n't a business - like proceeding , and [you]3246-mr. 'll excuse [me]101-ida if [I]101-ida do n't take it kindly . There 's the door , and good morning to [you]3246-mr. ! "[101-ida]

The door opened , and [a young man , looking pale and dismayed]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed , came out quickly , and at once left [the house]288-the house . Behind [him]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed came [the last speaker]475-the last speaker . At the sight of [the waiting child]476-the waiting child [he]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed stood still , and the expression of [his]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed face changed from sour annoyance to annoyed surprise .

" Eh ? Well ? "[473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed] [he]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed exclaimed , looking closely at [Ida]101-ida , [his]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed eye - brows contracting .

[His]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed short and somewhat angry tone was evidently in some degree the result of the interview that had just closed , but also pretty clearly an indication of [his]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed general manner to [strangers]477-strangers . [He]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed let [the child]320-the child pass [him]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed , and followed [her]101-ida into [the room]255-the room with the letter in [his]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed hand . [He]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed did not seem able to remove [his]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed eyes from [her]101-ida face . [Ida]101-ida , on [her]101-ida side , did not dare to look up at [him]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed . [He]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed was [a massively built , grey - headed man of something more than sixty]480-a massively built , grey - headed man of something more than sixty . Everything about [him]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed expressed strength and determination , power alike of body and mind . [His]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed features were large and heavy , but the forehead would have become [a man of strong intellect]481-a man of strong intellect ; the eyes were full of astonishing vital force , and the chin was a physiognomical study , so strikingly did its moulding express energy of character . [He]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed was clean - shaven , and scarcely a seam or wrinkle anywhere broke the hard , smooth surface of [his]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed visage , its complexion clear and rosy as that of [a child]378-a child .

Still regarding [Ida]101-ida , [he]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed tore open the envelope . At the sight of the writing [he]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed , not exactly started , but moved [his]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed head rather suddenly , and again turned [his]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed eyes upon [the messenger]483-the messenger .

" Sit down , "[473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed] [he]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed said , pointing to a chair . [The room]255-the room was [an uncomfortable office]485-an uncomfortable office , with no fire . [He]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed [himself]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed took a seat deliberately at a desk , whence [he]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed could watch [Ida]101-ida , and began to read . As [he]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed did so , [his]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed face remained unmoved , but [he]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed looked away occasionally , as if to reflect .

" What 's [your]101-ida name ? " [Ida]101-ida , [sir]3257-sir , [Ida Starr]101-ida . "[473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed]

" [Starr]101-ida , eh ? "[473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed] [He]473-a young man , looking pale and dismayed looked at [her]101-ida very keenly , and , still looking , and still tearing up the letter , went on in a hard , unmodulated voice . " Well , [Ida Starr]101-ida , it seems [[your]101-ida mother]3184-your mother wants to put [you]101-ida in the way of earning [your]101-ida living .
