[Waymark]130-waymark helped the conversation by offering a cup of coffee , which [he]130-waymark [himself]130-waymark made .

" [You]851-his visitor smoke , [I]130-waymark hope ? "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark asked , reaching some cigars from the mantelpiece .

[Julian]118-julian shook [his]118-julian head , with a smile .

" No ? How on earth do [you]130-waymark support existence ? At all events , [you]130-waymark do n't , as the railway - carriage phrase has it , object to smoking ? "[118-julian]

" Not at all . [I]118-julian like the scent , but was never tempted to go further . "[118-julian]

[Waymark]130-waymark filled [his]130-waymark pipe , and made [himself]130-waymark conformable in a low cane - bottom chair , which had stood folded - up against the wall . Talk began to range over very various topics , [Waymark]130-waymark leading the way , [[his]130-waymark visitor]851-his visitor only gradually venturing to take the initiative . [Theatres]132-theatres were mentioned , but [Julian]118-julian knew little of them ; recent books , but with these [he]118-julian had small acquaintance ; politics , but in these [he]118-julian had clearly no interest .

" That 's a point of contact , at all events , "[130-waymark] exclaimed [Waymark]130-waymark . " [I]130-waymark detest the very name of Parliament , and could as soon read [Todhunter]133-todhunter on Conic Sections as the reports of a debate . Perhaps [you]130-waymark 're [a mathematician]3371-a mathematician ? "[130-waymark] This with a smile .

" By no means , "[130-waymark] was the reply . " In fact , "[118-julian] [Casti]118-julian went on , " [I]118-julian 'm afraid [you]130-waymark begin to think [my]118-julian interests are very narrow indeed . [My]118-julian opportunities have been small . [I]118-julian left [a very ordinary school]3372-a very ordinary school at fourteen , and what knowledge [I]118-julian have since got has come from [my]118-julian own efforts . [I]118-julian am sure the profit from [our]3373-our intercourse would be entirely on [my]118-julian side . [I]118-julian have the wish to go in for many things , however , "[118-julian]

" Oh , "[130-waymark] broke in the other , " do n't suppose that [I]130-waymark am [a scholar in any sense of the word]3374-a scholar in any sense of the word , or [a man of more than average culture]3375-a man of more than average culture . [My]130-waymark own regular education came to an end pretty much at the same age , and only a certain stubbornness has forced [me]130-waymark into an intellectual life , if [you]130-waymark can call it so . Not much intellect required in [my]130-waymark every - day business , at all events . [The school in which [I]130-waymark teach]3376-the school in which i teach is a fair type of [the middle - class commercial ' academy]3377-the middle - class commercial ' academy ; ' [the headmaster]3378-the headmaster [a nincompoop and charlatan]3379-a nincompoop and charlatan , [[my]130-waymark fellow - assistants poor creatures , who must live]3380-my fellow - assistants poor creatures , who must live , [I]130-waymark suppose , though one does n't well understand why . [I]130-waymark had always a liking for Greek and Latin and can make shift to read both in a way satisfactory to [myself]130-waymark , though [I]130-waymark dare say it would n't go for much with [college examiners]3381-college examiners . Then , as for [my]130-waymark scribbling , well , it has scarcely yet passed the amateur stage . It will some day ; simply because [I]130-waymark 've made up [my]130-waymark mind that it shall ; but as yet [I]130-waymark have n't got beyond a couple of weak articles in weak magazines , and [I]130-waymark do n't exactly feel sure of [my]130-waymark way . [I]130-waymark rather think [we]3382-we shall approach most nearly in [our]3382-we taste for poetry . [I]130-waymark liked much what [you]3383-you had to say about [Keats]128-keats . It decided [me]130-waymark that [we]3382-we ought to go on . "[130-waymark]

[Julian]118-julian looked up with a bright smile .

" What did [you]3383-you think at first of [my]130-waymark advertisement , eh ? "[130-waymark] cried [Waymark]130-waymark , with a sudden burst of loud laughter . " Queer idea , was n't it ? "[130-waymark]

" It came upon [me]130-waymark curiously . It was so like a frequent thought of [my]130-waymark own actually carried out . "[130-waymark]

" It was ? [You]3383-you have felt that same desperate need of congenial society ? "[130-waymark]

" [I]130-waymark have felt it very strongly indeed . [I]130-waymark live so very much alone , and have always done so . Fortunately [I]130-waymark am of a very cheerful disposition , or [I]130-waymark might have suffered much . [The young fellows]3384-the young fellows [I]130-waymark see every day have n't much intellect , it must be confessed . [I]130-waymark used to try to get [them]3384-the young fellows under the influence of [my]130-waymark own enthusiasms , but [they]3384-the young fellows did n't seem to understand [me]130-waymark . [They]3384-the young fellows care only for things which either repel [me]130-waymark , or are utterly without interest . "[130-waymark]

" Ha ! [you]3383-you understand what that means ! "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark had risen from [his]130-waymark low chair , and stood with [his]130-waymark back to the fire . [His]130-waymark eyes had a new life , and [he]130-waymark spoke in a strong , emphatic way which suited well with [his]130-waymark countenance . " [You]3383-you know what it is to have to do exclusively with [fools]3385-fools and [brutes]3386-brutes , to rave under the vile restraints of Philistine surroundings ? Then [you]3383-you can form some notion of the state [I]130-waymark was in when [I]130-waymark took the step of writing that advertisement ; [I]130-waymark was , [I]130-waymark firmly believe , on the verge of lunacy ! For two or three days [I]130-waymark had come back [home]3157-home from [the school]311-the school only to pace up and down [the room]255-the room in an indescribable condition . [I]130-waymark get often like that , but this time things seemed reaching a head . Why , [I]130-waymark positively cried with misery , absurd as it may sound . [My]130-waymark blood seemed too hot , seemed to be swelling out the veins beyond endurance . As a rule [I]130-waymark get over these moods by furious walking about [the streets]3169-the streets half through the night , but [I]130-waymark could n't even do that . [I]130-waymark had no money to go in for dissipation : that often helps [me]130-waymark . Every book was loathsome to [me]130-waymark . [[My]130-waymark landlady]3391-my landlady must have overheard something , for [she]3391-my landlady came in and began a conversation about God knows what ; [I]130-waymark fear [I]130-waymark mortally offended [her]3391-my landlady ; [I]130-waymark could have pitched [the poor old woman]3392-the poor old woman out of the window ! Heavens , how did [I]130-waymark get through those nights ? "[130-waymark]

" And the fit has passed ? "[118-julian] inquired [Julian]118-julian when the other ceased .

" [The Lord]3393-the lord be praised ; yes ! "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark laughed half - scornfully . " There came [an editor]3394-an editor 's note , accepting a thing that had been going from magazine to magazine for three months . This snatched [me]130-waymark up into furious spirits . [I]130-waymark rushed out to [a theatre]3395-a theatre , drank more than was good for [me]130-waymark , made a fool of [myself]130-waymark in general , and then received [your]3396-your letter . Good luck never comes singly . "[130-waymark]

[Julian]118-julian had watched the strange workings of [Waymark]130-waymark 's face with close interest . When [the latter]425-the latter suddenly turned [his]130-waymark eyes , as if to see the effect of all [his]130-waymark frankness , [Casti]118-julian coloured slightly and looked away , but with a look of friendly sympathy .

" Do [I]449-the other shock [you]118-julian ? "[449-the other] asked [the other]449-the other . " Do [you]118-julian think [me]449-the other rather too much of an animal , for all [my]449-the other spiritual longings ? "[449-the other]

" Certainly not , [I]118-julian can well understand [you]118-julian , [I]118-julian believe . "[118-julian]

The conversation passed to quieter things . [Julian]118-julian seemed afraid of saying too much about [his]118-julian own experiences , but found opportunities of showing [his]118-julian acquaintance with English poetry , which was quite as extensive as that of [[his]118-julian new friend]859-his new friend , excepting in the case of [a few writers of the day]860-a few writers of the day , whom [he]118-julian had not been able to procure . [He]118-julian had taught [himself]118-julian Italian , too , and had read considerably in that language . [He]118-julian explained that [[his]118-julian father]497-his father was [an Italian]686-an italian , but had died when [he]118-julian [himself]118-julian was still [an infant]416-an infant .

" [You]118-julian have been in [Italy]13-italy ? "[130-waymark] asked [Waymark]130-waymark , with interest .

A strange look came over [Julian]118-julian 's features , a look at once bright and melancholy ; [his]118-julian fine eyes gleamed as was their wo nt eight years ago , in [the back - parlour in [Boston Street]4-boston street]864-the back - parlour in boston street , when [he]118-julian was telling tales from [Plutarch]119-plutarch .

" Not , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian said , in a low voice charged with feeling , ' since [I]0-i was three years old . [You]865-you will think it strange , but [I]0-i do n't so much long for the modern [Italy]13-italy , for the beautiful scenery and climate , not even for [the Italy of [Raphael]134-raphael]23-the italy of raphael , or of [Dante]135-dante . [I]0-i think most of classical [Italy]13-italy . [I]0-i am [no scholar]866-no scholar , but [I]0-i love [the Latin writers]867-the latin writers , and can forget [myself]0-i for hours , working through [Livy]136-livy or [Tacitus]137-tacitus . [I]0-i want to see [the ruins of [Rome]14-rome]868-the ruins of rome ; [I]0-i want to see [the Tiber]24-the tiber , [the Clitumnus]25-the clitumnus , [the Aufidus]26-the aufidus , [the Alban Hills]27-the alban hills , [Lake Trasimenus]28-lake trasimenus , [a thousand places]869-a thousand places ! It is strange how those old times have taken hold upon [me]0-i . The mere names in Roman history make [my]0-i blood warm . And there is so little chance that [I]0-i shall ever be able to go [there]3249-there ; so little chance . "[130-waymark]

[Waymark]130-waymark had watched the glowing face with some surprise .

" Why , this is famous ! "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark exclaimed . " [We]3397-we shall suit [each other]459-each other splendidly . Who knows ? [We]3397-we may see [Italy]13-italy together , and look back upon these times of miserable struggle . By the by , have [you]118-julian ever written verses ? "[130-waymark]

[Julian]118-julian reddened , like [a girl]469-a girl .

" [I]118-julian have tried to , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian said .

" And do still ? "[130-waymark]

" Sometimes . "[130-waymark]

" [I]130-waymark thought as much . Some day [you]118-julian shall let [me]130-waymark hear them ; wo n't [you]118-julian ? And [I]130-waymark will read [you]118-julian some of [my]130-waymark own . But [mine]130-waymark are in the savage vein , a mere railing against [the universe]3399-the universe , altogether too furious to be anything like poetry ; [I]130-waymark know that well enough . [I]130-waymark have long since made up [my]130-waymark mind to stick to prose ; it is the true medium for [a polemical egotist]3400-a polemical egotist . [I]130-waymark want to find some new form of satire ; [I]130-waymark feel capabilities that way which shall by no means rust unused . It has pleased [Heaven]138-heaven to give [me]130-waymark a splenetic disposition , and some day or other [I]130-waymark shall find the tongue . "[130-waymark]

It was midnight before [Julian]118-julian rose to leave , and [he]118-julian was surprised when [he]118-julian discovered how time had flown . [Waymark]130-waymark insisted on [[his]130-waymark guest]872-his guest 's having some supper before setting out on [his]130-waymark walk [home]3157-home ; [he]130-waymark brought out of a cupboard a tin of Australian mutton , which , with bread and pickles , afforded a very tolerable meal after four hours ' talk . [They]874-they then left [the house]288-the house together , and [Waymark]130-waymark accompanied [[his]130-waymark friend]876-his friend as far as [Westminster Bridge]29-westminster bridge .

" It 's too bad to have brought [you]130-waymark so far at this hour , "[118-julian] said [Julian]118-julian , as [they]874-they parted .

" Oh , it is [my]130-waymark hour for walking , "[130-waymark] was the reply . " [London]3-london streets at night are [my]130-waymark element . Depend upon it , [Rome]14-rome was poor in comparison ! "[130-waymark]

[He]130-waymark went off laughing and waving [his]130-waymark hand .

CHAPTER VII

BETWEEN OLD AND NEW

[[Julian Casti]118-julian 's uncle]877-julian casti 's uncle had been three years dead . It was well for [him]130-waymark that [he]130-waymark lived no longer ; [his]130-waymark business had continued to dwindle , and the last months of [the poor man]878-the poor man 's life were embittered by the prospect of inevitable bankruptcy . [He]130-waymark died of an overdose of some opiate , which the anguish of sleeplessness brought [him]130-waymark into the habit of taking . Suicide it might have been , yet that was scarcely probable ; [he]130-waymark was too anxious on [[his]130-waymark daughter]679-his daughter 's account to abandon [her]679-his daughter in this way , for certainly [his]130-waymark death could be nothing to [her]679-his daughter profit . [Julian]118-julian was then already eighteen , and quickly succeeded in getting a situation . [Harriet Smales]99-harriet left [London]3-london , and went to live with [[her]99-harriet sole relative]880-her sole relative , except [Julian]118-julian , [an aunt who kept [[a stationer]882-a stationer 's shop in [Colchester]30-colchester]883-a stationer 's shop in colchester]881-an aunt who kept a stationer 's shop in colchester . [She]99-harriet was taught the business , and assisted [[her]99-harriet aunt]737-her aunt for more than two years , when , growing tired of the life of [a country town]885-a country town , [she]99-harriet returned to [London]3-london , and succeeded in getting a place at [[a stationer]882-a stationer 's in [Gray 's Inn Road]31-gray 's inn road]887-a stationer 's in gray 's inn road . This was six months ago . Having thus established [herself]99-harriet , [she]99-harriet wrote to [Julian]118-julian , and told [him]118-julian where [she]99-harriet was .

[Julian]118-julian never forgot the promise [he]118-julian had made to [[his]118-julian uncle]699-his uncle that Christmas night , eight years ago , when [he]118-julian was [a lad of thirteen]889-a lad of thirteen . [Harriet]99-harriet [he]118-julian had always regarded as [[his]118-julian sister]695-his sister , and never yet had [he]118-julian failed in brotherly duty to [her]99-harriet . When [the girl]316-the girl left [Colchester]30-colchester , [she]316-the girl was on rather bad terms with [[her]316-the girl aunt]737-her aunt , and [the latter]425-the latter wrote to [Julian]118-julian , saying that [she]425-the latter knew nothing of [Harriet]99-harriet 's object in going to [London]3-london , but that it was certainly advisable that [some friend]894-some friend should be at hand , if possible , to give [her]425-the latter advice ; though advice [she]425-the latter went on to say was seldom acceptable to [Harriet]99-harriet . This letter alarmed [Julian]118-julian , as it was the first [he]118-julian had heard of [[his]118-julian cousin]895-his cousin 's new step ; the letter from [herself]316-the girl at the end of a week 's time greatly relieved [him]118-julian , and [he]118-julian went off as soon as possible to see [her]316-the girl . [He]118-julian found [her]316-the girl living in [the house]288-the house where [she]316-the girl was engaged , apparently with [decent people]897-decent people , and moderately contented ; more than this could never be said of [the girl]316-the girl . Since then , [he]118-julian had seen [her]316-the girl at least once every week . Sometimes [he]118-julian visited [her]316-the girl at [the shop]361-the shop ; when the weather was fine , [they]900-they spent the Sunday afternoon in walking together . [Harriet]99-harriet 's health seemed to have improved since [her]99-harriet return to [town]901-town . Previously , as in [her]99-harriet childhood , [she]99-harriet had always been more or less ailing . From both [father]902-father and [mother]375-mother [she]99-harriet had inherited an unhealthy body ; there was a scrofulous tendency in [her]99-harriet constitution , and the slightest casual ill - health , a cold or any trifling accident , always threatened [her]99-harriet with serious results . [She]99-harriet was of mind corresponding to [her]99-harriet body ; restless , self - willed , discontented , sour - tempered , querulous . [She]99-harriet certainly used no special pains to hide these faults from [Julian]118-julian , perhaps was not [herself]99-harriet sufficiently conscious of them , but [the young man]818-the young man did not seem to be repelled by [her]99-harriet imperfections ; [he]818-the young man invariably treated [her]99-harriet with gentle forbearance , pitied [her]99-harriet sufferings , did many a graceful little kindness in hope of pleasing [her]99-harriet .

The first interview between [Julian]118-julian and [Waymark]130-waymark was followed by a second a few days after , when it was agreed that [they]905-they should spend each Sunday evening together in [Kennington]22-kennington ; [Julian]118-julian had [no room in which [he]118-julian could well receive [visitors]907-visitors]906-no room in which he could well receive visitors . The next Sunday proved fine ; [Julian]118-julian planned to take [Harriet]99-harriet for a walk in the afternoon , then , after accompanying [her]99-harriet [home]3157-home , to proceed to [Walcot Square]21-walcot square . As was usual on these occasions , [he]118-julian was to meet [[his]118-julian cousin]895-his cousin at [the Holborn end of [Gray 's Inn Road]31-gray 's inn road]910-the holborn end of gray 's inn road , and , as also was the rule , [Harriet]99-harriet came some twenty minutes late . [Julian]118-julian was scrupulously punctual , and waiting irritated [him]118-julian not a little , but [he]118-julian never allowed [himself]118-julian to show [his]118-julian annoyance . There was always the same kind smile on [his]118-julian handsome face , and the pressure of [his]118-julian hand was warm .

[Harriet Smales]99-harriet was about a year younger than [[her]99-harriet cousin]911-her cousin . [Her]99-harriet dress showed moderately good taste , with the usual fault of a desire to imitate an elegance which [she]99-harriet could not in reality afford . [She]99-harriet wore a black jacket , fur - trimmed , over a light grey dress ; [her]99-harriet black straw hat had a few flowers in front . [Her]99-harriet figure was good and [her]99-harriet movements graceful ; [she]99-harriet was nearly as tall as [Julian]118-julian . [Her]99-harriet face , however , could not be called attractive ; it was hollow and of a sickly hue , even the lips scarcely red . Grey eyes , beneath which were dark circles , looked about with a quick , suspicious glance ; the eye - brows made almost a straight line . The nose was of a coarse type , the lips heavy and indicative of ill - temper . The disagreeable effect of these lineaments was heightened by a long scar over [her]99-harriet right temple ; [she]99-harriet evidently did [her]99-harriet best to conceal it by letting [her]99-harriet hair come forward very much on each side , an arrangement in itself unsuited to [her]99-harriet countenance .

" [I]99-harriet think [I]99-harriet 'm going to leave [[my]99-harriet place]3401-my place , "[99-harriet] was [her]99-harriet first remark to - day , as [they]912-they turned to walk westward . [She]99-harriet spoke in a dogged way with which [Julian]118-julian was familiar enough , holding [her]99-harriet eyes down , and , as [she]99-harriet walked , swinging [her]99-harriet arms impatiently .

" [I]911-her cousin hope not , "[911-her cousin] said [[her]99-harriet cousin]911-her cousin , looking at [her]99-harriet anxiously . " What has happened ? "[911-her cousin]

" Oh , [I]99-harriet do n't know ; it 's always the same ; [people]3402-people treat [you]3403-you as if [you]3403-you was so much dirt . [I]99-harriet have n't been accustomed to it , and [I]99-harriet do n't see why [I]99-harriet should begin now . [I]99-harriet can soon enough get [a new shop]3404-a new shop . "[99-harriet]

" Has [Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle been unkind to [you]118-julian ? "[911-her cousin]

" Oh , [I]99-harriet do n't know , and [I]99-harriet do n't much care . [You]3403-you 're expected to slave just the same , day after day , whether [you]3403-you 're feeling well or not . "[99-harriet]

This indirect and querulous mode of making known [her]99-harriet grievances was characteristic of [the girl]316-the girl . [Julian]118-julian bore with it very patiently .

" Have n't [you]316-the girl been feeling well ? "[118-julian] [he]118-julian asked , with the same kindness .

" Well , no , [I]911-her cousin have n't . [My]911-her cousin head fairly splits now , and this sun is n't likely to make it any better . "[911-her cousin]

" Let [us]3405-us cross to [the shady side]3406-the shady side . "[911-her cousin]

" ' Twon't make any difference ; [I]911-her cousin ca n't run to get out of the way of horses . "[911-her cousin]

[Julian]118-julian was silent for a little .

" Why did n't [you]118-julian write to [me]99-harriet in the week ? "[99-harriet] [she]99-harriet asked presently . " [I]99-harriet 'm sure it would be a relief to hear from [somebody]324-somebody sometimes . It 's like a year from one Sunday to another . "[99-harriet]

" Did [I]118-julian promise to write ? [I]118-julian really did n't remember having done so ; [I]118-julian 'm very sorry . [I]118-julian might have told [you]99-harriet about [a new friend [I]118-julian 've got]3408-a new friend i 've got . "[118-julian]

[Harriet]99-harriet looked sharply into [his]118-julian face . [Julian]118-julian had made no mention of [Waymark]130-waymark on the preceding Sunday ; it had been a rainy day , and [they]915-we had only spent a few minutes together in the parlour which [Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle , [the keeper of [the shop]361-the shop]916-the keeper of the shop , allowed [them]915-we to use on these occasions .

" What sort of [a friend]3409-a friend ? "[316-the girl] [the girl]316-the girl inquired rather sourly .

" [A very pleasant fellow]3410-a very pleasant fellow , rather older than [myself]316-the girl ; [I]316-the girl made [his]3410-a very pleasant fellow acquaintance by chance . "[316-the girl]

[Julian]118-julian avoided reference to the real circumstances . [He]118-julian knew well the difficulty of making [Harriet]99-harriet understand [them]919-them .

" [We]915-we are going to see [each other]459-each other every Sunday , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian went on .

" Then [I]118-julian suppose [you]316-the girl 'll give up coming for [me]118-julian ? "[118-julian]

" Oh no , not at all . [I]118-julian shall see [him]3410-a very pleasant fellow at night always , after [I]118-julian have left [you]316-the girl . "[118-julian]

" Where does [he]3410-a very pleasant fellow live ? "[118-julian]

" Rather far off ; in [Kennington]22-kennington . "[118-julian]

" What is [he]3410-a very pleasant fellow ? "[118-julian]

" [A teacher in [a school]3413-a school]3412-a teacher in a school . [I]118-julian hope to get good from being with [him]3410-a very pleasant fellow ; [we]915-we 're going to read together , and so on . [I]118-julian wish [you]316-the girl could find [some pleasant companion of the same kind]3414-some pleasant companion of the same kind , [Harriet]99-harriet ; [you]316-the girl would n't feel so lonely . "[118-julian]

" [I]118-julian dare say [I]118-julian 'm better off without [anybody]3415-anybody . [I]118-julian should n't suit [them]3415-anybody . It 's very [few people]3416-few people [I]118-julian do suit , or else [people]3402-people do n't suit [me]118-julian , one or the other . What 's [his]3410-a very pleasant fellow name , [[your]316-the girl new friend]3418-your new friend 's ? "[118-julian]

" [Waymark]130-waymark . "[118-julian]

" And [he]3410-a very pleasant fellow lives in [Kennington]22-kennington ? Whereabouts ? "[118-julian]

" In [Walcot Square]21-walcot square . [I]118-julian do n't think [you]118-julian know that part , do [you]118-julian ? "[118-julian]

" What number ? "[118-julian]

[Julian]118-julian looked at [her]920-i with some surprise . [He]118-julian found [her]920-i eyes fixed with penetrating observation upon [his]118-julian face . [He]118-julian mentioned the number , and [she]920-i evidently made a mental note of it . [She]920-i was silent for some minutes .

" [I]920-i suppose [you]118-julian 'll go out at nights with [him]3410-a very pleasant fellow ? "[920-i] was [her]920-i next remark .

" It is scarcely likely . Where should [we]3419-we go to ? "[920-i]

" Oh , [I]920-i do n't know , and [I]920-i do n't suppose it matters much , to [me]920-i . "[920-i]

" [You]118-julian seem vexed at this , [Harriet]99-harriet . [I]920-i 'm very sorry . Really , it 's [the first friend [I]920-i 've ever had]3420-the first friend i 've ever had . [I]920-i 've often felt the need of some such companionship . "[920-i]

" [I]920-i 'm [nobody]3421-nobody ? "[920-i] [she]920-i said , with a laugh , the first today .

[Julian]118-julian 's face registered very perfectly the many subtle phases of thought and emotion which succeeded each other in [his]118-julian mind . This last remark distressed [him]118-julian for a moment ; [he]118-julian could not bear to hurt [another]921-another 's feelings .

" Of course [I]118-julian meant [male friend]3422-male friend , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian said quickly . " [You]920-i are [[my]118-julian sister]3423-my sister . "[118-julian]

" No , [I]920-i 'm not , "[920-i] was the reply ; and , as [she]920-i spoke , [Harriet]99-harriet glanced sideways at [him]118-julian in a particularly unpleasant manner . [She]99-harriet [herself]99-harriet meant it to be pleasant .

" Oh yes , [you]99-harriet are , [Harriet]99-harriet , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian insisted good - humouredly . " [We]3424-we 've been [brother]3425-brother and [sister]3426-sister ever since [we]3424-we can remember , have n't [we]3424-we ? "[118-julian]

" But [we]3424-we are n't really , for all that , "[316-the girl] said [the girl]316-the girl , looking away . " Well , now [you]118-julian 've got [somebody else]3427-somebody else to take [you]118-julian up , [I]316-the girl know very well [I]316-the girl shall see less of [you]118-julian . [You]118-julian 'll be making excuses to get out of the rides when the summer comes again . "[316-the girl]

" Pray do n't say or think anything of the kind , [Harriet]99-harriet , "[118-julian] urged [Julian]118-julian with feeling . " [I]118-julian should not think of letting anything put a stop to [our]3424-we picnics . It will soon be getting warm enough to think of [the river]3428-the river , wo n't it ? And then , if [you]99-harriet would like it , there is no reason why [[my]118-julian friend]3429-my friend should n't come with [us]3424-we , sometimes . "[118-julian]

" Oh , nonsense ! Why , [you]99-harriet 'd be ashamed to let [him]3429-my friend know [me]316-the girl . "[316-the girl]

" Ashamed ! How can [you]99-harriet possibly think so ? But [you]99-harriet do n't mean it ; [you]99-harriet are joking . "[118-julian]

" [I]316-the girl 'm sure [I]316-the girl 'm not . [I]316-the girl should make mistakes in talking , and all sorts of things . [You]99-harriet do n't think much of [me]316-the girl , as it is , and that would make [you]99-harriet like [me]316-the girl worse still . "[316-the girl]

[She]923-her tossed [her]923-her head nervously , and swung [her]923-her arms with the awkward restlessness which always denoted some strong feeling in [her]923-her .

" Come , [Harriet]99-harriet , this is too bad , "[118-julian] [Julian]118-julian exclaimed , smiling . " Why , [I]118-julian shall have to quarrel with [you]99-harriet , to prove that [we]3430-we 're [good friends]3431-good friends . "[118-julian]

" [I]316-the girl wish [you]118-julian would quarrel with [me]316-the girl sometimes , "[316-the girl] said [the girl]316-the girl , laughing in a forced way . " [You]118-julian take all [my]316-the girl bad - temper always just in the same quiet way . [I]316-the girl 'd far rather [you]118-julian fell out with [me]316-the girl . It 's treating [me]316-the girl too like [a child]378-a child , as if it did n't matter how [I]316-the girl went on , and [I]316-the girl was n't anything to [you]118-julian . "[316-the girl]

Of late , [Harriet]99-harriet had been getting much into the habit of this ambiguous kind of remark when in [[her]99-harriet cousin]911-her cousin 's company . [Julian]118-julian noticed it , and it made [him]118-julian a trifle uneasy . [He]118-julian attributed it , however , to [the girl]316-the girl 's strangely irritable disposition , and never failed to meet such outbreaks with increased warmth and kindness of tone . To - day , [Harriet]99-harriet 's vagaries seemed to affect [him]118-julian somewhat unusually . [He]118-julian became silent at times , and then tried to laugh away the unpleasantness , but the laughter was not exactly spontaneous . At length [he]118-julian brought back the conversation to the point from which it had started , and asked if [she]99-harriet had any serious intention of leaving [Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle .

" [I]99-harriet 'm tired of being ordered about by [people]3402-people ! "[99-harriet] [Harriet]99-harriet exclaimed . " [I]99-harriet know [I]99-harriet sha'n't put up with it much longer . [I]99-harriet only wish [I]99-harriet 'd a few pounds to start [a shop for [myself]99-harriet]3434-a shop for myself . "[99-harriet]

" [I]118-julian heartily wish [I]118-julian had the money to give [you]118-julian , "[118-julian] was [Julian]118-julian 's reply .

" Do n't [you]118-julian save anything at all ? "[895-his cousin] asked [[his]118-julian cousin]895-his cousin , with affected indifference .

" A little ; very little . At all events , [I]99-harriet think [we]3435-we shall be able to have [our]3435-we week at [the seaside]3436-the seaside when the time comes . Have [you]118-julian thought where [you]118-julian 'd like to go to ? "[99-harriet]

" No ; [I]99-harriet have n't thought anything about it . What time shall [you]118-julian get back [home]3157-home to - night ? "[99-harriet]

" Rather late , [I]99-harriet dare say . [We]3435-we sit talking and forget the time . It may be after twelve o'clock . "[99-harriet]

[Harriet]99-harriet became silent again . [They]928-they reached [Hyde Park]32-hyde park , and joined [the crowds of people going in all directions about the walks]929-the crowds of people going in all directions about the walks . [Harriet]99-harriet had always a number of ill - natured comments to make on the dress and general appearance of [people]3402-people [they]928-they passed . [Julian]118-julian smiled , but with no genuine pleasure . As always , [he]118-julian did [his]118-julian best to lead [the girl]316-the girl 's thoughts away from [their]928-they incessant object , [hers]316-the girl , elf .

[They]928-they were back again at the end of [Gray 's Inn Road]31-gray 's inn road by half - past four .

" Well , [I]99-harriet wo n't keep [you]118-julian , "[99-harriet] said [Harriet]99-harriet , with the sour smile . " [I]99-harriet know [you]118-julian 're in a hurry to be off . Are [you]118-julian going to walk ? "[99-harriet]

" Yes ; [I]130-waymark can do it in about an hour . "[130-waymark]

[The girl]316-the girl turned away without further leave - taking , and [Julian]118-julian walked southwards with a troubled face .

[Waymark]130-waymark expected [him]118-julian to tea . At this , [their]928-they third meeting , [the two]273-the two were already on very easy terms . [Waymark]130-waymark did the greater share of the talking , for [Julian]118-julian was naturally of fewer words ; from the beginning it was clear that [the elder of [the friends]935-the friends]934-the elder of the friends would have the initiative in most things . [Waymark]130-waymark unconsciously displayed something of that egoism which is inseparable from force of character , and to the other this was far from disagreeable ; [Julian]118-julian liked the novel sensation of having a strong nature to rely upon . Already [he]118-julian was being led by [his]118-julian natural tendency to hero - worship into a fervid admiration for [[his]118-julian friend]876-his friend .

" What have [you]118-julian ' been doing with [yourself]118-julian this fine day ? "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark asked , as [they]928-they sat down to table .

" [I]118-julian always spend Sunday afternoon with [a cousin of mine]3438-a cousin of mine , "[118-julian] replied [Julian]118-julian , with the unhesitating frankness which was natural to [him]118-julian .

" Male or female ? "[118-julian]

" Female . "[118-julian] There was a touch of colour on [his]118-julian face as [he]118-julian met [the other]449-the other 's eye , and [he]118-julian continued rather quickly . " [We]928-they lived together always as [children]3150-children , and were only separated at [[my]118-julian uncle]3440-my uncle 's death , three years ago . [She]876-his friend is engaged at [[a stationer]882-a stationer 's shop]3442-a stationer 's shop . "[118-julian]

" What is [a fellow]3443-a fellow to do to get money ? "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark exclaimed , when [his]118-julian pipe was well alight . " [I]130-waymark 'm growing sick of this hand - to - mouth existence . Now if [one]318-one had a bare competency , what glorious possibilities would open out . The vulgar saying has it that ' time is money ; ' like most vulgar sayings putting the thing just the wrong way about . ' Money is time , ' [I]130-waymark prefer to say ; it means leisure , and all that follows . Why do n't [you]3445-you write a poem on Money , [Casti]118-julian ? [I]130-waymark almost feel capable of it [myself]130-waymark . What can claim precedence , in all [this world]3446-this world , over hard cash ? It is the fruitful soil wherein is nourished the root of the tree of life ; it is the vivifying principle of human activity . Upon it luxuriate art , letters , science ; rob [them]3447-them of its sustenance , and they droop like withering leaves . Money means virtue ; the lack of it is vice . [The devil]3448-the devil loves no lurking - place like an empty purse . Give [me]130-waymark a thousand pounds to - morrow , and [I]130-waymark become [the most virtuous man in [England]15-england]3449-the most virtuous man in england . [I]130-waymark satisfy all [my]130-waymark instincts freely , openly , with no petty makeshifts and vile hypocrisies . To scorn and revile wealth is the mere resource of splenetic poverty . What can not be purchased with coin of [the realm]3450-the realm ? First and foremost , freedom . [The moneyed man]3451-the moneyed man is [the sole king]3452-the sole king ; the herds of [the penniless]3453-the penniless are but as [slaves]3454-slaves before [his]3451-the moneyed man footstool . [He]3451-the moneyed man breathes with a sense of proprietorship in the whole globe - enveloping atmosphere ; for is it not in [his]3451-the moneyed man power to inhale it wheresoever [he]3451-the moneyed man pleases ? [He]3451-the moneyed man puts [his]3451-the moneyed man hand in [his]3451-the moneyed man pocket , and bids with security for every joy of body and mind ; even death [he]3451-the moneyed man faces with the comforting consciousness that [his]3451-the moneyed man defeat will only coincide with that of human science . [He]3451-the moneyed man buys culture , [he]3451-the moneyed man buys peace of mind , [he]3451-the moneyed man buys love . [You]3455-you think not ! [I]130-waymark do n't use the word cynically , but in very virtuous earnest . Make [me]130-waymark [a millionaire]3456-a millionaire , and [I]130-waymark will purchase the passionate devotion of [any free - hearted woman [the world]622-the world contains]3457-any free - hearted woman the world contains ! "[130-waymark]

[Waymark]130-waymark 's pipe had gone out ; [he]130-waymark re - lit it , with the half - mocking smile which always followed upon any more vehement utterance .

" That [I]130-waymark am poor , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark went on presently , " is the result of [my]130-waymark own pigheadedness . [[My]130-waymark father]3353-my father was [a stock - broker]3460-a stock - broker , in anything but flourishing circumstances . [He]3353-my father went in for some cursed foreign loan or other , [I]130-waymark know nothing of such things , and ruined [himself]3353-my father completely . [He]3353-my father had to take a subordinate position , and died in it . [I]130-waymark was about seventeen then , and found [myself]130-waymark alone in [the world]622-the world . [A friend of [[my]130-waymark father]3353-my father 's]3462-a friend of my father 's , also [a city man]3464-a city man , [Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock by name , was left [[my]130-waymark guardian]3465-my guardian . [He]3462-a friend of my father 's wanted [me]130-waymark to begin a business career , and , like [a fool]3466-a fool , [I]130-waymark would n't hear of it . [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock and [I]130-waymark quarrelled ; [he]3462-a friend of my father 's showed [himself]3462-a friend of my father 's worthy of [his]3462-a friend of my father 's name , and told [me]130-waymark plainly that , if [I]130-waymark did n't choose to take [his]3462-a friend of my father 's advice , [I]130-waymark must shift for [myself]130-waymark . That [I]130-waymark professed [myself]130-waymark perfectly ready to do ; [I]130-waymark was bent on an intellectual life , forsooth ; could n't see that the natural order of things was to make money first and be intellectual afterwards . So , lad as [I]130-waymark was , [I]130-waymark got a place as [a teacher]589-a teacher , and that 's been [my]130-waymark business ever since . "[130-waymark]

[Waymark]130-waymark threw [himself]130-waymark back and laughed carelessly . [He]130-waymark strummed a little with [his]130-waymark fingers on the arm of the chair , and resumed :

" [I]130-waymark interested [myself]130-waymark in religion and philosophy ; [I]130-waymark became [an aggressive disciple of free - thought]3468-an aggressive disciple of free - thought , as it is called . Radicalism of every kind broke out in [me]130-waymark , like an ailment . [I]130-waymark bought cheap free - thought literature ; to one or two papers of the kind [I]130-waymark even contributed . [I]130-waymark keep these effusions carefully locked up , for salutary self - humiliation at some future day , when [I]130-waymark shall have grown conceited . Nay , [I]130-waymark went further . [I]130-waymark delivered lectures at [[working - men]3469-working - men 's clubs]3470-working - men 's clubs , lectures with violent titles . One , [I]130-waymark remember , was called ' The Gospel of Rationalism . ' And [I]130-waymark was enthusiastic in the cause , with an enthusiasm such as [I]130-waymark shall never experience again . Can [I]130-waymark imagine [myself]130-waymark writing and speaking such things now - a - days ? Scarcely : yet the spirit remains , it is only the manifestations which have changed . [I]130-waymark am by nature combative ; [I]130-waymark feel the need of attacking the cherished prejudices of [society]3471-society ; [I]130-waymark have a joy in outraging what are called the proprieties . And [I]130-waymark wait for [my]130-waymark opportunity , which has yet to come . "[130-waymark]

" How commonplace [my]118-julian life has been , in comparison , "[118-julian] said [Julian]118-julian , after an interval of thoughtfulness .

" [Your]876-his friend nature , [I]130-waymark believe , is very pure , and therefore very happy . [I]130-waymark am what [Browning]140-browning somewhere calls a ' beast with a speckled hide , ' and happiness , [I]130-waymark take it , [I]130-waymark shall never know . "[130-waymark]

[Julian]118-julian could begin to see that [[his]118-julian friend]876-his friend took something of a pleasure in showing and dwelling upon the worst side of [his]118-julian own character .

" [You]876-his friend will be happy , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian said , " when [you]876-his friend once find [your]876-his friend true work , and feel that [you]876-his friend are doing it well . "[118-julian]

" But the motives , the motives ! Never mind , [I]942-the figure 've talked enough of [myself]942-the figure for one sitting . Do n't think [I]942-the figure 've told [you]876-his friend everything . Plenty more confessions to come , when time and place shall serve . Little by little [you]876-his friend will get to know [me]942-the figure , and by then will most likely have had enough of [me]942-the figure . "[942-the figure]

" That is not at all likely ; rather the opposite . "[118-julian]

When [they]939-they left [the house]288-the house together , shortly after eleven , [Julian]118-julian 's eye fell upon the dark figure of [a girl]469-a girl , standing by a gas - lamp on the opposite side of the way . [The figure]942-the figure held [his]118-julian gaze . [Waymark]130-waymark moved on , and [he]130-waymark had to follow , but still looked back . [The girl]316-the girl had a veil half down upon [her]316-the girl face ; [she]316-the girl was gazing after [the two]273-the two . [She]316-the girl moved , and the resemblance to [Harriet]99-harriet was so striking that [Julian]118-julian again stopped . As [he]118-julian did so , [the figure]942-the figure turned away , and walked in the opposite direction , till it was lost in the darkness .

[Julian]118-julian went on , and for a time was very silent .

CHAPTER VIII

ACADEMICAL

[The school in which [Osmond Waymark]129-waymark taught]946-the school in which osmond waymark taught was situated in " [a pleasant suburb of southern [London]3-london]3472-a pleasant suburb of southern london "[118-julian] [Brixton]33-brixton , to wit ; had [[its]946-the school in which osmond waymark taught ' spacious playground]947-its ' spacious playground and gymnasium " [the former]3473-the former [a tolerable back - yard]3474-a tolerable back - yard , the latter [a disused coach - house]3475-a disused coach - house ; and , as to educational features , offered , at the choice of [parents]3476-parents and [guardians]3477-guardians , either the solid foundation desirable for [those youths predestined to a commercial career]3478-those youths predestined to a commercial career , or the more liberal training adapted to [minds of a professional bias]3479-minds of a professional bias . Anything further in the way of information was to be obtained by applying to [the headmaster]3378-the headmaster , [Dr. Tootle]141-dr. tootle .[118-julian]

At present the number of [resident pupils]948-resident pupils was something under forty . The marvel was how so many could be accommodated in so small [a house]949-a house . [Two fair - sized bedrooms]950-two fair - sized bedrooms , and [a garret in which [the servants]952-the servants could not be persuaded to sleep]951-a garret in which the servants could not be persuaded to sleep , served as [dormitories for [the whole school]954-the whole school]953-dormitories for the whole school ; [the younger children]955-the younger children sleeping two together .

[Waymark]129-waymark did not reside on [the premises]956-the premises . For a stipulated sum of thirteen pounds per quarter [he]129-waymark taught daily from nine till five , with an interval of an hour and a half at dinner - time , when [he]129-waymark walked [home]3157-home to [Walcot Square]21-walcot square for such meal as the state of [[his]129-waymark exchequer]958-his exchequer would allow . [Waymark]129-waymark occupied [a prominent place in [Dr. Tootle]141-dr. tootle 's prospectus]959-a prominent place in dr. tootle 's prospectus . As [Osmond Waymark]129-waymark , B.A. , the degree was a bona fide one , of [London University]960-london university , [he]129-waymark filled the position of [Senior Classical Master]961-senior classical master ; anonymously [he]129-waymark figured as [a teacher of drawing and lecturer on experimental chemistry]962-a teacher of drawing and lecturer on experimental chemistry . [The other two masters]963-the other two masters , [resident]964-resident , were [Mr. O'Gree]142-o'gree and [Herr Egger]143-herr egger ; [the former]3473-the former , [teacher of mathematics]966-teacher of mathematics , [assistant classical master]967-assistant classical master , and [professor of gymnastics]968-professor of gymnastics ; [the latter]425-the latter , [teacher of foreign languages , of music , and of dancing]970-teacher of foreign languages , of music , and of dancing . [Dr. Tootle]141-dr. tootle took upon [himself]141-dr. tootle the English branches , and , of course , the arduous duty of general superintendence . [He]141-dr. tootle was [a very tall , thin , cadaverous , bald - headed man]971-a very tall , thin , cadaverous , bald - headed man . Somehow or other [he]141-dr. tootle had the reputation of having , at an earlier stage in [his]141-dr. tootle career , grievously over - exerted [his]141-dr. tootle brain in literary labour ; [parents]3476-parents were found , on the whole , ready to accept this fact as an incontestable proof of [the doctor]3154-the doctor 's fitness to fill [[his]141-dr. tootle present office]974-his present office , though it resulted in entire weeks of retreat from [the school - room]975-the school - room under the excuse of fearful headaches . [The only known product of the literary toil which had had such sad results]976-the only known product of the literary toil which had had such sad results was a very small English Grammar , of course used in [the school]311-the school , and always referred to by [the doctor]3154-the doctor as " [my]3154-the doctor little compendium . "[3154-the doctor]

Now and then , [Waymark]129-waymark sought refuge from the loneliness of [[his]129-waymark room]979-his room in a visit to [[his]129-waymark colleagues at [the Academy]981-the academy]980-his colleagues at the academy . [[The masters]982-the masters ' sitting - room]983-the masters ' sitting - room was not remarkable for cosiness , even when a fire burnt in the grate and the world of [school]306-school was for the time shut out . The floor was uncarpeted , the walls illustrated only with a few maps and diagrams . There was a piano , whereon [Herr Egger]143-herr egger gave [his]143-herr egger music lessons . [Few rooms in existence]985-few rooms in existence could have excelled this for draughts ; at all times there came beneath the door a current of wind which pierced the legs like a knife ; impossible to leave loose papers anywhere with a chance of finding them in the same place two minutes after .

When [Waymark]129-waymark entered this evening , [he]129-waymark found [[his]129-waymark colleagues]986-his colleagues seated together in silence . [Mr. Philip]144-philip O'Gree " fill - up "[144-philip] was [his]144-philip own pronunciation of the name would have been worse than insignificant in appearance , but for the expression of good - humour and geniality which possessed [his]144-philip irregular features . [He]144-philip was red - headed , and had large red whiskers .

[Herr Egger]143-herr egger was [a gentleman of very different exterior]987-a gentleman of very different exterior . Tall , thick , ungainly , with a very heavy , stupid face , coarse hands , outrageous lower extremities . A mass of coal - black hair seemed to weigh down [his]143-herr egger head . [His]144-philip attire was un - English , and , one might suspect , had been manufactured in [some lonely cottage away in [the remote Swiss valley]989-the remote swiss valley which had till lately been [the poor fellow]990-the poor fellow 's home]988-some lonely cottage away in the remote swiss valley which had till lately been the poor fellow 's home . [Dr. Tootle]141-dr. tootle never kept [[his]141-dr. tootle foreign masters]991-his foreign masters long . [His]141-dr. tootle plan was to get hold of [some foreigner without means]992-some foreigner without means , and ignorant of English , who would come and teach French or German in return for mere board and lodging ; when [the man]491-the man had learnt a little English , and was in a position to demand a salary , [he]491-the man was dismissed , and [a new professor]994-a new professor obtained . [Egger]143-herr egger had lately , under the influence of some desperate delusion , come to [our]995-our hospitable clime in search of [his]143-herr egger fortune . Of languages [he]143-herr egger could not be said to know any ; [his]143-herr egger French and [his]143-herr egger German were of barbarisms all compact ; English as yet [he]143-herr egger could use only in a most primitive manner . [He]143-herr egger must have been [the most unhappy man in all [London]3-london]996-the most unhappy man in all london . Finding [himself]143-herr egger face to face with [large classes of youngsters accustomed to no kind of discipline]997-large classes of youngsters accustomed to no kind of discipline , in whom every word [he]143-herr egger uttered merely excited outrageous mirth , [he]143-herr egger was hourly brought to the very verge of despair . Constitutionally [he]143-herr egger was lachrymose ; tears came from [him]143-herr egger freely when distress had reached a climax , and the contrast between [his]143-herr egger unwieldy form and this weakness of demeanour supplied inexhaustible occasion for mirth throughout [the school]311-the school . [His]143-herr egger hours of freedom were spent in abysmal brooding .

[Waymark]129-waymark entered in good spirits . At the sight of [him]129-waymark , [Mr. O'Gree]142-o'gree started from the fireside , snatched up the poker , brandished it wildly about [his]129-waymark head , and burst into vehement exclamations .

" Ha ! ha ! [you]129-waymark 've come in time , [sir]3257-sir ; [you]129-waymark 've come in time to hear [my]142-o'gree resolution . [I]142-o'gree ca n't stand ut any longer ; [I]142-o'gree wo n't stand ut a day longer ! [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark , [you]129-waymark 're a witness of the outrageous way in which [I]142-o'gree 'm treated in [this academy]3482-this academy the way in which [I]142-o'gree 'm treated both by [Dr. Tootle]141-dr. tootle and by [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle . [You]129-waymark were witness of [his]143-herr egger insulting behaviour this very afternoon . [He]143-herr egger openly takes the side of [the boys]3483-the boys against [me]142-o'gree ; [he]143-herr egger ridicules [my]142-o'gree accent ; [he]143-herr egger treats [me]142-o'gree as [no gentleman]3484-no gentleman can treat [another]921-another , unless one of [them]3483-the boys 's [no gentleman]3484-no gentleman at all ! And , [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark , [I]142-o'gree wo n't stand ut ! "[142-o'gree]

[Mr. O'Gree]142-o'gree 's accent was very strong indeed , especially in [his]142-o'gree present mood . [Waymark]130-waymark listened with what gravity [he]130-waymark could command .

" [You]130-waymark 're quite right , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark said in reply . " [Tootle]145-mrs. tootle 's behaviour was especially scandalous to - day . [I]130-waymark should certainly take some kind of notice of it . "[130-waymark]

" [Notuss]146-notuss , [sir]3257-sir , notuss ! [I]130-waymark 'll take that amount of notuss of it that all [the metropoluss]3488-the metropoluss shall hear of [my]130-waymark wrongs . [I]130-waymark 'll assault ' um , [sir]3257-sir ; [I]130-waymark 'll assault ' um in the face of [the school]311-the school , the very next time [he]142-o'gree dares to provoke [me]130-waymark ! [I]130-waymark 'll rise in [my]130-waymark might , and smite [his]142-o'gree bald crown with [[his]142-o'gree own ruler]3491-his own ruler ! [I]130-waymark 'm not [a tall man]3492-a tall man , [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark , but [I]130-waymark can reach [his]142-o'gree crown , and that [he]142-o'gree shall be aware of before [he]142-o'gree knows ut . [He]142-o'gree sets [me]130-waymark at naught in [[my]130-waymark own class]3493-my own class , [sir]3257-sir ; [he]142-o'gree pooh - poohs [my]130-waymark mathematical demonstrations , [sir]3257-sir ; [he]142-o'gree encourages [[my]130-waymark pupils]3496-my pupils in insubordination ! And [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle ! [Bedad]147-bedad , if [I]130-waymark do n't invent some device for revenging [myself]130-waymark on [that supercilious woman]3497-that supercilious woman . The very next time [she]3497-that supercilious woman presumes to address [me]130-waymark disrespectfully at the dinner - table , [sir]3257-sir , [I]130-waymark 'll rise in [my]130-waymark might , [sir]3257-sir , see if [I]130-waymark do n't ! and [I]130-waymark 'll say to [her]3497-that supercilious woman , ' [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle , [ma'am]3500-ma'am , [you]3500-ma'am seem to forget that [I]130-waymark 'm [a gentleman]3501-a gentleman , and have [a gentleman]3501-a gentleman 's susceptibilities . When [I]130-waymark treat [you]3500-ma'am with disrespect , [ma'am]3500-ma'am , pray tell [me]130-waymark of ut , and [I]130-waymark 'll inform [you]3500-ma'am [you]3500-ma'am speak an untruth ! ' "[130-waymark]

[Waymark]130-waymark smiled , with the result that the expression of furious wrath immediately passed from [[his]130-waymark colleague]999-his colleague 's countenance , giving place to a broad grin .

" [Waymark]130-waymark , look here ! "[1000-the irishman] exclaimed [the Irishman]1000-the irishman , snatching up a piece of chalk , and proceeding to draw certain outlines upon a black - board . " Here 's [Tootle]145-mrs. tootle , [a veritable Goliath]3504-a veritable goliath ; here 's [me]1000-the irishman , as it were [David]148-david . Observe ; [Tootle]145-mrs. tootle holds in [his]130-waymark hand [his]130-waymark ' little compendium , ' raised in haughty superciliousness . Observe [me]1000-the irishman with [the ruler]3505-the ruler ! [I]1000-the irishman am on tiptoe ; [I]1000-the irishman am taking aim ; there is wrath in every sinew of [my]1000-the irishman arrum ! [My]1000-the irishman arrum descends on the very centre of [Tootle]145-mrs. tootle 's bald pate "[1000-the irishman]

" [Mr. O'Gree]142-o'gree ! "[1000-the irishman]

The tableau was most effective . Unnoticed by either [the Irishman]1000-the irishman or [Waymark]130-waymark , the door had opened behind [them]1002-them , and there had appeared [a little red - faced woman]1003-a little red - faced woman , in slatternly dress . It was [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle . [She]145-mrs. tootle had overheard almost the whole of [O'Gree]142-o'gree 's vivid comment upon [his]142-o'gree graphic illustration , in silence , until at length [she]145-mrs. tootle could hold [her]145-mrs. tootle peace no longer , and gave utterance to [the teacher]325-the teacher 's name in a voice which trembled with rage and mortification .

" [Mr. O'Gree]142-o'gree ! Are [you]142-o'gree aware of [my]145-mrs. tootle presence , [sir]3257-sir ? "[145-mrs. tootle]

The chalk dropped from [O'Gree]142-o'gree 's fingers , but otherwise [his]142-o'gree attitude remained unaltered ; struck motionless with horror , [he]142-o'gree stood pointing to the drawing on the board , [his]142-o'gree face pale , [his]142-o'gree eyes fascinated by those of [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle . [The latter]425-the latter went on in a high note .

" Well , [sir]3257-sir , as soon as [you]3257-sir have had enough of [your]3257-sir insulting buffoonery , perhaps [you]3257-sir will have the goodness to attend to [me]425-the latter , and to [your]3257-sir duty ! What do [you]3257-sir mean by allowing [the dormitories]3508-the dormitories to get into this state of uproar ? There 's been a pillow - fight going on for the last half - hour , and [you]3257-sir pay no sort of attention ; [the very house]3509-the very house is shaking ? "[425-the latter]

" [I]425-the latter protest [I]425-the latter had not heard a sound , [ma'am]3500-ma'am , or [I]425-the latter should have "[425-the latter]

" Perhaps [you]3257-sir hear nothing now , [sir]3257-sir , and [the doctor]3154-the doctor suffering from one of [his]3154-the doctor very worst headaches , utterly unable to rest even if [the house]288-the house were perfectly quiet ! "[425-the latter]

[O'Gree]142-o'gree darted to the door , past [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle , and was lost to sight . There was indeed a desperate uproar in [the higher regions of [the house]288-the house]1006-the higher regions of the house . In a moment the noise increased considerably . [O'Gree]142-o'gree had rushed up without a light , and was battling desperately in the darkness with [a score of pillow - fighters]1008-a score of pillow - fighters , roaring out threats the while at the top of [his]142-o'gree voice . [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle retired from [[the masters]982-the masters ' room]1010-the masters ' room with much affectation of dignity , leaving the door open behind [her]145-mrs. tootle .

[Waymark]130-waymark slammed it to , and turned with a laugh to [the poor Swiss]1011-the poor swiss .

" In low spirits to - night , [I]130-waymark 'm afraid , [Mr. Egger]149-egger ? "[130-waymark]

[Egger]149-egger let [his]149-egger chair tilt forward , rose slowly , drew a yellow handkerchief from [his]149-egger mouth and wiped [his]149-egger eyes with it , then exclaimed , in the most pitiful voice

" [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark , [I]149-egger have made [my]149-egger possible ! [I]149-egger can no more ! "[149-egger]

It was [his]149-egger regular phrase on these occasions ; [Waymark]130-waymark had always much ado to refrain from laughter when [he]130-waymark heard it repeated , but [he]130-waymark did [his]130-waymark best to be seriously sympathetic , and to attempt consolation in such German as was at [his]130-waymark command . [Egger]149-egger 's despondency only increased , and [he]149-egger wept afresh to hear accents which were intelligible to [him]149-egger . [Mr. O'Gree]142-o'gree re - entered [the room]255-the room , and [the Swiss]1013-the swiss retired to [[his]1013-the swiss comer]1014-his comer .

[Philip]144-philip was hot with excitement and bodily exertion ; [he]144-philip came in mopping [his]144-philip forehead , and , without turning to [Waymark]130-waymark , stood with eyes fixed on the chalk caricatures . Very gradually [he]144-philip turned round . [Waymark]130-waymark was watching [him]144-philip , on [his]130-waymark face an expression of subdued mirth . [Their]1015-their looks met , and both exploded in laughter .

" [Bedad]147-bedad , [[my]142-o'gree boy]3299-my boy , "[142-o'gree] exclaimed [O'Gree]142-o'gree , " [I]142-o'gree 'm devilish sorry ! [I]142-o'gree would n't have had it happen for a quarter 's salary , though [I]142-o'gree sadly need a new pair of breeches . "[142-o'gree]

" By - the - by , [Waymark]130-waymark , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark added in a moment , " what [a stunner]3516-a stunner [the new governess]3517-the new governess is ! [You]3299-my boy 're a lucky dog , to sit in [the same room]3518-the same room with [her]3299-my boy . What 's [her]3299-my boy name , [I]130-waymark say ? "[130-waymark]

" [Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby . [You]130-waymark 've seen [her]3299-my boy , have [you]130-waymark ? "[142-o'gree]

" [I]130-waymark caught a glimpse of [her]3299-my boy as [she]3299-my boy came [downstairs]445-downstairs ; it was quite enough ; [she]3299-my boy floored [me]130-waymark . [She]3299-my boy 's never been out of [my]130-waymark thoughts for a minute since [I]130-waymark saw [her]3299-my boy . ' [I]130-waymark love [her]3299-my boy , [I]130-waymark love [her]3299-my boy , and who shall dare , to chide [me]130-waymark for loving [that teacher]3520-that teacher fair ! ' "[130-waymark]

" Well , yes , "[130-waymark] said [Waymark]130-waymark , ' [she]1016-she has a tolerable face ; seems to [me]0-i a long way too good to be teaching [those unlicked cubs]1017-those unlicked cubs . " Not civil to [her]3299-my boy ? If [I]130-waymark were present , and heard [that woman]3521-that woman breathe the slight eat incivility , [I]130-waymark 'd "[130-waymark]

[He]130-waymark broke off in the midst of [his]130-waymark vehemence with a startled look towards the door .

" [Mr. Egger]149-egger , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark exclaimed , " a song ; [I]130-waymark beg , a song . Come , [I]130-waymark 'll lead off .[130-waymark]

' [Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby hath a beaming eye ' Bah ! [I]0-i 'm not in voice to - night . "[0-i]

[Egger]149-egger was persuaded to sit down to the piano . It was a mournful instrument , reduced to discordant wheeziness by five - finger exercises , but the touch of the Swiss could still evoke from it some kind of harmony . [He]149-egger sang a Volkslied , and in a way which showed that there was poetry in [the man]491-the man 's nature , though [his]149-egger outward appearance gave so little promise of it . [His]149-egger voice was very fair , and well suited to express the tender pathos of these inimitable melodies . [Waymark]130-waymark always enjoyed this singing ; [his]130-waymark eyes brightened , and a fine emotion played about [his]130-waymark lips . And as [he]130-waymark walked along the dark ways to [[his]130-waymark lodgings]1020-his lodgings , [Egger]149-egger 's voice was still in [his]130-waymark ears

" Der Mensch wenn er fortgeht , der kommt nimmermefr . "[149-egger]

" [Heaven]138-heaven be thanked , no ! "[818-the young man] [the young man]818-the young man said to [himself]818-the young man .

[Poverty]151-poverty was [[his]149-egger familiar companion]1022-his familiar companion , and had been so for years . [His]149-egger rent paid each week , there often remained a sum quite insufficient for the absolute necessities of existence ; for anything more , [he]149-egger had to look to chance pupils in the evenings , and what little [he]149-egger could earn with [his]149-egger pen . [He]149-egger wrote constantly , but as yet had only succeeded in getting two articles printed . Then , it was a necessity of [his]149-egger existence to mix from time to time in the life of [the town]1023-the town , and a stroll into [the Strand]1024-the strand after nightfall inevitably led to the expenditure of whatever cash [his]149-egger pocket contained . [He]149-egger was passionately found of [the theatre]1025-the theatre ; the lights about the open entrance drew [him]149-egger on irresistibly , and if , as so often , [he]149-egger had to choose between a meal and a seat in [the gallery]1026-the gallery , the meal was sacrificed . Hunger , indeed , was [his]149-egger normal state ; semi - starvation , alternating with surfeits of cheap and unwholesome food , brought about an unhealthy condition of body . Often [he]149-egger returned to [Walcot Square]21-walcot square from [his]149-egger day - long drudgery , and threw [himself]149-egger upon the bed , too exhausted to light a fire and make [his]149-egger tea , for [he]149-egger was [[his]149-egger own servant]1027-his own servant in all things except the weekly cleaning - out of [the room]255-the room . Those were dark hours , and they had to be struggled through in solitude .

Weary as [he]149-egger was [he]149-egger seldom went to bed before midnight , sometimes long after , for [he]149-egger clung to those few hours of freedom with something like savage obstinacy ; during this small portion of each day at least , [he]149-egger would possess [his]149-egger own soul , be free to think and read . Then came the penalty of anguish unutterable when the morning had to be faced . These dark , foggy February mornings crushed [him]149-egger with a recurring misery which often drove [him]149-egger to the verge of mania . [His]149-egger head throbbing with the torture of insufficient sleep , [he]149-egger lay in dull half - conscious misery till there was no longer time to prepare breakfast , and [he]149-egger had to hasten off to [school]306-school after a mouthful of dry bread which choked [him]149-egger . There had been moments when [his]149-egger strength failed , and [he]149-egger found [his]149-egger eyes filling with tears of wretchedness . To face the hideous drudgery of the day 's teaching often cost [him]149-egger more than it had cost [many men]1030-many men to face the scaffold . The hours between nine and one , the hours between half - past two and five , [Waymark]130-waymark cursed [them]1031-them minute by minute , as their awful length was measured by the crawling hands of the school - clock . [He]130-waymark tried sometimes , in mere self - defence , to force [himself]130-waymark into an interest in [his]130-waymark work , that the time might go the quicker ; but the effort was miserably vain . [His]130-waymark senses reeled amid the din and rattle of classes where discipline was unknown and intelligence almost indiscoverable . Not seldom [his]130-waymark temper got the better even of sick lassitude ; [his]130-waymark face at such times paled with passion , and in ungoverned fury [he]130-waymark raved at [[his]130-waymark tormentors]1032-his tormentors . [He]130-waymark awed [them]1032-his tormentors , too , but only for the moment , and the waste of misery swallowed [him]149-egger up once more .

Was this to be [his]130-waymark life ? [he]130-waymark asked [himself]130-waymark . Would this last for ever ?

For some reason , the morning after the visit to [[the masters]982-the masters ' room]1010-the masters ' room just spoken of found [him]149-egger in rather better spirits than usual . Perhaps it was that [he]149-egger had slept fairly well ; a gleam of unwonted sunshine had doubtless something to do with it . Yet there was another reason , though [he]130-waymark would scarcely admit it to [himself]130-waymark . It was the day on which [he]130-waymark gave a drawing - lesson to [[Dr. Tootle]141-dr. tootle 's two eldest children]1035-dr. tootle 's two eldest children . These drawing - lessons were always given in [a room [upstairs]434-upstairs]1036-a room upstairs , which was also appropriated to [the governess who came every morning to teach [three other young Tootles]1039-three other young tootles , [two girls]1040-two girls and [a boy]3219-a boy , the latter considered not yet old enough to go into [the school]311-the school]1038-the governess who came every morning to teach three other young tootles , two girls and a boy , the latter considered not yet old enough to go into the school . On the previous day , [Waymark]130-waymark had been engaged in [the room]255-the room for half an hour touching up some drawings of [[boys]3224-boys in [the school]311-the school]1045-boys in the school , which were about to be sent [home]3157-home . [He]130-waymark knew that [he]130-waymark should find [a fresh governess]1048-a fresh governess busy with [the children]253-the children , [the lady hitherto employed]1050-the lady hitherto employed having gone at a moment 's notice after a violent quarrel with [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle , an incident which had happened not infrequently before . When [he]130-waymark entered [the room]255-the room , [he]130-waymark saw [a young woman]1052-a young woman seated with [her]1052-a young woman back to [him]130-waymark , penning a copy , whilst [the children]253-the children jumped and rioted about [her]1052-a young woman in [their]253-the children usual fashion . [The late governess]1054-the late governess had been [a mature person of features rather serviceable than handsome]1055-a mature person of features rather serviceable than handsome ; that [[her]1054-the late governess successor]1056-her successor was of a different type appeared sufficiently from the fair round head , the gracefully handed neck , the perfect shoulders , the slight , beautiful form . [Waymark]130-waymark took [his]130-waymark place and waited with some curiosity till [she]1052-a young woman moved . When [she]1052-a young woman did so , and , rising , suddenly became aware of [his]130-waymark presence , there was a little start on both sides ; [Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby so [Waymark]130-waymark soon heard [her]1052-a young woman called by [the pupils]1057-the pupils had not been aware , owing to the noise , of [a stranger]1058-a stranger 's entrance , and [Waymark]130-waymark on [his]130-waymark side was so struck with the face presented to [him]130-waymark . [He]130-waymark had expected , at the most , [a pretty girl of the commonplace kind]1059-a pretty girl of the commonplace kind : [he]130-waymark saw a countenance in which refinement was as conspicuous as beauty . [She]1059-a pretty girl of the commonplace kind was probably not more than eighteen or nineteen . In speaking with [the children]253-the children [she]1059-a pretty girl of the commonplace kind rarely if ever smiled , but exhibited a gentle forbearance which had something touching in it ; it was almost as though [she]1059-a pretty girl of the commonplace kind appealed for gentleness in return , and feared a harsh word or look .

" That 's [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark , "[152-master percy tootle] cried out [Master Percy Tootle]152-master percy tootle , when [his]152-master percy tootle overquick eyes perceived that [the two]273-the two had seen [each other]459-each other . " [He]693-the boy 's [[our]253-the children drawing - master]3522-our drawing - master . Do [you]1064-the youngster like the look of [him]693-the boy ? "[152-master percy tootle]

[Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby reddened , and laid [her]150-miss enderby hand on [the boy]693-the boy 's arm , trying to direct [his]130-waymark attention to a book . But [the youngster]1064-the youngster shook off [her]150-miss enderby gentle touch , and looked at [[his]130-waymark brothers]1065-his brothers and [sisters]1066-sisters with a much too knowing grin . [Waymark]130-waymark had contented [himself]130-waymark with a slight bow , and at once bent again over [his]130-waymark work .

Very shortly [the two eldest children]1067-the two eldest children , [both girls]1068-both girls , came in , and with [them]1067-the two eldest children [[their]1067-the two eldest children mother]1069-their mother . [The latter]425-the latter paid no attention to [Waymark]130-waymark , but proceeded to cross - examine [the new governess]3517-the new governess as to [her]3517-the new governess methods of teaching , [her]3517-the new governess experience , and so on , in the coarse and loud manner which characterised [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle .

" [You]1064-the youngster 'll find [[my]145-mrs. tootle children]3523-my children clever , "[145-mrs. tootle] said [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle , " at least , that has been the opinion of all [[their]3523-my children teachers]3524-their teachers hitherto . If [they]3523-my children do n't make progress , it certainly will not be [their]3523-my children own fault . At the same time , [they]3523-my children are high - spirited , and require to be discreetly managed . This , as [I]145-mrs. tootle previously informed [you]1064-the youngster , must be done without the help of punishment in any shape ; [I]145-mrs. tootle disapprove of those methods altogether . Now let [me]145-mrs. tootle hear [you]1064-the youngster give [them]3523-my children a lesson in geography . "[145-mrs. tootle]

[Waymark]130-waymark retired at this juncture ; [he]130-waymark felt that it would be nothing less than cruelty to remain . The episode , however , had lightened [his]130-waymark day with an interest of a very unusual kind . And so it was that , on the following morning , not only the gleam of watery sunshine , but also the thought of an hour to be spent in the presence of that timid face , brought [him]130-waymark on [his]130-waymark way to [the school]311-the school with an unwonted resignation . Unfortunately [his]130-waymark drawing lessons were only given on two mornings in the week . Still , there would be something in future to look forward to , a novel sensation at [The Academy]981-the academy .

CHAPTER IX

[THE COUSINS

Harriet Smales]99-harriet had left [home]3157-home in a bad temper that Sunday afternoon , and when [she]99-harriet came back to tea , after [her]99-harriet walk with [Julian]118-julian , [her]99-harriet state of mind did not appear to have undergone any improvement . [She]99-harriet took [her]99-harriet place at the tea - table in silence . [She]99-harriet and [Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle were alone this evening ; [[the latter]425-the latter 's husband]1076-the latter 's husband [he]1076-the latter 's husband was [a journeyman printer]1077-a journeyman printer , and left entirely in [[his]1076-the latter 's husband wife]505-his wife 's hands the management of [the shop in [Gray 's Inn Road]31-gray 's inn road]1079-the shop in gray 's inn road happened to be away . [Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle was [a decent , cheerful woman , of motherly appearance]1080-a decent , cheerful woman , of motherly appearance . [She]139-mrs. ogle made one or two attempts to engage [Harriet]99-harriet in conversation , but , failing , subsided into silence , only looking askance at [the girl]316-the girl from time to time . When [she]99-harriet had finished [her]99-harriet tea and bread - and - butter , [Harriet]99-harriet coughed , and , without facing [[her]99-harriet companion]1082-her companion , spoke in rather a cold way .

" [I]99-harriet may be late back to - night , [Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle . [You]139-mrs. ogle wo n't lock the door ? "[99-harriet]

" [I]448-the woman sha'n't go to bed till eleven [myself]448-the woman , "[448-the woman] was the reply .

" But it may be after twelve when [I]99-harriet get back . "[99-harriet]

" Where are [you]99-harriet going to , [Harriet]99-harriet ? "[99-harriet]

" If [you]99-harriet must know always , [Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle , [I]99-harriet 'm going to see [[my]99-harriet friend]3429-my friend in [Westminster]34-westminster . "[99-harriet]

" Well , it ai n't no business of [mine]448-the woman , [[my]448-the woman girl]3290-my girl , "[448-the woman] returned [the woman]448-the woman , not unkindly , " but [I]448-the woman think it 's only right [I]448-the woman should have some idea where [you]99-harriet spend [your]99-harriet nights . " [I]99-harriet do n't want [any one]3197-any one to be responsible for [me]99-harriet , [Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle . "[99-harriet]

" Maybe not , [[my]448-the woman girl]3290-my girl . But [young people]3530-young people ai n't always the best judges of what 's good for [them]3530-young people , and what is n't .
