[I]448-the woman shall sit up for [you]99-harriet , and [you]99-harriet must n't be after twelve . "[448-the woman]

It was said very decidedly . [Harriet]99-harriet made no reply , but speedily dressed and went out . [She]99-harriet took [an omnibus]1084-an omnibus eastward , and sought [a neighbourhood which [most decently dressed people]1086-most decently dressed people would have been chary of entering after nightfall , or indeed at any other time , unless compelled to do so]1085-a neighbourhood which most decently dressed people would have been chary of entering after nightfall , or indeed at any other time , unless compelled to do so . [The girl]316-the girl found the object of [her]99-harriet walk in [a dirty little public - house]1088-a dirty little public - house at [the corner of [two foul and narrow by - ways]1090-two foul and narrow by - ways]1089-the corner of two foul and narrow by - ways . [She]99-harriet entered by a private door , and passed into [a parlour]1091-a parlour , which was behind the bar .

[A woman]3216-a woman was sitting in [the room]255-the room , beguiling [her]3216-a woman leisure with a Sunday paper . [She]3216-a woman was dressed with vulgar showiness , and made a lavish display of jewellery , more or less valuable . Eight years ago [she]3216-a woman was [a servant in [[Mr. Smales]106-mr. smales 's house]1095-mr. smales 's house]1094-a servant in mr. smales 's house , and [her]3216-a woman name was [Sarah]105-sally . [She]3216-a woman had married in the meanwhile , and become [Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl .

[She]3216-a woman welcomed [[her]3216-a woman visitor]797-her visitor with a friendly nod , but did not rise .

" [I]3216-a woman thought it likely [you]797-her visitor 'd look in , as [you]797-her visitor missed larst week . How 's things goin' in [[your]797-her visitor part o ' [the world]622-the world]3532-your part o ' the world ? "[3216-a woman]

" Very badly , "[99-harriet] returned [Harriet]99-harriet , throwing off [her]99-harriet hat and cloak , and going to warm [her]99-harriet hands and feet at the fire . " It wo n't last much longer , that 's the truth of it . "[99-harriet]

" Eh well , it 's all in a life ; [we]3534-we all has [our]3534-we little trials an ' troubles , as the sayin ' is . "[3216-a woman]

" How 's [the baby]3535-the baby ? "[99-harriet] asked [Harriet]99-harriet looking towards a bundle of wrappers which lay on a sofa .

" [I]403-the mother doubt it 's too good for [this world]3446-this world , "[403-the mother] returned [the mother]403-the mother , grinning in a way which made [her]403-the mother ugly face peculiarly revolting . " Dessay it 'll join [[its]3535-the baby little brother]3537-its little brother an ' sister before long . [Mike]154-mike put it in [the club]3538-the club yes'day . "[403-the mother]

[The burial - club]1098-the burial - club , [Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl meant , and [Harriet]99-harriet evidently understood the allusion .

" Have [you]99-harriet walked ? "[448-the woman] went on [the woman]448-the woman , doubling up [her]448-the woman paper , and then throwing it aside . " Dessay [you]99-harriet could do with somethin' to take the cold orff [yer]99-harriet chest . [Liz]155-liz , "[153-mrs. sprowl] [she]153-mrs. sprowl called out to some one behind the bar , with which [the parlour]1100-the parlour communicated by an open door ; " [two Irish]3539-two irish ! "[153-mrs. sprowl]

The liquor was brought . Presently [some one]3153-some one called to [Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl , who went out . Leaning on the counter , in one of [the compartments]1102-the compartments , was something which [a philanthropist]1103-a philanthropist might perhaps have had the courage to claim as [a human being]1104-a human being ; a very tall creature , with bent shoulders , and head seeming to grow straight out of its chest ; thick , grizzled hair hiding almost every vestige of feature , with the exception of one dreadful red eye , its fellow being dead and sightless . [He]1105-he had laid on the counter , with palms downward as if concealing something , two huge hairy paws . [Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl seemed familiar with the appearance of [this monster]1106-this monster ; [she]153-mrs. sprowl addressed [him]1105-he rather bad - temperedly , but otherwise much as [she]153-mrs. sprowl would have spoken to [any other customer]1107-any other customer .

" No , [you]99-harriet do n't , [Slimy]156-slimy ! No , [you]99-harriet do n't ! What [you]99-harriet have in [this house]3540-this house [you]99-harriet pay for in coppers , so [you]99-harriet know . Next time [I]153-mrs. sprowl catch [you]99-harriet tryin ' to ring the changes , [I]153-mrs. sprowl 'll have [you]99-harriet run in , and then [you]99-harriet 'll get a warm bath , which [you]99-harriet would n't partic'lar care for . "[153-mrs. sprowl]

[The creature]1108-the creature spoke , in hoarse , jumbled words , not easy to catch unless [you]1109-you listened closely .

" If [you]99-harriet 've any accusion to make agin [me]1108-the creature , [Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl , p'r'aps [you]99-harriet 'll wait till [you]99-harriet can prove it . [I]1108-the creature want change for arf a suvrin : ai n't that straight , now ? "[1108-the creature]

" Straight or not , [you]99-harriet wo n't get no change over this counter , so there [you]99-harriet 've the straight tip . Now sling [yer]99-harriet ' ook , [Slimy]156-slimy , an ' get it somewhere else . "[1108-the creature]

" If [you]99-harriet 've any accusion to make "[1108-the creature]

" Hold [yer]99-harriet noise ! What 's [he]491-the man ordered , [Liz]155-liz ? "[1108-the creature]

" Pot o ' old six , "[316-the girl] answered [the girl]316-the girl .

" Got sixpence , [Slimy]156-slimy ? "[1108-the creature]

" No , [I]1108-the creature ai n't , [Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl , "[1108-the creature] muttered [the creature]1108-the creature . " [I]1108-the creature 've got arf a suvrin . "[1108-the creature]

" Then go an ' get change for it . Now , once more , sling [yer]99-harriet ' ook . "[1108-the creature]

[The man]491-the man moved away , sending back a horrible glare from [his]491-the man one fiery eyeball .

[Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl re - entered [the parlour]1100-the parlour .

" [I]99-harriet wish [you]99-harriet 'd take [me]99-harriet on as [barmaid]3541-barmaid , [Sarah]105-sally , "[99-harriet] [Harriet]99-harriet said , when [she]99-harriet had drunk [her]99-harriet glass of spirits .

" Take [you]99-harriet on ? "[449-the other] exclaimed [the other]449-the other , with surprise . " Why , have [you]99-harriet fallen out with [[your]99-harriet cousin]3531-your cousin ? [I]449-the other thought [you]99-harriet was goin' to be married soon . "[449-the other]

" [I]153-mrs. sprowl did n't say for sure that [I]153-mrs. sprowl was ; [I]153-mrs. sprowl only said [I]153-mrs. sprowl might be . Any way it wo n't be just yet , and [I]153-mrs. sprowl 'm tired of [my]153-mrs. sprowl place in [the shop]361-the shop . "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" Do n't [you]99-harriet be [a fool]3466-a fool , [Harriet]99-harriet , "[449-the other] said [the other]449-the other , with genial frankness . " [You]99-harriet 're well enough off . [You]99-harriet stick where [you]99-harriet are till [you]99-harriet get married . [You]99-harriet would n't make nothin' at [our]3545-our business ; ' tain't all sugar an ' lemon , an ' sittin ' drinkin ' twos o ' whisky till further orders . [You]99-harriet want a quiet , easy business , [you]99-harriet do , an ' [you]99-harriet 've got it . If [you]99-harriet keep worritin ' yerself this way , [you]99-harriet wo n't never make old bones , an ' that 's the truth . [You]99-harriet wait a bit , an ' give [[yer]99-harriet cousin]3546-yer cousin a chance to arst [you]99-harriet , if that 's what [you]99-harriet 're troublin ' about . "[449-the other]

" [I]99-harriet 've given [him]3546-yer cousin lots o ' chances , "[99-harriet] said [Harriet]99-harriet peevishly .

" Eh well , give [him]3546-yer cousin lots more , an ' it 'll all come right . [We]3547-we 're all born , but [we]3547-we 're not buried . [Hev]3546-yer cousin ' [another Irish]3548-another irish ? "[449-the other]

[Harriet]99-harriet allowed [herself]99-harriet to be persuaded to take another glass .

When the clock pointed to half - past nine , [she]99-harriet rose and prepared to depart . [She]99-harriet had told [Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl that [she]99-harriet would take [the ' bus]1116-the ' bus and go straight [home]3157-home ; but something seemed to have led [her]99-harriet to alter [her]99-harriet purpose , for [she]99-harriet made [her]99-harriet way to [Westminster Bridge]29-westminster bridge , and crossed [the river]3428-the river . Then [she]99-harriet made some inquiries of [a policeman]1119-a policeman , and , in consequence , got into [a Kennington omnibus]1120-a kennington omnibus . Very shortly [she]99-harriet was set down close by [Walcot Square]21-walcot square . [She]99-harriet walked about till , with some difficulty in the darkness , [she]99-harriet had discovered the number at which [Julian]118-julian had told [her]99-harriet [[his]118-julian friend]876-his friend lived . [The house]288-the house found , [she]99-harriet began to pace up and down on [the opposite pavement]1123-the opposite pavement , always keeping [her]99-harriet eyes fixed on the same door . [She]99-harriet was soon shivering in the cold night air , and quickened [her]99-harriet walk . It was rather more than an hour before the door [she]99-harriet was watching at length opened , and [two friends]1124-two friends came out together . [Harriet]99-harriet followed [them]1124-two friends as closely as [she]99-harriet could , until [she]99-harriet saw that [she]99-harriet [herself]99-harriet was observed . Thereupon [she]99-harriet walked away , and , by a circuit , ultimately came back into [the main road]1125-the main road , where [she]99-harriet took [a ' bus]3243-a ' bus going northwards .

[[Harriet]99-harriet 's cousin]1127-harriet 's cousin , when alone of an evening , sat in [[his]1127-harriet 's cousin bedroom]1128-his bedroom , [the world]622-the world shut out , [his]1127-harriet 's cousin thoughts in long past times , rebuilding [the ruins of [a fallen Empire]1131-a fallen empire]1130-the ruins of a fallen empire .

When [he]1127-harriet 's cousin was eighteen , [the lad]1132-the lad had the good luck to light upon a cheap copy of [Gibbon]157-gibbon in [a second - hand book - shop]1133-a second - hand book - shop . It was the first edition ; six noble quarto volumes , clean and firm in the old bindings . Often [he]1127-harriet 's cousin had turned longing eyes upon newer copies of the great book , but the price had always put them beyond [his]1127-harriet 's cousin reach . That very night [he]1127-harriet 's cousin solemnly laid open the first volume at the first page , propping it on a couple of meaner books , and , after glancing through the short Preface , began to read with a mind as devoutly disposed as that of [any pious believer]1134-any pious believer poring upon [his]1127-harriet 's cousin Bible . " In the second century of [the Christian AEra]158-the christian aera , [the empire of Rome]3549-the empire of rome comprehended [the fairest part of [the earth]3551-the earth]3550-the fairest part of the earth , and [the most civilised portion of [mankind]3553-mankind]3552-the most civilised portion of mankind . [The frontiers of that extensive monarchy]3554-the frontiers of that extensive monarchy were guarded by ancient renown and disciplined valour . "[1127-harriet 's cousin] With what a grand epic roll , with what anticipations of solemn music , did the noble history begin ! Far , far into the night [Julian]118-julian turned over page after page , thoughtless of sleep and the commonplace duties of the morrow .

Since then [he]118-julian had mastered [[his]118-julian Gibbon]1135-his gibbon , knew [him]1135-his gibbon from end to end , and joyed in [him]1135-his gibbon more than ever . Whenever [he]118-julian had a chance of obtaining any of the writers , ancient or modern , to whom [Gibbon]157-gibbon refers , [he]118-julian read [them]1136-them and added to [his]118-julian knowledge . About a year ago , [he]118-julian had picked up [an old Claudian]1137-an old claudian , and the reading of [the poet]1138-the poet had settled [him]118-julian to a task which [he]118-julian had before that doubtfully sought . [He]118-julian wanted to write either a poem or a drama on some subject taken from the " Decline and Fall , "[118-julian] and now , with [Claudian]159-claudian 's help , [he]118-julian fixed upon [Stilicho]160-stilicho for [[his]118-julian hero]1139-his hero . The form , [he]118-julian then decided , should be dramatic . Upon " [Stilicho]160-stilicho "[118-julian] [he]118-julian had now been engaged for a year , and to - night [he]118-julian is writing the last words of the last scene . Shortly after twelve [he]118-julian has finished it , and , throwing down [his]118-julian pen , [he]118-julian paces about [the room]255-the room with enviable feelings .

[He]118-julian had not as yet mentioned to Waymark the work [he]118-julian was engaged upon , though [he]118-julian had confessed that [he]118-julian wrote verses at times . [He]118-julian wished to complete it , and then read it to [[his]118-julian friend]876-his friend . It was now only the middle of the week , and though [he]118-julian had decided previously to wait till [his]118-julian visit to [Walcot Square]21-walcot square next Sunday before saying a word about " [Stilicho]160-stilicho , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian could not refrain now from hastily penning a note to [Waymark]130-waymark , and going out to post it at once .

When the day came , the weather would not allow the usual walk with [Harriet]99-harriet , and [Julian]118-julian could not help feeling glad that it was so . [He]118-julian was too pre - occupied to talk in the usual way with [the girl]316-the girl , and [he]118-julian knew how vain it would be to try and make [her]316-the girl understand [his]118-julian state of mind . Still , [he]118-julian went to see [her]316-the girl as usual , and sat for an hour in [[Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle 's parlour]1143-mrs. ogle 's parlour . At times , throughout the week , [he]118-julian had thought of the curious resemblance between [Harriet]99-harriet and [the girl [he]118-julian had noticed on leaving [[Waymark]130-waymark 's house]1145-waymark 's house last Sunday]1144-the girl he had noticed on leaving waymark 's house last sunday , and now [he]118-julian asked [her]316-the girl , in a half - jesting way , whether it had really been [she]316-the girl .

" How could it be ? "[99-harriet] said [Harriet]99-harriet carelessly . " [I]99-harriet ca n't be in two places at once . "[99-harriet]

" Did [you]99-harriet stay at [home]3157-home that evening ? "[316-the girl]

" No , not all the evening . "[99-harriet]

" What [friends]562-friends are [they]562-friends [you]99-harriet go to , when [you]99-harriet are out at night , [Harriet]99-harriet ? "[316-the girl]

" Oh , [some relations of [the Colchester people]3558-the colchester people]3557-some relations of the colchester people . [I]99-harriet suppose [you]99-harriet 've been spending most of [your]99-harriet time in [Kennington]22-kennington since Sunday ? "[99-harriet]

" [I]316-the girl have n't left [home]3157-home . In fact , [I]316-the girl 've been very busy . [I]316-the girl 've just finished some work that has occupied [me]316-the girl for nearly a year . "[316-the girl]

After all , [he]1146-he could not refrain from speaking of it , though [he]1146-he had made up [his]1146-he mind not to do so .

" Work ? What work ? "[99-harriet] asked [Harriet]99-harriet , with the suspicious look which came into [her]99-harriet grey eyes whenever [she]99-harriet heard something [she]99-harriet could not understand .

" Some writing . [I]99-harriet 've written a play . "[99-harriet]

" A play ? Will it be acted ? "[316-the girl]

" Oh no , it is n't meant for acting . "[99-harriet]

" What 's the good of it then ? "[316-the girl]

" It 's written in verse . [I]99-harriet shall perhaps try to get it published . "[99-harriet]

" Shall [you]316-the girl get money for it ? "[316-the girl]

" That is scarcely likely . In all probability [I]99-harriet shall not be able to get it printed at all . "[99-harriet]

" Then what 's the good of it ? "[99-harriet] repeated [Harriet]99-harriet , still suspicious , and a little contemptuous .

" It has given [me]99-harriet pleasure , that 's all . "[99-harriet]

[Julian]118-julian was glad when at length [he]118-julian could take [his]118-julian leave . [Waymark]130-waymark received [him]118-julian with a pleased smile , and much questioning .

" Why did [you]118-julian keep it such a secret ? [I]130-waymark shall try [my]130-waymark hand at a play some day or other , but , as [you]118-julian can guess , the material will scarcely be sought in [Gibbon]157-gibbon . It will be desperately modern , and possibly not altogether in accordance with the views of [the Lord Chamberlain]3560-the lord chamberlain . What 's the time ? Four o'clock . [We]3561-we 'll have a cup of coffee and then fall to . [I]130-waymark 'm eager to hear [your]118-julian ' deep - chested music , ' [your]118-julian ' hollow oes and aes . ' "[130-waymark]

The reading took some three hours ; [Waymark]130-waymark smoked a vast number of pipes the while , and was silent till the close . Then [he]130-waymark got up from [his]130-waymark easy - chair , took a step forward , and held out [his]130-waymark hand . [His]130-waymark face shone with the frankest enthusiasm . [He]130-waymark could not express [himself]130-waymark with sufficient vehemence . [Julian]118-julian sat with the manuscript rolled up in [his]118-julian hands , on [his]118-julian face a glow of delight .

" It 's very kind of [you]118-julian to speak in this way , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian faltered at length .

" Kind ! How the deuce should [I]118-julian speak ? But come , [we]3561-we will have this off to [a publisher]3562-a publisher 's forth with . Have [you]118-julian any ideas for the next work ? "[118-julian]

" Yes ; but so daring that [they]3563-they hardly bear putting into words . "[118-julian]

" Try the effect on [me]118-julian . "[118-julian]

" [I]118-julian have thought , "[118-julian] said [Julian]118-julian , with embarrassment , " of a long poem an Epic . [Virgil]161-virgil wrote of the founding of [Rome]14-rome ; [her]14-rome dissolution is as grand a subject . It would mean years of preparation , and again years in the writing . The siege and capture of [Rome]14-rome by [Alaric]162-alaric what do [you]118-julian think ? "[118-julian]

" A work not to be raised from the heat of youth , or the vapours of wine . But who knows ? "[118-julian]

There was high talk in [Walcot Square]21-walcot square that evening . All unknown to [[its]21-walcot square other inhabitants]1147-its other inhabitants , [the poor lodging - house]1148-the poor lodging - house was converted into [a temple of the Muses]1149-a temple of the muses , and harmonies as from [Apollo]163-apollo 's lyre throbbed in the hearts of [the two friends]1150-the two friends . The future was [their]1150-the two friends inexhaustible subject , the seed - plot of strange hopes and desires . [They]1150-the two friends talked the night into morning , hardly daunted when perforce [they]1150-the two friends remembered the day 's work .

CHAPTER X

THE WAY OUT

The ruling spirit of [the Academy]981-the academy was [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle . [[Her]145-mrs. tootle husband]584-her husband 's constitutional headache , and yet more constitutional laziness , left to [her]145-mrs. tootle almost exclusively the congenial task of guiding [the household]1153-the household , and even of disciplining [the school]311-the school . In lesson - time [she]145-mrs. tootle would even flit about [the classrooms]1155-the classrooms , and not scruple to administer sharp rebukes to [a teacher whose pupils]1156-a teacher whose pupils were disorderly , the effect of this naturally being to make confusion worse confounded . [The boys]3483-the boys of course hated [her]145-mrs. tootle with the hatred of which [schoolboys]1158-schoolboys alone are capable , and many a practical joke was played at [her]145-mrs. tootle expense , not , however , with impunity . Still more pronounced , if possible , was the animus entertained against [[Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle 's offspring]1159-mrs. tootle 's offspring , and it was upon the head of [Master Felix]164-master felix that the full energy of detestation concentrated itself . [He]164-master felix was , in truth , as offensive [a young imp]1160-a young imp as the soil of [a middle - class boarding - school]1161-a middle - class boarding - school could well produce . If [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle ruled [the Academy]981-the academy , [he]164-master felix in turn ruled [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle , and on all occasions showed [himself]164-master felix [a most exemplary autocrat]1163-a most exemplary autocrat . [His]164-master felix position , however , as in the case of [certain other autocratic rulers]1164-certain other autocratic rulers , had its disadvantages ; [he]164-master felix could never venture to wander out of earshot of [[his]164-master felix father]497-his father or mother , who formed [his]164-master felix body - guard , and the utmost prudence did not suffice to protect [him]164-master felix from an occasional punch on the head , or a nip in a tender part , meant probably as earnest of more substantial kindnesses to be conferred upon [him]164-master felix at the very earliest opportunity .

To [poor Egger]149-egger fell the unpleasant duty of instructing [these young Tootles]1166-these young tootles in the elements of the French language . For that purpose [he]164-master felix went up every morning to [the class - room]1167-the class - room on [the first floor]1168-the first floor , and for a while relieved [Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby of [her]150-miss enderby charge . With anguish of spirit [he]164-master felix felt the approach of the moment which summoned [him]164-master felix to this dread duty , for , in addition to the lively spite of [Master Felix]164-master felix and [the other children]269-the other children , [he]164-master felix had to face the awful superintendence of [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle [herself]145-mrs. tootle ; who was invariably present at these lessons . [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle had somehow conceived the idea that French was a second mother - tongue to [her]145-mrs. tootle , and [her]145-mrs. tootle intercourse with [Mr. Egger]149-egger was invariably carried on in that language . Now this was a refinement of torture , seeing that it was often impossible to gather a meaning from [her]145-mrs. tootle remarks , whilst to show any such difficulty was to incur [her]145-mrs. tootle most furious wrath . [Egger]149-egger trembled when [he]149-egger heard the rustle of [her]145-mrs. tootle dress outside , the perspiration stood on [his]149-egger forehead as [he]149-egger rose and bowed before [her]145-mrs. tootle .

" Bon jour , [Monsieur]3564-monsieur , "[145-mrs. tootle] [she]145-mrs. tootle would come in exclaiming . " Quel un beau matin ! Vous trouverez les jeunes dames et messieurs en bons esprits ce matin . "[145-mrs. tootle]

The spirits of [Master Felix]164-master felix had manifested [themselves]1170-themselves already in [his]164-master felix skilfully standing a book upright on [the teacher]325-the teacher 's chair , so that when [Egger]149-egger subsided from [his]149-egger obeisance [he]149-egger sat down on a sharp edge and was thrown into confusion .

" [Monsieur Felix]165-monsieur felix , "[1172-his mother] cried [[his]149-egger mother]1172-his mother , " que faites - vous la ? Les jeunes messieurs anglais sont plus spirituels que les jeunes messieurs suisses , n'est ce pas , [Monsieur Egger]166-monsieur egger ? "[1172-his mother]

" En effet , [madame]3565-madame , "[325-the teacher] muttered [the teacher]325-the teacher , nervously arranging [his]325-the teacher books .

" [Monsieur Egger]166-monsieur egger , "[145-mrs. tootle] exclaimed [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle , with a burst of good humour , " est - ce vrai ce qu'on dit que les Suisses sont si excessivement sujets a etre chez - malades ? "[145-mrs. tootle]

The awful moment had come . What on earth did chez - malades mean ? Was [he]149-egger to answer yes or no ? In [his]149-egger ignorance of [her]145-mrs. tootle meaning , either reply might prove offensive . [He]149-egger reddened , fidgeted on [his]149-egger chair , looked about [him]149-egger with an anguished mute appeal for help . [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle repeated [her]145-mrs. tootle question with emphasis and a change of countenance which [he]149-egger knew too well . [The poor fellow]990-the poor fellow had not the tact to appear to understand , and , as [he]149-egger might easily have done , mystify [her]145-mrs. tootle by some idiomatic remark . [He]149-egger stammered out [his]149-egger apologies and excuses , with the effect of making [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle furious .

Then followed a terrible hour , at the end of which [poor Egger]166-monsieur egger rushed down to [[the Masters]982-the masters ' Room]1010-the masters ' room , covered [his]166-monsieur egger head with [his]166-monsieur egger hands and wept , regardless of [the boy]693-the boy strumming [his]166-monsieur egger exercises on the piano . [Waymark]130-waymark shortly came in to summon [him]149-egger to some other class , whereupon [he]130-waymark rose , and , with gestures of despair , groaned out

" Let [me]130-waymark , let [me]130-waymark ! [I]130-waymark have made [my]130-waymark possible ; [I]130-waymark can no more ! "[130-waymark]

[Waymark]130-waymark alone feared neither [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle nor [[her]145-mrs. tootle hopeful son]1178-her hopeful son , and , in turn , was held in some little awe by [both of [them]1179-both of them]1179-both of them . [The lady]262-the lady had at first tried the effect of interfering in [his]149-egger classes , as [she]262-the lady did in those of [the other masters]1181-the other masters , but the result was not encouraging .

" Do n't [you]149-egger think , [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark , "[262-the lady] [she]262-the lady had said one day , as [she]262-the lady walked through [the school - room]975-the school - room and paused to listen to [[our]1183-our friend]1184-our friend 's explanation of some rule in English grammar ; " do n't [you]149-egger think it would be better to confine [yourself]149-egger to the terms of [the doctor]3154-the doctor 's little compendium ? [The boys]3483-the boys are used to it . "[262-the lady]

" In this case , "[130-waymark] replied [Waymark]130-waymark calmly , " [I]130-waymark think the terms of the compendium are rather too technical for the fourth class . "[130-waymark]

" Still , it is customary in [this school]298-this school to use the compendium , and it has never yet been found unsatisfactory . Whilst [you]149-egger are discoursing at such length , [I]262-the lady observe [your]149-egger class gets very disorderly . "[262-the lady]

[Waymark]130-waymark looked at [her]262-the lady , but kept silence . [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle stood still .

" What are [you]130-waymark waiting for , [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark ? "[262-the lady] [she]262-the lady asked sharply .

" Till [your]130-waymark presence has ceased to distract [the boys]3483-the boys ' attention , [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle , "[262-the lady] was the straightforward reply .

[The woman]448-the woman was disconcerted , and , as [Waymark]130-waymark preserved [his]130-waymark calm silence , [she]448-the woman had no alternative but to withdraw , after giving [him]130-waymark a look not easily forgotten .

But there was [another person whose sufferings under the tyranny of]1186-another person whose sufferings under the tyranny of [mother]375-mother and [children]3150-children were perhaps keenest of all . [Waymark]130-waymark had frequent opportunities of observing [Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby under persecution , and learned to recognise in [her]150-miss enderby the signs of acutest misery . Many times [he]130-waymark left [the room]255-the room , rather than add to [her]150-miss enderby pain by [his]130-waymark presence ; very often it was as much as [he]130-waymark could do to refrain from taking [her]150-miss enderby part , and defending [her]150-miss enderby against [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle . [He]130-waymark had never been formally introduced to [Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby , and during several weeks held no kind of communication with [her]150-miss enderby beyond a " good morning "[130-waymark] when [he]130-waymark entered [the room]255-the room and found [her]150-miss enderby there . The first quarter of a year was drawing to a close when there occurred the first conversation between [them]1191-them . [Waymark]130-waymark had been giving [some of [the children]253-the children]1192-some of the children [their]1192-some of the children drawing - lesson , whilst [the governess]1194-the governess taught [the two youngest]1195-the two youngest . The class - time being over , [the youngsters]1196-the youngsters all scampered off . For a wonder , [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle was not present , anti [Waymark]130-waymark seized the opportunity to exchange a word with [the young lady]1197-the young lady .

" [I]130-waymark fear [[your]1197-the young lady pupils]3570-your pupils give [you]1197-the young lady dreadful trouble , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark said , as [he]130-waymark stood by the window pointing a pencil .

[She]1197-the young lady started at being spoken to .

" [They]3570-your pupils are full of life , "[1197-the young lady] [she]1197-the young lady replied , in the low sad voice which was natural to [her]1197-the young lady .

" Which would all seem to be directed towards shortening that of [others]256-others , "[130-waymark] said [Waymark]130-waymark , with a smile .

" [They]3570-your pupils are intelligent , "[1194-the governess] [the governess]1194-the governess ventured to suggest , after a silence . " It would be a pleasure to teach [them]3570-your pupils if [they]3570-your pupils if [they]3570-your pupils were a little more orderly . "[1194-the governess]

" Certainly . If [[their]3570-your pupils parents]3572-their parents had only common sense "[1194-the governess]

[He]130-waymark stopped . A flush had risen to [the girl]316-the girl 's face , and a slight involuntary motion of [her]1194-the governess hand seemed to warn [him]130-waymark . The reason was that [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle stood in the doorway , to which [he]130-waymark had [his]130-waymark back turned . [Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby said a quick " good morning "[150-miss enderby] and left [him]130-waymark .

[He]130-waymark was taking up some papers , preparatory to leaving [the room]255-the room , when [he]130-waymark noticed that [the governess]1194-the governess had left behind [her]1194-the governess a little book in which [she]1194-the governess was accustomed to jot down lessons for [the children]253-the children . [He]130-waymark took it up and examined it . On the first page was written " [Maud Enderby]103-maud , [South Bank]36-south bank , [Regent 's Park]3573-regent 's park . "[130-waymark] [He]130-waymark repeated the name to [himself]130-waymark several times . Then [he]130-waymark smiled , recalling the way in which [the governess]1194-the governess had warned [him]130-waymark that [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle could overhear what [he]130-waymark said . Somehow , this slight gesture of [the girl]316-the girl 's had seemed to bring [them]1205-them closer to [each other]459-each other ; there was an unpremeditated touch of intimacy in the movement , which it pleased [him]130-waymark to think of . This was by no means the first time that [he]130-waymark had stood with thoughts busied about [her]316-the girl , but the brief exchange of words and what had followed gave something of a new complexion to [his]130-waymark feelings . Previously [he]130-waymark had been interested in [her]316-the girl ; [her]316-the girl striking features had made [him]130-waymark wonder what was the history which [their]1205-them expression concealed ; but [her]316-the girl extreme reticence and the timid coldness of [her]316-the girl look had left [his]130-waymark senses unmoved . Now [he]130-waymark all at once experienced the awakening of quite a new interest ; there had been something in [her]316-the girl eyes as they met [his]130-waymark which seemed to desire sympathy ; [he]130-waymark was struck with the possibilities of emotion in the face which this one look had revealed to [him]130-waymark . [Her]316-the girl situation seemed , when [he]130-waymark thought of it , to affect [him]130-waymark more strongly than hitherto ; [he]130-waymark felt that it would be more difficult henceforth to maintain [his]130-waymark calmness when [he]130-waymark saw [her]316-the girl insulted by [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle or disrespectfully used by [the children]253-the children .

Nor did the new feelings subside as rapidly as they had arisen . At [home]3157-home that night [he]130-waymark was unable to settle to [his]130-waymark usual occupations , and , as a visit to [[his]130-waymark friends]1209-his friends in [[the Masters]982-the masters ' Room]1010-the masters ' room would have been equally distasteful , [he]130-waymark rambled about [the streets]3169-the streets and so tired [himself]130-waymark . [His]130-waymark duties did not take [him]130-waymark up to [[the children]253-the children 's classroom]1214-the children 's classroom on the following morning , but [he]130-waymark invented an excuse for going [there]3249-there , and felt rewarded by the very faint smile and the inclination of the head with which [Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby returned [his]130-waymark " good morning . "[150-miss enderby] Day after day , [he]130-waymark schemed to obtain an opportunity of speaking with [her]150-miss enderby again , and [he]130-waymark fancied that [she]150-miss enderby [herself]150-miss enderby helped to remove any chances that might have occurred . Throughout [his]130-waymark lessons , [his]130-waymark attention remained fixed upon [her]150-miss enderby ; [he]130-waymark studied [her]150-miss enderby face intently , and was constantly discovering in it new meanings . When [she]150-miss enderby caught [his]130-waymark eyes thus busy with [her]150-miss enderby , [she]150-miss enderby evinced , for a moment , trouble and uneasiness ; [he]130-waymark felt sure that [she]150-miss enderby arranged [her]150-miss enderby seat so as to have [her]150-miss enderby back to [him]130-waymark more frequently than [she]150-miss enderby had been accustomed to do . [Her]150-miss enderby work appeared to [him]130-waymark to be done with less self - forgetfulness than formerly ; the rioting and impertinence of [the children]253-the children seemed to trouble [her]150-miss enderby more ; [she]150-miss enderby bore [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle 's interference with something like fear . Once , when [Master Felix]164-master felix had gone beyond [his]164-master felix wonted licence , in [[his]164-master felix mother]1172-his mother 's absence , [Waymark]130-waymark went so far as to call [him]130-waymark to order . As soon as [he]130-waymark had spoken , [the girl]316-the girl looked up at [him]130-waymark in a startled way , and seemed silently to beg [him]130-waymark to refrain . All this only strengthened the influence [she]316-the girl exercised upon [Waymark]130-waymark .

Since the climax of wretchedness which had resulted in [his]130-waymark advertisement and the forming of [Julian Casti]118-julian 's acquaintance , a moderate cheerfulness had possessed [him]130-waymark . Now [he]130-waymark once more felt the clouds sinking about [him]130-waymark , was aware of many a threatening portent , the meaning whereof [he]130-waymark too well understood . There had been a week or two of prevailing bad weather , a state of things which always wrought harmfully upon [him]130-waymark ; [his]130-waymark thoughts darkened under the dark sky , and the daily downpour of rain sapped [his]130-waymark energies . It was within a few days of Easter , but the prospect of a holiday had no effect upon [him]130-waymark . Night after night [he]130-waymark lay in fever and unrest . [He]130-waymark felt as though some voice were calling upon [him]130-waymark to undertake a vaguely hazardous enterprise which yet [he]130-waymark knew not the nature of .

On one of these evenings , [Mr. O'Gree]142-o'gree announced to [him]130-waymark that [Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby was going to give up [her]150-miss enderby position at the end of the quarter . [Philip]144-philip had gathered this from a conversation heard during the day between [Dr. Tootle]141-dr. tootle and [[his]141-dr. tootle wife]505-his wife .

" The light of [my]142-o'gree life will be gone out , "[142-o'gree] exclaimed [O'Gree]142-o'gree , " when [I]142-o'gree am no longer able to catch a glimpse of [her]150-miss enderby as [she]150-miss enderby goes past [the schoolroom]263-the schoolroom door . And [I]142-o'gree 've never even had a chance of speaking to [her]150-miss enderby . [You]130-waymark know the tale of [Raleigh]167-raleigh and [Queen Elizabeth]155-liz . Suppose [I]142-o'gree were to rush out and throw [my]142-o'gree top - coat on the muddy door - step , just as [she]150-miss enderby 's going out ; d'ye think [she]150-miss enderby 'd say thank [you]130-waymark ? "[142-o'gree]

" Probably , "[130-waymark] muttered [Waymark]130-waymark , without knowing what [he]130-waymark said . It was [Mr. O'Gree]142-o'gree 's habit to affect this violent devotion to [each new governess]1220-each new governess in turn , but [Waymark]130-waymark did not seem to find the joke amusing at present .

" [Bedad]147-bedad , [I]130-waymark 'll do it then ! Or , rather , [I]130-waymark would , if [I]130-waymark 'd two top - coats . Hang it ! There 's no behaving like [a gentleman]3501-a gentleman on twenty - five pounds a year . "[130-waymark]

[Waymark]130-waymark walked about [the streets]3169-the streets the greater part of the night , and the next morning came to [school]306-school rather late . [Dr. Tootle]141-dr. tootle had to consult with [him]130-waymark about some matter as soon as [he]130-waymark arrived .

" [You]130-waymark seem indisposed , [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark , "[3154-the doctor] [the doctor]3154-the doctor remarked , when [he]3154-the doctor had in vain tried to elicit intelligible replies to [his]3154-the doctor questions .

" [I]449-the other am a little out of sorts , "[449-the other] [the other]449-the other returned carelessly . " Perhaps [we]3576-we could talk about these things to - morrow . "[449-the other]

" As [you]285-his assistant please , "[141-dr. tootle] said [Dr. Tootle]141-dr. tootle , a little surprised at [[his]141-dr. tootle assistant]285-his assistant 's indifference .

It was a drawing - lesson morning . As [he]130-waymark went [upstairs]434-upstairs , [his]130-waymark ears apprised [him]130-waymark of the state of things [he]130-waymark would find in [[Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby 's room]1227-miss enderby 's room . The approach of the Easter holidays was making [the youngsters]1196-the youngsters even more than usually uproarious , and [their]1196-the youngsters insubordination had passed beyond all pretence of attending to tasks . When [Waymark]130-waymark entered , [his]130-waymark first glance , as always , was towards [the governess]1194-the governess . [She]1194-the governess looked harassed and ill ; was in vain endeavouring to exert some authority with [her]1194-the governess gentle voice . [Her]1194-the governess eyes showed unmistakable gratitude as [the teacher]325-the teacher appeared , for [his]130-waymark approach meant that [she]1194-the governess would be relieved from [the three elder children]1231-the three elder children . [Waymark]130-waymark called sharply to [[his]130-waymark pupils]1232-his pupils to come and take [their]1232-his pupils places , but without any attention on [their]1232-his pupils part . [Master Felix]164-master felix openly urged [the rest]258-the rest to assume a defiant attitude , and began to improvise melodies on a trumpet formed by rolling up a copy - book .

" [Felix]164-master felix , "[150-miss enderby] said [Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby , " give [me]150-miss enderby [your]693-the boy copy - book and go to the drawing - lesson . "[150-miss enderby]

[The boy]693-the boy removed the trumpet from [his]693-the boy mouth , and , waving it once round [his]693-the boy head , sent it flying across [the room]255-the room at [the speaker]488-the speaker ; it hit [her]150-miss enderby on the cheek . In the same minute , [Waymark]130-waymark had bent across [his]130-waymark knee a large pointer which stood in a corner of [the room]255-the room , and had snapped it into two pieces . Holding the lighter of these in one hand , with the other hand [he]130-waymark suddenly caught [Master Felix]164-master felix by the coat - collar , and in a second had [him]130-waymark out of [the room]255-the room and on to [the landing]1239-the landing . Then did the echoes of [the Academy]981-the academy wake to such a bellowing as [they]1241-they had probably never heard before . With a grip impossible even to struggle against , [Waymark]130-waymark held [the young imp]1242-the young imp under [his]130-waymark arm , and plied the broken pointer with great vigour ; the stripes were almost as loud as the roarings . There was a rush from [the rooms below]1243-the rooms below in the direction of the disturbance ; [all the boys]1244-all the boys were in a trice leaping about delightedly on the stairs , and behind [them]1244-all the boys came [O'Gree]142-o'gree , [Egger]166-monsieur egger , and [Dr. Tootle]141-dr. tootle [himself]141-dr. tootle . From [the room above]1245-the room above rushed out all [the young Tootles]1246-the young tootles , yelling for help . Last of all , from [still higher regions of [the house]288-the house]1247-still higher regions of the house there swept down a vision of disordered female attire , dishevelled hair , and glaring eyes ; it was [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle , disturbed at [her]145-mrs. tootle toilet , forgetting all considerations of personal appearance at the alarming outcry . Just as [she]145-mrs. tootle reached the spot , [Waymark]130-waymark 's arm dropped in weariness ; [he]130-waymark flung [the howling young monkey]1249-the howling young monkey into one corner , the stick into another , and deliberately pulled [his]130-waymark coat - sleeves into position once more . [He]130-waymark felt vastly better for the exercise , and there was even a smile on [his]130-waymark heated face .

" [[You]130-waymark brutal ruffian]3577-you brutal ruffian ! "[145-mrs. tootle] shrieked [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle . " How dare [you]130-waymark touch [[my]145-mrs. tootle child]3185-my child ? [You]130-waymark shall answer for this in [the police court]3579-the police court , [sir]3257-sir . "[145-mrs. tootle]

" [Waymark]130-waymark , "[584-her husband] cried [[her]145-mrs. tootle husband]584-her husband , who had struggled to the scene through [the crowd of [cheering boys]1252-cheering boys]1251-the crowd of cheering boys , " what 's the meaning of this ? [You]130-waymark forget [yourself]130-waymark , [sir]3257-sir . Who gave [you]130-waymark authority to use corporal chastisement ? "[584-her husband]

" [The boy]693-the boy has long deserved a good thrashing , "[584-her husband] [he]584-her husband said , " and [I]584-her husband 'm glad [I]584-her husband lost [my]584-her husband temper sufficiently to give [him]693-the boy a portion of [his]693-the boy deserts . If [you]3257-sir wish to know the immediate cause , it simply was that [he]693-the boy threw a book at [[his]693-the boy governess]3583-his governess 's head and hit [her]3583-his governess . "[584-her husband]

" [Mr. O'Gree]142-o'gree , "[3154-the doctor] called out [the doctor]3154-the doctor , " take [[your]3257-sir boys]3584-your boys back to [their]3584-your boys duties , [sir]3257-sir ! [I]3154-the doctor am quite unable to understand this disgraceful lack of discipline . [Every boy who is not at [his]3586-every boy who is not at his seat in one minute seat in one minute]3586-every boy who is not at his seat in one minute will have five hundred verses of the Psalms to write out ! [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark , [I]3154-the doctor shall be obliged to [you]130-waymark if [you]130-waymark will step into [[my]3154-the doctor study]3587-my study . "[3154-the doctor]

Five minutes after , [Waymark]130-waymark was closeted with [Dr. Tootle]141-dr. tootle . [The latter]425-the latter had all at once put off [his]425-the latter appearance of indignation .

" Really , "[3154-the doctor] [he]3154-the doctor began , " it 's a great pity [you]3257-sir let [yourself]3257-sir be carried away like that . [I]3154-the doctor think it very probable indeed that [Felix]164-master felix deserved castigation of some kind , but [you]3257-sir would have done much better to report [him]164-master felix to [me]3154-the doctor , [you]3257-sir know , and let [me]3154-the doctor see to it . [You]3257-sir have put [me]3154-the doctor in an awkward position . [I]3154-the doctor fear [you]3257-sir must make an apology to [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle , and then perhaps the matter can be allowed to blow over . "[3154-the doctor]

" [I]130-waymark think not , "[130-waymark] replied [Waymark]130-waymark , whose mind was evidently made up . There was a look of recklessness on [his]130-waymark face which [one]318-one could at any time have detected lurking beneath the hard self - control which usually marked [him]130-waymark . " [I]130-waymark do n't feel disposed to apologise , and [I]130-waymark am tired of [my]130-waymark position here . [I]130-waymark must give it up . "[130-waymark]

[Dr. Tootle]141-dr. tootle was annoyed . It would not be easy to get [another teacher of the kind]1256-another teacher of the kind at so cheap a rate .

" Come , [you]3257-sir do n't mean this , "[141-dr. tootle] [he]141-dr. tootle said . " [You]3257-sir are out of temper for the moment . Perhaps the apology could be dispensed with ; [I]141-dr. tootle think [I]141-dr. tootle may promise that it can be . [The lad]1132-the lad will be no worse for [his]1132-the lad little correction . Possibly [we]3589-we can come to some more satisfactory arrangements for the future "[141-dr. tootle]

" No , "[130-waymark] interposed [Waymark]130-waymark ; " [I]130-waymark have quite made up [my]130-waymark mind . [I]130-waymark mean to give up teaching altogether ; it does n't suit [me]130-waymark . Of course [I]130-waymark am willing to come as usual the next two days . "[130-waymark]

" [You]1257-the principal are aware that this notice should have been given [me]1257-the principal at the beginning of the quarter ? "[1257-the principal] hinted [the principal]1257-the principal .

" Oh yes . Of course [you]1257-the principal will legally owe [me]141-dr. tootle nothing . [I]141-dr. tootle am prepared for that . "[141-dr. tootle]

" Well , [I]141-dr. tootle shall have to consider it . But [I]141-dr. tootle still think that [you]1257-the principal "[141-dr. tootle]

" As far as [I]141-dr. tootle am concerned , the matter is decided . [I]141-dr. tootle go at [Easter]37-easter . "[141-dr. tootle]

" Very well . [I]141-dr. tootle think [you]1257-the principal are blind to [your]1257-the principal own interest , but of course [you]1257-the principal do as [you]1257-the principal please . If [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle should press [me]141-dr. tootle to take out a summons against [you]1257-the principal for assault , of course [I]141-dr. tootle "[141-dr. tootle]

" Good morning , [Dr. Tootle]141-dr. tootle . "[141-dr. tootle]

The summons was not taken out , but [Waymark]130-waymark 's resolution suffered no change . There was another interview between [him]130-waymark and [the principal]1257-the principal , from which [he]130-waymark issued with the sum of six pounds ten in [his]130-waymark pocket , being half the quarter 's salary . [He]130-waymark had not applied for this , but did not refuse it when it was offered . Seeing that the total amount of cash previously in [his]130-waymark possession was something less than five shillings , [he]130-waymark did wisely , perhaps , to compromise with [his]130-waymark dignity , and let [Dr. Tootle]141-dr. tootle come out of the situation with a certain show of generosity .

CHAPTER XI

BY THE WAYSIDE

" So there ends another chapter . How many more to the end of the story ? How many more scenes till the farce is played out ? There is something flattering to [one]318-one 's vanity in this careless playing with fate ; it is edifying , moreover , to sot circumstances at defiance in this way , now and then , to assert [one]318-one 's freedom . Freedom ! What a joke the word must be to whoever is pulling the wires and making [us]3592-us poor puppets dance at [his]130-waymark pleasure . Pity that [we]3592-us have to pay the piper so heavily for [our]3592-us involuntary jigging ! "[118-julian]

A passage from the letter [Waymark]130-waymark wrote to [[his]130-waymark friend]876-his friend [Casti]118-julian , on the evening when [his]130-waymark school - work came to an end . That night [he]130-waymark sought rest early , and slept well . The sensations with which [he]130-waymark woke next morning were such as [he]130-waymark had not experienced for a long time . [He]130-waymark was at liberty , with six pounds ten in [his]130-waymark pocket . [He]130-waymark could do what [he]130-waymark liked and go whither [he]130-waymark liked , till lack of a dinner should remind [him]130-waymark that [[a man]1260-a man 's hardest master]1261-a man 's hardest master is [his]1260-a man own body . [He]130-waymark dressed leisurely , and , having dressed , treated [himself]130-waymark to an egg for breakfast . Absolutely no need for hurry ; the thought of school - hours dismissed for ever ; a horizon quite free from the vision of hateful toil ; in the real sky overhead a gleam of real sunshine , as if to make credible this sudden change . [His]130-waymark mood was still complete recklessness , a revolt against the idea of responsibility , indifference to all beyond the moment .

It was Thursday ; the morrow would be Good Friday ; after that the intervention of two clear days before the commencement of a new week In the meantime the sun was really shining , and the fresh spring air invited to the open ways . [Waymark]130-waymark closed the door of [[his]130-waymark room]979-his room behind [him]130-waymark , and went [downstairs]445-downstairs , whistling to [himself]130-waymark . But , before reaching the bottom , [he]130-waymark turned and went back again . It seemed warm enough to sit in one of [the parks]1264-the parks and read . [He]130-waymark laid [his]130-waymark hand on a book , almost at haphazard , to put in [his]130-waymark pocket . Then [he]130-waymark walked very leisurely along [Kennington Road]38-kennington road , and on , and on , till [he]130-waymark had crossed [the river]3428-the river .

Wondering in which direction [he]130-waymark should next turn , [he]130-waymark suddenly found [himself]130-waymark repeating , with unaccountable transition of thought , the words " [South Bank]36-south bank , [Regent 's Park]5-regent 's park . "[130-waymark] In all likelihood , [he]130-waymark said to [himself]130-waymark presently , they were suggested by some inscription on [a passing omnibus]1266-a passing omnibus , noted unconsciously . The address was that [he]130-waymark had read in [Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby 's note - book . Why not ramble in that direction as well as another , and amuse [himself]130-waymark by guessing which house it was that [the governess]1194-the governess lived in ? [He]130-waymark had not seen [her]1194-the governess since the uproar which had terminated [his]130-waymark connection with [the young Tootles]1246-the young tootles . Was it true that [she]1194-the governess had then already decided to give up [her]1194-the governess position ? If not , [his]130-waymark outbreak of temper had doubtless resulted unpleasantly for [her]1194-the governess , seeing that [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle would almost certainly dismiss [her]1194-the governess out of mere spite . Several times during the last two days [he]130-waymark had thought of conveying to [her]1194-the governess a note by some means , to express in some way or other this fear , and the regret it caused [him]130-waymark ; the real motive , [he]130-waymark knew well enough , would be a hope of receiving a reply from [her]1194-the governess . But now [she]1194-the governess had perhaps left [the school]311-the school , and [he]130-waymark did not know [her]1194-the governess exact address . [He]130-waymark made [his]130-waymark way across [the Park]600-the park in the direction of [St. John 's Wood]39-st. john 's wood , and had soon reached [South Bank]36-south bank .

[He]130-waymark had walked once the length of [the road]1271-the road , and was looking at [the nearest houses]1272-the nearest houses before [he]130-waymark turned , when [a lady]3171-a lady came round the corner and paused to avoid [him]130-waymark , as [he]130-waymark stood in the middle of [the pavement]1274-the pavement . It was [Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby [herself]150-miss enderby . [Her]1194-the governess embarrassment was apparently not as great as [his]130-waymark own . [She]1194-the governess smiled with friendliness ; seemed indeed in a happier frame of mind than any in which [Waymark]130-waymark had as yet seen [her]1194-the governess . But [she]1194-the governess did not offer [her]1194-the governess hand , and the other , having raised [his]130-waymark hat , was almost on the point of passing on , when [he]130-waymark overcame [his]130-waymark diffidence and spoke .

" [I]130-waymark came here to try and discover where [you]316-the girl lived , [Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby . "[130-waymark]

There was something grotesque in this abruptness ; [his]130-waymark tone only saved it from impertinence . [The girl]316-the girl looked at [him]130-waymark with frank surprise .

" Pray do n't misunderstand [me]130-waymark , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark went on hurriedly . " [I]130-waymark wished , if possible , to well , to tell [you]316-the girl that [I]130-waymark feared [I]130-waymark acted thoughtlessly the other day ; without regard , [I]130-waymark mean , to any consequences it might have for [yourself]316-the girl . "[130-waymark]

" Rather [I]316-the girl ought to thank [you]316-the girl for defending [me]316-the girl . It made no difference in the way [you]316-the girl mean . It had already been decided that [I]316-the girl should leave . [I]316-the girl did not suit [Mrs. Tootle]145-mrs. tootle . "[316-the girl]

It was very pleasant to look down into [her]316-the girl earnest face , and watch it as [she]316-the girl spoke in this unrestrained way . [She]316-the girl seemed so slight and frail , evidently thought so depreciatingly of [herself]316-the girl , looked as though [her]316-the girl life had in it so little joy , that [Waymark]130-waymark had speedily assumed a confident attitude , and gazed at [her]316-the girl as [a man]1260-a man does at one whom [he]1260-a man would gladly guard and cherish .

" [You]316-the girl were certainly unsuited for the work , in every way , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark said , with a smile . " [Your]316-the girl efforts were quite wasted there . Still , [I]130-waymark am sorry [you]316-the girl have left . "[130-waymark]

" [I]316-the girl am going into [a family]3593-a family , "[316-the girl] were [her]316-the girl next words , spoken almost cheerfully . " It is in [the country]3594-the country , in [Essex]40-essex . There are only [two children]3595-two children , quite young . A scarcely heard " yes "[316-the girl] fell from [her]316-the girl lips . [Her]316-the girl eyes were cast down .

" [I]130-waymark am going to make a bold request , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark exclaimed , with a sort of recklessness , though [his]130-waymark voice expressed no less respect than hitherto . " Will [you]130-waymark tell [me]130-waymark where [you]130-waymark are going to ? "[130-waymark]

[She]316-the girl told [him]130-waymark , without looking up , and with a recurrence to the timid manner which had marked [her]316-the girl in [the schoolroom]263-the schoolroom . This gave [Waymark]130-waymark encouragement ; [his]130-waymark confidence grew as [hers]316-the girl diminished .

"[316-the girl]

[The girl]316-the girl answered timidly

" [I]316-the girl shall be glad to keep up [our]3596-our acquaintance . [I]316-the girl shall be glad to hear from [you]130-waymark . "[316-the girl]

Then , at once feeling that [she]316-the girl had gone too far , [her]316-the girl confusion made [her]316-the girl pale . [Waymark]130-waymark held out [his]130-waymark hand , as if to take leave .

" Thank [you]316-the girl very much , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark said warmly . " [I]130-waymark am very grateful . "[130-waymark]

[She]316-the girl gave [him]130-waymark a quick " good - bye , "[316-the girl] and then passed on . [Waymark]130-waymark moved at once in the opposite direction , turning the corner . Then [he]130-waymark wished to go back and notice [which house [she]316-the girl entered]1279-which house she entered , but would not do so lest [she]316-the girl should observe [him]130-waymark . [He]130-waymark walked straight forwards .

How the aspect of [the world]622-the world had changed for [him]130-waymark in these few minutes ; what an incredible revolution had come to pass in [his]130-waymark own desires and purposes t The intellectual atmosphere [he]130-waymark breathed was of [his]130-waymark own creation ; [the society of cultured people [he]130-waymark had never had an opportunity of enjoying]1281-the society of cultured people he had never had an opportunity of enjoying . [A refined and virtuous woman]1282-a refined and virtuous woman had hitherto existed for [him]130-waymark merely in the sanctuary of [his]130-waymark imagination ; [he]130-waymark had known not one such . If [he]130-waymark passed one in [the street]340-the street , the effect of the momentary proximity was only to embitter [his]130-waymark thoughts , by reminding [him]130-waymark of the hopeless gulf fixed between [[his]130-waymark world]1284-his world and that in which such creatures had [their]1285-their being . In revenge , [he]130-waymark tried to soil the purity of [his]130-waymark ideals ; would have persuaded [himself]130-waymark that the difference between the two spheres was merely in externals , that [he]130-waymark was imposed upon by wealth , education , and superficial refinement of manners . Happily [he]130-waymark had never really succeeded in thus deceiving [himself]130-waymark , and the effort had only served to aggravate [his]130-waymark miseries . The habit of mind , however , had shown itself in the earlier stages of [his]130-waymark acquaintance with [Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby . The first sight of [her]150-miss enderby had moved [him]130-waymark somewhat , but scarcely with any foreshadowing of serious emotion . [He]130-waymark felt that [she]150-miss enderby was different from [any woman with whom [he]130-waymark had ever stood on an equal footing]1286-any woman with whom he had ever stood on an equal footing ; but , at the same time , the very possibility of establishing more or less intimate relations with [her]150-miss enderby made [him]130-waymark distrustful of [his]130-waymark judgment . In spite of [himself]130-waymark , [he]130-waymark tried to disparage [her]150-miss enderby qualities . [She]150-miss enderby was pretty , [he]130-waymark admitted , but then of such a feeble , characterless type ; doubtless [her]150-miss enderby understanding corresponded with the weakness of [her]150-miss enderby outward appearance . None the less , [he]130-waymark had continued to observe [her]150-miss enderby keenly , and had noted with pleasure every circumstance which contradicted [his]130-waymark wilful depreciation of [her]150-miss enderby . [His]130-waymark state of mind after the thrashing [he]130-waymark gave to [young Tootle]145-mrs. tootle had been characteristic . What had been the cause of [his]130-waymark violence ? Certainly not uncontrollable anger , for [he]130-waymark had in reality been perfectly cool throughout the affair ; simply , then , the pleasure of avenging [Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby . And for this [he]130-waymark had sacrificed [his]130-waymark place , and left [himself]130-waymark without resources . [He]130-waymark had acted absurdly ; certainly would not have repeated the absurdity had the scene been to act over again . This was not the attitude of [one in love]1287-one in love , and [he]130-waymark knew it . Moreover , though [he]130-waymark had thought of writing to [her]150-miss enderby , it would in reality have cost [him]130-waymark nothing if [she]150-miss enderby had forthwith passed out of [his]130-waymark sight and knowledge . Now how all this had been altered , by a mere chance meeting . The doubts had left [him]130-waymark ; [she]150-miss enderby was indeed the being from a higher world that [he]130-waymark would have liked to believe [her]150-miss enderby from the first ; the mysterious note of true sympathy had been struck in that short exchange of words and looks , and , though [they]1288-they had taken leave of each other for who could say how long , mutual knowledge was just beginning , real intercourse about to be established between [them]1288-they . [He]130-waymark might write to [her]150-miss enderby , and of course [she]150-miss enderby would reply .

[He]130-waymark walked without much perception of time or distance , and found [himself]130-waymark at [home]3157-home just before nightfall . [He]130-waymark felt disposed for a quiet evening , to be spent in the companionship of [his]130-waymark thoughts . But when [he]130-waymark had made [his]130-waymark coffee and eaten with appetite after the day 's rambling , restlessness again possessed [him]130-waymark . After all , it was not retirement that [he]130-waymark needed ; these strange new Imaginings would consort best with motion and the liveliness of [the streets]3169-the streets . So [he]130-waymark put out [his]130-waymark lamp , and once more set forth . The night air freshened [his]130-waymark spirits ; [he]130-waymark sang to [himself]130-waymark as [he]130-waymark went along . It was long since [he]130-waymark had been to [a theatre]3395-a theatre , and just now [he]130-waymark ' vas so hopelessly poor that [he]130-waymark could really afford a little extravagance . So [he]130-waymark was soon sitting before [the well - known drop of [a favourite play - house]1293-a favourite play - house]1292-the well - known drop of a favourite play - house , as full of light - hearted expectancy as [a boy who is enjoying a holiday]1294-a boy who is enjoying a holiday . The evening was delightful , and passed all too quickly .

The play over , [he]130-waymark was in no mood to go straight [home]3157-home . [He]130-waymark lit a cigar and drifted with the current westward , out of [the Strand]1024-the strand and into [Pall Mall]41-pall mall . A dispute between [a cabdriver]1297-a cabdriver and [his]130-waymark fare induced [him]130-waymark to pause for a moment under the colonnade , and , when [the little cluster of people]1298-the little cluster of people had moved on , [he]130-waymark still stood leaning against one of the pillars , enjoying the mild air and the scent of [his]130-waymark cigar . [He]130-waymark felt [his]130-waymark elbow touched , and , looking round with indifference , met the kind of greeting for which [he]130-waymark was prepared . [He]130-waymark shook [his]130-waymark head and did not reply ; then the sham gaiety of the voice all at once turned to a very real misery , and [the girl]316-the girl began to beg instead of trying to entice [him]130-waymark in the ordinary way . [He]130-waymark looked at [her]316-the girl again , and was shocked at the ghastly wretchedness of [her]316-the girl daubed face . [She]316-the girl was ill , [she]316-the girl said , and could scarcely walk about , but must get money somehow ; if [she]316-the girl did n't , [[her]316-the girl landlady]537-her landlady would n't let [her]316-the girl sleep in [the house]288-the house again , and [she]316-the girl had nowhere else to go to . There could be no mistake about the genuineness of [her]316-the girl story , at all events as far as bodily suffering went . [Waymark]130-waymark contrasted [her]316-the girl state with [his]130-waymark own , and took out what money [he]130-waymark had in [his]130-waymark pocket ; it was the change out of a sovereign which [he]130-waymark had received at [the theatre]1025-the theatre , and [he]130-waymark gave [her]316-the girl it all . [She]316-the girl stared , and did not understand .

[They]1331-they went up [two flights of stairs]1341-two flights of stairs , then entered [a room where a bright fire was burning]1342-a room where a bright fire was burning . [[Waymark]130-waymark 's conductor]1343-waymark 's conductor held a piece of paper to the flame , and lit a lamp . It was [a small , pleasantly furnished sitting - room]1344-a small , pleasantly furnished sitting - room .

" Do [you]316-the girl play ? "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark asked , seeing an open piano , with music upon it .

" [I]130-waymark only wish [I]130-waymark could . [[My]130-waymark landlady 's daughter]3619-my landlady 's daughter is giving [me]130-waymark lessons . But [I]130-waymark think [I]130-waymark 'm getting on . Listen to [me]130-waymark do this exercise . "[130-waymark]

[She]316-the girl sat down , and , with much conscientious effort , went over some simple bars . Then [she]316-the girl looked up at [[her]316-the girl companion]1082-her companion and caught [him]1082-her companion smiling .

" Well , "[316-the girl] [she]316-the girl exclaimed , in a pet , " [you]1082-her companion must begin at the beginning in everything , must n't [you]1082-her companion ? Come and let [me]316-the girl hear what [you]1082-her companion can do . "[316-the girl]

" Not even so much . "[316-the girl]

" Then do n't laugh at [a poor girl doing [her]3620-a poor girl doing her best best]3620-a poor girl doing her best . [You]1082-her companion have such a queer smile too ; it seems both ill - natured and good - natured at the same time . Now wait a minute till [I]316-the girl come back . "[316-the girl]

[She]316-the girl went into [an inner room]1346-an inner room , and closed the door behind [her]316-the girl . In five minutes it opened again . [She]316-the girl appeared in a dressing gown and with [her]316-the girl feet in slippers . [Her]316-the girl fine hair fell heavily about [her]316-the girl shoulders ; in [her]316-the girl arms [she]316-the girl held a beautiful black cat , with white throat and paws .

" This is [[my]316-the girl child]3185-my child . Do n't [you]1082-her companion admire [him]3185-my child ? Shake hands , [Grim]169-grim . "[316-the girl]

" Why [Grim]169-grim ? "[316-the girl]

" It 's short for [Grimalkin]170-grimalkin . The name of a cat in a hook of fairy tales [I]316-the girl used to be fond of reading . [I]316-the girl picked [him]3185-my child up on [our]3623-we door - step , two months ago . Oh , [you]1082-her companion never saw [such a wretched little object , dripping with rain , and with such a poor starved little face]3624-such a wretched little object , dripping with rain , and with such a poor starved little face , and bones almost coming through the skin . [He]3185-my child looked up at [me]316-the girl , and begged [me]316-the girl as plain as plain could be to have pity on [him]3185-my child and help [him]3185-my child ; did n't [you]1082-her companion , [Grimmy]171-grimmy ? "[316-the girl]

" Yes . "[316-the girl]

The door of [the room]255-the room suddenly opened , and there sprang in [a fresh - coloured young girl in hat and jacket]1348-a fresh - coloured young girl in hat and jacket , short , plump , pretty , and looking about seventeen . " What is it , [Sally]105-sally ? "[169-grim] asked [[Grim]169-grim 's mistress]1350-grim 's mistress , with a good - natured laugh .

" How do [you]169-grim know ? "[1354-me] [she]1354-me asked sharply . " Why should [you]169-grim think [me]1354-me selfish ? "[1354-me]

" Why not bring it ? "[1354-me]

" Everything is possible .
