[Waymark]129-waymark lit [his]1355-he pipe , stooped to give [Grim]169-grim a stroke , and buttoned up [his]1355-he coat . [Ida]101-ida led the way [downstairs]445-downstairs . [They]1358-they shook hands again , and parted .

CHAPTER XII

RENT DAY

It was much after [his]1355-he usual hour when [Waymark]129-waymark awoke on Good Friday morning . [He]1355-he had been troubled throughout the night with a strangely vivid dream , which seemed to have repeated itself several times ; when [he]1355-he at length started into consciousness the anguish of the vision was still upon [him]1355-he .

[He]1355-he rose at once , and dressed quickly , doing [his]1355-he best to shake off the clinging misery of sleep . In a little while it had passed , and [he]1355-he tried to go over in [his]1355-he mind the events of the preceding day . Were they , too , only fragments of a long dream ? Surely so many and strange events could not have crowded themselves into one period of twelve hours ; and for [him]1355-he , whose days passed with such dreary monotony . The interview with [Maud Enderby]103-maud seemed so unnaturally long ago ; that with [Ida Starr]101-ida , so impossibly fresh and recent . Yet both had undoubtedly taken place . [He]1355-he , who but yesterday morning had felt so bitterly [his]1355-he loneliness in [the world]622-the world , and , above all , the impossibility of what [he]1355-he most longed for [woman]1360-woman 's companionship found [himself]1355-he all at once on terms of at least friendly intimacy with [two women]1361-two women , both young , both beautiful , yet so wholly different . Each answered to an ideal which [he]1355-he cherished , and the two ideals were so diverse , so mutually exclusive . The experience had left [him]1355-he in a curious frame of mind . For the present , [he]1355-he felt cool , almost indifferent , to both [[his]1355-he new acquaintances]1362-his new acquaintances . [He]1355-he had asked and obtained leave to write to [Maud Enderby]103-maud ; what on earth could [he]1355-he write about ? How could [he]1355-he address [her]103-maud ? [He]1355-he had promised to go and see [Ida Starr]101-ida , on a most impracticable footing . Was it not almost certain that , before the day came round , [her]103-maud caprice would have vanished , and [his]1355-he reception would prove anything but a flattering one ? The feelings which [both girls]1068-both girls had at the time excited in [him]1355-he seemed artificial ; in [his]1355-he present mood [he]1355-he in vain tried to resuscitate [his]1355-he interest either in the one or the other . It was as though [he]1355-he had over - exerted [his]1355-he emotional powers , and [they]1068-both girls lay exhausted . Weariness was the only reality of which [he]1355-he was conscious . [He]1355-he must turn [his]1355-he mind to other things . Having breakfasted , [he]1355-he remembered what day it was , and presently took down a volume of [his]1355-he Goethe , opening at the Easter morning scene in [Faust]173-faust , favourite reading with [him]1355-he . This inspired [him]1355-he with a desire to go into the open air ; it was a bright day , and there would be life in [the streets]3169-the streets . Just as [he]1355-he began to prepare [himself]1355-he for walking , there came a knock at [his]1355-he door , and [Julian Casti]118-julian entered .

" [Halloa]174-halloa ! "[129-waymark] [Waymark]129-waymark cried . " [I]129-waymark thought [you]1355-he told [me]129-waymark [you]1355-he were engaged with [[your]1355-he cousin]3531-your cousin to - day . "[129-waymark]

" [I]1365-i was , but [I]1365-i sent [her]3531-your cousin a note yesterday to say [I]1365-i was unable to meet [her]3531-your cousin . "[1365-i]

" Then why did n't [you]1355-he write at the same time and tell [me]129-waymark [you]1355-he were coming ? [I]129-waymark might have gone out for the day . "[129-waymark]

" [I]1365-i had no intention of coming then . "[1365-i]

" What 's the matter ? [You]1355-he look out of sorts . "[129-waymark]

" [I]1365-i do n't feel in very good spirits . By the by , [I]1365-i heard from [the publishers]3660-the publishers yesterday . Here 's the note . "[1365-i]

[It]1365-i simply stated that [Messrs. So]175-messrs. so - and - so had given [their]175-messrs. so best attention to the play of " Stilicho , "[1365-i] which [Mr. Casti]116-mr. casti had been so good as to submit to [them]175-messrs. so , and regretted [their]175-messrs. so inability to make any proposal for its publication , seeing that its subject was hardly likely to excite popular interest . [They]175-messrs. so thanked [the author]1366-the author for offering it to [them]175-messrs. so , and begged to return the MS .

" Well , it 's a disappointment , "[129-waymark] said [Waymark]129-waymark , " but [we]175-messrs. so must try again . [I]129-waymark [myself]129-waymark am so hardened to this kind of thing that [I]129-waymark fear [you]3661-you will think [me]129-waymark unsympathetic . It 's like having a tooth out . [You]3661-you never quite get used to it , but [you]3661-you learn after two or three experiments to gauge the moment 's torture at its true value . Re - direct [your]3661-you parcel , and fresh hope beats out the old discouragement . "[129-waymark]

" It was n't altogether that which was making [me]116-mr. casti feel restless and depressed , "[116-mr. casti] [Casti]116-mr. casti said , when [they]175-messrs. so had left [the house]288-the house and were walking along . " [I]116-mr. casti suppose [I]116-mr. casti 'm not quite right in health just at present . [I]116-mr. casti seem to have lost [my]116-mr. casti natural good spirits of late ; the worst of it is , [I]116-mr. casti ca n't settle to [my]116-mr. casti day 's work as [I]116-mr. casti used to . In fact , [I]116-mr. casti have just been applying for a new place , that of dispenser at [the All Saints ' Hospital]3662-the all saints ' hospital . If [I]116-mr. casti get it , it would make [my]116-mr. casti life a good deal more independent . [I]116-mr. casti should live in [lodgings of [my]116-mr. casti own]3663-lodgings of my own , and have much more time to [myself]116-mr. casti . "[116-mr. casti]

[Waymark]129-waymark encouraged the idea strongly . But [[his]129-waymark companion]1325-his companion could not be roused to the wonted cheerfulness . After a long silence , [he]129-waymark all at once put a strange question , and in an abashed way .

" [Waymark]129-waymark , have [you]129-waymark ever been in love ? "[129-waymark]

[Osmond]129-waymark laughed , and looked at [[his]129-waymark friend]876-his friend curiously .

" Many thousand times , "[129-waymark] was [his]129-waymark reply .

" No , but seriously , "[118-julian] urged [Julian]118-julian .

" With desperate seriousness for two or three days at a time . Never longer . "[129-waymark]

" Well now , answer [me]118-julian in all earnestness . Do [you]129-waymark believe it possible to love [a woman whom in almost every respect [you]129-waymark regard as [your]129-waymark inferior]3664-a woman whom in almost every respect you regard as your inferior , who [you]129-waymark know ca n't understand [your]129-waymark thoughts and aspirations , who has no interest in anything above daily needs ? "[118-julian]

" Impossible to say . Is [she]3664-a woman whom in almost every respect you regard as your inferior good - looking ? "[129-waymark]

" Suppose [she]3664-a woman whom in almost every respect you regard as your inferior is not ; yet not altogether plain . "[118-julian]

" Then does [she]3664-a woman whom in almost every respect you regard as your inferior love [you]118-julian ? "[129-waymark]

[Julian]118-julian reddened at the direct application .

" Suppose [she]3664-a woman whom in almost every respect you regard as your inferior seems to . "[118-julian]

" Seems to , eh ? On the whole , [I]118-julian should say that [I]118-julian could n't declare it possible or the contrary till [I]118-julian had seen [the girl]316-the girl . [I]118-julian [myself]118-julian should be very capable of falling desperately in love with [a girl who had n't an idea in [her]3664-a woman whom in almost every respect you regard as your inferior head]3666-a girl who had n't an idea in her head , and did n't know [her]3664-a woman whom in almost every respect you regard as your inferior letters . All [I]118-julian should ask would be passion in return , and well , yes , [a pliant and docile character]3667-a pliant and docile character . "[118-julian]

" [You]118-julian are right ; the character would go for much . Never mind , [we]3668-we wo n't speak any more of the subject . It was an absurd question to ask [you]118-julian . "[118-julian]

" Nevertheless , [you]118-julian have made [me]118-julian very curious . "[118-julian]

" [I]118-julian will tell [you]118-julian more some other time ; not now . Tell [me]118-julian about [your]118-julian own plans . What decision have [you]118-julian come to ? "[118-julian]

[Waymark]129-waymark professed to have formed no plan whatever . This was not strictly true . For some months now , ever and again , as often indeed as [he]129-waymark had felt the burden of [his]129-waymark schoolwork more than usually intolerable , [his]129-waymark thoughts had turned to [the one person who could be of any assistance to [him]129-waymark , and upon whom [he]129-waymark had any kind of claim]1370-the one person who could be of any assistance to him , and upon whom he had any kind of claim ; that was [Abraham Woodstock]1371-abraham woodstock , [[his]129-waymark father 's old friend]1372-his father 's old friend . [He]129-waymark had held no communication with [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock for four years ; did not even know whether [he]114-mr. woodstock was living . But of [him]114-mr. woodstock [he]129-waymark still thought , now that absolute need was close at hand , and , as soon as [Julian Casti]118-julian had left [him]129-waymark to - day , [he]129-waymark examined a directory to ascertain whether [the accountant]1373-the accountant still occupied [the house in [St. John Street Road]7-st. john street road]1374-the house in st. john street road . Apparently [he]114-mr. woodstock did . And the same evening [Waymark]129-waymark made up [his]129-waymark mind to visit [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock on the following day .

[The old gentleman]1375-the old gentleman was sitting alone when [the servant]289-the servant announced [a visitor]1377-a visitor . In personal appearance [he]1375-the old gentleman was scarcely changed since the visit of [[his]1375-the old gentleman little grand - daughter]1378-his little grand - daughter . Perhaps the eye was not quite so vivid , the skin on forehead and cheeks a trifle less smooth , but [his]1375-the old gentleman face had the same healthy colour ; there was the same repose of force in the huge limbs , and [his]1375-the old gentleman voice had lost nothing of its resonant firmness .

" Ah ! "[1375-the old gentleman] [he]1375-the old gentleman exclaimed , as [Waymark]129-waymark entered . " [You]129-waymark ! [I]1375-the old gentleman 've been wondering where [you]129-waymark were to be found . "[1375-the old gentleman]

[The visitor]842-the visitor held out [his]842-the visitor hand , and [Abraham]115-abraham , though [he]842-the visitor did not rise , smiled not unpleasantly as [he]842-the visitor gave [his]842-the visitor own .

" [You]129-waymark wanted to see [me]129-waymark ? "[129-waymark] [Waymark]129-waymark asked .

" Well , yes . [I]842-the visitor suppose [you]129-waymark 've come about the mines . "[842-the visitor]

" Mines ? [What mines]3669-what mines ? "[842-the visitor]

" Oh , then [you]129-waymark have n't come about [them]3669-what mines . [You]129-waymark did n't know [the Llwg Valley people]3670-the llwg valley people have begun to pay a dividend ? "[842-the visitor]

[Waymark]129-waymark remembered that one of [[his]129-waymark father]497-his father 's unfortunate speculations had been the purchase of certain shares in [some Welsh mines]1381-some welsh mines . [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock explained that things were looking up with [the company in question , who had just declared a dividend of 4 per cent . on all [their]1382-the company in question , who had just declared a dividend of 4 per cent . on all their paid - up shares paid - up shares]1382-the company in question , who had just declared a dividend of 4 per cent . on all their paid - up shares .

" In other words , "[129-waymark] exclaimed [Waymark]129-waymark eagerly , " [they]1382-the company in question , who had just declared a dividend of 4 per cent . on all their paid - up shares owe [me]129-waymark some money ? "[129-waymark]

" Which [you]129-waymark can do with , eh ? "[115-abraham] said [Abraham]115-abraham , with a twinkle of good - humoured commiseration in [his]497-his father eye .

" Perfectly . What are the details ? "[129-waymark]

" There are fifty ten - pound shares . Dividend accordingly twenty pounds . "[129-waymark]

" By Jingo ! How is it to be got at ? "[129-waymark]

" No ; on the whole [I]129-waymark think not . "[129-waymark]

" Ho , [ho]3671-ho , [Osmond]129-waymark , where have [you]129-waymark learnt prudence , eh ? Why do n't [you]129-waymark sit down ? If [you]129-waymark did n't come about [the mines]3672-the mines , why did [you]129-waymark come , eh ? "[129-waymark]

" Not to mince matters , "[129-waymark] said [Waymark]129-waymark , taking a chair , and speaking in an off - hand way which cost [him]129-waymark much effort , " [I]129-waymark came to ask [you]129-waymark to help [me]129-waymark to some way of getting a living . "[129-waymark]

" [Hollo]176-hollo ! "[1383-the old man] exclaimed [the old man]1383-the old man , chuckling . " Why , [I]1383-the old man should have thought [you]129-waymark 'd made [your]129-waymark fortune by this time . Poetry does n't pay , it seems ? "[1383-the old man]

" [I]129-waymark have none . [I]129-waymark only know that [I]129-waymark 've been half - starved for years in the cursed business of teaching , and that [I]129-waymark ca n't stand it any longer . [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock pondered for a few moments . [He]114-mr. woodstock thrust out [his]114-mr. woodstock great legs with feet crossed on the fender , and with [his]114-mr. woodstock hands jingled coin in [his]114-mr. woodstock trouser - pockets .

[Waymark]129-waymark was punctual enough on the following Tuesday , and [the two]273-the two drove in [a hansom eastward]1388-a hansom eastward . [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock stopped at the end of [an alley]1389-an alley .

" [You]129-waymark see , "[114-mr. woodstock] [he]114-mr. woodstock said , " that 's [Litany Lane]45-litany lane . [Waymark]129-waymark looked . [Litany Lane]45-litany lane was [a narrow passage]1390-a narrow passage , with [houses]1391-houses only on one side ; opposite to [them]1391-houses ran a long high wall , apparently the limit of some manufactory . Two posts set up at the entrance to [the Lane]1392-the lane showed that it was no thoroughfare for [vehicles]1393-vehicles . [The houses]1394-the houses were of three storeys . There were [two or three dirty little shops]1395-two or three dirty little shops , but the rest were [ordinary lodging - houses]1396-ordinary lodging - houses , the front - doors standing wide open as a matter of course , exhibiting [a dusky passage , filthy stairs]1397-a dusky passage , filthy stairs , with generally a glimpse right through into [the yard]1398-the yard in the rear . In [Elm Court]1399-elm court [the houses]1394-the houses were smaller , and had [their]1394-the houses fronts whitewashed . Under the archway which led into [the Court]1401-the court were fastened up several written notices of [rooms]1402-rooms to be let at this or that number . [The paving]1403-the paving was in evil repair , forming here and there considerable pools of water , the stench and the colour whereof led to the supposition that [the inhabitants]1404-the inhabitants facilitated domestic operations by emptying casual vessels out of the windows . The dirty little casements on [the ground floor]1405-the ground floor exhibited without exception a rag of red or white curtain on the one side , prevailing fashion evidently requiring no corresponding drapery on the other . [The Court]1401-the court was [a cul de sac]1407-a cul de sac , and at the far end stood a receptacle for ashes , the odour from which was intolerable . Strangely enough , almost all the window - sills displayed flower - pots , and , despite the wretched weather , several little bird - cages hung out from the upper storeys . In one of [them]1391-houses a lark was singing briskly .

[They]1408-they began [their]1408-they progress through [the tenements]1409-the tenements , commencing at [the top of [Litany Lane]45-litany lane]1410-the top of litany lane . [Many of [the rooms]739-the rooms]1411-many of the rooms were locked , [the occupiers]1413-the occupiers being away at [their]1413-the occupiers work , but in such case the rent had generally been left with [some other person in [the house]288-the house]1414-some other person in the house , and was forthcoming . But now and then neither rent nor [tenant]1416-tenant was to be got at , and dire were the threats which [Abraham]115-abraham bade [the neighbours]1417-the neighbours convey to [the defaulters]1418-the defaulters on [their]1417-the neighbours return . [His]1419-his way with one and all was curt and vigorous ; to [Waymark]129-waymark it seemed needlessly brutal . [A woman]3216-a woman pleading inability to make up [her]3216-a woman total sum would be cut short with a thunderous oath , and the assurance that , if [she]3216-a woman did not pay up in a day or two , every stick would be carried off . Pitiful pleading for time had absolutely no effect upon [Abraham]115-abraham . Here and there [e tenant]1421-e tenant would complain of high rent , and point out a cracked ceiling , a rotten piece of stairs , or something else imperatively calling for renovation . " If [you]129-waymark do n't like [the room]255-the room , clear out , "[1422-the landlord] was [the landlord]1422-the landlord 's sole reply to all such speeches .

In one place [they]1423-they came across [an old Irish woman engaged in washing]1424-an old irish woman engaged in washing . [The room]255-the room was hung with reeking clothes from wall to wall . For a time it was difficult to distinguish objects through the steam , and [Waymark]129-waymark , making [his]129-waymark way in , stumbled and almost fell over an open box . From the box at once proceeded a miserable little wail , broken by as terrible a cough as [a child]378-a child could be afflicted with ; and [Waymark]129-waymark then perceived that the box was being used as a cradle , in which lay [a baby gasping in the agonies of some throat disease]1427-a baby gasping in the agonies of some throat disease , whilst drops from the wet clothing trickled on to [its]1427-a baby gasping in the agonies of some throat disease face .

On leaving [this house]3540-this house , [they]1423-they entered [Elm Court]46-elm court . Here , sitting on the doorstep of [the first house]1429-the first house , was [a child of apparently nine or ten]1430-a child of apparently nine or ten , and seemingly [a girl]469-a girl , though the nondescript attire might have concealed either sex , and the face was absolutely sexless in its savagery . [Her]469-a girl hair was cut short , and round [her]469-a girl neck was a bit of steel chain , fastened with string . On seeing [the two]273-the two approach , [she]469-a girl sprang up , and disappeared with a bound into [the house]288-the house .

" That 's [the most infernal little devil in all [London]3-london]3695-the most infernal little devil in all london , [I]114-mr. woodstock do believe , "[114-mr. woodstock] said [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock , as [they]1423-they began to ascend the stairs . " [[Her]469-a girl mother]377-her mother owes two weeks , and if [she]469-a girl do n't pay something to - day , [I]114-mr. woodstock 'll have [her]469-a girl out . [The room in question]1434-the room in question was at [the top of [the house]288-the house]1435-the top of the house . [It]1434-the room in question proved to be quite bare of furniture . On a bundle of straw in one corner was lying [a woman]3216-a woman , to all appearances in extremis . [She]3216-a woman lay looking up to the ceiling , [her]3216-a woman face distorted into the most ghastly anguish , [her]3216-a woman lips foaming ; [her]3216-a woman whole frame shivered incessantly .

" Ha , [I]115-abraham thought so , "[115-abraham] exclaimed [Abraham]115-abraham as [he]1438-he entered . " Are [you]448-the woman going to pay anything this week ? "[115-abraham]

[The woman]448-the woman seemed to be unconscious .

" Then out [you]320-the child go ! Come , [you]320-the child , get up now ; d ' [you]320-the child hear ? "[1441-we]

[They]1441-we dragged [her]448-the woman about half - way to the door , when suddenly [Waymark]129-waymark felt the foot [he]129-waymark had hold of withdrawn from [his]129-waymark grasp , and at once [the woman]448-the woman sprang upright . Then [she]448-the woman fell on [him]129-waymark , tooth and nail , screaming like some evil beast . Had not [Abraham]115-abraham forthwith come to the rescue , [he]129-waymark would have been seriously torn about the face , but just in time [the woman]448-the woman 's arms were seized in a giant grip , and [she]448-the woman was flung bodily out of [the room]255-the room , falling with a crash upon [the landing]1239-the landing . Then from [her]448-the woman and [the child]320-the child arose a most terrific uproar of commination ; both together yelled such foulness and blasphemy as can only be conceived by [those who have made a special study of this vocabulary]1447-those who have made a special study of this vocabulary , and the vituperation of [the child]320-the child was , if anything , richer in quality than [the mother]403-the mother 's . [The former]3473-the former , moreover , did not confine [herself]3473-the former to words , but all at once sent [her]3473-the former clenched fist through every pain of glass in the window , heedless of the fearful cuts [she]3473-the former inflicted upon [herself]3473-the former , and uttering a wild yell of triumph at each fracture . [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock was too late to save [[his]114-mr. woodstock property]1451-his property , but [he]114-mr. woodstock caught up [the creature like a doll]1452-the creature like a doll , and flung [her]448-the woman out also on to [the landing]1239-the landing , then coolly locked the door behind [him]114-mr. woodstock , put the key in [his]114-mr. woodstock pocket , and , letting [Waymark]129-waymark pass on first , descended [the stairs]742-the stairs . The yelling and screeching behind [them]1455-they continued as long as [they]1455-they were in [the Court]1401-the court , but it drew no attention from [the neighbours]1417-the neighbours , who were far too accustomed to this kind of thing to heed it .

In [the last house]1458-the last house [they]1455-they had to enter [they]1455-they came upon [a man asleep on a bare bedstead]1459-a man asleep on a bare bedstead . It was difficult to wake [him]1459-a man asleep on a bare bedstead . When at length [he]114-mr. woodstock was aroused , [he]114-mr. woodstock glared at [them]1455-they for a moment with one blood - shot eye the other was sightless , looking much like a wild beast which doubts whether to spring or to shrink back .

" Rent , Slimy , "[114-mr. woodstock] said [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock with more of good humour than usual .

[The man]491-the man pointed to the mantelpiece , where the pieces of money were found to be lying . [Waymark]129-waymark looked round [the room]255-the room . Besides [the bedstead]1462-the bedstead , a table was the only article of furniture , and on it stood a dirty jug and a glass . Lying about was a strange collection of miscellaneous articles , heaps of rags and dirty paper , bottles , boots , bones . There were one or two chairs in process of being new - caned ; there was a wooden frame for holding glass , such as is carried about by itinerant glaziers , and , finally , there was a knife - grinding instrument , adapted for wheeling about [the streets]3169-the streets . The walls were all scribbled over with obscene words and drawings . On the inside of the door had been fitted two enormous bolts , one above and one below .

" How 's trade , [Slimy]156-slimy ? "[114-mr. woodstock] inquired [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock .

" Which trade , [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock ? "[491-the man] asked [the man]491-the man in return , in a very husky voice .

" Oh , trade in general . "[491-the man]
