[CHAPTER XIII

A MAN - TRAP

Julian Casti]118-julian was successful in [his]491-the man application for the post of dispenser at [the All Saints ' Hospital]3662-the all saints ' hospital , and shortly after [Easter]37-easter [he]491-the man left [the shop in [Oxford Street]19-oxford street]1468-the shop in oxford street , taking lodgings in [Beaufort Street]47-beaufort street , [Chelsea]48-chelsea . [His]491-the man first evening there was spent in [[Waymark]129-waymark 's company]1469-waymark 's company , and there was much talk of the progress [his]491-the man writing would make , now that [his]491-the man hours of liberty were so considerably extended . For the first time in [his]491-the man life [he]491-the man was enjoying the sense of independence . [Waymark]129-waymark talked of moving from [Walcot Square]21-walcot square , in order to be nearer to [[his]129-waymark friend]876-his friend . [He]491-the man , too , was possessed of more freedom than had been the case for a long time , and [his]491-the man head was full of various fancies . [They]1471-they would encourage each other in [their]1471-they work , afford by mutual appreciation that stimulus which is so essential to [the young artist]1472-the young artist .

But in [this world]3446-this world , though [man]1474-man may propose , it is [woman]1360-woman who disposes . And at this moment , [Julian]118-julian 's future was being disposed of in a manner [he]118-julian could not well have foreseen .

[Harriet Smales]99-harriet had heard with unconcealed pleasure of [his]118-julian leaving [the shop]361-the shop and taking lodgings of [his]118-julian own . [She]99-harriet had been anxious to come and see [the rooms]739-the rooms , and , though the following Sunday was appointed for [her]99-harriet visit , [she]99-harriet could not wait so long , but , to [[her]99-harriet cousin]911-her cousin 's surprise , presented [herself]99-harriet at [the house]288-the house one evening , and was announced by [the landlady , who looked suspicious]1480-the landlady , who looked suspicious . [Julian]118-julian , with some nervousness , hastened to explain that [the visitor]842-the visitor was [a relative]1482-a relative , which did not in the least alter [[his]118-julian landlady]1483-his landlady 's preconceived ideas . [Harriet]99-harriet sat down and looked about [her]99-harriet with a sigh of satisfaction . If [she]99-harriet could but have such [a home]1484-a home ! [Girls]3221-girls had no chance of getting on as [men]3195-men did . If only [[her]99-harriet father]514-her father could have lived , things would have been different . Now [she]99-harriet was thrown on [the world]622-the world , and had to depend upon [her]99-harriet own hard work . Then [she]99-harriet gave way to an hysterical sob , and [Julian]118-julian who felt sure that [the landlady]386-the landlady was listening at the door could only beg [her]99-harriet nervously not to be so down - hearted .

" Whatever success [I]118-julian have , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian said to [her]99-harriet , " [you]99-harriet will share it . "[118-julian]

" If [I]99-harriet thought so ! "[99-harriet] [she]99-harriet sighed , looking down at the floor , and moving the point of [her]99-harriet umbrella up and down . [Harriet]99-harriet had saturated [her]99-harriet mind with the fiction of penny weeklies , and owed to this training all manner of awkward affectations which [she]99-harriet took to be the most becoming manifestations of a susceptible heart . At times [she]99-harriet would express [herself]99-harriet in phrases of the most absurdly high - flown kind , and lately [she]99-harriet had got into the habit of heaving profound sighs between [her]99-harriet sentences . [Julian]118-julian was not blind to the meaning of all this . [His]118-julian active employments during the past week had kept [his]118-julian thoughts from brooding on the matter , and [he]118-julian had all but dismissed the trouble it had given [him]118-julian . But this visit , and [Harriet]99-harriet 's demeanour throughout it , revived all [his]118-julian anxieties . [He]118-julian came back from accompanying [[his]118-julian cousin]895-his cousin part of [her]895-his cousin way [home]3157-home in a very uneasy frame of mind . What could [he]118-julian do to disabuse [the poor girl of the unhappy hopes [she]895-his cousin entertained]1492-the poor girl of the unhappy hopes she entertained ? The thought of giving pain to [any most humble creature]1493-any most humble creature was itself a pain unendurable to [Julian]118-julian . [His]118-julian was one of those natures to which self - sacrifice is infinitely easier than the idea of sacrificing another to [his]118-julian own desires or even necessities , a vice of weakness often more deeply and widely destructive than the vices of strength .

The visit having been paid , it was arranged that on the following Sunday [Julian]118-julian should meet [[his]118-julian cousin]895-his cousin at [the end of [Gray 's Inn Road]31-gray 's inn road]1495-the end of gray 's inn road as usual . On that day the weather was fine , but [Harriet]99-harriet came out in no mood for a walk . [She]99-harriet had been ailing for a day or two , [she]99-harriet said , and felt incapable of exertion ; [Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle was away from [home]3157-home for the day , too , and it would be better [they]1497-they should spend the afternoon together in [the house]288-the house . [Julian]118-julian of course assented , as always , and [they]1497-they established [themselves]1497-they in [the parlour behind [the shop]361-the shop]1499-the parlour behind the shop . In the course of talk , [the girl]316-the girl made mention of an engraving [Julian]118-julian had given [her]316-the girl a week or two before , and said that [she]316-the girl had had it framed and hung it in [[her]316-the girl bed - room]1502-her bed - room .

" Do come up and look at it , "[316-the girl] [she]316-the girl exclaimed ; " there 's [no one]3702-no one in [the house]288-the house . [I]316-the girl want to ask [you]118-julian if [you]118-julian can find a better place for it . It does n't show so well where it is . "[316-the girl]

[Julian]118-julian hesitated for a moment , but [she]316-the girl was already leading the way , and [he]118-julian could not refuse to follow . [They]1497-they went up to [the top of [the house]288-the house]1435-the top of the house , and entered [a little chamber which might have been more tidy , but was decently furnished]1505-a little chamber which might have been more tidy , but was decently furnished . The bed was made in a slovenly way , the mantelpiece was dusty , and the pictures on the walls hung askew . [Harriet]99-harriet closed the door behind [them]1497-they , and proceeded to point out the new picture , and discuss the various positions which had occurred to [her]99-harriet . [Julian]118-julian would have decided the question as speedily as possible , and once or twice moved to return [downstairs]445-downstairs , but each time [the girl]316-the girl found something new to detain [him]118-julian . Opening a drawer , [she]316-the girl took out several paltry little ornaments , which [she]316-the girl wished [him]118-julian to admire , and , in showing them , stood very close by [his]118-julian side . All at once the door of [the room]255-the room was pushed open , and [a woman]3216-a woman ran in . On seeing [the stranger present]1510-the stranger present , [she]3216-a woman darted back with an exclamation of surprise .

" Oh , [Miss Smales]179-miss smales , [I]3216-a woman did n't know as [you]179-miss smales was n't alone ! [I]3216-a woman heard [you]179-miss smales moving about , and come just to arst [you]179-miss smales to lend [me]3216-a woman but never mind , [I]3216-a woman 'm so sorry ; why did n't [you]179-miss smales lock the door ? "[3216-a woman]

And [she]3216-a woman bustled out again , apparently in much confusion .

[Harriet]99-harriet had dropped the thing [she]99-harriet held in [her]99-harriet hand , and stood looking at [[her]99-harriet cousin]911-her cousin as if dismayed .

" [I]99-harriet never thought [any one]3197-any one was in , "[99-harriet] [she]99-harriet said nervously . " It 's [Miss Mould]180-miss mould , [the lodger]3705-the lodger . [She]180-miss mould went out before [I]99-harriet did , and [I]99-harriet never heard [her]180-miss mould come back . Whatever will [she]180-miss mould think ! "[99-harriet]

" But of course , "[911-her cousin] [he]911-her cousin stammered , " [you]99-harriet will explain everything to [her]180-miss mould . [She]180-miss mould knows who [I]911-her cousin am , does n't [she]180-miss mould ? "[911-her cousin]

" [I]99-harriet do n't think so , and , even if [she]180-miss mould did "[99-harriet]

[She]99-harriet stopped , and stood with eyes on the ground , doing [her]99-harriet best to display maiden confusion . Then [she]99-harriet began to cry .

" But surely , surely there is no need to trouble [yourself]99-harriet , "[118-julian] exclaimed [Julian]118-julian , almost distracted , beginning to be dimly conscious of all manner of threatening possibilities . " [I]118-julian will speak to [the woman]448-the woman [myself]118-julian , and clear [you]99-harriet of every . Oh , but this is all nonsense . Let [us]3707-us go down at once , [Harriet]99-harriet . What a pity [you]99-harriet asked [me]118-julian to come up here ! "[118-julian]

It was the nearest to a reproach that [he]118-julian had ever yet addressed to [her]99-harriet . [His]118-julian face showed clearly how distressed [he]118-julian was , and that on [his]118-julian own account more than [hers]99-harriet , for [he]118-julian could not conceive any blame save on [himself]118-julian for being so regardless of appearances .

" Go as quietly as ever [you]118-julian can , "[99-harriet] [Harriet]99-harriet whispered . " The stairs creak so . Step very softly . "[99-harriet]

This was terrible to [the poor fellow]990-the poor fellow . To steal down in this guilty way was as bad as a confession of evil intentions , and [he]118-julian so entirely innocent of a shadow of evil even in [his]118-julian thought . Yet [he]118-julian could not but do as [she]99-harriet bade [him]118-julian . Even on [the stairs]742-the stairs [she]99-harriet urged [him]118-julian in a very loud whisper to be yet more cautious . [He]118-julian was out of [himself]118-julian with mortification ; and felt angry with [her]99-harriet for bringing [him]118-julian into such ignominy . In [the back parlour]703-the back parlour once more , [he]118-julian took up [his]118-julian hat at once .

" [You]118-julian must n't go yet , "[99-harriet] whispered [Harriet]99-harriet . " [I]99-harriet 'm sure [that woman]3521-that woman 's listening on the stairs . [You]118-julian must talk a little . Let 's talk so [she]3521-that woman can hear [us]3709-us . Suppose [she]3521-that woman should tell [Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle . "[99-harriet]

" [I]118-julian ca n't see that it matters , "[118-julian] said [Julian]118-julian , with annoyance . " [I]118-julian will [myself]118-julian see [Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle . "[118-julian]

" No , no ! The idea ! [I]99-harriet should have to leave at once . Whatever shall [I]99-harriet do if [she]3521-that woman turns [me]99-harriet away , and wo n't give [me]99-harriet a reference or anything ! "[99-harriet]

Even in a calmer mood , [Julian]118-julian 's excessive delicacy would have presented an affair of this kind in a grave light to [him]118-julian ; at present [he]118-julian was wholly incapable of distinguishing between true and false , or of gauging these fears at their true value . The mere fact of [the girl]316-the girl making so great a matter out of what should have been so easy to explain and have done with , caused an exaggeration of the difficulty in [his]118-julian own mind . [He]118-julian felt that [he]118-julian ought of course to justify [himself]118-julian before [Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle , and would have been capable of doing so had only [Harriet]99-harriet taken the same sensible view ; but [her]99-harriet apparent distress seemed even to [him]118-julian so much more like conscious guilt than troubled innocence , that such a task would cost [him]118-julian the acutest suffering . For nearly an hour [he]118-julian argued with [her]99-harriet , trying to convince [her]99-harriet how impossible it was that [the woman who had surprised [them]1517-them]1516-the woman who had surprised them should harbour any injurious suspicions .

" But [she]99-harriet knows "[99-harriet] began [Harriet]99-harriet , and then stopped , [her]99-harriet eyes falling .

" What does [she]99-harriet know ? "[911-her cousin] demanded [[her]99-harriet cousin]911-her cousin in surprise ; but could get no reply to [his]118-julian question . However , [his]118-julian arguments seemed at length to have a calming effect , and , as [he]118-julian took leave , [he]118-julian even affected to laugh at the whole affair . For all that , [he]118-julian had never suffered such mental trouble in [his]118-julian life as during this visit and throughout the evening which followed . The mere thought of having been obliged to discuss such things with [[his]118-julian cousin]895-his cousin filled [him]118-julian with inexpressible shame and misery . [Waymark]129-waymark came to spend the evening with [him]118-julian , but found poor entertainment . Several times [Julian]118-julian was on the point of relating what had happened , and asking for advice , but [he]118-julian found it impossible to broach the subject . There was an ever - recurring anger against [Harriet]99-harriet in [his]118-julian mind , too , for which at the same time [he]118-julian reproached [himself]118-julian . [He]118-julian dreaded the next meeting between [them]1520-them .

[Harriet]99-harriet , though [herself]99-harriet quite innocent of fine feeling and nice complexities of conscience , was well aware of the existence of such properties in [[her]99-harriet cousin]911-her cousin . [She]99-harriet neither admired nor despised [him]118-julian for possessing them ; they were of unknown value , indifferent to [her]99-harriet , indeed , until [she]99-harriet became aware of the practical use that might be made of [them]1522-them . Like [most narrow - minded girls]1523-most narrow - minded girls , [she]99-harriet became [a shrewd reader of character]1524-a shrewd reader of character , when [her]99-harriet affections and interests were concerned , and could calculate [Julian]118-julian 's motives , and the course wherein they would lead [him]118-julian , with much precision . [She]99-harriet knew too well that [he]118-julian did not care for [her]99-harriet in the way [she]99-harriet desired , but at the same time [she]99-harriet knew that [he]118-julian was capable of making almost any sacrifice to spare [her]99-harriet humiliation and trouble , especially if [he]118-julian felt that [her]99-harriet unhappiness was in any way caused by [himself]118-julian .

Thus it came about that , on the Tuesday evening of the ensuing week , [Julian]118-julian was startled by [[his]118-julian landlady]1483-his landlady 's announcing another visit from [Miss Smales]179-miss smales . [Harriet]99-harriet came into [the room]255-the room with a veil over [her]99-harriet face , and sank on a chair , sobbing . What [she]99-harriet had feared had come to pass . [The lodger]3705-the lodger had told [Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle of what had taken place in [her]3705-the lodger absence on the Sunday afternoon , and [Harriet]99-harriet had received notice that [she]99-harriet must find another place at once . [Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle was [a woman of severe virtue]1528-a woman of severe virtue , and would not endure the suspicion of wrong - doing under [her]139-mrs. ogle roof . To whom could [she]139-mrs. ogle come for advice and help , but to [Julian]118-julian ?

[Julian]118-julian was overwhelmed . [His]118-julian perfectly sincere nature was incapable of suspecting a far more palpable fraud . [He]118-julian started up with the intention of going forthwith to [Gray 's Inn Road]31-gray 's inn road , but [Harriet]99-harriet clung to [him]118-julian and held [him]118-julian back . The idea was vain . [The lodger]3705-the lodger , [Miss Mould]180-miss mould , had long entertained a spite against [her]99-harriet , [Harriet]99-harriet said , and had so exaggerated this story in relating it to [Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle , that [the latter]425-the latter , and [[her]425-the latter husband]584-her husband , had declared that [Casti]118-julian should not as much as put foot in [[their]1532-they shop]1533-their shop again .

" If [you]118-julian only knew what [they]1532-they 've been told ! "[316-the girl] sobbed [the girl]316-the girl , still clinging to [Julian]118-julian . " [They]1532-they would n't listen to a word [you]118-julian said . As if [I]316-the girl could have thought of such a thing happening , and [that woman]3521-that woman to say all the bad things of [us]1532-they [she]3521-that woman can turn [her]3521-that woman tongue to ! [I]316-the girl sha'n't never get another place ; [I]316-the girl 'm thrown out on [the wide world]3711-the wide world ! "[316-the girl]

It was a phrase [she]316-the girl had got out of [her]316-the girl penny fiction ; and very remarkable indeed was the mixture of acting and real sentiment which marked [her]316-the girl utterances throughout .

[Julian]118-julian 's shame and anger began to turn to compassion . [A woman in tears]1535-a woman in tears was a sight which always caused [him]118-julian the keenest distress .

" But , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian cried , with tears in [his]118-julian own eyes , " it is impossible that [you]316-the girl should suffer all this through [me]118-julian , and [I]118-julian not even make an attempt to clear [you]316-the girl of such vile charges ! "[118-julian]

" It was [my]118-julian own fault . [I]118-julian was thoughtless . [I]118-julian ought to have known that [people]3402-people 's always ready to think harm . But [I]118-julian think of nothing when [I]118-julian 'm with [you]316-the girl , [Julian]118-julian ! "[118-julian]

[He]118-julian had disengaged [himself]118-julian from [her]316-the girl hands , and was holding one of them in [his]118-julian own . But , as [she]316-the girl made this last confession , [she]316-the girl threw [her]316-the girl arms about [his]118-julian neck and drooped [her]316-the girl head against [his]118-julian bosom .

" Oh , if [you]118-julian only felt to [me]316-the girl like [I]316-the girl do to [you]118-julian ! "[316-the girl] [she]316-the girl sobbed .

[No man]1536-no man can hear without some return of emotion a confession from [a woman]3216-a woman 's lips that [she]3216-a woman loves [him]118-julian . [Harriet]99-harriet was [the only girl whom [Julian]118-julian had ever approached in familiar intercourse]1538-the only girl whom julian had ever approached in familiar intercourse ; [she]99-harriet had [no rival to fear amongst [living women]1540-living women]1539-no rival to fear amongst living women ; [the one rival to be dreaded]1541-the one rival to be dreaded was altogether out of the sphere of [her]99-harriet conceptions , the ideal love of [a poet]1542-a poet 's heart and brain . But the ideal is often least present to [us]1543-us when most needed . Here was love ; offer but love to [a poet]1542-a poet , and does [he]1542-a poet pause to gauge its quality ? The sudden whirl of conflicting emotions left [Julian]118-julian at the mercy of the instant 's impulse . [She]316-the girl was weak ; [she]316-the girl was suffering through [him]118-julian ; [she]316-the girl loved [him]118-julian .

" Be [[my]118-julian wife]3713-my wife , then , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian whispered , returning [her]316-the girl embrace , " and let [me]118-julian guard [you]316-the girl from all who would do [you]316-the girl harm . "[118-julian]

[She]316-the girl uttered a cry of delight , and the cry was a true one .

CHAPTER XIV

NEAR AND FAR

[Osmond Waymark]129-waymark was light - hearted ; and with [him]129-waymark such a state meant something not at all to be understood by [those with whom lightness of heart is a chronic affection]1545-those with whom lightness of heart is a chronic affection . [The man who dwells for long periods face to face with the bitter truths of life]1546-the man who dwells for long periods face to face with the bitter truths of life learns so to distrust a fleeting moment of joy , gives habitually so cold a reception to [the tardy messenger of delight]1547-the tardy messenger of delight , that , when [the bright guest]1548-the bright guest outdares [his]129-waymark churlishness and perforce tarries with [him]129-waymark , there ensues a passionate revulsion unknown to hearts which open readily to every fluttering illusive bliss . Illusion it of course remains ; is ever recognised as that ; but illusion so sweet and powerful that [he]118-julian thanks [the god that blinds [him]118-julian]1549-the god that blinds him , and counts off with sighs of joy the hours thus brightly winged .

[He]118-julian awaited with extreme impatience the evening on which [he]118-julian would again see [Ida]101-ida . Distrustful always , [he]118-julian could not entirely dismiss the fear that [his]118-julian first impressions might prove mistaken in the second interview ; yet [he]118-julian tried [his]118-julian best to do so , and amused [himself]118-julian with imagining for [Ida]101-ida a romantic past , for [her]101-ida and [himself]118-julian together a yet more romantic future . In spite of the strange nature of [their]1550-their relations , [he]118-julian did not delude [himself]118-julian with the notion that [the girl]316-the girl had fallen in love with [him]118-julian at first sight , and that [she]316-the girl stood before [him]118-julian to take or reject as [he]118-julian chose . [He]118-julian had a certain awe of [her]316-the girl . [He]118-julian divined in [her]316-the girl a strength of character which made [her]316-the girl [his]118-julian equal ; it might well be , [[his]118-julian superior]1552-his superior . Take , for instance , the question of the life [she]316-the girl was at present leading . In the case of [an ordinary pretty and good - natured girl falling in [his]118-julian way]1553-an ordinary pretty and good - natured girl falling in his way as [Ida Starr]101-ida had done , [he]118-julian would have exerted whatever influence [he]118-julian might acquire over [her]316-the girl to persuade [her]316-the girl into better paths . Any such direct guidance was , [he]118-julian felt , out of the question here . [The girl]316-the girl had independence of judgment ; [she]316-the girl would resent anything said by [him]118-julian on the assumption of [her]316-the girl moral inferiority , and , for aught [he]118-julian knew , with justice . The chances were at least as great that [he]118-julian might prove unworthy of [her]316-the girl , as that [she]316-the girl should prove unworthy of [him]118-julian .

When [he]118-julian presented [himself]118-julian at [the house in [the little court]1556-the little court by [Temple Bar]49-temple bar]1555-the house in the little court by temple bar , it was [the girl [Sally]105-sally who opened the door to [him]118-julian]1557-the girl sally who opened the door to him . [She]105-sally beckoned [him]118-julian to follow , and ran before [him]118-julian [upstairs]434-upstairs . [The sitting - room]290-the sitting - room presented the same comfortable appearance , and [Grim]169-grim , rising lazily from the hearthrug , came forward purring a welcome , but [Ida]101-ida was not there .

" [She]101-ida was obliged to go out , "[105-sally] said [Sally]105-sally , in answer to [his]118-julian look of inquiry . " [She]101-ida wo n't be long , and [she]101-ida said [you]118-julian was to make [yourself]118-julian comfortable till [she]101-ida came back . "[105-sally]

On a little side - table stood cups and saucers , and a box of cigars . [The latter Sally]1560-the latter sally brought forward .

" [I]105-sally was to ask [you]129-waymark to smoke , and whether [you]129-waymark 'd like a cup of coffee with it ? "[105-sally] [she]105-sally asked , with the curious naivete which marked [her]105-sally mode of speech .

" The kettle 's boiling on the side , "[105-sally] [she]105-sally added , seeing that [Waymark]129-waymark hesitated . " [I]129-waymark can make it in a minute . "[129-waymark]

" In that case , [I]105-sally will . "[105-sally]

" [You]129-waymark do n't mind [me]129-waymark having one as well ? "[129-waymark]

" Of course not . "[105-sally]

" Shall [I]105-sally talk , or shall [I]105-sally keep quiet ? [I]105-sally 'm not [a servant here]3714-a servant here , [you]129-waymark know , "[105-sally] [she]105-sally added , with an amusing desire to make [her]105-sally position clear . " [Ida]101-ida and [[me]105-sally 's friends]3715-me 's friends , and [she]101-ida 'd do just as much for [I.]105-sally "[105-sally]

" Talk by all means , "[129-waymark] said [Waymark]129-waymark , smiling , as [he]129-waymark lit [his]129-waymark cigar . The result was that , in a quarter of an hour [Sally]105-sally had related [her]105-sally whole history . As [Ida]101-ida had said , [she]105-sally came from [Weymouth]44-weymouth , where [[her]105-sally father]514-her father was [a fisherman]1562-a fisherman , and owner of [bum - boats]1563-bum - boats . [[Her]105-sally mother]377-her mother kept [a laundry]1565-a laundry , and [the family]675-the family had all lived together in easy circumstances . [She]105-sally [herself]105-sally had come to [London]3-london well , just for a change . And what was [she]105-sally doing ? Oh , getting [her]105-sally living as best [she]105-sally could . In the day - time [she]105-sally worked in [a city workroom]1567-a city workroom .

" And how much do [you]3716-you think [I]105-sally earn a week ? "[105-sally] [she]105-sally asked .

" Fifteen shillings or so , [I]101-ida suppose ? "[101-ida]

" Ah , that 's all [you]3716-you know about it ! Now , last week was the best [I]101-ida 've had yet , and [I]101-ida made seven shillings . "[101-ida]

" What do [you]3716-you do ? "[101-ida]

" Machine work ; makin ' ulsters . How much do [you]3716-you think [we]3717-we get , now , for makin ' a ulster one like this ? "[101-ida] pointing to one which hung behind the door .

" Have no idea . "[101-ida]

" Well , fourpence : there now ! "[101-ida]

" And how many can [you]3716-you make in a day ? "[101-ida]

" [I]101-ida ca n't make no more than two . [Some]3718-some make three , but it 's blessed hard work . But [I]101-ida get a little job now and then to do at [home]3157-home . "[101-ida]

" But [you]3716-you ca n't live on seven shillings a week ? "[101-ida]

" [I]101-ida sh'd think not , indeed . [We]3717-we have to make up the rest as best [we]3717-we can , s'nough . "[101-ida]

" But [[your]3716-you employers]3720-your employers must know that ? "[101-ida]

" In course . What 's the odds ? [All [us]3717-we girls]3721-all us girls are the same ; [we]3717-we have to keep on the two jobs at the same time . But [I]101-ida 'll give up the day - work before long , s'nough . [I]101-ida come [home]3157-home at night that tired out [I]101-ida ai n't fit for nothing . [I]101-ida feel all eyes , as the sayin ' is . And it 's hard to have to go out into [the Strand]50-the strand , when [you]3716-you 're like that . "[101-ida]

" But do [they]3720-your employers know about all this at [home]3157-home ? "[101-ida]

" No fear ! If [[our]3717-we father]3724-our father knew , [he]3724-our father 'd be down here precious soon , and [the house]288-the house would n't hold [him]3724-our father . But [I]101-ida shall go back some day , when [I]101-ida 've got a good fit - out . "[101-ida]

The door opened quietly , and [Ida]101-ida came in .

" Well , [young people]3530-young people , so [you]3530-young people are making [yourselves]3530-young people at [home]3157-home . "[101-ida]

The sweet face , the eyes and lips with [their]1568-their contained mirth , the light , perfect form , [the graceful carriage]1569-the graceful carriage , [Waymark]129-waymark felt [his]129-waymark pulses throb at the sound of [her]101-ida voice and the touch of [her]101-ida hand .

" [You]3530-young people did n't mind waiting a little for [me]129-waymark ? [I]129-waymark really could n't help it . And then , after all , [I]129-waymark thought [you]3530-young people might n't come . "[129-waymark]

" But [I]316-the girl promised to . "[316-the girl]

" Promises , promises , oh dear ! "[101-ida] laughed [Ida]101-ida . " [Sally]105-sally , here 's an orange for [you]105-sally . "[101-ida]

" [You]105-sally are a duck ! "[316-the girl] was [the girl]316-the girl 's reply , as [she]316-the girl caught it , and , with a nod to [Waymark]129-waymark , left [the room]255-the room .

" And so [you]105-sally 've really come , "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida went on , sitting down and beginning to draw off [her]101-ida gloves .

" [You]105-sally find it surprising ? To begin with , [I]316-the girl have come to pay [my]316-the girl debts . "[316-the girl]

" Is there another cup of coffee ? "[101-ida] [she]101-ida asked , seeming not to have heard . " [I]101-ida 'm too tired to get up and see . "[101-ida]

[Waymark]129-waymark felt a keen delight in waiting upon [her]101-ida , in judging to a nicety the true amount of sugar and cream , in drawing the little table just within [her]101-ida reach .

" [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark , "[101-ida] [she]101-ida exclaimed , all at once , " if [you]130-waymark had had supper with [a friend]3409-a friend , and [[your]130-waymark friend]3729-your friend had paid the bill , should [you]130-waymark take out [your]130-waymark purse and pay [him]3729-your friend back at [your]130-waymark next meeting ? "[101-ida]

" It would depend entirely on circumstances . "[101-ida]

" Just so . Then the present circumstances do n't permit anything of the kind , and there 's an end of that matter . Light another cigar , will [you]130-waymark ? "[101-ida]

" [You]130-waymark do n't dislike the smoke ? "[101-ida]

" If [I]101-ida did , [I]101-ida should say so . "[101-ida]

Having removed [her]101-ida outer garments one by one , [she]101-ida rose and took them into [the inner room]1572-the inner room . On reappearing , [she]101-ida went to the sitting - room door and turned the key in the lock .

" Could [you]130-waymark let [me]101-ida have some more books to read ? "[101-ida] [she]101-ida asked .

" [I]101-ida have brought one , thinking [you]130-waymark might be ready for it . "[101-ida]

It was " [Jane Eyre]181-jane . "[101-ida] [She]101-ida glanced over the pages eagerly .

" [I]101-ida do n't know how it is , "[101-ida] [she]101-ida said , " [I]101-ida have grown so hungry for reading of late . Till just now [I]101-ida never cared for it . When [I]101-ida was [a child]378-a child and went to [school]306-school , [I]101-ida did n't like [my]101-ida lessons . Still [I]101-ida learned a good deal , for [a little girl]266-a little girl , and it has stayed by [me]101-ida . And oh , it seems so long ago ! Never mind , perhaps [I]101-ida will tell [you]129-waymark all about that some day . "[101-ida]

[They]1573-they were together for an hour or so . [Waymark]129-waymark , uneasily watching [[his]129-waymark companion]1325-his companion 's every movement , rose as soon as [she]101-ida gave sign of weariness , and [Ida]101-ida did not seek to detain [him]129-waymark .

" [I]129-waymark shall think much of [you]101-ida , "[129-waymark] [he]129-waymark said .

" The less the better , "[101-ida] was [Ida]101-ida 's reply .

For [his]129-waymark comfort , yes , [Waymark]129-waymark thought , as [he]129-waymark walked homewards . [Ida]101-ida had already a dangerous hold upon [him]129-waymark ; [she]101-ida possessed [his]129-waymark senses , and set [him]129-waymark on fire with passionate imaginings . Here , as on every hand , [his]129-waymark cursed poverty closed against [him]129-waymark the possibilities of happiness . That [she]101-ida should ever come to love [him]129-waymark , seemed very unlikely ; the alliance between [them]1575-them could only be a mere caprice on [her]101-ida part , such as [girls of [her]101-ida kind]1576-girls of her kind are very subject to ; [he]129-waymark might perhaps fill up [her]101-ida intervals of tedium , but would have no share in [her]101-ida real life . And the thought of that life fevered [him]129-waymark with jealousy . [She]101-ida might say what [she]101-ida liked about never having known love , but it was of course impossible that [she]101-ida should not have a preference among [[her]101-ida lovers]1577-her lovers . And to think of the chances before [such a girl , so blessed with rare beauty and endless charms]1578-such a girl , so blessed with rare beauty and endless charms . In the natural order of events [she]101-ida would become [the mistress of [some rich man]1580-some rich man]1579-the mistress of some rich man ; might even , as at times happens , be rescued by marriage ; in either case , [their]1575-them acquaintance must cease . And , indeed , what right had [he]129-waymark to endeavour to gain [her]101-ida love having nothing but mere beggarly devotion to offer [her]101-ida in return ? [He]129-waymark had not even the excuse of one who could offer [her]101-ida married life in easy circumstances , supposing that to be an improvement on [her]101-ida present position . Would it not be better at once to break off these impossible relations ? How often [he]129-waymark had promised [himself]129-waymark , in moments of clear thought , never again to enter on a course which would obviously involve [him]129-waymark in futile suffering . Why had [he]129-waymark not now the strength to obey [his]129-waymark reason , and continue to possess [his]129-waymark soul in the calm of which [he]129-waymark had enjoyed a brief taste ?

The novel circumstances of the past week had almost driven from [his]129-waymark mind all thought of [Maud Enderby]103-maud . [He]129-waymark regretted having asked and obtained permission to write to [her]103-maud . [She]103-maud seemed so remote from [him]129-waymark , [their]1575-them meeting so long past . What could there be in common between [himself]129-waymark and [that dim , quiet little girl]1581-that dim , quiet little girl , who had excited [his]129-waymark sympathy merely because [her]103-maud pretty face was made sad by the same torments which had afflicted [him]129-waymark ? [He]129-waymark needed some strong , vehement , original nature , such as [Ida Starr]101-ida 's ; how would [Maud]103-maud 's timid conventionality doubtless [she]103-maud was absolutely conventional suit with the heresies of which [he]129-waymark was all compact ? Still , [he]129-waymark could not well ignore what had taken place between [them]1575-them , and , after all , there would be a certain pleasant curiosity in awaiting [her]103-maud reply . In any case , [he]129-waymark would write just such a letter as came naturally from [him]129-waymark . If [she]103-maud were horrified , well , there was an end of the matter .

Accordingly , [he]129-waymark sat down on the morning after [his]129-waymark visit to [Ida]101-ida , and , after a little difficulty in beginning , wrote a long letter . It was mainly occupied with a description of [his]129-waymark experiences in [Litany Lane]45-litany lane and [Elm Court]46-elm court . [He]129-waymark made no apology for detailing such unpleasant matters , and explained that [he]129-waymark would henceforth be kept in pretty close connection with [this unknown world]1582-this unknown world . Even this , [he]129-waymark asserted , was preferable to the world of [[Dr. Tootle]141-dr. tootle 's Academy]1583-dr. tootle 's academy . Then [he]129-waymark dwelt a little on the contrast between this life of [his]129-waymark and that which [Maud]103-maud was doubtless leading in [[her]103-maud home on [the Essex coast]1585-the essex coast]1584-her home on the essex coast ; and finally [he]129-waymark hoped [she]103-maud would write to [him]129-waymark when [she]103-maud found leisure , and be able to let [him]129-waymark know that [she]103-maud was no longer so unhappy as formerly .

This [he]129-waymark posted on Friday . On the following Monday morning , the post brought two letters for [him]129-waymark , both addressed in female hand , one bearing [a city]1586-a city , the other a country , post - mark . [Waymark]129-waymark smiled as [he]129-waymark compared the two envelopes , on one of which [his]129-waymark name stood in firm , upright characters , on the other in slender , sloping , delicate writing . The former [he]129-waymark pressed to [his]129-waymark lips , then tore open eagerly ; it was the promised intimation that [Ida]101-ida would be at [home]3157-home after eight o'clock on Wednesday and Friday evenings , nothing more . The second letter [he]129-waymark allowed to lie by till [he]129-waymark had breakfasted . [He]129-waymark could see that it contained more than one sheet . When at length [he]129-waymark opened it , [he]129-waymark read this :

" [DEAR MR . WAYMARK]130-waymark , [I]129-waymark have an hour of freedom this Sunday afternoon , and [I]129-waymark will spend it in replying as well as [I]129-waymark can to [your]130-waymark very interesting letter . [My]129-waymark life is , as [you]130-waymark say , very quiet and commonplace compared with that [you]130-waymark find [yourself]130-waymark suddenly entering upon . [I]129-waymark have no such strange and moving things to write about , but [I]129-waymark will tell [you]130-waymark in the first place how [I]129-waymark live and what [I]129-waymark do , then put down some of the thoughts [your]130-waymark letter has excited in [me]129-waymark .[129-waymark]

" The family [I]129-waymark am with consists of [very worthy but commonplace people]3733-very worthy but commonplace people . [They]3733-very worthy but commonplace people treat [me]129-waymark with more consideration than [I]129-waymark imagine [governesses]3734-governesses usually get , and [I]129-waymark am grateful to [them]3733-very worthy but commonplace people for this , but [their]3733-very worthy but commonplace people conversation , especially that of [Mrs. Epping]182-mrs. epping , [I]129-waymark find rather wearisome . It deals with very trivial concerns of everyday life , in which [I]129-waymark vainly endeavour to interest [myself]129-waymark .[129-waymark]

" Then there is the religious formalism of [the Eppings]183-the eppings and [[their]183-the eppings friends]3735-their friends . [They]3733-very worthy but commonplace people are [High Church]51-high church . [They]3733-very worthy but commonplace people discuss with astonishing vigour and at dreadful length what seems to [me]129-waymark the most immaterial points in the Church service , and just at present an impulse is given to [their]3733-very worthy but commonplace people zeal by the fact of [[their]3733-very worthy but commonplace people favourite clergyman]3736-their favourite clergyman being threatened with a prosecution for ritualistic practices . Of course [I]129-waymark have to feign a becoming interest in all this , and to take part in all [their]3733-very worthy but commonplace people religious forms and ceremonies . And indeed it is all so new to [me]129-waymark that [I]129-waymark have scarcely yet got over the first feelings of wonder and curiosity .[129-waymark]

" Have [I]129-waymark not , then , [you]3737-you will ask , the courage of [my]129-waymark opinions ? But indeed [my]129-waymark religious opinions are so strangely different from those which prevail here , that [I]129-waymark fear it would be impossible to make [my]129-waymark thoughts clear to [these good people]3738-these good people . [They]3738-these good people would scarcely esteem [me]129-waymark [a Christian]3739-a christian ; and yet [I]129-waymark can not but think that it is [they]3738-these good people [who are widely astray from Christian belief and practice]3740-who are widely astray from christian belief and practice . The other evening [the clergyman]3741-the clergyman dined with [us]3742-us , and throughout the meal discussions of the rubric alternated with talk about delicacies of the table ! That the rubric should be so interesting amazes [me]129-waymark , but that [an earnest Christian]3743-an earnest christian should think it compatible with [his]3743-an earnest christian religion to show the slightest concern in what [he]3743-an earnest christian shall eat or drink is unspeakably strange to [me]129-waymark . Surely , if Christianity means anything it means asceticism . [My]129-waymark experience of [the world]622-the world is so slight . [I]129-waymark believe this is [the first clergyman [I]129-waymark ever met in private life]3745-the first clergyman i ever met in private life . Surely [they]3738-these good people can not all be thus ?[129-waymark]

" [I]129-waymark knew well how far [the world]622-the world at large had passed from true Christianity ; that has been impressed upon [me]129-waymark from [my]129-waymark childhood . But how strange it seems to [me]129-waymark to hear proposed as a remedy the formalism to which [[my]129-waymark friends]3747-my friends here pin [their]3747-my friends faith ! How often have [I]129-waymark burned to speak up among [them]3738-these good people , and ask ' What think [ye]3738-these good people , then , of [Christ]122-christ ? Is [He]122-christ , or is [He]122-christ not , [our]3748-we exemplar ? Was not [His]122-christ life meant to exhibit to [us]3748-we the ideal of the completest severance from [the world]622-the world which is consistent with human existence ? To follow [Him]122-christ , should [we]3748-we not , at least in the spirit , cast off everything which may tempt [us]3748-we to consider life , as life , precious ? ' [We]3748-we can not worship both [God]123-god and [the world]622-the world , and yet nowadays [Christians]184-christians seem to make a merit of doing so . When [I]129-waymark conceive a religious revival , [my]129-waymark thought does not in the least concern itself with forms and ceremonies . [I]129-waymark imagine another [John the Baptist]185-john the baptist inciting [the people]3247-the people , with irresistible fervour , to turn from [their]3247-the people sins that is , from [the world]622-the world and all its concerns and to purify [themselves]3247-the people by Renunciation . What [they]3247-the people call ' Progress , ' [I]129-waymark take to be [the veritable Kingdom of [Antichrist]186-antichrist]3753-the veritable kingdom of antichrist . [The world]622-the world is evil , life is evil ; only by renunciation of the very desire for life can [we]3748-we fulfil the Christian idea . What then of the civilisation which endeavours to make [the world]622-the world more and more pleasant as a dwelling - place , life more and more desirable for its own sake ?[129-waymark]

" And so [I]129-waymark come to the contents of [your]3756-you own letter . [You]3756-you say [you]3756-you marvel that [these wretched people [you]3756-you visited]3757-these wretched people you visited do not , in a wild burst of insurrection , overthrow all social order , and seize for [themselves]3757-these wretched people you visited a fair share of [the world]622-the world 's goods . [I]129-waymark marvel also ; all the more that [[their]3757-these wretched people you visited very teachers]3759-their very teachers in religion seem to lay such stress on the joys of life . And yet what profit would [a real Christian preacher]3760-a real christian preacher draw for [them]3757-these wretched people you visited from this very misery of [their]3757-these wretched people you visited existence ! [He]3760-a real christian preacher would teach [them]3757-these wretched people you visited that herein lay [their]3757-these wretched people you visited supreme blessing , not [their]3757-these wretched people you visited curse ; that in [their]3757-these wretched people you visited poverty and nakedness lay means of grace and salvation such as [the rich]3761-the rich can scarcely by any means attain to ; that [they]3757-these wretched people you visited should proudly , devoutly , accept [their]3757-these wretched people you visited heritage of woe , and daily thank [God]123-god for depriving [them]3757-these wretched people you visited of all that can make life dear . Only awaken the spirit in [these poor creatures]3762-these poor creatures , and how near might [they]3757-these wretched people you visited be to [the true Kingdom of [Heaven]138-heaven]3763-the true kingdom of heaven ! And surely [such a preacher]3764-such a preacher will yet arise , and there will be a Reformation very different from the movement [we]3765-we now call by that name . But [I]129-waymark weary [you]3766-you , perhaps . It may be [you]3766-you have no interest in all this . Yet [I]129-waymark think [you]3766-you would wish [me]129-waymark to write from what [I]129-waymark am .[129-waymark]

" It would interest [me]129-waymark to hear [your]3766-you further experiences in the new work . Believe [me]129-waymark to be [[your]3766-you sincere friend]3767-your sincere friend ,[129-waymark]

" [MAUD ENDERBY]103-maud . "[129-waymark]

[Waymark]130-waymark read , and thought , and wondered .

Then it was time to go and collect [his]130-waymark rents .

CHAPTER XV

UP [THE RIVER]53-the river

Here is an extract from a letter written by [Julian Casti]118-julian to [Waymark]129-waymark in the month of May. By this time [they]1588-they were living near to [each other]459-each other , but something was about to happen which [Julian]118-julian preferred to communicate in writing .

" This will be the beginning of a new life for [me]118-julian . Already [I]118-julian have felt a growth in [my]118-julian power of poetical production . Verse runs together in [my]118-julian thoughts without effort ; [I]118-julian feel ready for some really great attempt . Have [you]129-waymark not noticed something of this in [me]118-julian these last few days ? Come and see [me]118-julian to - night , if [you]129-waymark can , and rejoice with [me]118-julian . "[118-julian]

This meant that [Julian]118-julian was about to be married . Honeymoon journey was out of the question for [him]118-julian . [He]118-julian and [[his]118-julian wife]505-his wife established [themselves]1588-they in [the lodgings which [he]118-julian was already occupying]1591-the lodgings which he was already occupying . And the new life began .

[Waymark]130-waymark had made [Harriet]99-harriet 's acquaintance a couple of weeks before ; [Julian]118-julian had brought [her]99-harriet with [him]118-julian one Sunday to [[[his]118-julian friend]876-his friend 's room]1593-his friend 's room . [She]99-harriet was then living alone , having quitted [Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle the day after that decisive call upon [Julian]118-julian . There was really no need for [her]99-harriet to have done so , [Mrs. Ogle]139-mrs. ogle 's part in the comedy being an imaginary one of [Harriet]99-harriet 's devising . But [Julian]118-julian was led entirely by [[his]118-julian cousin]895-his cousin , and , as [she]99-harriet knew quite well , there was not the least danger of [his]118-julian going on [his]118-julian own account to [the shop in [Gray 's Inn Road]31-gray 's inn road]1079-the shop in gray 's inn road ; [he]118-julian dreaded the thought of such an interview .

[Waymark]130-waymark was not charmed with [Miss Smales]179-miss smales ; the more [he]130-waymark thought of this marriage , the more it amazed [him]130-waymark ; for , of course , [he]130-waymark deemed it wholly of [[his]130-waymark friend]876-his friend 's bringing about .

The marriage affected [their]1597-their intercourse . [Harriet]99-harriet did not like to be left alone in the evening , so [Julian]118-julian could not go to [[Waymark]130-waymark 's]1598-waymark 's , as [he]118-julian had been accustomed to , and conversation in [Mrs. Casti]187-mrs. casti 's presence was , of course , under restraint . [Waymark]130-waymark bore this with impatience , and even did [his]130-waymark best to alter it . One Sunday afternoon , about three weeks after the marriage , [he]130-waymark called and carried [Julian]118-julian off to [[his]118-julian room]979-his room across [the street]340-the street . [Harriet]99-harriet 's face sufficiently indicated [her]99-harriet opinion of this proceeding , and [Julian]118-julian had difficulty in appearing at [his]118-julian case . [Waymark]130-waymark understood what was going on , and tried to discuss the matter freely , but the other shrank from it .

" [I]130-waymark am grievously impatient of domestic arrangements , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark said . " [I]130-waymark fancy it would never do for [me]130-waymark to marry , unless [I]130-waymark had limitless cash , and [[my]130-waymark wife]3713-my wife were [as great a Bohemian as [myself]130-waymark]3769-as great a bohemian as myself . By the by , [I]130-waymark have another letter from [Maud]103-maud . [Her]103-maud pessimism is magnificent . This intense religiousness is no doubt a mere phase ; it will pass , of course ; [I]130-waymark wonder how things would arrange themselves if [she]103-maud came back to [London]3-london . Why should n't [she]103-maud come here to sit and chat , like [you]130-waymark do ? "[130-waymark]

" That would naturally lead to something definite , "[118-julian] said [Casti]118-julian , smiling .

" Oh , [I]130-waymark do n't know . Why should it ? [I]130-waymark 'm a believer in friendship between [men]3195-men and [women]3771-women . Of course there is in it the spice of the difference of sex , and why not accept that as a pleasant thing ? How much better if , when [we]3772-we met [a woman [we]3772-we liked]3773-a woman we liked , [we]3772-we could say frankly , ' Now let [us]3772-we amuse [each other]459-each other without any arriere pensee . If [I]130-waymark married [you]3773-a woman we liked to - day , even though [I]130-waymark feel quite ready to , [I]130-waymark should ten to one see some one next week who would make [me]130-waymark regret having bound [myself]130-waymark . So would [you]3773-a woman we liked , [[my]130-waymark dear]3165-my dear . Very well , let [us]3772-we tantalise [each other]459-each other agreeably , and be at ease in the sense that [we]3772-we are on the right side of the illusion . ' [You]3773-a woman we liked laugh at the idea ? "[130-waymark]

[Julian]118-julian laughed , but not heartily . [They]1601-they passed to other things .

" [I]130-waymark 'm making an article out of [Elm Court]46-elm court , "[130-waymark] said [Waymark]130-waymark . " Semi - descriptive , semi - reflective , wholly cynical Maybe it will pay for [my]130-waymark summer holiday . And , apropos of the same subject , [I]130-waymark 've got great ideas . This introduction to such phases of life will prove endlessly advantageous to [me]130-waymark , artistically speaking . Let [me]130-waymark get a little more experience , and [I]130-waymark will write a novel such as [no one]3702-no one has yet ventured to write , at all events in [England]15-england . [I]130-waymark begin to see [my]130-waymark way to magnificent effects ; ye gods , such light and shade ! The fact is , the novel of every - day life is getting worn out . [We]3772-we must dig deeper , get to untouched social strata . [Dickens]188-dickens felt this , but [he]188-dickens had not the courage to face [[his]188-dickens subjects]3778-his subjects ; [his]188-dickens monthly numbers had to lie on the family tea - table . Not virginibus puerisque will be [my]130-waymark book , [I]130-waymark assure [you]3779-you , but for [men]3195-men and [women who like to look beneath the surface , and who understand that only as artistic material has human life]3781-women who like to look beneath the surface , and who understand that only as artistic material has human life any significance . Yes , that is the conclusion [I]130-waymark am working round to . [The artist]3782-the artist is [the only sane man]3783-the only sane man . Life for its own sake ? no ; [I]130-waymark would drink a pint of laudanum to - night . But life as the source of splendid pictures , inexhaustible material for effects that can reconcile [me]130-waymark to existence , and that only . It is a delight followed by no bitter after - taste , and the only such delight [I]130-waymark know . "[130-waymark]

[Harriet]99-harriet was very quiet when [Julian]118-julian returned . [She]99-harriet went about getting the tea with a sort of indifference ; [she]99-harriet let a cup fall and break , but made no remark , and left [[her]99-harriet husband]584-her husband to pick up the pieces .

" [Waymark]130-waymark thinks [I]118-julian 'm neglecting [him]118-julian , "[118-julian] said [Julian]118-julian , with a laugh , as [they]1603-we sat down together .

" It 's better to neglect [him]118-julian than to neglect [me]99-harriet , [I]99-harriet should think , "[99-harriet] was [Harriet]99-harriet 's reply , in a quiet ill - natured tone which [she]99-harriet was mistress of .

" But could n't [we]1603-we find out some way of doing neither , [dear]3177-dear ? "[118-julian] went on [Julian]118-julian , playing with [his]118-julian spoon . " Now suppose [I]118-julian give [him]118-julian a couple of hours one evening every week ? [You]118-julian could spare that , could n't [you]118-julian ? Say , from eight to ten on Wednesdays ? "[118-julian]

" [I]99-harriet suppose [you]118-julian 'll go if [you]118-julian want to . "[99-harriet] said [Harriet]99-harriet , rising from the tea - table , and taking a seat sulkily by the window .

" Come , come , [we]1603-we wo n't say any more about it , if it 's so disagreeable to [you]99-harriet , "[118-julian] said [Julian]118-julian , going up to [her]99-harriet , and coaxing [her]99-harriet back to [her]99-harriet place . " [You]99-harriet do n't feel well to - day , do [you]99-harriet ? [I]118-julian ought n't to have left [you]99-harriet this afternoon , but it was difficult to refuse , was n't it ? "[118-julian]

" [He]130-waymark had no business to ask [you]99-harriet to go . [He]130-waymark could see [I]130-waymark did n't like it . "[130-waymark]

[Waymark]130-waymark grew so accustomed to receiving [Ida]101-ida 's note each Monday morning , that when for the first time it failed to conic [he]130-waymark was troubled seriously . It happened , too , that [he]130-waymark was able to attach a particular significance to the omission . When [they]1604-they had last parted , instead of just pressing [her]101-ida hand as usual , [he]130-waymark had raised it to [his]130-waymark lips . [She]101-ida frowned and turned quickly away , saying no word . [He]130-waymark had offended [her]101-ida by this infringement of the conditions of [their]1604-they friendship ; for once before , when [he]130-waymark had uttered a word which implied more than [she]101-ida was willing to allow , [Ida]101-ida had engaged [him]130-waymark in the distinct agreement that [he]130-waymark should never do or say anything that approached love - making . As , moreover , it was distinctly understood that [he]130-waymark should never visit [her]101-ida save at times previously appointed , [he]130-waymark could not see [her]101-ida till [she]101-ida chose to write . After waiting in the vain expectation of some later post bringing news , [he]130-waymark [himself]130-waymark wrote , simply asking the cause of [her]101-ida silence . The reply came speedily .

" [I]101-ida have no spare time in the week . [I]101-ida thought [you]101-ida would understand this .[101-ida]

[I.]1605-i. S. "[1605-i.]

It was [her]101-ida custom to write without any formal beginning or ending ; yet [Waymark]130-waymark felt that this note was briefer than it would have been , had all been as usual between [them]1604-they . The jealousy which now often tortured [him]130-waymark awoke with intolerable vehemence . [He]130-waymark spent a week of misery .

But late on Saturday evening came a letter addressed in the well - known hand . It said

" [Sally]105-sally and [I]1605-i. are going up [the river]3428-the river to - morrow , if it is fine . Do [you]101-ida care to meet [us]1604-they on [the boat which reaches [Chelsea Pier]55-chelsea pier]3786-the boat which reaches chelsea pier at 10.30 ?[1605-i.]

[I.]1605-i. S. "[1605-i.]

It seemed [he]130-waymark did care ; at all events [he]130-waymark was half an hour too soon at [the pier]1606-the pier . As [the boat]1607-the boat approached [his]130-waymark eye soon singled out [two very quietly - dressed girls]1608-two very quietly - dressed girls , who sat with [their]1608-two very quietly - dressed girls backs to [him]130-waymark , and neither turned nor made any sign of expecting any addition to [[their]1608-two very quietly - dressed girls party]1609-their party . With like undemonstrativeness [he]130-waymark took a seat at [Ida]101-ida 's side , and returned [Sally]105-sally 's nod and smile . [Ida]101-ida merely said " Good morning ; "[101-ida] there was nothing of displeasure on [her]101-ida face , however , and when [he]130-waymark began to speak of indifferent things [she]101-ida replied with the usual easy friendliness .

It was the first time [he]130-waymark had seen [her]101-ida by daylight . [He]130-waymark had been uncertain whether [she]101-ida used any artificial colour on [her]101-ida cheeks ; seemingly [she]101-ida did , for now [she]101-ida looked much paler than usual . But the perfect clearness of [her]101-ida complexion , the lustre of [her]101-ida eyes , appeared to indicate complete health . [She]101-ida breathed the fresh sun - lit air with frank enjoyment , and smiled to [herself]101-ida at objects on [either side of [the river]3428-the river]1610-either side of the river .

" By the by , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark said , when no words had been exchanged for some minutes , " [you]101-ida did n't tell [me]130-waymark where [you]101-ida were going ; so [I]130-waymark took no ticket , and left matters to fate . "[130-waymark]

" Are [you]101-ida [a good walker]3787-a good walker ? "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida asked .

" Fairly good , [I]130-waymark flatter [myself]130-waymark . "[130-waymark]

" Then this is what [I]130-waymark propose . It 's a plan [I]130-waymark carried out two or three times by [myself]130-waymark last summer , and enjoyed . [We]3788-we get off at [Putney]56-putney , walk through [Roehampton]57-roehampton , then over [the park]600-the park into [Richmond]58-richmond . By that time [we]3788-we shall be ready for dinner , and [I]130-waymark know a place where [we]3788-we can have it in comfort . "[130-waymark]

There was little thought of weariness throughout the delightful walk . [All three]1612-all three gave [themselves]1612-all three up for the time to simple enjoyment ; [their]1612-all three intercourse became that of [children]3150-children ; the troubles of passion , the miseries of self - consciousness , the strain of mutual observation fell from [them]1612-all three as [the city]463-the city dropped behind ; [they]1612-all three were once more creatures for whom [the external world]1615-the external world alone had reality . There was a glorious June sky ; there were [country roads]1616-country roads scented with flower and tree ; [the wide - gleaming common]1617-the wide - gleaming common with its furze and bramble ; then [the great park , with felled trunks to rest upon]1618-the great park , with felled trunks to rest upon , and prospects of endlessly - varied green to soothe the eye . [The girls]373-the girls exhibited [their]373-the girls pleasure each in [her]1620-her own way . [Sally]105-sally threw off restraint , and sprang about in free happiness , like one of [the young roes]1621-the young roes , the sight of which made [her]105-sally utter cries like [a delighted child]1622-a delighted child . [She]105-sally remembered scenes of [home]3157-home , and chattered in [her]105-sally dialect of [people]3402-people and places strange enough to both [[her]105-sally companions]322-her companions . [She]105-sally was in constant expectation of catching a glimpse of [the sea]1626-the sea ; in spite of all warnings it was a great surprise and disappointment to [her]105-sally that [Richmond Hill]59-richmond hill did not end in cliffs and breakers . [Ida]101-ida talked less , but every now and then laughed in [her]101-ida deep enjoyment . [She]101-ida had no reminiscence of country life it was enough that all about [her]101-ida was new and fresh and pure ; nothing to remind [her]101-ida of [Regent Street]42-regent street and [the Strand]1024-the strand . [Waymark]130-waymark talked of [he]130-waymark knew not what , cheerful things that came by chance to [his]130-waymark tongue , trifling stories , descriptions of places , ideal plans for spending of ideal holidays ; but nothing of [London]3-london , nothing of what at other times [his]130-waymark thoughts most ran upon . [He]130-waymark came back to [himself]130-waymark now and then , and smiled as [he]130-waymark looked at [the girls]373-the girls , but this happened seldom .

The appetites of all three were beyond denying when [they]373-the girls had passed the " Star and Garter "[130-waymark] and began to walk down into [the town]1023-the town . [Waymark]130-waymark wondered whither [[their]373-the girls guide]1630-their guide would lead [them]373-the girls , but asked no questions . To [his]130-waymark surprise , [Ida]101-ida stopped at [a small inn half way down [the hill]1632-the hill]1631-a small inn half way down the hill .

" [You]130-waymark are to go straight in , "[101-ida] [she]101-ida said , with a smile , to [Waymark]130-waymark , " and are to tell [the first person [you]130-waymark meet]3790-the first person you meet that [three people]3791-three people want dinner . These directions were obeyed , with the result that all reached an upper chamber , wherein a table was cleanly and comfortably laid , as if expecting [them]373-the girls . French windows led out on to [a quaint little verandah at the back of [the house]288-the house]1633-a quaint little verandah at the back of the house , and the view thence was perfect . [The river]3428-the river below , winding between [wooded banks]1636-wooded banks , and everywhere the same splendour of varied green which had delighted [their]373-the girls eyes all the morning . Just below [the verandah]1637-the verandah was the tiled roof of [an outhouse]1638-an outhouse , whereon lay a fine black and white cat , basking in the hot sun . [Ida]101-ida clapped [her]101-ida hands .

" [He]130-waymark 's like [poor old Grim]3793-poor old grim , "[101-ida] [she]101-ida cried . Then , turning to [Waymark]130-waymark : " If [you]130-waymark are good , [you]130-waymark may bring out a chair and smoke a cigar here after dinner . "[101-ida]

[They]373-the girls had just began to eat , when footsteps were heard coining up the stairs .

" Oh bother ! "[105-sally] exclaimed [Sally]105-sally . " There 's [some one else]3794-some one else a - comin ' , s'nough . "[105-sally]

There was . The door opened , and [two gentlemen]1639-two gentlemen walked in . [The girl]316-the girl had evidently made up [her]316-the girl mind to be absolutely proper . [Sally]105-sally gave [her]105-sally hand , smiled , evidently wished to say something , but ended by turning away and running after [[her]105-sally companions]322-her companions .

[CHAPTER XVI

EXAMPLE WITHOUT PRECEPT

Waymark]194-chapter xvi example without precept waymark was grateful for the help [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock had given [him]142-o'gree . Indeed , [the two]273-the two soon began to get on very well together . In a great measure , of course , this was due to the change in [Waymark]194-chapter xvi example without precept waymark 's philosophy ; whereas [his]194-chapter xvi example without precept waymark early idealism had been revolted by what [he]194-chapter xvi example without precept waymark then deemed [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock 's crass materialism and vulgarity , the tolerance which had come with widened experience now made [him]194-chapter xvi example without precept waymark regard these characteristics with far less certainty of condemnation . [He]194-chapter xvi example without precept waymark was often merely amused at what had formerly enraged and disgusted [him]194-chapter xvi example without precept waymark . At the same time , there were changes in [Abraham]115-abraham [himself]115-abraham , no doubt at all events in [his]194-chapter xvi example without precept waymark manner to [the young man]818-the young man . [He]194-chapter xvi example without precept waymark , on [his]194-chapter xvi example without precept waymark side , was also far more tolerant than in the days when [he]194-chapter xvi example without precept waymark had growled at [Osmond]129-waymark for [a conceited young puppy]1660-a conceited young puppy .

One Sunday morning in early July , [Waymark]129-waymark was sitting alone in [[his]129-waymark room]979-his room , when [he]129-waymark noticed that [a cab]648-a cab stopped before [the house]288-the house . A minute after , there was a knock at [his]129-waymark door , and , to [his]129-waymark great surprise , [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock entered , bearing a huge volume in [his]114-mr. woodstock arms . [Abraham]115-abraham deposited it on a chair , wiped [his]114-mr. woodstock forehead , and looked round [the room]255-the room .

" [You]129-waymark smoke poor tobacco , "[114-mr. woodstock] was [his]114-mr. woodstock first remark , as [he]114-mr. woodstock sniffed the air .

" Good tobacco happens to be expensive , "[129-waymark] was the reply . " Will [you]129-waymark sit down ? "[129-waymark]

" Yes , [I]129-waymark will . "[129-waymark] The chair creaked under [him]129-waymark . " And so here [you]129-waymark hang out , eh ? Only [one room]3802-one room ? "[129-waymark]

" As [you]129-waymark see . "[129-waymark]

" Devilish unhealthy , [I]129-waymark should think . "[129-waymark]

" But economical . "[129-waymark]

" Ugh ! "[129-waymark]

The grunt meant nothing in particular . [Waymark]129-waymark was eyeing the mighty volume on the chair , and had recognised it Some fortnight previously , [he]129-waymark had come upon [Abraham]115-abraham , in [[the latter]425-the latter 's study]1666-the latter 's study , turning over a collection of [Hogarth]195-hogarth 's plates , and greatly amusing [himself]129-waymark with the realism which so distinctly appealed to [his]129-waymark taste in art . It was the first time that [Waymark]129-waymark had had an opportunity of examining [Hogarth]195-hogarth ; the pictures harmonised with [his]129-waymark mood ; they gave [him]129-waymark a fresh impulse in the direction [his]129-waymark literary projects were taking . [He]129-waymark spent a couple of hours in turning the leaves , and [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock had observed [his]129-waymark enjoyment . What meant the arrival of the volume here in [Beaufort Street]47-beaufort street ?

" [I]196-way mark think [you]1383-the old man never had [a son]689-a son ? "[196-way mark] said [Way mark]196-way mark , observing the note of melancholy which every now and then came up in [the old man]1383-the old man 's talk .

" No . "[114-mr. woodstock]

" But [you]1383-the old man had [some children]3844-some children , [I]114-mr. woodstock think ? "[114-mr. woodstock]

" Yes , yes , [they]3844-some children 're dead . "[114-mr. woodstock]

[He]196-way mark had walked to the window , and suddenly turned round with a kind of impatience .

" Never mind [the friend]3845-the friend to - day ; come and have some dinner with [me]114-mr. woodstock . [I]114-mr. woodstock seem to want a bit of company . "[114-mr. woodstock]

This was the first invitation of the kind [Waymark]129-waymark had received . [He]196-way mark accepted it , and [they]1672-they went out together .

" It 's a pleasant part this , "[114-mr. woodstock] [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock said , as [they]1672-they walked by [the river]3428-the river . " [One]318-one might build [himself]318-one [a decent house]3847-a decent house somewhere about here , eh ? "[114-mr. woodstock]

" Do [you]129-waymark think of doing so ? "[114-mr. woodstock]

" [I]114-mr. woodstock think of doing so ! What 's the good of [a house]949-a house , and [nobody]3421-nobody to live in [it]949-a house ? "[114-mr. woodstock]

[Waymark]129-waymark studied these various traits of [the old man]1383-the old man 's humour , and constantly felt more of kindness towards [him]1383-the old man .

On the following day , just as [he]129-waymark had collected [his]129-waymark rents , and was on [his]129-waymark way out of [Litany Lane]45-litany lane , [Waymark]129-waymark was surprised at coming face to face with [Mrs. Casti]187-mrs. casti ; yet more surprised when [he]129-waymark perceived that [she]187-mrs. casti had come out from [a public - house]1675-a public - house . [She]187-mrs. casti looked embarrassed , and for a moment seemed about to pass without recognising [him]129-waymark ; but [he]129-waymark had raised [his]129-waymark hat , and [she]187-mrs. casti could not but move [her]187-mrs. casti head in reply . [She]187-mrs. casti so obviously wished to avoid speaking , that [he]129-waymark walked quickly on in another direction . [He]129-waymark wondered what [he]129-waymark could be doing in such a place as this . It could hardly be that [she]187-mrs. casti had [acquaintances]1676-acquaintances or connections [here]3335-here . [Julian]118-julian had not given [him]129-waymark any particulars of [Harriet]99-harriet 's former life , and [[his]129-waymark friend]876-his friend 's marriage was still a great puzzle to [him]129-waymark . [He]129-waymark knew well that [the girl]316-the girl had no liking for [himself]129-waymark ; it was not improbable that this casual meeting would make [their]1680-their intercourse yet more strained . [He]129-waymark thought for a moment of questioning [Julian]118-julian , but decided that the matter was no business of [his]129-waymark .

It was so rare for [him]129-waymark to meet [an acquaintance in [the streets]3169-the streets]1681-an acquaintance in the streets , that a second chance of the same kind , only a few minutes later , surprised [him]129-waymark greatly . This time the meeting as a pleasant one ; [somebody]324-somebody ran across to [him]129-waymark from over the way , and [he]129-waymark saw that it was [Sally Fisher]105-sally . [She]105-sally looked pleased . [The girl]316-the girl had preserved a good deal of [her]316-the girl sea - side complexion through the year and a half of [town]901-town life , and , when happy , glowed all over [her]316-the girl cheeks with the healthiest hue . [She]105-sally held out [her]105-sally hand in the usual frank , impulsive way .

" Oh , [I]105-sally thought it was [you]129-waymark ! [You]129-waymark wo n't see [I]105-sally no more at [the old place]3850-the old place . "[105-sally]

" No ? How 's that ? "[449-the other]

" [I]105-sally 'm leavin ' un to - morrow . [I]105-sally 've got [a place in [a shop]3852-a shop]3851-a place in a shop , just by here , [[a chandler]3853-a chandler 's shop]3854-a chandler 's shop , and [I]105-sally 'm going to live in . "[105-sally]

" Indeed ? Well , [I]449-the other 'm glad to hear it . [I]449-the other dare say [you]129-waymark 'll be better off . "[449-the other]

" Oh , [I]105-sally say , [you]129-waymark know [[your]129-waymark friend]3729-your friend ? "[105-sally]

" [The Irishman]192-the irishman ? "[449-the other]

" Yes . "[105-sally]

" What about [him]3729-your friend ? "[449-the other] asked [the other]449-the other , smiling as [he]449-the other looked into [the girl]316-the girl 's pretty face .

" Well , "[105-sally] said [Sally]105-sally , " [I]105-sally do n't mind [you]129-waymark telling [un]129-waymark where [I]105-sally live now , if [you]129-waymark like . Look , there 's the address on that paper ; [you]129-waymark can take it . "[105-sally]

" Oh , [I]105-sally see . In point of fact , [you]129-waymark wish [me]105-sally to tell [him]3729-your friend ? "[105-sally]

" Oh , [I]105-sally do n't care . [I]105-sally dessay [he]3729-your friend do n't want to know anything about [I.]105-sally But [you]129-waymark can if [you]129-waymark like . "[105-sally]

" [I]105-sally will be sure to , and no doubt [he]3729-your friend will be delighted . [He]3729-your friend 's been growing thin since [I]105-sally told [him]3729-your friend [you]129-waymark declined to renew [his]3729-your friend acquaintance . "[105-sally]

" Oh , do n't talk ! And now [I]105-sally must be off . Good - bye . [I]105-sally dessay [I]105-sally shall see [you]129-waymark sometimes ? "[105-sally]

" Without doubt . [We]3856-we 'll have another Sunday at [Richmond]58-richmond soon . Good - bye . "[105-sally]

It was about four in the afternoon when [Sally]105-sally reached [home]3157-home , and [she]105-sally ran up at once to [[Ida]101-ida 's room]1689-ida 's room , and burst in , crying out , " [I]105-sally 've got it ! [I]105-sally 've got it ! "[105-sally] with much dancing about and joyous singing . [Ida]101-ida rose with a faint smile of welcome . [She]101-ida had been sitting at the window , reading a book lent [her]101-ida by [Waymark]129-waymark .

" [They]3857-they said [they]3857-they liked [my]105-sally appearance , "[105-sally] [Sally]105-sally went on , " and ' ud give [me]105-sally a try . [I]105-sally go in to - morrow . It wo n't be [a over easy place]3858-a over easy place , neither . [I]105-sally 've to do all the cleaning in [the house]288-the house , and there 's [a baby]3355-a baby to look after when [I]105-sally 'm not in [the shop]361-the shop . "[105-sally]

" And what will [they]3857-they give [you]105-sally ? "[105-sally]

" Ten shillings a month for the first half - year ; then a rise . "[105-sally]

" And [you]105-sally 're satisfied ? "[105-sally]

" Oh , it 'll do till something better turns up . Oh , [I]105-sally say , [I]105-sally met [[your]105-sally friend]3729-your friend just after [I]105-sally 'd come away . "[105-sally]

" Did [you]105-sally ? "[101-ida] said [Ida]101-ida quietly .

" Yes ; and [I]105-sally told [him]3729-your friend [he]3729-your friend could tell [[his]3729-your friend friend]876-his friend where [I]105-sally was , if [he]3729-your friend liked . "[105-sally]

" [[His]3729-your friend friend]876-his friend ? "[105-sally]

" [The Irishman]192-the irishman , [you]101-ida know , "[105-sally] explained [Sally]105-sally , moving about [the room]255-the room . " [I]105-sally told [you]101-ida [he]3729-your friend 'd been asking after [me]105-sally . "[105-sally]

[Ida]101-ida seemed all at once to awake from a dream . [She]101-ida uttered a long " Ah ! "[101-ida] under [her]101-ida breath , and for a moment looked at [the girl]316-the girl like one who is struck with an unexpected explanation . Then [she]101-ida turned away to the window , and again gazed up at the blue sky , standing so for nearly a minute .

" Are [you]101-ida engaged to - night ? "[105-sally] [Sally]105-sally asked presently .

" No ; will [you]101-ida sit with [me]101-ida ? "[101-ida]

" [You]101-ida 're not feeling very well to - day , are [you]101-ida ? "[101-ida]

" [I]101-ida think not , "[101-ida] replied [Ida]101-ida , passing [her]101-ida hand over [her]101-ida forehead . " [I]101-ida 've been thinking of going out of [London]3-london for a few days , perhaps to [the seaside]3436-the seaside . "[101-ida]

" Go to [Weymouth]44-weymouth ! "[105-sally] cried [Sally]105-sally , delighted at the thought . " Go and see [[my]105-sally people]3866-my people , and tell [un]3867-you how [I]105-sally 'm getting on . [They]3866-my people 'll make [you]3867-you hide with [un]3868-un all the time [you]3867-you 're [there]3249-there , [s'nough]61-s'nough . It is n't [a big house]3870-a big house , but [it]3870-a big house 's comfortable , and see if [[our]3871-our mother]3872-our mother would n't look after [you]3867-you ! It 's three weeks since [I]105-sally wrote ; if [I]105-sally do n't mind there 'll be [[our]3871-our father]3724-our father up here looking after [I.]105-sally Now , do go ! "[105-sally]

" No , it 's too far . Besides , if [I]101-ida go , [I]101-ida shall want to be quite alone . "[101-ida]

On the following evening [Waymark]129-waymark was expected . At [his]129-waymark last visit [he]129-waymark had noticed that [Ida]101-ida was not in [her]101-ida usual spirits . To - night [he]129-waymark saw that something was clearly wrong , and when [Ida]101-ida spoke of going to [the seaside]3436-the seaside , [he]129-waymark strongly urged [her]101-ida to do so .

" Where should [you]101-ida go to ? "[129-waymark] [he]129-waymark asked .

" [I]129-waymark think to [Hastings]12-hastings . [I]129-waymark went [there]3249-there once , when [I]129-waymark was [a child]378-a child , with [[my]129-waymark mother]3876-my mother [I]129-waymark believe [I]129-waymark told [you]101-ida . [I]129-waymark had rather go [there]3249-there than [anywhere else]3878-anywhere else . "[129-waymark]

" [I]129-waymark feel the need of a change [myself]129-waymark , "[129-waymark] [he]129-waymark said , a moment after , and without looking at [her]101-ida . " Suppose [I]129-waymark were to go to [Hastings]12-hastings , too at the same time that [you]101-ida 're [there]3249-there would [you]101-ida dislike it ? "[129-waymark]

[She]101-ida merely shook [her]101-ida head , almost indifferently . [She]101-ida did not care to talk much to - night , and frequently nodded instead of replying with words .

" But [you]101-ida would rather [I]129-waymark did n't ? "[129-waymark] [he]129-waymark urged .

" No , indeed , "[101-ida] still in the same indifferent way . " [I]101-ida should have company , if [I]101-ida found it dull . "[101-ida]

" Then let [us]3880-us go down by [the same train]1656-the same train will [you]101-ida , [Ida]101-ida ? "[129-waymark]

As far as [she]101-ida remembered , it was the first time that [he]129-waymark had ever addressed [her]101-ida thus by [her]101-ida name . [She]101-ida looked up and smiled slightly .

" If [you]129-waymark like , "[101-ida] was [her]101-ida answer .

CHAPTER XVII

THE MISSING YEARS

" Why should n't life be always like this ? "[129-waymark] said [Waymark]129-waymark , lying on [the upper beach]1693-the upper beach and throwing pebbles into the breakers , which each moment drew a little further hack and needed a little extra exertion of the arm to reach [them]1694-them . There was small disturbance by [people]3402-people passing , here [some two miles up [the shore]1697-the shore eastward from [Hastings]12-hastings]1696-some two miles up the shore eastward from hastings . A large shawl spread between two walking - sticks stuck upright gave , at this afternoon hour , all the shade needful for [two persons]1698-two persons lying side by side , and , even in the blaze of unclouded summer , there were pleasant airs flitting about [the edge of [the laughing sea]1700-the laughing sea]1699-the edge of the laughing sea . " Why should n't life be always like this ? It might be sunshine or fireside if [men]3195-men were wise .
