Not improbably , [Waymark]130-waymark 's last two letters had been forced and lacking in interest . [He]130-waymark had never said anything which could be construed into more than an expression of friendly interest , or intellectual sympathy . It may be that [Maud]103-maud 's condition , dimly prophetic of the coming change , required more than this , and [she]103-maud conceived a certain dissatisfaction . Then came the great event , and for some weeks [she]103-maud scarcely thought of [[her]103-maud correspondent]1888-her correspondent . One day , however , [she]103-maud chanced upon the little packet of [his]130-waymark letters , and read them through again . It was with new eyes . Thoughts spoke to [her]103-maud which had not been there on the first reading . [Waymark]130-waymark had touched at times on art and kindred subjects , and only now could [she]103-maud understand [his]130-waymark meaning . [She]103-maud felt that , in breaking off [her]103-maud connection with [him]130-waymark , [she]103-maud had lost [the one person who could give [her]103-maud entire sympathy]1889-the one person who could give her entire sympathy ; to whom [she]103-maud might have spoken with certainty of being understood , of all the novel ideas which possessed [her]103-maud ; who , indeed , would have been invaluable as [a guide in [the unknown land]1891-the unknown land [she]103-maud was treading]1890-a guide in the unknown land she was treading . It was now almost the end of the year ; more than three months had gone by since [she]103-maud received that last letter from [him]130-waymark . Could [she]103-maud write now , and let [him]130-waymark know that [she]103-maud was in [London]3-london ? [She]103-maud could not but give expression to [her]103-maud altered self ; and would [he]130-waymark be able to understand [her]103-maud ? Yet , [she]103-maud needed [him]130-waymark ; and there was something of [[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother in the fretting to which [she]103-maud was now and then driven by the balked desire . At length [she]103-maud was on the point of writing a letter , with whatever result , when chance spared [her]103-maud the trouble .

One morning in December , [she]103-maud went with [[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother to an exhibition of pictures in [Bond Street]70-bond street . Such visits had been common of late ; [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby could rarely occupy [herself]204-mrs. enderby at [home]3157-home , and pictures , as everything beautiful , always attracted [her]204-mrs. enderby . [They]1895-they had been in [the gallery]1026-the gallery a few minutes only , when [Maud]103-maud recognised [Waymark]130-waymark close at hand . [He]130-waymark was looking closely at a canvas , and seemed quite unaware of [her]103-maud proximity . [She]103-maud laid [her]103-maud hand on [[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother 's arm , and spoke in a nervous whisper .

" [Mother]126-mother , [I]103-maud know [that gentleman]1645-that gentleman . "[103-maud]

" This one ? "[204-mrs. enderby] asked [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby , indicating [Waymark]130-waymark , with a smile . [She]204-mrs. enderby showed no surprise , any more than [she]204-mrs. enderby would have done had [Maud]103-maud been only [[her]103-maud friend]669-her friend .

" Yes . If [he]1645-that gentleman should notice [me]204-mrs. enderby , may [I]204-mrs. enderby introduce [him]1645-that gentleman to [you]377-her mother ? [He]1645-that gentleman was at [the school where [I]204-mrs. enderby taught]4101-the school where i taught a year ago . "[204-mrs. enderby]

" Why , certainly , [[my]377-her mother love]4102-my love , "[377-her mother] replied [[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother , with cheerful assent . " It is quite natural that [you]4102-my love should have [acquaintances]1676-acquaintances [I]377-her mother should like to know . Shall [I]377-her mother ask [him]1645-that gentleman to come and see [us]1901-they ? "[377-her mother]

There was no opportunity of answering . [Waymark]130-waymark , in moving on , had glanced round at [the groups of people]1900-the groups of people , and [his]130-waymark eye had fallen on [Maud]103-maud . [He]130-waymark seemed uncertain ; looked quickly away ; glanced again , and , meeting [her]103-maud eyes , raised [his]130-waymark hat , though still without conviction in [his]130-waymark face . [Maud]103-maud came naturally forward a step or two , and [they]1901-they shook hands ; then at once [she]103-maud introduced [him]130-waymark to [[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother . [No one]3702-no one ever experienced awkward pauses in [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby 's presence ; conversation linked itself with perfect ease , and in a minute [they]1901-they were examining the pictures together . [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby had made up [her]204-mrs. enderby mind with regard to [her]204-mrs. enderby new acquaintance in one or two gleams of [her]204-mrs. enderby quick eyes , and then talked on in an eager , intelligent way , full of contagious enthusiasm , which soon brought out [Waymark]130-waymark 's best powers . [Maud]103-maud said very little . Whenever it was possible unobserved , [she]103-maud gazed at [Waymark]130-waymark 's face . [She]103-maud found [herself]103-maud thinking that , in external appearance , [he]130-waymark had improved since [she]103-maud last saw [him]130-waymark . [He]130-waymark had no longer that hungry , discontented look to which [she]103-maud had grown accustomed in [the upper schoolroom at [Dr. Tootle 's]141-dr. tootle]1904-the upper schoolroom at dr. tootle 's ; [his]130-waymark eye seemed at once quieter and keener ; [his]130-waymark complexion was brighter ; the habitual frown had somewhat smoothed away . Then , [he]130-waymark was more careful in the matter of dress . On the whole , it seemed probable that [his]130-waymark circumstances had changed for the better .

[Waymark]130-waymark , on [his]130-waymark side , whilst [he]130-waymark talked , was not less full of speculation about [Maud]103-maud . For the change in [her]103-maud appearance was certainly much more noticeable than it could be in [his]130-waymark own . Not only that [she]103-maud had put aside [her]103-maud sad - coloured and poor raiment for a costume of tasteful and attractive simplicity this , of course , [[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother 's doing but the look of shrinking , almost of fear , which [he]130-waymark had been wo nt to see on [her]103-maud face , was entirely gone . [Her]103-maud eyes seemed for ever intelligent of new meanings ; [she]103-maud was pale , but with the pallor of eager , joy - bringing thought . There was something pathetic in this new - born face ; the lips seemed still to speak of past sorrows , or , it might be , to hold unspoken a sad fate half - foreseen .

If this renewal of acquaintanceship came just at the right time for [Maud]103-maud , it was no less welcome to [Waymark]130-waymark . When [he]130-waymark wrote [his]130-waymark last letter to [her]103-maud , it had proceeded more from a sense of obligation than any natural impulse . For [he]130-waymark was then only just recovering from a period of something like despair . [His]130-waymark pursuit of [Ida Starr]101-ida to [London]3-london had been fruitless . It was true that [she]103-maud had left [[her]103-maud former abode]1906-her former abode , and [the landlady]386-the landlady professed to be ignorant of [[her]103-maud new one]1908-her new one , though [she]103-maud admitted that [she]103-maud had seen [Ida]101-ida scarcely two hours before [Waymark]130-waymark 's arrival . [He]130-waymark wrote , but had no reply . [His]130-waymark only comfort was an ever - rising suspicion of the truth as [he]130-waymark would learn it later , but fears were , on the whole , strongest within [him]130-waymark . Confidence in [her]103-maud [he]130-waymark had not . All the reflections of that last evening on [Hastings pier]12-hastings lived and re - lived in [his]130-waymark mind ; outcome of the cynicism which was a marked feature in [his]130-waymark development , and at the same time tending to confirm it . [She]103-maud had been summoned back suddenly by a letter ; who but [a simpleton]1909-a simpleton could doubt what that meant ? [He]130-waymark thought of [Sally]105-sally , of course , and the step [she]105-sally had taken ; but could [he]130-waymark draw conclusions about [Ida]101-ida from [Sally]105-sally , and did ever two such instances come within [a man]1260-a man 's experience ? To [Sally]105-sally [herself]105-sally [he]130-waymark had naturally had recourse , but in vain . [She]103-maud said that [she]103-maud knew nothing of [the lost girl]1911-the lost girl . [So Waymark]130-waymark fought it out , to the result of weariness ; then plunged into [his]130-waymark work again , and had regained very much [his]130-waymark ordinary state of mind when [Maud Enderby]103-maud unexpectedly came before [him]130-waymark .

[He]130-waymark called upon [the Enderbys]202-the enderbys , and was soon invited to dine , which necessitated the purchase of a dress suit . On the appointed evening , [he]130-waymark found [Maud]103-maud and [[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother in [a little drawing - room]1913-a little drawing - room , which had a pleasant air of ease and refinement . It was a new sensation for [Waymark]130-waymark as [he]130-waymark sank into a soft chair , and , in speaking , lowered [his]130-waymark voice , to suit the quietness of [the room]255-the room . The soft lamp - light spreading through the coloured shade , the just perceptible odour of scent when [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby stirred , the crackling of the welcome fire , filled [him]130-waymark with a sense of luxury to which [he]130-waymark was not accustomed . [He]130-waymark looked at [Maud]103-maud . [She]103-maud was beautiful in [her]103-maud evening dress ; and , marking the grave , sweet thoughtfulness of [her]103-maud face , the grace of [her]103-maud movements , the air of purity which clung about [her]103-maud , [his]130-waymark mind turned to [Ida Starr]101-ida , and experienced a shock at the comparison . Where was [Ida]101-ida at this moment ? The mere possibilities which such a question brought before [his]130-waymark mind made [him]130-waymark uneasy , almost as if [he]130-waymark had forgotten [himself]130-waymark and uttered aloud some word all unfit for [ladies]1915-ladies ' ears . The feeling was a novel one , and , in afterwards recalling it , [he]130-waymark could smile rather contemptuously , If [we]1916-we are enraptured with one particular flower , shall [we]1916-we necessarily despise [another , whose beauty and perfume happen to be of quite a different kind]1917-another , whose beauty and perfume happen to be of quite a different kind ?

[Mr. Enderby]205-mr. enderby appeared , followed by [another gentleman]1918-another gentleman . [Waymark]130-waymark noticed an unpleasant heat in the hand held out to [him]130-waymark ; there was a flush in [Paul]203-paul 's cheeks , too , and [his]130-waymark eyes were very bright . [He]130-waymark greeted [the visitor]842-the visitor with somewhat excessive warmth , then turned and introduced [[his]130-waymark companion]1325-his companion , by the name of [Mr. Rudge]208-mr. rudge .

[Waymark]130-waymark observed that [this gentleman]793-this gentleman and [[his]793-this gentleman hostess]1922-his hostess were on terms of lively intimacy . [They]1923-they talked much throughout the evening .

During the three months that followed , [Waymark]130-waymark 's intercourse with [the Enderbys]202-the enderbys was pretty frequent . [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby asked few questions about [him]130-waymark , and [Maud]103-maud was silent after [she]103-maud had explained [Waymark]130-waymark 's position , so far as [she]103-maud was acquainted with it , and how [she]103-maud had come to know [him]130-waymark . To [both parents]1924-both parents , the fact of [Maud]103-maud 's friendship was a quite sufficient guarantee , so possessed were [they]1924-both parents with a conviction of the trustworthiness of [her]103-maud judgment , and the moral value of [her]103-maud impulses . In [Waymark]130-waymark 's character there was something which [women]3771-women found very attractive ; strength and individuality are perhaps the words that best express what it was , though these qualities would not in themselves have sufficed to give [him]130-waymark [his]130-waymark influence , without a certain gracefulness of inward homage which manifested itself when [he]130-waymark talked with [women]3771-women , a suggestion , too , of underlying passion which works subtly on [a woman]3216-a woman 's imagination . There was nothing commonplace in [his]130-waymark appearance and manner ; one divined in [him]130-waymark a past out of the ordinary range of experiences , and felt the promise of a future which would , in one way or another , be remarkable .

The more [Waymark]130-waymark saw of [Maud Enderby]103-maud the more completely did [he]130-waymark yield to the fascination of [her]103-maud character . In [her]103-maud presence [he]130-waymark enjoyed a strange calm of spirit . For the first time [he]130-waymark knew [a woman who by no word or look or motion]1928-a woman who by no word or look or motion could stir in [him]130-waymark a cynical thought . Here was something higher than [himself]130-waymark , a nature which [he]130-waymark had to confess transcended the limits of [his]130-waymark judgment , a soul with insight possibly for ever denied to [himself]130-waymark . [He]130-waymark was often pained by the deference with which [she]103-maud sought [his]130-waymark opinion or counsel ; the words in which [he]130-waymark replied to [her]103-maud sounded so hollow ; [he]130-waymark became so often and so keenly sensible of [his]130-waymark insincerity , a quality which , with others , [he]130-waymark could consciously rely upon as a resource , but which , before [Maud]103-maud , stung [him]130-waymark . [He]130-waymark was driven to balance judgments , to hesitate in replies , to search [his]130-waymark own heart , as perhaps never before .

Artificial good humour , affected interest , mock sympathy , were as far from [her]103-maud as was the least taint of indelicacy ; every word [she]103-maud uttered rang true , and [her]103-maud very phrases had that musical fall which only associates itself with beautiful and honest thought . [She]103-maud never exhibited gaiety , or a spirit of fun , but could raise a smile by an exquisite shade of humour humour which , as the best is , was more than half sadness . Nor was [she]103-maud fond of mixing with people whom [she]103-maud did not know well ; when there was [company at dinner]1929-company at dinner , [she]103-maud generally begged to be allowed to dine alone . Though always anxious to give pleasure to [[her]103-maud parents]511-her parents , [she]103-maud was most happy when nothing drew [her]103-maud from [[her]103-maud own room]1931-her own room ; there [she]103-maud would read and dream through hours There were times when the old dreaded feelings took revenge ; night - wakings , when [she]103-maud lay in cold anguish , yearning for the dawn . [She]103-maud was not yet strong enough to face past and future , secured in attained conviction . As yet , [she]103-maud could not stir beyond the present , and in the enjoyment of the present was [her]103-maud strength .

CHAPTER XIX

IN THE MEANTIME

It was one Wednesday evening in early April , that [Waymark]130-waymark found a letter awaiting [him]130-waymark , addressed in a hand [he]130-waymark at once recognised .

" Will [you]103-maud come and see [me]130-waymark ? [I]130-waymark am at [home]3157-home after eight o'clock till the end of the week , and all day on Sunday .[130-waymark]

[I.]130-waymark S. "[130-waymark]

No distinct pleasure was aroused in [Waymark]130-waymark as [he]130-waymark read this . As was always the case for hours after [he]130-waymark had left [Maud]103-maud 's presence , [her]103-maud face and voice lived with [him]130-waymark to the exclusion of every other thought . There was even something of repulsion in the feeling excited by [his]130-waymark thus having the memory of [Ida]101-ida brought suddenly before [him]130-waymark ; [her]103-maud face came as an unwelcome intruder upon the calm , grave mood which always possessed [him]130-waymark on these evenings . In returning [home]3157-home each Wednesday night , [Waymark]130-waymark always sought the speediest and quietest route , unwilling to be brought in contact with that life of [the streets]3169-the streets which at other times delighted [him]130-waymark . [Ida]101-ida 's note seemed a summons from [that world]1934-that world which , for the moment , [he]130-waymark held at a distance . But the call was not to be silenced at [his]130-waymark will . [He]130-waymark began to wonder about [her]101-ida life during the past half - year . Why had [she]101-ida written just now , after so long a silence ? Where , and under what circumstances , should [he]130-waymark meet [her]101-ida ? Did [she]101-ida think to find [him]130-waymark the same as when [they]1935-they last talked together ?

Through the night [he]130-waymark woke constantly , and always with thoughts busy about [Ida]101-ida . In the morning [his]130-waymark first impulse was to re - read [her]101-ida message ; received so carelessly , it had in the meantime become of more account , and [Waymark]130-waymark laughed in [his]130-waymark wonted way as [he]130-waymark saw [himself]130-waymark thus swayed between forces [he]130-waymark could not control . The ordinary day 's task was neglected , and [he]130-waymark impatiently waited for the hour when [he]130-waymark could be sure of finding [Ida]101-ida at [home]3157-home . The address was at [Fulham]72-fulham , and , on reaching [it]72-fulham , [he]130-waymark found [a large new block of the kind known as [model lodging - houses]1938-model lodging - houses]1937-a large new block of the kind known as model lodging - houses . [Ida]101-ida 's number was up at the very top . When [he]130-waymark knocked , the door opened immediately , and [she]101-ida stood there , holding out [her]101-ida hand to [him]130-waymark .

[She]101-ida wore the same dress that [she]101-ida had worn at [Hastings]12-hastings , but the gold brooch and watch - chain were missing , and [her]101-ida hair was arranged in a simpler way . [She]101-ida was a trifle pale , perhaps , but that might be due to the excitement of the moment ; [her]101-ida voice shook a little as [she]101-ida spoke .

[Waymark]130-waymark looked about [him]130-waymark as [he]130-waymark went in . There appeared to be [two rooms]1939-two rooms , one of them [a very small bedroom]1940-a very small bedroom , the other fitted with a cooking - grate and oven ; [the kind of tenement suitable to [very poor working - people]1942-very poor working - people]1941-the kind of tenement suitable to very poor working - people . The floors were bare , and there was nothing in the way of furniture beyond the most indispensable articles : a table , two chairs , and a few cups , saucers , and plates on a shelf ; through the half - open door , [he]130-waymark saw that [the bed - room]1943-the bed - room was equally plain . A fire was burning , and a kettle on [it]1944-it ; and in front , on a little square piece of carpet , lay [[Ida]101-ida 's inseparable friend]1945-ida 's inseparable friend , [Grim]169-grim . [Grim]169-grim had lifted [his]169-grim head at [Waymark]130-waymark 's entrance , and , with gathering curiosity in [his]169-grim eyes , slowly stood up ; then stretched [himself]169-grim , and , looking first at one , then at the other , waited in doubt .

[Ida]101-ida stooped and took [him]169-grim up in [her]101-ida arms .

" And who 's this ? "[101-ida] [she]101-ida asked , talking to [him]169-grim as [one]318-one talks to [a child]378-a child , whilst [she]101-ida pressed [his]169-grim warm black cheek against [her]101-ida own . " Does [Grim]169-grim remember who this is ? [We]4105-we still keep together , "[101-ida] [she]101-ida added , looking at [Waymark]130-waymark . " All day long , whilst [I]101-ida 'm away , [he]169-grim keeps [house]4106-house ; [I]101-ida 'm often afraid [he]169-grim suffers dreadfully from loneliness , but , [you]130-waymark see , [I]101-ida 'm obliged to lock [him]169-grim in . And [he]169-grim knows exactly the time when [I]101-ida come [home]3157-home . [I]101-ida always find [him]169-grim sitting on that chair by the door , waiting , waiting , oh so patiently ! And [I]101-ida often bring [him]169-grim back something nice , do n't [I]101-ida , [Grimmy]171-grimmy ? [You]130-waymark should see how delighted [he]169-grim is as soon as [I]101-ida enter the door . "[101-ida]

[Ida]101-ida was changed , and in many ways . [She]101-ida seemed to have grown younger ; in [her]101-ida voice and manner there was a girlishness which was quite new to [Waymark]130-waymark . [Her]101-ida motions were lighter and nimbler ; there was no longer that slow grace of step and carriage which had expressed absolute leisure , and with it had gone , perhaps , something of dignity , which used to sit so well upon [her]101-ida . [She]101-ida laughed from time to time in a free , careless way ; formerly [she]101-ida seldom did more than smile . In the old days , there was nothing about [her]101-ida suggestive of what are called the domestic virtues ; now [she]101-ida seemed perfectly at [home]3157-home amid these simple surroundings , and , almost as soon as [[her]101-ida visitor]797-her visitor had sat down , [she]101-ida busied [herself]101-ida in laying the table in a quick , ready way , which came of the habit of waiting upon [herself]101-ida .

" [You]130-waymark 'll have a cup of tea with [me]101-ida ? "[101-ida] [she]101-ida said , looking at [Waymark]130-waymark with the curiosity which seemed to show that [she]101-ida also found something changed in [him]130-waymark . " [I]101-ida only get [home]3157-home about eight o'clock , and this is the quietest and pleasantest meal in the day for [me]101-ida . "[101-ida]

" What do [you]101-ida do all day , then ? "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark asked , softening the bluntness of [his]130-waymark question with a smile .

[She]101-ida stepped near to [him]130-waymark , and held out [her]101-ida hands for [him]130-waymark to look at ; then , as [he]130-waymark met [her]101-ida eyes again , laughed merrily .

" Do [you]130-waymark guess ? "[101-ida] [she]101-ida asked .

" [I]101-ida believe [I]101-ida can . [You]130-waymark have gone back to [the laundry]4109-the laundry again ? "[101-ida]

" Yes . "[101-ida]

" And how long is it since [you]101-ida did so ? "[101-ida]

" How long is it since [we]4110-we last saw [each other]459-each other ? "[101-ida]

" Did [you]101-ida begin at once when [you]101-ida returned to [London]3-london ? "[101-ida]

" Yes . "[101-ida]

[Waymark]130-waymark kept silence , whilst [Ida]101-ida poured out a cup of tea for [him]130-waymark , and then took [her]101-ida seat at the table .

" Do n't [you]130-waymark think [I]101-ida 'm comfortable [here]3335-here ? "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida said . " It 's like having [a house of [my]101-ida own]4113-a house of my own . [I]101-ida see nothing of [the other people in [the building]4115-the building]4114-the other people in the building , and feel independent . "[101-ida]

" Did [you]101-ida buy the furniture [yourself]101-ida ? "[101-ida]

" Yes ; just the things [I]101-ida could n't do without . [I]101-ida pay only three - and - sixpence a week , and so long as [I]101-ida can earn that , [I]101-ida 'm sure at all events of [a home]1484-a home , where [I]101-ida can be happy or miserable , as [I]101-ida please . "[101-ida]

[Waymark]130-waymark wondered . There was no mistaking the genuineness of [her]101-ida tone . What , then , had been the reason for this astonishing change , a change extending , it would seem , almost to temperament ? What intermediate phases had led up to this result ? [He]130-waymark wished to ask [her]101-ida for an explanation , but to do so would be to refer to the condition [she]101-ida had left , and that [he]130-waymark did not wish to do . All would no doubt explain itself as [they]1950-they talked ; in the meantime [she]101-ida told [him]130-waymark how [her]101-ida days were ordered , and the details of [her]101-ida life .

" Have [you]130-waymark brought [your]130-waymark pipe ? "[101-ida] [she]101-ida asked , when [they]1950-they had drank [their]1950-they tea .

" May [I]101-ida smoke ? "[101-ida]

" Of course , just as [you]130-waymark used to . "[101-ida]

" But it is not the same , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark said , half to [himself]130-waymark .

" Are [you]130-waymark sorry for the change ? "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida asked , as [she]101-ida handed [him]130-waymark a box of matches .

" What induced [you]130-waymark to make it ? "[101-ida]

" Oh , [I]101-ida have strange fancies . The idea came , just like others do . Are [you]130-waymark sorry ? "[101-ida]

" The opposite . Did the idea come whilst [we]1950-they were at [Hastings]12-hastings ? "[101-ida]

" Before that . Do [you]130-waymark remember [my]101-ida telling [you]130-waymark that [I]101-ida had a letter calling [me]101-ida back to [London]3-london ? "[101-ida]

[Waymark]130-waymark nodded .

" It was from [the laundry]4109-the laundry , to say [I]130-waymark could go to work as soon as [I]130-waymark liked . "[130-waymark]

" And why did n't [you]130-waymark tell [me]101-ida that ? "[101-ida]

[Ida]101-ida seemed about to reply , but altered [her]101-ida intention , and , after being silent for a moment , asked another question .

" Did [you]130-waymark think [you]130-waymark would ever hear from [me]101-ida ? "[101-ida]

" [I]101-ida had given up hope . "[101-ida]

" And did [you]130-waymark wonder what had become of [me]101-ida ? "[101-ida]

" Often . Why did n't [you]130-waymark write before ? "[101-ida]

" [I]101-ida was n't ready . "[101-ida]

" What does that mean ? "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark asked , looking closely at [her]101-ida .

" Perhaps [I]101-ida shall be able to explain some day . If not , well , it wo n't matter . "[101-ida]

" And will [you]101-ida let [me]130-waymark see [you]101-ida often ? "[130-waymark] said [Waymark]130-waymark , after thinking a little . " Are [we]1951-we to be [friends]562-friends again , as [we]1951-we used to be ? "[130-waymark]

" If [you]101-ida would care for it . "[101-ida]

[Waymark]130-waymark turned away as [their]1951-we eyes met .

" Certainly [I]130-waymark should care for it , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark said , feeling all at once a difficulty in speaking naturally . Then [he]130-waymark looked at [Ida]101-ida again ; [she]101-ida was bending down and stroking [Grim]169-grim 's ears . There was rather a long silence , which [Waymark]130-waymark at length forced [himself]130-waymark to break .

" Shall [I]130-waymark bring [you]101-ida books again ? "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark said .

" [I]101-ida have very little time for reading , "[101-ida] was [Ida]101-ida 's reply . " It 's better , perhaps , that it is so . "[101-ida]

" But why ? "[101-ida]

" Perhaps it would make [me]101-ida discontented with [my]101-ida work , and want all sorts of things [I]101-ida could n't have . "[101-ida]

" [You]101-ida have [your]101-ida Sundays free ? "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark said , after another rather long silence .

" Yes . "[130-waymark]

" Then [we]4119-we must have some expeditions again , now that the fine days have come . By the by , do [you]101-ida ever see [Sally]105-sally ? "[101-ida]

[Ida]101-ida looked up with a smile and said , " Yes ; do [you]101-ida ? "[101-ida]

" No ; but [I]101-ida hear of [her]105-sally . "[101-ida]

" From [[your]101-ida friend]3729-your friend ? "[101-ida]

" Yes , from [O'Gree]142-o'gree . "[101-ida]

" Do [[your]101-ida other friends]4121-your other friends still live near [you]101-ida ? "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida asked , speaking quickly , as if to interrupt what [Waymark]130-waymark was about to say .

" [The Castis]209-the castis ? Oh yes . "[101-ida]

" What is [Mrs. Casti]187-mrs. casti like ? "[101-ida] [she]101-ida said , in a tone which attracted [Waymark]130-waymark 's attention .

" Well , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark replied , " it 's difficult to describe [her]187-mrs. casti . There 's nothing very good about [her]187-mrs. casti , and [I]130-waymark suppose nothing very bad . [I]130-waymark see little of [her]187-mrs. casti now ; [she]187-mrs. casti 's almost always ill . "[130-waymark]

" What 's the matter with [her]187-mrs. casti ? "[101-ida]

" Ca n't say ; general weakness and ill health , [I]130-waymark think ? "[130-waymark]

" But [she]187-mrs. casti 's so young , is n't [she]187-mrs. casti ? Has [she]187-mrs. casti [friends]562-friends to go and see [her]187-mrs. casti ? "[101-ida]

" Very few , [I]130-waymark think . "[130-waymark]

" It must be dreadful to be like that , "[101-ida] said [Ida]101-ida . " [I]101-ida 'm thankful that [I]101-ida have [my]101-ida health , at all events . Loneliness is n't so hard to bear , as it must be in illness . "[101-ida]

" Do [you]130-waymark feel lonely ? "[130-waymark]

" A little , sometimes , "[101-ida] said [Ida]101-ida . " But it 's ungrateful to [poor old Grim]3793-poor old grim to say so . "[101-ida]

" Have [you]130-waymark no acquaintances except [the people [you]130-waymark work with]4124-the people you work with ? "[130-waymark]

[She]101-ida shook [her]101-ida head .

" And [you]130-waymark do n't read ? Would n't [you]130-waymark like to go on reading as [you]130-waymark used to ? [You]130-waymark have a better head than [most women]4125-most women , and it 's a pity not to make use of it . That 's all nonsense about in making [you]130-waymark discontented . [You]130-waymark wo n't always be living like this , [I]101-ida suppose . "[101-ida]

" Why not ? "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida asked simply .

" Well , "[130-waymark] said [Waymark]130-waymark , without meeting [her]101-ida look , " even if [you]101-ida do , it will be gain to [you]101-ida to cultivate [your]101-ida mind ? "[130-waymark]

" Do [you]130-waymark wish [me]101-ida to cultivate [my]101-ida mind ? "[101-ida]

" [You]130-waymark know [I]130-waymark do . "[130-waymark]

[Waymark]130-waymark seemed uneasy . [He]130-waymark rose and leaned against the mantelpiece .

" [I]101-ida will do whatever [you]130-waymark bid [me]101-ida , "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida said . " [I]101-ida can get an hour or so each night , and [I]101-ida have all Sunday . "[101-ida]

[Waymark]130-waymark felt only too well the effect of the tone [he]130-waymark was adopting . The situation was by this time clear enough to [him]130-waymark , and [his]130-waymark own difficulties no less clear . [He]130-waymark avoided looking at [Ida]101-ida as much as [he]130-waymark could . A change had again come over [her]101-ida manner ; the girlishness was modified , the old sadder tone was audible at moments .

" If it 's fine on Sunday , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark said , " will [you]101-ida go with [me]130-waymark to [Richmond]58-richmond , and let [us]4126-we have dinner at [the old place]3850-the old place ? "[130-waymark]

" No , "[101-ida] was [Ida]101-ida 's reply , with a smile , " [I]101-ida ca n't afford it . "[101-ida]

" But [I]130-waymark invite [you]101-ida . Of course [I]130-waymark did n't mean that it should be any expense . "[130-waymark]

[She]101-ida still shook [her]101-ida head .

" No , [I]130-waymark must take [my]130-waymark own share , wherever [we]4126-we go . "[130-waymark]

" Then [I]130-waymark shall certainly refuse [your]101-ida cup of tea next time [I]130-waymark come , "[130-waymark] said [Waymark]130-waymark jestingly .

" That 's quite different , "[101-ida] said [Ida]101-ida . " But if [you]130-waymark like , [we]4126-we can go in the afternoon , and walk about [Roehampton]57-roehampton ; that [I]101-ida can afford . "[101-ida]

" As [you]130-waymark please . When shall [I]101-ida call for [you]130-waymark ? "[101-ida]

" Half - past one . "[101-ida]

[She]101-ida opened the door for [him]130-waymark , and held out [her]101-ida hand . [Their]1952-their eyes did not meet as [they]1952-their said good - bye . The door closed , and [Waymark]130-waymark went so slowly down [the stone steps]1953-the stone steps that [he]130-waymark seemed at every moment on the point of stopping and turning back .

[CHAPTER XX

A SUGGESTION

Waymark]210-waymark and [Julian Casti]118-julian were sitting together in [the former 's room]1954-the former 's room . It was Saturday evening two days after [Waymark]210-waymark 's visit to [Ida]101-ida . [Julian]118-julian had fallen into a sad reverie .

" How is [[your]210-waymark wife]4128-your wife ? "[876-his friend] asked [[his]118-julian friend]876-his friend , after watching the melancholy face for a while .

" [She]4128-your wife said [her]4128-your wife headache was worse to - night . "[210-waymark]

" [Curiously]211-curiously , "[210-waymark] observed [Waymark]210-waymark , with a little acidity , " it always is when [you]210-waymark have to leave [home]3157-home . "[210-waymark]

[Julian]118-julian looked up , and seemed to reach a crisis in [his]118-julian thoughts .

" [Waymark]210-waymark , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian began , reddening as [he]118-julian still always did when greatly moved , " [I]118-julian fear [I]118-julian have been behaving very foolishly . Many a time [I]118-julian have wished to speak out to [you]210-waymark plainly , but a sort of delicacy a wrong kind of delicacy , [I]118-julian think prevented [me]118-julian . [I]118-julian ca n't keep this attitude any longer . [I]118-julian must tell [you]210-waymark how things are going on , and [you]210-waymark must give [me]118-julian what help [you]210-waymark can . And perhaps [I]118-julian shall be telling [you]210-waymark what [you]210-waymark already know ? "[118-julian]

" [I]210-waymark have suspected . "[210-waymark]

" Where is the blame ? "[118-julian] [Julian]118-julian broke out , with sudden vehemence . " [I]118-julian can not think that ever [husband]4130-husband was more patient and more indulgent than [I]118-julian have been . [I]118-julian have refused [her]4131-her nothing that [my]118-julian means could possibly obtain . [I]118-julian have given up all the old quiet habits of [my]118-julian life that [she]4131-her might n't think [I]118-julian slighted [her]4131-her ; [I]118-julian scarcely ever open a book at [home]3157-home , knowing that it irritates [her]4131-her to see [me]118-julian reading ; [I]118-julian do [my]118-julian best to amuse [her]4131-her at all times . How does [she]4131-her reward [me]118-julian ? For ever [she]4131-her grumbles that [I]118-julian ca n't perform impossibilities , take [her]4131-her to [theatres]4133-theatres , buy [her]4131-her new dresses , procure for [[her]4131-her friends]520-her friends and [acquaintances]1676-acquaintances . [My]118-julian wishes , expressed or understood , weigh with [her]4131-her less than the least of [her]4131-her own caprices . [She]4131-her wantonly does things which [she]4131-her knows will cause [me]118-julian endless misery . [[Her]4131-her companions]322-her companions are [gross and depraved people , who constantly drag [her]4131-her lower and lower , to [their]322-her companions own level]4137-gross and depraved people , who constantly drag her lower and lower , to their own level . [The landlady]386-the landlady has told [me]118-julian that , in [my]118-julian absence , [women]3771-women have called to see [her]4131-her who certainly ought not to enter [any decent house]4140-any decent house . When [I]118-julian entreat [her]4131-her to give up [such associates]4141-such associates , [her]4131-her only answer is to accuse [me]118-julian of selfishness , since [I]118-julian have [friends]562-friends [myself]118-julian , and yet wo n't permit [her]4131-her to have any . And things have gone from bad to worse . Several nights of late , when [I]118-julian have got [home]3157-home , [she]4131-her has been away , and has not returned till much after midnight . Hour after hour [I]118-julian have sat there in the extremest misery , waiting , waiting , feeling as though [my]118-julian brain would burst with its strain ! [I]118-julian have no idea where [she]4131-her goes to . If [I]118-julian ask , [she]4131-her only retorts by asking [me]118-julian where [I]118-julian spend the nights when [I]118-julian am with [you]4144-you , and laughs contemptuously when [I]118-julian tell [her]4131-her the truth . [Her]4131-her suspicions and jealousy are incessant , and torture [me]118-julian past endurance . Once or twice , [I]118-julian confess , [I]118-julian have lost patience , and have spoken angrily , too angrily ; then [she]4131-her has accused [me]118-julian of brutal disregard of [her]4131-her sufferings . It would hurt [me]118-julian less if [she]4131-her pierced [me]118-julian with a knife . Only this morning there was a terrible scene ; [she]4131-her maddened [me]118-julian past endurance by [her]4131-her wretched calumnies accusing [me]118-julian of [I]118-julian know not what disgraceful secrets and when words burst from [me]118-julian involuntarily , [she]4131-her fell into hysterics , and shrieked till [all the people in [the house]288-the house]4145-all the people in the house ran up in alarm . Can [you]4147-you understand what this means to one of [my]118-julian temperament ? To have [my]118-julian private affairs forced upon [strangers]477-strangers in this way tortures [me]118-julian with the pains of hell . [I]118-julian am naturally reticent and retiring too much so , [I]118-julian dare say and no misery could have been devised for [me]118-julian more dreadful than this . [Her]4131-her accusations are atrocious , such as could only come from a grossly impure mind , or at the suggestion of [vile creatures]4149-vile creatures . [You]4147-you [she]4131-her hates with a rabid hatred God only knows why . " But , "[118-julian] broke in [Julian]118-julian , " this amounts to a sentence of death ! What of the life before [me]118-julian , of the years [I]118-julian shall have to spend with [her]4152-her ? Work , forget [myself]118-julian , forget [her]4152-her , that is just what [I]118-julian can not do ! [My]118-julian nerves are getting weaker every day ; [I]118-julian am beginning to have fits of trembling and horrible palpitation ; [my]118-julian dreams are hideous with vague apprehensions , only to be realised when [I]118-julian wake . Work ! Half [my]118-julian misery is caused by the thought that [my]118-julian work is at an end for ever . It is all forsaking [me]118-julian , the delight of imagining great things , what power [I]118-julian had of putting [my]118-julian fancies into words , the music that used to go with [me]118-julian through the day 's work . It is long since [I]118-julian wrote a line of verse . Quietness , peace , a calm life of thought , these things are what [I]118-julian must have ; [I]118-julian thought [I]118-julian should have them in a higher degree than ever , and [I]118-julian find they are irretrievably lost . [I]118-julian feel [my]118-julian own weakness , as [I]118-julian never could before . It is fearful to think of what [I]118-julian shall become as time goes on . [I]118-julian dread [myself]118-julian ! There have been revealed to [me]118-julian depths of passion and misery in [my]118-julian own heart which [I]118-julian had not suspected . [I]118-julian shall lose all self - control , and become as selfish and heedless as [she]4154-she is . "[118-julian]

" All but the most important part of it . There 's no chance of [my]142-o'gree being able to marry for long enough to come . Now , can [you]142-o'gree give [me]142-o'gree any advice ? [I]142-o'gree 've quite made up [my]142-o'gree mind to leave [Tootle]141-dr. tootle . The position is n't worthy of [a gentleman]3501-a gentleman ; [I]142-o'gree 'm losing [my]142-o'gree self - respect . The she - Tootle gets worse and worse . If [I]142-o'gree do n't electrify [her]1965-the girl - mummy , one of these days , with an outburst of ferocious indignation , [she]1965-the girl - mummy will only have [my]142-o'gree patience to thank . Let [her]1965-the girl - mummy beware how [she]1965-the girl - mummy drives the lion to bay ! "[142-o'gree]

" Could n't [you]142-o'gree get a non - resident mastership ? "[142-o'gree]

" [I]142-o'gree must try , but the pay is so devilish small . "[142-o'gree]

" [We]1967-we must talk the matter over . "[142-o'gree]

CHAPTER XXI

DIPLOMACY

[Waymark]130-waymark had a good deal of frank talk with [himself]130-waymark before meeting [Ida]101-ida again on the Sunday . Such conversation was , as [we]1967-we know , habitual . Under the circumstances , however , [he]130-waymark felt that it behoved [him]130-waymark to become especially clear on one or two points ; never mind what course [he]130-waymark might ultimately pursue , it was always needful to [him]130-waymark to dissect [his]130-waymark own motives , that [he]130-waymark might at least be acting with full consciousness .

One thing was clear enough . The fiction of a mere friendship between [himself]130-waymark and [Ida]101-ida was impossible to support . It had been impossible under the very different circumstances of a year ago , and was not likely to last a week , now that [Ida]101-ida could so little conceal how [her]101-ida own feelings had changed . What , then , was to be [their]1968-their future ? Could [he]130-waymark accept [her]101-ida love , and join [their]1968-their lives without legal bond , thinking only of present happiness , and content to let things arrange [themselves]1968-their as they would in the years to come ?

[His]130-waymark heart strongly opposed such a step . Clearly [Ida]101-ida had changed [her]101-ida life for [his]130-waymark sake , and was undergoing hardships in the hope of winning [his]130-waymark respect as well as [his]130-waymark love . Would [she]101-ida have done all this without something of a hope that [she]101-ida might regain [her]101-ida place in [the every - day world]1969-the every - day world , and be held by [Waymark]130-waymark worthy to become [[his]130-waymark wife]505-his wife ? [He]130-waymark could not certainly know , but there was little doubt that this hope had led [her]101-ida on . Could [he]130-waymark believe [her]101-ida capable of yet nobler ideas ; could [he]130-waymark think that only in reverence of the sanctity of love , and without regard to other things , [she]101-ida had acted in this way ; then , regarding [her]101-ida as indeed [[his]130-waymark equal]1971-his equal , [he]130-waymark would open [his]130-waymark heart to [her]101-ida and speak somewhat in this way . " Yes , [I]130-waymark do love [you]101-ida ; but at the same time [I]130-waymark know too well the uncertainty of love to go through the pretence of binding [myself]130-waymark to [you]101-ida for ever . Will [you]101-ida accept [my]130-waymark love in its present sincerity , neither hoping nor fearing , knowing that whatever happens is beyond [our]4215-our own control , feeling with [me]130-waymark that only an ignoble nature can descend to the affectation of union when the real links are broken ? "[130-waymark] Could [Waymark]130-waymark but have felt sure of [her]101-ida answer to such an appeal , it would have gone far to make [his]130-waymark love for [Ida]101-ida all - engrossing . [She]101-ida would then be [[his]130-waymark ideal woman]1972-his ideal woman , and [his]130-waymark devotion to [her]101-ida would have no bounds .

But [he]130-waymark felt too strongly that in thus speaking [he]130-waymark would sadden [her]101-ida by the destruction of [her]101-ida great hope . On the other hand , to offer to make [her]101-ida [[his]130-waymark legal wife]1973-his legal wife would be to do [her]101-ida a yet greater injustice , even had [he]130-waymark been willing to so sacrifice [himself]130-waymark . The necessity for legal marriage would be a confession of [her]101-ida inferiority , and the sense of being thus bound would , [he]130-waymark well knew , be the surest means of weakening [his]130-waymark affection . This affection [he]130-waymark could not trust . How far was it mere passion of the senses , which gratification would speedily kill ?

In the case of [his]130-waymark feeling towards [Maud Enderby]103-maud there was no such doubt . Never was [his]130-waymark blood so calm as in [her]103-maud presence . [She]103-maud was to [him]130-waymark a spirit , and in the spirit [he]130-waymark loved [her]103-maud . With [Maud]103-maud [he]130-waymark might look forward to union at some distant day , a union outwardly of the conventional kind . It would be so , not on account of any inferiority to [his]130-waymark ideal in [Maud]103-maud , for [he]130-waymark felt that there was no height of [his]130-waymark own thought whither [she]103-maud would not in time follow [him]130-waymark ; but simply because no point of principle would demand a refusal of the yoke of respectability , with its attendant social advantages . And the thought of thus binding [himself]130-waymark to [Maud]103-maud had nothing repulsive , for the links between [them]1974-their were not of the kind which easily yield , and loyalty to a higher and nobler nature may well be deemed a duty .

So far logical arguing . But the fact remained that [he]130-waymark had not the least intention of breaking off [his]130-waymark intercourse with [Ida]101-ida , despite the certainty that passion would grow upon [him]130-waymark with each of [their]1974-their meetings , rendering [their]1974-their mutual relations more and more dangerous . Of only one thing could [he]130-waymark be sure : marriage was not to be thought of . It remained , then , that [he]130-waymark was in danger of being led into conduct which would be the source of grievous unrest to [himself]130-waymark , and for [Ida]101-ida would lay the foundation of much suffering . [Waymark]130-waymark was honest enough in [his]130-waymark self - communing to admit that [he]130-waymark could not trust [himself]130-waymark . Gross deception [he]130-waymark was incapable of , but [he]130-waymark would not answer for it that , the temptation pressing [him]130-waymark too hard , [he]130-waymark might not be guilty of allowing [Ida]101-ida to think [his]130-waymark love of more worth than it really was . [She]101-ida knew [his]130-waymark contempt of conventional ties , and [her]101-ida faith in [him]130-waymark would keep [her]101-ida from pressing [him]130-waymark to any step [he]130-waymark disliked ; [she]101-ida would trust [him]130-waymark without that . And such trust would be unmerited .

It was significant that [he]130-waymark did not take into account loyalty to [Maud]103-maud as a help in resisting this temptation . [He]130-waymark was too sure of [himself]130-waymark as regarded that purer love ; let what might happen , [his]130-waymark loyalty to [Maud]103-maud would be unshaken . It was independent of passion , and passion could not shake it .

Then came the subject of the proposed acquaintance between [Ida]101-ida and [Mrs. Casti]187-mrs. casti . An impulse of friendship had led to [his]130-waymark conceiving the idea ; together , perhaps , with the recollection of what [Ida]101-ida had said about [her]101-ida loneliness , and the questions [she]101-ida had asked about [Mrs. Casti]187-mrs. casti . [Waymark]130-waymark had little doubt that those questions indicated a desire to become acquainted with [[his]130-waymark friends]1209-his friends ; the desire was natural , under the circumstances . Still , [he]130-waymark regretted what [he]130-waymark had done . To introduce [Ida]101-ida to [[his]130-waymark friends]1209-his friends would be almost equivalent to avowing some conventional relations between [her]101-ida and [himself]130-waymark . And , in the next place , it would be an obstacle in the way of those relations becoming anything but conventional . Well , and was not this exactly the kind of aid [he]130-waymark needed in pursuing the course which [he]130-waymark felt to be right ? Truly ; yet

At this point [Waymark]130-waymark broke into that half contemptuous , half indulgent laugh which so frequently interrupted [his]130-waymark self - communings , and , it being nearly one o'clock , set out to call for [Ida]101-ida . The day was fine , and , when [they]1977-they left [the steamer]1978-the steamer at [Putney]56-putney , [they]1977-they walked on to [the heath]1979-the heath in good spirits and with cheerful talk . To be with [Ida]101-ida under these circumstances , in the sunlight and the fresh breeze , was very different from sitting with [her]101-ida yonder in [the little room]291-the little room , with the lamp burning on the table , and the quietness of night around . The calm pleasure of passionless intercourse was realised and sufficing . [Ida]101-ida , too , seemed content to enjoy the moment ; there was not that wistfulness in [her]101-ida eyes which had been so new to [him]130-waymark and so strong in its influence . It was easy to find indifferent subjects of conversation , and to avoid the seriousness which would have been fatal .

When [they]1977-they had found a pleasant spot to rest awhile before turning back , [Waymark]130-waymark made up [his]130-waymark mind to fulfil [his]130-waymark promise to [Julian]118-julian .

" It 's rather strange , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark said , " that [you]101-ida should have been asking [me]130-waymark questions about [Mrs. Casti]187-mrs. casti . Since then [I]130-waymark 've discovered that [you]101-ida probably know [her]187-mrs. casti , or once did . "[130-waymark]

[Ida]101-ida looked surprised .

" Do [you]130-waymark remember once having [a schoolfellow]4216-a schoolfellow called [Harriet Smales]99-harriet ? "[101-ida]

" Is that [her]187-mrs. casti name ? "[101-ida]

" It was , before [her]187-mrs. casti marriage . "[101-ida]

[Ida]101-ida became grave , and thought for some moments before speaking again .

" Yes , [I]101-ida remember [her]187-mrs. casti , "[101-ida] [she]101-ida said , " and not pleasantly . "[101-ida]

" [You]130-waymark would n't care to renew [her]187-mrs. casti acquaintance then ? "[101-ida] said [Waymark]130-waymark , half glad , in spite of [himself]130-waymark , that [she]101-ida spoke in this way .

[Ida]101-ida asked , with earnestness , how [he]130-waymark had made this discovery . [Waymark]130-waymark hesitated , but at length told the truth . [He]130-waymark explained that [Mrs. Casti]187-mrs. casti suffered from the want of companionship , and that [he]130-waymark had mentioned [Ida]101-ida 's name to [Julian]118-julian ; whence the discovery .

" Has [she]187-mrs. casti been told about [me]101-ida ? "[101-ida] asked [Ida]101-ida .

" Nothing was to be said till [I]130-waymark had spoken to [you]130-waymark . "[130-waymark]

[Waymark]130-waymark paused , but presently continued in a more serious tone . In recurring to that conversation with [Julian]118-julian , [[his]130-waymark friend]876-his friend 's trouble spoke strongly to [him]130-waymark once more , and overcame selfish thoughts .

" [I]130-waymark said that [I]130-waymark had come to know [you]130-waymark by chance , and that strange as it might sound [we]4217-we were simply [friends]562-friends . "[130-waymark] [He]130-waymark glanced for an instant at [Ida]101-ida ; [her]101-ida eyes were turned to the ground . " [You]130-waymark will believe [me]130-waymark , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark went on quickly , " when [I]130-waymark tell [you]130-waymark that [I]130-waymark really said nothing more ? "[130-waymark]

" [I]101-ida never doubt a word of yours , "[101-ida] was [Ida]101-ida 's quiet reply .

" [Casti]118-julian was overjoyed at the thought of finding [such a friend for [[his]118-julian wife]505-his wife]4219-such a friend for his wife . Of course [I]130-waymark told [him]118-julian that [he]118-julian must not certainly count either on [your]130-waymark consent or on [[his]118-julian wife]505-his wife 's . [Hers]505-his wife [I]130-waymark thought to be perhaps more doubtful than [yours]130-waymark . "[130-waymark]

" Could [I]101-ida really be of any use to [her]505-his wife , "[101-ida] asked [Ida]101-ida , after a silence , " with so little free time as [I]101-ida have ? "[101-ida]

" Supposing [she]505-his wife would welcome [you]130-waymark , [I]130-waymark really believe [you]130-waymark could be of great use . [She]505-his wife is [a strange creature]4222-a strange creature , miserably weak in body and mind . If [you]130-waymark could get to regard this as a sort of good work [you]130-waymark were called upon to undertake , [you]130-waymark would very likely be little less than an angel of mercy to [both of [them]1179-both of them]1179-both of them . [Casti]118-julian is falling into grievous unhappiness why , [you]130-waymark will understand sufficiently if [you]130-waymark come to know [them]1179-both of them . "[130-waymark]

" Do [you]130-waymark think [she]505-his wife bears malice against [me]101-ida ? "[101-ida]

" Of that [I]130-waymark know nothing . [Casti]118-julian said [she]505-his wife had never spoken of [you]130-waymark in that way . By - the - by , [she]505-his wife still has a scar on [her]505-his wife forehead , [I]130-waymark often wondered how it came there . "[130-waymark]

[Ida]101-ida winced .

" What a little termagant [you]101-ida must have been ! "[130-waymark] exclaimed [Waymark]130-waymark , laughing . " How hard it is to fancy [you]101-ida at that age , [Ida]101-ida . What was the quarrel all about ? "[130-waymark]

" [I]101-ida ca n't speak of it , "[101-ida] [she]101-ida replied , in a low , sad voice . " It is so long ago ; and [I]101-ida want to forget it . "[101-ida]

[Waymark]130-waymark kept silence .

" Do [you]130-waymark wish [me]101-ida to be [[her]505-his wife friend]669-her friend ? "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida asked , suddenly looking up .

" Certainly not if [you]130-waymark dislike the thought . "[130-waymark]

" No , no . But [you]130-waymark think it would be doing good ? [you]130-waymark would like [me]130-waymark to help [[your]130-waymark friend]3729-your friend if [I]130-waymark can ? "[130-waymark]

" Yes , [I]130-waymark should , "[130-waymark] was [Waymark]130-waymark 's reply .

" Then [I]130-waymark hope [she]3729-your friend will be willing to let [me]130-waymark go and see [her]3729-your friend . [I]130-waymark will do [my]130-waymark very best . Let [us]4226-us lose no time in trying . It is such a strange thing that [we]4226-us should meet again in this way ; perhaps it is something more than chance . "[130-waymark]

[Waymark]130-waymark smiled .

" [You]130-waymark think [I]1982-i am superstitious ? "[1982-i] [she]1982-i asked quickly . " [I]1982-i often feel so . [I]1982-i have all sorts of hopes and faiths that [you]130-waymark would laugh at . "[1982-i]

[Ida]101-ida 's thoughts were busy that night with the past and the future . The first mention of [Harriet]99-harriet 's name had given [her]101-ida a shock ; it brought back with vividness the saddest moments of [her]101-ida life ; it awoke a bitter resentment which mere memory had no longer kept the power to revive . That was only for a moment , however . The more [she]101-ida accustomed [herself]101-ida to the thought , the easier it seemed to be to bury the past in forgiveness . [Harriet]99-harriet must have changed so much since those days . Possibly there would never be a mention between [them]1983-them of the old trouble ; practically [they]1983-them would be [new acquaintances]1962-new acquaintances , and would be very little helped to an understanding of [each other]459-each other by the recollections of childhood . And then [Ida]101-ida felt there was so much to be glad of in the new prospects . [She]101-ida longed for [a world more substantial than that of [her]101-ida own imaginations]1986-a world more substantial than that of her own imaginations , and here , as [she]101-ida thought , it would be opened to [her]101-ida . Above all , by introducing [her]101-ida to [[his]1987-his friends]1209-his friends , [Waymark]130-waymark had strengthened the relations between [her]101-ida and [himself]130-waymark . [He]130-waymark was giving [her]101-ida , too , a chance of showing [herself]101-ida to [him]130-waymark in a new light . For the first time [he]130-waymark would see [her]101-ida under the ordinary conditions of [a woman]3216-a woman 's life in [a home circle [Ida]101-ida]1990-a home circle ida had passed from one extreme to the other . At present there was nothing [she]101-ida desired so much as the simple , conventional , every - day existence of [the woman who has never swerved from the beaten track]1991-the woman who has never swerved from the beaten track . [She]101-ida never saw [a family group]1992-a family group anywhere without envying the happiness which to [her]101-ida seemed involved in the mere fact of [a home]1484-a home and relations . [Her]101-ida isolation weighed heavily upon [her]101-ida . If there were but [some one who could claim [her]101-ida services , as of right , and in return render [her]101-ida the simple hum - drum affection which goes for so much in easing the burden of life]1994-some one who could claim her services , as of right , and in return render her the simple hum - drum affection which goes for so much in easing the burden of life . [She]101-ida was weary of [her]101-ida solitary heroism , though [she]101-ida never regarded it as heroism , but merely as the path in which [she]101-ida was naturally led by [her]101-ida feelings . [Waymark]130-waymark could not but still think of [her]101-ida very much in the old light , and [she]101-ida wished to prove to [him]130-waymark how completely [she]101-ida was changed . The simple act of making tea for [him]130-waymark when [he]130-waymark came to see [her]101-ida had been a pleasure ; it was domestic and womanly , and [she]101-ida had often glanced at [his]130-waymark face to see whether [he]130-waymark noticed it at all . Then the fact of [Harriet]99-harriet 's being [an invalid]1995-an invalid would give [her]101-ida many opportunities for showing that [she]101-ida could be gentle and patient and serviceable . [Casti]118-julian would observe these things , and doubtless would speak of them to [Waymark]130-waymark . Thinking in this way , [Ida]101-ida became all eagerness for the new friendship . There was of course the possibility that [Harriet]99-harriet would refuse to accept [her]101-ida offered kindness , but it seemed very unlikely , and the disappointment would be so great that [she]101-ida could not bear to dwell on the thought . [Waymark]130-waymark had promised to come as soon as [he]130-waymark had any news . The time would go very slowly till [she]101-ida saw [him]130-waymark .

[Waymark]130-waymark had met [Harriet]99-harriet very seldom of late . [Julian]118-julian spent regularly one evening a week with [him]130-waymark , but it was only occasionally that [Waymark]130-waymark paid a visit in turn . [He]130-waymark knew that [he]130-waymark was anything but welcome to [Mrs. Casti]187-mrs. casti , who of course had neither interest nor understanding for the conversation between [himself]130-waymark and [Julian]118-julian . Formerly [he]130-waymark had now and then tried [his]130-waymark best to find some common subject for talk with [her]101-ida , but the effort had been vain ; [she]101-ida was hopelessly stupid , and more often than not in a surly mood , which made [her]101-ida mere presence difficult to be endured . Of late , whenever [he]130-waymark came , [she]101-ida made [her]101-ida illness an excuse for remaining in [[her]101-ida bed - room]1502-her bed - room . And hence arose another trouble . [The two rooms]1997-the two rooms were only divided by folding doors , and when [Harriet]99-harriet got impatient with what [she]99-harriet conceived to be [the visitor]842-the visitor 's undue stay , [she]99-harriet would rap on the doors , to summon [Julian]118-julian to [her]99-harriet . This rapping would take place sometimes six or seven times in half an hour , till [Waymark]130-waymark hastened away in annoyance . And indeed there was little possibility of conversing in [[Julian]118-julian 's own room]1999-julian 's own room . [Julian]118-julian sat for ever in a state of nervous apprehension , dreading the summons which was sure to come before long . When [he]118-julian left [the room]255-the room for a moment , in obedience to it , [Waymark]130-waymark could hear [Harriet]99-harriet 's voice speaking in a peevish or ill - tempered tone , and [Julian]118-julian would return pale with agitation , unable to utter consecutive words . It was a little better when the meeting was at [[Waymark]130-waymark 's]1598-waymark 's , but even then [Julian]118-julian was anything but at [his]118-julian ease . [He]118-julian would often sit for a long time in gloomy silence , and seldom could even affect [his]118-julian old cheerfulness . The change which a year had made in [him]118-julian was painful . [His]118-julian face was growing haggard with ceaseless anxiety . The slightest unexpected noise made [him]118-julian start nervously . [His]118-julian old enthusiasms were dying away . [His]118-julian daily work was a burden which grew more and more oppressive . [He]118-julian always seemed weary , alike in body and mind .

[Harriet]99-harriet 's ailments were not of that unreal kind which [hysterical women]2002-hysterical women often affect , for the mere sake of demanding sympathy , though it was certain [she]99-harriet made the most of [them]2003-them . The scrofulous taint in [her]99-harriet constitution was declaring itself in many ways . The most serious symptoms took the form of convulsive fits . On [Julian]118-julian 's return [home]3157-home one evening , [he]118-julian had found [her]99-harriet stretched upon the floor , unconscious , foaming at the mouth , and struggling horribly . Since then , [he]118-julian had come back every night in agonies of miserable anticipation . [Her]99-harriet illness , and [his]118-julian own miseries , were of course much intensified by [her]99-harriet self - willed habits . When [she]99-harriet remained away from [home]3157-home till after midnight , [Julian]118-julian was always in fear lest some accident had happened to [her]99-harriet , and once or twice of late [she]99-harriet had declared whether truly or not it was impossible to say that [she]99-harriet had had fits in [the open street]2006-the open street . Weather made no difference to [her]99-harriet ; [she]99-harriet would leave [home]3157-home on the pretence of making necessary purchases , and would come back drenched with rain . [Protest]213-protest availed nothing , save to irritate [her]99-harriet . At times [her]99-harriet conduct was so utterly unreasonable that [Julian]118-julian looked at [her]99-harriet as if to see whether [she]99-harriet had lost [her]99-harriet senses . And all this [he]118-julian bore with a patience which few could have rivalled . Moments there were when [she]99-harriet softened , and , in a burst of hysterical weeping , begged [him]118-julian to forgive [her]99-harriet for some unusual violence , pleading [her]99-harriet illness as the cause ; and so sensible was [he]118-julian to compassion , that [he]118-julian always vowed in [his]118-julian mind to bear anything rather than deal harshly with [her]99-harriet . Love for [her]99-harriet , in the true sense , [he]118-julian had never felt , but [his]118-julian pity often led [him]118-julian to effusions of tenderness which love could scarcely have exceeded . [He]118-julian was giving up everything for [her]99-harriet . Through whole evenings [he]118-julian would sit by [her]99-harriet , as [she]99-harriet lay in pain , holding [her]99-harriet hands , and talking in a way which [he]118-julian thought would amuse or interest [her]99-harriet .

" [You]118-julian 're sorry [you]118-julian married [me]99-harriet , "[99-harriet] [she]99-harriet would often say at such times . " It 's no good saying no ; [I]99-harriet 'm sure [you]118-julian are . "[99-harriet]

That always made [Julian]118-julian think of [[her]99-harriet father]514-her father , and of [his]118-julian own promise always to be [a friend to [the poor , weak , ailing creature]2010-the poor , weak , ailing creature]2009-a friend to the poor , weak , ailing creature ; and [he]118-julian strengthened [himself]118-julian in [his]118-julian resolution to bear everything .

[Waymark]130-waymark decided that [he]130-waymark would venture on the step of going to see [Harriet]99-harriet during the daytime , whilst [Julian]118-julian was away , in order to speak of [Ida]101-ida . This [he]118-julian did on the Monday , and was lucky enough to find [her]99-harriet at [home]3157-home . [She]99-harriet was evidently surprised at [his]118-julian visit , and perhaps still more so at the kind and friendly way in which [he]118-julian began to speak to [her]99-harriet . In a few minutes [he]118-julian had worked round to [his]118-julian subject . [He]118-julian had , [he]118-julian said , [a friend]3409-a friend , [a young lady who was very lonely , and for whom [he]118-julian wanted to find [an agreeable companion]2014-an agreeable companion]2013-a young lady who was very lonely , and for whom he wanted to find an agreeable companion . It had occurred to [him]118-julian that perhaps [he]118-julian might ask to be allowed to introduce [her]99-harriet . [Waymark]130-waymark had concluded that this would probably be the best way of putting it ; [Harriet]99-harriet would perhaps be flattered by being asked to confer the favour of [her]99-harriet acquaintance . And indeed [she]99-harriet seemed so ; there was even something like a momentary touch of colour in [her]99-harriet pale cheek .

" Does [Julian]118-julian know [her]99-harriet ? "[99-harriet] [she]99-harriet asked , fixing [her]99-harriet eyes on [his]130-waymark with the closest scrutiny .

" No , [he]118-julian does not . "[99-harriet]

[He]118-julian would leave [her]99-harriet to what conclusion [she]99-harriet liked about [his]130-waymark relations to [Ida]101-ida ; in reality that mattered little .

" [She]99-harriet is [some one]3153-some one , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian went on , " for whom [I]118-julian have a great regard . As [I]118-julian say , [she]99-harriet has really [no friends]4228-no friends , and [she]99-harriet earns [her]99-harriet own living . [I]118-julian feel sure [you]99-harriet would find [her]99-harriet company pleasant ; [she]99-harriet is sensible and cheerful , and would be very grateful for any kindness [you]99-harriet showed [her]99-harriet . [Her]99-harriet name , by - the - by , is [Ida Starr]101-ida . "[118-julian]

" [Ida Starr]101-ida ? "[118-julian]

" Is the name familiar to [you]118-julian ? "[118-julian]

" [I]118-julian used to know [some one called that]4229-some one called that . "[118-julian]

" Indeed ? How strange it would be if [you]118-julian knew [her]99-harriet already . [I]118-julian have spoken to [her]99-harriet of [you]118-julian , but [she]99-harriet did n't tell [me]118-julian [she]99-harriet knew [your]118-julian name . "[118-julian]

" Oh no , [she]99-harriet would n't . It was years and years ago . [We]4230-we used to go to [school]306-school together if it 's the same . "[118-julian]

The way in which this was spoken was not very promising , but [Waymark]130-waymark would not be discouraged , having once brought [himself]130-waymark to the point of carrying the scheme through . [Harriet]99-harriet went on to ask many questions , all of which [he]130-waymark answered as satisfactorily as [he]130-waymark could , and in the end [she]99-harriet expressed [herself]99-harriet quite willing to renew [Ida]101-ida 's acquaintance . [Waymark]130-waymark had watched [her]99-harriet face as closely as [she]99-harriet did [his]130-waymark , and [he]130-waymark was able to read pretty accurately what was passing in [her]99-harriet mind . Curiosity , it was clear , was [her]99-harriet main incentive . Good will there was none ; its growth , if at all possible , would depend upon [Ida]101-ida [herself]101-ida . There was even something very like a gleam of hate in [her]99-harriet dark eyes when [Ida]101-ida 's name was first spoken .

" When may [I]130-waymark bring [her]101-ida ! "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark asked . " Perhaps [you]99-harriet would like to talk it over with [Julian]118-julian first ? [By - the - by]4232-by - the - by , perhaps [he]118-julian remembers [her]101-ida as [[your]99-harriet schoolfellow]4233-your schoolfellow ? "[130-waymark]

" [I]99-harriet do n't know , [I]99-harriet 'm sure , "[99-harriet] [she]99-harriet said , with a pretence of indifference . " [I]99-harriet do n't see what [he]118-julian can have to say against it . Bring [her]101-ida as soon as [you]99-harriet like . "[99-harriet]

" [She]101-ida is not free till seven at night . Perhaps [we]4234-we had better leave it till next Sunday ? "[130-waymark]

" Why ? Why could n't [she]101-ida come to - morrow night ? "[99-harriet]

" Do [you]118-julian remember [Ida Starr]101-ida ? "[99-harriet] was [Harriet]99-harriet 's first question to [[her]99-harriet husband]584-her husband when [he]584-her husband returned that evening .

" Certainly [I]118-julian do , "[118-julian] replied [Julian]118-julian , with complete self - control . " Why ? "[118-julian]

" Of course [I]99-harriet do . "[99-harriet]

An explanation followed .

" Has n't [he]584-her husband ever spoken to [you]584-her husband about [her]101-ida ? "[99-harriet] [Harriet]99-harriet asked .

UNDER - CURRENTS]214-chapter xxii under - currents

" Well , how do [you]99-harriet like [her]101-ida ? "[118-julian] [Julian]118-julian asked , when [[their]2016-their visitors]2017-their visitors had left [them]2016-their .

" Oh , [I]118-julian dare say [she]101-ida 's all right , "[118-julian] was the reply . " [She]101-ida 's got a good deal to say for [herself]101-ida . "[118-julian]

[Julian]118-julian turned away , and walked about [the room]255-the room .

" What does [she]101-ida work at ? "[99-harriet] said [Harriet]99-harriet , after glancing at [him]118-julian furtively once or twice .

" [I]118-julian have no idea . "[118-julian]

" It 's [my]118-julian belief [she]101-ida does n't work at all . "[118-julian]

" Why should [Waymark]130-waymark have said so , then ? "[118-julian] asked [Julian]118-julian , standing still and looking at [her]99-harriet . [He]118-julian spoke very quietly , but [his]118-julian face betrayed some annoyance .

[Harriet]99-harriet merely laughed , [her]99-harriet most ill - natured and maliciously suggestive laugh , and rose from [her]99-harriet seat . [Julian]118-julian came up and faced [her]99-harriet .

" [Harriet]99-harriet , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian said , with perfect gentleness , though [his]118-julian lips trembled , " why do [you]99-harriet always prefer to think the worst of [people]3402-people ? " [We]4241-we 're different in a good many things , [you]118-julian see , "[99-harriet] said [Harriet]99-harriet , with a sneer . [Her]99-harriet countenance had darkened . [Julian]118-julian had learnt the significance of [her]99-harriet looks and tones only too well . Under the circumstances it would have been better to keep silence , but something compelled [him]118-julian to speak .

" [I]118-julian am sure of this , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian said . " If [you]99-harriet will only meet [her]99-harriet in [her]99-harriet own spirit , [you]99-harriet will find [her]99-harriet [a valuable friend just such a friend as [you]99-harriet need]4242-a valuable friend just such a friend as you need . " [You]118-julian seemed to notice [her]99-harriet a good deal . "[118-julian]

[Julian]118-julian had never known the whole story of that scar on [[his]118-julian wife]505-his wife 's forehead .

" Never mind , "[99-harriet] said [Harriet]99-harriet , nodding significantly .

" [I]118-julian have no idea what [you]118-julian mean , "[118-julian] [Julian]118-julian returned . " At all events [I]118-julian can trust [Waymark]130-waymark , and [I]118-julian know very well [he]130-waymark would not have brought [her]99-harriet here , if [she]99-harriet had n't been a proper person for [you]99-harriet to know . But come , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian added quickly , making an effort to dismiss the disagreeable tone between [them]2020-them , " there 's surely no need for [us]2020-them to talk like this , [Harriet]99-harriet . [I]118-julian am sure [you]99-harriet will like [her]99-harriet , when [you]99-harriet know [her]99-harriet better . Promise [me]118-julian that [you]99-harriet will try , [dear]3177-dear . [You]99-harriet are so lonely , and it would rejoice [me]118-julian so to feel that [you]99-harriet had [a friend]3409-a friend to help [you]99-harriet and to be a comfort to [you]99-harriet . At all events [you]99-harriet will judge [her]99-harriet on [her]99-harriet own merits , wo n't [you]99-harriet , and put aside all kind of prejudice ? "[118-julian]

" [I]130-waymark have n't said [I]130-waymark should n't ; but [I]130-waymark suppose [I]130-waymark must get to know [her]99-harriet first ? "[130-waymark]

Ominous as such a commencement would have been under any other circumstances , [Julian]118-julian was so prepared for more decided hostility , that [he]118-julian was even hopeful . When [he]118-julian met [Waymark]130-waymark next , the change in [his]130-waymark manner was obvious ; [he]130-waymark was almost cheerful once more . And the improvement held its ground as the next two or three weeks went by . [Ida]101-ida came to [Beaufort Street]47-beaufort street often , and [Julian]118-julian was able to use the freedom [he]118-julian thus obtained to spend more time in [[Waymark]130-waymark 's society]2021-waymark 's society . [The latter]425-the latter noticed the change in [him]118-julian with surprise .

" Things go well still ? "[425-the latter] [he]425-the latter would ask , when [Julian]118-julian came in of an evening .

" Very well indeed . [Harriet]99-harriet has n't been out one night this week . "[425-the latter]

" And [you]118-julian think it will last ? "[425-the latter]

" [I]425-the latter have good hope . "[425-the latter]

[They]2023-they did not speak much of [Ida]101-ida , however . It was only when three weeks had gone by that [Julian]118-julian asked one night , with some hesitation in putting the question , whether [Waymark]130-waymark saw [her]101-ida often .

" Pretty often , "[425-the latter] was the reply . " [I]425-the latter am [[her]101-ida tutor]4252-her tutor , in a sort of way . [We]2023-they read together , and that kind of thing . "[425-the latter]

" At [[her]101-ida lodgings]4253-her lodgings ? "[425-the latter]

" Yes . Does it seem a queer arrangement ? "[425-the latter]

" [She]101-ida seems very intelligent , "[118-julian] said [Julian]118-julian , letting the question pass by , and speaking with some constraint . " Is n't it a pity that [she]101-ida ca n't find some employment better suited to [her]101-ida ? "[118-julian]

" [I]425-the latter do n't see what is open . Could [you]130-waymark suggest anything ? "[425-the latter]

[Julian]118-julian was silent .

" In any case , it wo n't last very long , [I]118-julian suppose ? "[118-julian] [he]118-julian said , looking up with a smile which was rather a trembling of the lip .

" Why ? "[118-julian]

[They]2023-they gazed at [each other]459-each other for a moment .

" No , "[130-waymark] said [Waymark]130-waymark , shaking [his]130-waymark head and smiling . " It is n't as [you]118-julian think . [I]130-waymark have no motive for leading [you]118-julian astray in the matter . However things were , [I]130-waymark would tell [you]118-julian frankly . "[130-waymark]

There was another silence .

" Do [you]118-julian think there is anything like confidence between [[your]118-julian wife]4128-your wife and [her]4128-your wife ? "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark asked .

" That [I]118-julian hardly know . When [I]118-julian am present , of course [they]2023-they only talk about [ordinary women]4256-ordinary women 's interests , household affairs , and so on . "[118-julian]

" Then [you]118-julian have no means of well , of knowing whether [she]4128-your wife has spoken about [me]118-julian to [[your]118-julian wife]4128-your wife in any particular way ? "[118-julian]

" Nothing of the kind has ever been hinted to [me]118-julian "[118-julian]

" In what respect . "[118-julian]

" Do [you]118-julian mean to tell [me]118-julian honestly that that [you]118-julian "[118-julian]
