" But this is a strange state of mind , "[118-julian] said [Julian]118-julian , with a forced laugh . " Is it possible to balance feelings in this way ? "[118-julian]

" [You]118-julian , in [my]130-waymark position , would have no doubt ? "[130-waymark]

" [I]118-julian do n't know [Miss Enderby]150-miss enderby , "[118-julian] said [Julian]118-julian , reddening .

[Waymark]130-waymark walked up and down [the room]255-the room , with [his]130-waymark hands behind [his]130-waymark back , [his]130-waymark brows bent . [He]130-waymark had never told [[his]130-waymark friend]876-his friend anything of [Ida]101-ida 's earlier history ; but now [he]130-waymark felt half - tempted to let [him]876-his friend know everything . To do so , might possibly give [him]130-waymark that additional motive to a clear and speedy decision in the difficulties which grew ever more pressing . Yet was it just to [Ida]101-ida to speak of these things even to [one who would certainly not repeat a word]2027-one who would certainly not repeat a word ? Once or twice [he]130-waymark all but began , yet in the end a variety of motives kept [him]130-waymark silent .

" Well , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark exclaimed shortly , " [we]4260-we 'll talk about this another time . Perhaps [I]130-waymark shall have more to tell [you]876-his friend . Do n't be gloomy . Look , here [I]130-waymark am just upon the end of [my]130-waymark novel . If all goes smoothly [I]130-waymark shall finish it in a fortnight , and then [I]130-waymark will read it to [you]876-his friend . "[130-waymark]

" [I]118-julian hope [you]876-his friend may have better luck with it than [I]118-julian had , "[118-julian] said [Julian]118-julian .

" Oh , [your]876-his friend time is yet to come . And it 's very likely [I]130-waymark shall be no better off . There are things in the book which will scarcely recommend it to [the British parent]4261-the british parent . But it shall be published , if it is at [my]130-waymark own expense . If it comes to the worst , [I]130-waymark shall sell [my]130-waymark mining shares to [Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock . "[130-waymark]

" After all , "[118-julian] said [Julian]118-julian , smiling , " [you]876-his friend are [a capitalist]4262-a capitalist . "[118-julian]

" Yes , and much good it does [me]130-waymark . "[130-waymark]

Since that first evening [Julian]118-julian had refrained from speaking to [[his]118-julian wife]505-his wife about [Ida]101-ida , beyond casual remarks and questions which could carry no significance . [Harriet]99-harriet likewise had been silent . As far as could be observed , however , [she]99-harriet seemed to take a pleasure in [Ida]101-ida 's society , and , as [Julian]118-julian said , with apparently good result to [herself]99-harriet . [She]99-harriet was more at [home]3157-home than formerly , and [her]99-harriet health even seemed to profit by the change . Still , there was something not altogether natural in all this , and [Julian]118-julian could scarcely bring [himself]118-julian to believe in the happy turn things seemed to be taking . In [Harriet]99-harriet [herself]99-harriet there was no corresponding growth of cheerfulness or good - nature . [She]99-harriet was quiet , but with a quietness not altogether pleasant ; it was as though [her]99-harriet thoughts were constantly occupied , as never hitherto ; and [her]99-harriet own moral condition was hardly likely to be the subject of these meditations . [Julian]118-julian , when [he]118-julian sat reading , sometimes became desperately aware of [her]99-harriet eyes being fixed on [him]118-julian for many minutes at a time . Once , on this happening , [he]118-julian looked up with a smile .

" What is it , [dear]3177-dear ? "[118-julian] [he]118-julian asked , turning round to [her]99-harriet . " [You]99-harriet are very quiet . Shall [I]118-julian put away the book and talk ? "[118-julian]

" No ; [I]99-harriet 'm all right . "[99-harriet]

" [You]99-harriet 've been much better lately , have n't [you]99-harriet ? "[118-julian] [he]118-julian said , taking [her]99-harriet hand playfully . " Let [me]118-julian feel [your]99-harriet pulse ; [you]99-harriet know [I]118-julian 'm half [a doctor]3151-a doctor . "[118-julian]

[She]99-harriet drew it away peevishly . But [Julian]118-julian , whom a peaceful hour had made full of kindness , went on in the same gentle way .

" [You]99-harriet do n't know how happy it makes [me]118-julian to see [you]99-harriet and [Ida]101-ida such [good friends]3431-good friends . [I]118-julian was sure it would be so . Do n't [you]99-harriet feel there is something soothing in [her]99-harriet society ? [She]99-harriet speaks so gently , and always brings a sort of sunshine with [her]99-harriet . "[118-julian]

[Harriet]99-harriet 's lips curled , very slightly , but [she]99-harriet said nothing .

" When are [you]118-julian going to see [her]99-harriet again ? It 's hardly fair to let [the visiting]4266-the visiting be always on [her]99-harriet side , is it ? "[99-harriet]

" [I]118-julian shall go when [I]118-julian feel able . Perhaps to - morrow . "[118-julian]

[Julian]118-julian presently went back to [his]118-julian book again . If [he]118-julian could have seen the look [Harriet]99-harriet turned upon [him]118-julian when [his]118-julian face was averted , [he]118-julian would not have read so calmly .

That same evening [Harriet]99-harriet [herself]99-harriet was the subject of a short conversation between [Ida]101-ida and [Waymark]130-waymark , as [they]2030-they sat together in the usual way .

" [I]101-ida fear there will never be anything like confidence between [us]2030-they , "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida was saying . " Do [you]4267-you know that [I]101-ida am sometimes almost afraid of [her]99-harriet ; sometimes [she]99-harriet looks and speaks as if [she]99-harriet hated [me]101-ida . "[101-ida]

" [She]99-harriet is a poor , ill - conditioned creature , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark re plied , rather contemptuously .

" Can [you]4267-you explain , "[101-ida] asked [Ida]101-ida , " how it was that [Mr. Casti]116-mr. casti married [her]99-harriet ? "[101-ida]

" For [my]101-ida life , [I]101-ida ca n't ! [I]101-ida half believe it was out of mere pity ; [I]101-ida should n't wonder if the proposal came from [her]99-harriet side . [Casti]116-mr. casti might once have done something ; but [I]101-ida 'm afraid [he]116-mr. casti never will now . "[101-ida]

" And [he]116-mr. casti is so very good to [her]99-harriet . [I]101-ida pity [him]116-mr. casti from [my]101-ida heart whenever [I]101-ida see [them]4268-them together . Often [I]101-ida have been so discouraged by [her]99-harriet cold suspicious ways , that [I]101-ida half - thought [I]101-ida should have to give it up , but [I]101-ida felt it would be cruel to desert [him]116-mr. casti so . [I]101-ida met [him]116-mr. casti in [the street]340-the street the other night just as [I]101-ida was going to [her]99-harriet , and [he]116-mr. casti thanked [me]101-ida for what [I]101-ida was doing in a way that almost made [me]101-ida cry . "[101-ida]

" By - the - by , "[130-waymark] said [Waymark]130-waymark , " [you]130-waymark know [her]99-harriet too well to venture upon anything like direct criticism of [her]99-harriet behaviour , when [you]130-waymark talk together ! "[130-waymark]

" Indeed , [I]101-ida scarcely venture to speak of [herself]99-harriet at all . It would be hard to say what [we]4270-we talk about . "[101-ida]

" Of course , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark said , after a short silence , " there are limits to self - devotion . So long as it seems to [you]130-waymark that there is any chance of doing some good , well , persevere . But [you]130-waymark must n't be sacrificed to such a situation . The time [you]130-waymark give [her]99-harriet is so much absolute loss to [yourself]130-waymark . "[130-waymark]

" Oh , but [I]101-ida work hard to make up for it . [You]101-ida are not dissatisfied with [me]101-ida ? "[101-ida]

" And what if [I]130-waymark were ? Would it matter much ? "[130-waymark]

This was one of the things that [Waymark]130-waymark was ever and again saying , in spite of [himself]130-waymark . [He]130-waymark could not resist the temptation of proving [his]130-waymark power in this way ; it is so sweet to be assured of love , even though every voice within cries out against the temptation to enjoy it , and condemns every word or act that could encourage it to hope . [Ida]101-ida generally met such remarks with silence ; but in this instance [she]101-ida looked up steadily , and said

" Yes , it would matter much . "[101-ida] [Waymark]130-waymark drew in [his]130-waymark breath , half turned away and spoke of some quite different matter .

[Harriet]99-harriet carried out [her]99-harriet intention of visiting [Ida]101-ida on the following day . In these three weeks [she]99-harriet had only been to [[Ida]101-ida 's lodgings]1764-ida 's lodgings once . The present visit was unexpected . [She]99-harriet waited about the pavement for [Ida]101-ida 's return from work , and shortly saw [her]99-harriet approaching .

" This is kind of [you]99-harriet , "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida said . " [We]4271-we 'll have some tea , and then , if [you]99-harriet 're not too tired , [we]4271-we might go into [the park]600-the park . It will be cool then . "[101-ida]

[She]101-ida dreaded the thought of sitting alone with [Harriet]99-harriet . But [the latter]425-the latter said [she]101-ida must get [home]3157-home early , and would only have time to sit for half an hour . When [Ida]101-ida had lit [her]101-ida fire , and put the kettle on , [she]101-ida found that the milk which [she]101-ida had kept since the morning for [Grim]169-grim and [herself]101-ida had gone sour ; so [she]101-ida had to run out to [a dairy]2034-a dairy to fetch some .

" [You]99-harriet wo n't mind being left alone for a minute ? "[101-ida] [she]101-ida said .

" Oh , no ; [I]101-ida 'll amuse [myself]101-ida with [Grim]169-grim . "[101-ida]

As soon as [she]101-ida was alone , [Harriet]99-harriet went into [the bed - room]1943-the bed - room , and began to examine everything . [Grim]169-grim had followed [her]101-ida , and came up to rub affectionately against [her]101-ida feet , but [she]101-ida kicked [him]169-grim , muttering , " Get off ; [you]169-grim black beast ! "[101-ida] Having scrutinised the articles which lay about , [she]101-ida quickly searched the pockets of a dress which hung on the door , but found nothing except a handkerchief . All the time [she]101-ida listened for any footfall on the stone steps without . Next [she]101-ida went to the chest of drawers , and was pleased to find that they were unlocked . In the first [she]101-ida drew out there were some books and papers . These [she]101-ida rummaged through very quickly , and at length , underneath them , came upon a little bundle of pawn - tickets . On finding these , [she]101-ida laughed to [herself]101-ida , and carefully inspected every one of them . " Gold chain , "[101-ida] [she]101-ida muttered ; " bracelet ; seal - skin ; what was [she]101-ida doing with all those things , [I]101-ida wonder ? Ho , ho , [Miss Starr]189-miss starr ? "[101-ida]

[She]101-ida started ; there was a step on the stairs . In a second everything was replaced , and [she]101-ida was back in [the sitting - room]290-the sitting - room , stooping over [Grim]169-grim , who took [her]101-ida endearments with passive indignation .

" Have [I]101-ida been long ? "[101-ida] panted [Ida]101-ida , as [she]101-ida came in . " The kettle wo n't be a minute . [You]99-harriet 'll take [your]99-harriet things off ? "[101-ida]

[Harriet]99-harriet removed [her]99-harriet hat only . As [Ida]101-ida went about , preparing the tea , [Harriet]99-harriet watched [her]101-ida with eyes in which there was a new light . [She]101-ida spoke , too , in almost a cheerful way , and even showed a better appetite than usual when [they]2037-they sat down together .

" [You]101-ida are better to - day ? "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida said to [her]101-ida .

" Perhaps so ; but it does n't last long . "[101-ida]

" Oh , [you]101-ida must be more hopeful . Try not to look so much on the dark side of things . How would [you]101-ida be , "[101-ida] [she]101-ida added , with a good - humoured laugh , " if [you]101-ida had to work all day , like [me]101-ida ? [I]101-ida 'm sure [you]101-ida 've a great deal to make [you]101-ida feel happy and thankful . "[101-ida]

" [I]99-harriet do n't know what , "[99-harriet] returned [Harriet]99-harriet coldly .

" But [[your]101-ida husband]4273-your husband , [[your]101-ida home]4274-your home , [your]101-ida long , free days ? "[101-ida]

[The other]449-the other laughed peevishly . [Ida]101-ida turned [her]101-ida head away for a moment ; [she]101-ida was irritated by this wretched humour , and , as had often been the case of late , found it difficult to restrain some rather trenchant remark .

" It may sound strange , "[101-ida] [she]101-ida said , with a smile , " but [I]101-ida think [I]101-ida should be very willing to endure bad health for a position something like [yours]449-the other . "[101-ida]

[Harriet]99-harriet laughed again , and still more unpleasantly .

Later in the evening [Harriet]99-harriet went to call upon [[her]99-harriet friend]669-her friend [Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl . Something of an amusing kind seemed to be going forward in front of [the house]288-the house . On drawing near and pressing into [the crowd of loitering people]2041-the crowd of loitering people , [she]99-harriet beheld a spectacle familiar to [her]99-harriet , and one which brought a smile to [her]99-harriet face . [A man of wretched appearance , in vile semblance of clothing which barely clung together about [him]2042-a man of wretched appearance , in vile semblance of clothing which barely clung together about him]2042-a man of wretched appearance , in vile semblance of clothing which barely clung together about him , was standing on [his]2042-a man of wretched appearance , in vile semblance of clothing which barely clung together about him head upon [the pavement]1274-the pavement , and , in that attitude , drawling out what was meant for a song , while [those around made merry]2044-those around made merry and indulged in practical jokes at [his]2042-a man of wretched appearance , in vile semblance of clothing which barely clung together about him expense . One such put a sudden end to the exhibition . [A young ragamuffin]2045-a young ragamuffin drew near with a handful of rich mud , and carefully cast it right into [the singer]687-the singer 's inverted mouth . [The man]491-the man was on [his]491-the man feet in an instant , and pursuing [the assailant]2048-the assailant , who , however , succeeded in escaping down [an alley hard by]2049-an alley hard by . Returning , [the man]491-the man went from one to another in the crowd , holding out [his]491-the man hand . [Harriet]99-harriet passed on into [the bar]2051-the bar .

" [Slimy]156-slimy 's up to [his]156-slimy larks to - night , "[153-mrs. sprowl] exclaimed [Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl , with a laugh , as [she]153-mrs. sprowl welcomed [[her]153-mrs. sprowl visitor]797-her visitor in [the bar - parlour]2053-the bar - parlour . " [He]156-slimy 'll be losin ' [his]156-slimy sweet temper just now , see if [he]156-slimy do n't , an ' then one o ' [them]4275-them chaps 'll get a bash [i]153-mrs. sprowl ' the eye . "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" [I]99-harriet always like to see [him]156-slimy singing on [his]156-slimy head , "[99-harriet] said [Harriet]99-harriet , who seemed at once thoroughly at [her]99-harriet ease in the atmosphere of beer and pipes .

" It 's funny , ai n't it ? And ' ow 's [the world]622-the world been a - usin ' [you]99-harriet , [Harriet]99-harriet ? Seen anything more o ' [that affectionate friend o ' yourn]4277-that affectionate friend o ' yourn ? "[153-mrs. sprowl]

This was said with a grin , and a significant wink .

" Have [you]99-harriet found out anything about [her]4277-that affectionate friend o ' yourn ? "[99-harriet] asked [Harriet]99-harriet eagerly .

" Why yes , [I]153-mrs. sprowl have ; somethin' as 'll amuse [you]99-harriet . It 's just as [I]153-mrs. sprowl thought . "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" How do [you]99-harriet mean ? "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" Why , [Bella]215-bella , was in ' ere th ' other night , so [I]153-mrs. sprowl says to [her]215-bella , ' [Bella]215-bella , ' [I]153-mrs. sprowl says , ' did n't [you]215-bella never hear of [a girl called [Ida Starr]101-ida]4278-a girl called ida starr ? ' [I]153-mrs. sprowl says . ' Course [I]153-mrs. sprowl did , ' [she]215-bella says . ' One o ' the ' [igh]4279-igh an ' ' aughty lot , an ' [she]4277-that affectionate friend o ' yourn lived by [herself]4277-that affectionate friend o ' yourn somewhere in [the Strand]50-the strand . ' So it 's just as [I]153-mrs. sprowl told [you]215-bella . "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" But what is [she]4277-that affectionate friend o ' yourn doing now ? "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" [You]153-mrs. sprowl say [she]4277-that affectionate friend o ' yourn 's turned modest . "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" [I]99-harriet ca n't make [her]4277-that affectionate friend o ' yourn out quite , "[99-harriet] said [Harriet]99-harriet , reflecting , with [her]99-harriet head on one side . " [I]99-harriet 've been at [[her]4277-that affectionate friend o ' yourn lodgings]4253-her lodgings tonight , and , whilst [she]4277-that affectionate friend o ' yourn was out of [the room]255-the room , [I]99-harriet happened to get sight of a lot of pawn - tickets , for gold chains and sealskins , and [I]99-harriet do n't know what . "[99-harriet]

" Spouted 'em all when [she]4277-that affectionate friend o ' yourn threw up the job , [I]153-mrs. sprowl s'pose , "[153-mrs. sprowl] suggested [Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl . " [You]153-mrs. sprowl 're sure [she]4277-that affectionate friend o ' yourn does go to work ? "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" Yes , [I]99-harriet 've had [somebody]324-somebody to follow [her]4277-that affectionate friend o ' yourn and watch [her]4277-that affectionate friend o ' yourn . There 's [Waymark]130-waymark goes to see [her]4277-that affectionate friend o ' yourn often , and [I]99-harriet should n't wonder if [she]4277-that affectionate friend o ' yourn half keeps [him]130-waymark ; [he]130-waymark 's just that kind of fellow . "[99-harriet]

" [You]153-mrs. sprowl have n't caught [no one else]4236-no one else going [there]3249-there ? "[153-mrs. sprowl] asked [Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl , with another of [her]153-mrs. sprowl intense winks .

" No , [I]99-harriet have n't , not yet , "[99-harriet] replied [Harriet]99-harriet , with sudden vehemence , " but [I]99-harriet believe [he]130-waymark does go [there]3249-there , or else sees [her]4277-that affectionate friend o ' yourn somewhere else . "[99-harriet]

" Well , "[386-the landlady] said [the landlady]386-the landlady , with an air of generous wisdom , " [I]386-the landlady told [you]99-harriet from the first as [I]386-the landlady ' adn't much opinion of [men]3195-men as is so anxious to have [[their]3195-men wives]4287-their wives friendly with [other women]4288-other women . There 's always something at the bottom of it , [you]99-harriet may bet . It 's [my]386-the landlady belief [he]130-waymark 's one too many for [you]99-harriet , [Harriet]99-harriet ; [you]99-harriet 're too simple - minded to catch [him]130-waymark . "[386-the landlady]

" [I]316-the girl 'll have a good try , though , "[316-the girl] cried [the girl]316-the girl , deadly pale with passion . " Perhaps [I]316-the girl 'm not so simple as [you]99-harriet think . [I]316-the girl 'm pretty quick in tumbling to things no fear . If [they]4289-they think [I]316-the girl do n't notice what goes on , [they]4289-they must take [me]316-the girl for [a damned silly fool]4290-a damned silly fool , that 's all ! Why , [I]316-the girl 've seen [them]4289-they wink at [each other]459-each other , when [they]4289-they thought [I]316-the girl was n't looking . "[316-the girl]

" [You]99-harriet 're not such a fool as to leave [them]4289-they alone together ? "[448-the woman] said [the woman]448-the woman , who seemed to have a pleasure in working upon [Harriet]99-harriet 's jealousy .

" No fear ! But [they]4289-they understand [each other]459-each other ; [I]448-the woman can see that well enough . And [he]4293-he writes to [her]448-the woman ; [I]448-the woman 'm dead sure [he]4293-he writes to [her]448-the woman . Let [me]448-the woman get hold of a letter just once , that 's all ! "[448-the woman]

" And [he]4293-he 's orful good - natured to [her]448-the woman , ai n't [he]4293-he ? Looks after [her]448-the woman when [she]448-the woman has tea with [you]99-harriet , and so on ? "[448-the woman]

" [I]448-the woman should think [he]4293-he did . It 's all ' Wo n't [Miss Starr]189-miss starr have this ? ' and ' Wo n't [Miss Starr]189-miss starr have that ? ' [He]4293-he scarcely takes [his]4293-he eyes off of [her]448-the woman , all the time . "[448-the woman]

" [I]448-the woman know , [I]448-the woman know ; it 's allus the same ! [You]2057-you keep [your]2057-you eyes open , [Harriet]99-harriet , and [you]2057-you 'll ' ave [your]2057-you reward , as [the Scriptures]4294-the scriptures says . "[448-the woman]

When [she]2057-you reached [home]3157-home , [Julian]118-julian was in the uneasy condition always brought about by these late absences . To a remark [he]118-julian made about the time , [she]2057-you vouchsafed no answer .

" Have [you]2057-you been with [Ida]101-ida all the evening ? "[118-julian] [he]118-julian asked .

" No , [I]2057-you have n't , "[2057-you] was [her]2057-you reply .

[She]2057-you went into [the bed - room]1943-the bed - room , and was absent for a few minutes , then reappeared .

" Do [you]118-julian know where [my]2057-you silver spoon is ? "[2057-you] [she]2057-you asked , looking closely at [him]118-julian .

" [Your]2057-you silver spoon ? "[118-julian] [he]118-julian returned , in surprise . " Have [you]2057-you lost it ? "[118-julian]

The article in question , together with a fork , hod been a wedding - present from [Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl , whose character had in it a sort of vulgar generosity , displayed at times in gifts to [Harriet]99-harriet .

" [I]99-harriet ca n't find it , "[99-harriet] [Harriet]99-harriet said . " [I]99-harriet was showing it to [Ida Starr]101-ida when [she]101-ida was here on Sunday , and now [I]99-harriet come to look for it , it 's gone . "[99-harriet]

" Oh , it ca n't be very far off , "[118-julian] said [Julian]118-julian . " [You]99-harriet 'll find it if [you]99-harriet look . "[118-julian]

" But [I]99-harriet tell [you]99-harriet [I]99-harriet 've looked everywhere . It 's gone , that 's all [I]99-harriet know . "[99-harriet]

" Well , but what do [you]2057-you mean ? How can it have gone ? "[118-julian]

" [I]99-harriet do n't know . [I]99-harriet only know [I]99-harriet was showing [it]101-ida [her]101-ida on Sunday . "[99-harriet]

" And what connection is there between the two things ? "[118-julian] asked [Julian]118-julian , almost sternly . " [You]2057-you do n't wish [me]118-julian to understand that [Ida Starr]101-ida knows anything about the spoon ? "[118-julian]

" How can [I]99-harriet tell ? It 's gone . "[99-harriet]

" Come , "[118-julian] exclaimed [Julian]118-julian , with a laugh , " this is too absurd , [Harriet]99-harriet ! [You]99-harriet must have taken leave of [your]99-harriet senses . If it 's gone , then [some one in [the house]288-the house]4295-some one in the house has taken it . "[118-julian]

" And why not [Ida Starr]101-ida ? "[99-harriet]

[Julian]118-julian stared at [her]2060-her with mingled anger and alarm .

" Why not ? Simply because [she]101-ida is incapable of such a thing . "[99-harriet]

" Perhaps [you]2057-you think so , no doubt . [You]2057-you think a good deal of [her]101-ida , it seems to [me]99-harriet . Perhaps [you]2057-you do n't know quite as much about [her]101-ida as [I]99-harriet do . "[99-harriet]

" [I]118-julian fancy [I]118-julian know much more , "[118-julian] exclaimed [Julian]118-julian indignantly .

" Oh , do [you]2057-you ? "[99-harriet]

" If [you]2057-you think [her]101-ida capable of stealing [your]2057-you spoon , [you]2057-you show complete ignorance of [her]101-ida character . What do [you]2057-you know of [her]101-ida that [you]2057-you should have such suspicions ? "[99-harriet]

" Never mind , "[99-harriet] said [Harriet]99-harriet , nodding [her]99-harriet head obstinately .

There was again a long silence . [Julian]118-julian reflected .

" [We]4297-we will talk about this again to - morrow , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian said , " when [you]2057-you have had time to think . [You]2057-you are under some strange delusion . After all , [I]118-julian expect [you]2057-you will find the spoon , and then [you]2057-you 'll be sorry for having been so hasty . "[118-julian]

[Harriet]99-harriet became obstinately silent . [She]99-harriet cut a piece of bread and butter , and took it into [the other room]2061-the other room . [Julian]118-julian paced up and down .

CHAPTER XXIII

THE OPPORTUNITY

One or two days after this , [Ida Starr]101-ida came [home]3157-home from work with a heavy heart . Quite without notice , and without explanation , [[her]101-ida employer]2063-her employer had paid [her]101-ida a week 's wages and dismissed [her]101-ida . [Her]101-ida first astonished questions having been met with silence by [the honest but hard - grained woman who kept the laundry]2064-the honest but hard - grained woman who kept the laundry , [Ida]101-ida had not condescended to any further appeal . The fact was that [the laundress]2065-the laundress had received a visit from [a certain [Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl , who , under pretence of making inquiries for the protection of [a young female friend]2066-a young female friend]153-mrs. sprowl , revealed the damaging points of [Ida]101-ida 's story , and gained the end plotted with [Harriet Casti]216-harriet .

Several circumstances united to make this event disastrous to [Ida]101-ida . [Her]101-ida wages were very little more than [she]101-ida needed for [her]101-ida week to week existence , yet [she]101-ida had managed to save a shilling or two now and then . The greater part of these small savings [she]101-ida had just laid out in some new clothing , the reason for the expense being not so much necessity , as a desire to be rather better dressed when [she]101-ida accompanied [Waymark]130-waymark on those little country excursions which had reestablished [themselves]2067-themselves of late . By no means the smallest part of [Ida]101-ida 's heroism was that involved in this matter of external appearance . [A beautiful woman]2068-a beautiful woman can never be indifferent to the way in which [her]2068-a beautiful woman beauty is arrayed . That [Waymark]130-waymark was not indifferent to such things [she]101-ida knew well , and often [she]101-ida suffered from the thought that one strong means of attraction was lost to [her]101-ida . If at one moment [Ida]101-ida was conscious of [her]101-ida claim to inspire a noble enthusiasm , at another [she]101-ida fell into the saddest self - distrust , and , in [her]101-ida hunger for love , would gladly have sought every humblest aid of grace and adornment . So [she]101-ida had yielded to the needs of [her]101-ida heart , and only this morning was gladdened by the charm of some new clothing which became [her]101-ida well , and which [Waymark]130-waymark would see in a day or two . It lay there before [her]101-ida now that [she]101-ida returned [home]3157-home , and , in the first onset of trouble , [she]101-ida sat down and cried over it .

[She]101-ida suffered the more , too , that there had been something of a falling off of late in the good health [she]101-ida generally enjoyed . The day 's work seemed long and hard ; [she]101-ida felt an unwonted need of rest . And these things caused trouble of the mind . With scarcely an hour of depression [she]101-ida had worked on through those months of solitude , supported by the sense that every day brought an accession of the strength of purity , that the dark time was left one more stage behind , and that trust in [herself]101-ida was growing assured .

But it was harder than [she]101-ida had foreseen , to maintain reserve and reticence when [her]101-ida heart was throbbing with passion ; the effect upon [her]101-ida of [Waymark]130-waymark 's comparative coldness was so much harder to bear than [she]101-ida had imagined . [Her]101-ida mind tortured itself incessantly with the fear that some new love had taken possession of [him]130-waymark . And now there had befallen [her]101-ida this new misfortune , which , it might be , would once more bring about a crisis in [her]101-ida life .

Of course [she]101-ida must forthwith set about finding new work . It would be difficult , seeing that [she]101-ida had now no reference to give . [Reflection]217-reflection had convinced [her]101-ida that it must have been some discovery of [her]101-ida former life which had led to [her]101-ida sudden dismissal , and this increased [her]101-ida despondency . Yet [she]101-ida would not give way to it . On the following morning [she]101-ida began [her]101-ida search for employment , and day after day faced without result the hateful ordeal . Hope failed as [she]101-ida saw [her]101-ida painfully - eked - out coins become fewer and fewer . In a day or two [she]101-ida would have nothing , and what would happen then ?

When [she]101-ida returned to [London]3-london to begin a new life , now nearly a year ago , [she]101-ida had sold some and pawned the rest of such possessions as would in future be useful to [her]101-ida . Part of the money thus obtained had bought the furniture of [[her]101-ida rooms]2070-her rooms ; what remained had gone for a few months to supplement [her]101-ida weekly wages , thus making the winter less a time of hardship than it must otherwise have been . One or two articles yet remained capable of being turned into small sums , and these [she]101-ida now disposed of at [a neighbouring pawnbroker]2071-a neighbouring pawnbroker 's the same [she]101-ida had previously visited on the occasion of pawning one or two of the things , the tickets for which [Harriet Casti]216-harriet had so carefully inspected . [She]101-ida spoke to [no one of [her]101-ida position]2072-no one of her position . Yet now the time was quickly coming when [she]101-ida must either have help from [some quarter]2073-some quarter or else give up [[her]101-ida lodgings]4253-her lodgings . In food [she]101-ida was already stinting [herself]101-ida to the verge of starvation . And through all this [she]101-ida had to meet [[her]101-ida friends]520-her friends as hitherto , if possible without allowing any trace of [her]101-ida suffering to become visible . [Harriet]216-harriet , strange to say , had been of late [a rather frequent visitor]2076-a rather frequent visitor , and was more pressing than formerly in [her]216-harriet invitations . [Ida]101-ida dreaded [her]216-harriet coming , as it involved the unwarrantable expense of obtaining luxuries now unknown in [her]216-harriet cupboard , such as tea and butter . And , on the other hand , it was almost impossible to affect cheerfulness in the company of [the Castis]209-the castis . At times [she]101-ida caught [Julian]118-julian 's eyes fixed upon [her]101-ida , and felt that [he]118-julian noticed some change in [her]101-ida appearance . [She]101-ida had a sense of guilt in [their]2077-their presence , as if [she]101-ida were there on false pretences . For , together with [her]101-ida daily work , much of [her]101-ida confidence had gone ; an inexplicable shame constantly troubled [her]101-ida . [She]101-ida longed to hide [herself]101-ida away , and be alone with [her]101-ida wretchedness .

If it came to asking for help , of whom could [she]101-ida ask it but of [Waymark]130-waymark ? Yet for some time [she]101-ida felt [she]101-ida could not bring [herself]101-ida to that . In the consciousness of [her]101-ida own attitude towards [him]130-waymark , it seemed to [her]101-ida that [Waymark]130-waymark might well doubt the genuineness of [her]101-ida need , might think it a mere feint to draw [him]130-waymark into nearer relations . [She]101-ida could not doubt that [he]130-waymark knew [her]101-ida love for [him]130-waymark ; [she]101-ida did not desire to hide it , even had [she]101-ida been able . But [him]130-waymark [she]101-ida could not understand . A struggle often seemed going on within [him]130-waymark in [her]101-ida presence ; [he]130-waymark appeared to repress [his]130-waymark impulses ; [he]130-waymark was afraid of [her]101-ida . At times passion urged [her]101-ida to break through this barrier between [them]2078-them , to bring about a situation which would end in clear mutual understanding , cost [her]101-ida what it might . At other times [she]101-ida was driven to despair by the thought that [she]101-ida had made [herself]101-ida too cheap in [his]130-waymark eyes . Could [she]101-ida put off the last vestige of [her]101-ida independence , and , in so many words , ask [him]130-waymark to give [her]101-ida money ?

This evening [she]101-ida expected [Waymark]130-waymark , but the usual time of [his]130-waymark coming went by . [She]101-ida sat in the twilight , listening with painful intentness to every step on the stairs ; again and again [her]101-ida heart leaped at some footfall far below , only to be deceived . [She]101-ida had not even now made up [her]101-ida mind how to speak to [him]130-waymark , or whether to speak to [him]130-waymark at all ; but [she]101-ida longed passionately to see [him]130-waymark . The alternations of hope and disappointment made [her]101-ida feverish . [Illusions]218-illusions began to possess [her]101-ida . Once [she]101-ida heard distinctly the familiar knock . It seemed to rouse [her]101-ida from slumber : [she]101-ida sprang to the door and opened it , but [no one]3702-no one was there . [She]101-ida ran half way down [the stairs]742-the stairs , but saw [no one]3702-no one . It was now nearly midnight . The movement had dispelled for a little the lethargy which was growing upon [her]101-ida , and [she]101-ida suddenly came to a resolution . Taking a sheet of note - paper , [she]101-ida wrote this :

" [I]101-ida have been without work for a fortnight . All [my]101-ida money is done , and [I]101-ida am in want . Can [you]130-waymark send [me]101-ida some , for present help , till [I]101-ida get more work ? Do not bring it [yourself]130-waymark , and do not speak a word of this when [you]130-waymark see [me]101-ida , [I]101-ida beg [you]130-waymark earnestly . If [I]101-ida shall fail to get work , [I]101-ida will speak to [you]130-waymark of [my]101-ida own accord .[101-ida]

[I.]101-ida S. "[101-ida]

[She]101-ida went out and posted this , though [she]101-ida had no stamp to put on the envelope ; then , returning , [she]101-ida threw [herself]101-ida as [she]101-ida was on to the bed , and before long passed into unconsciousness .

[Waymark]130-waymark 's absence that evening had been voluntary . [His]130-waymark work had come to a standstill ; [his]130-waymark waking hours were passed in a restless misery which threatened to make [him]130-waymark ill . And to - night [he]130-waymark had not dared to go to [Ida]101-ida ; in [his]130-waymark present state the visit could have but one result , and even yet [he]130-waymark hoped that such a result might not come about . [He]130-waymark left [home]3157-home and wandered about [the streets]3169-the streets till early morning . All manner of projects occupied [him]130-waymark . [He]130-waymark all but made up [his]130-waymark mind to write a long letter to [Ida]101-ida and explain [his]130-waymark position without reserve . But [he]130-waymark feared lest the result of that might be to make [Ida]101-ida hide away from [him]130-waymark once more , and to this loss [he]130-waymark could not reconcile [himself]130-waymark . Yet [he]130-waymark was further than ever from the thought of giving [himself]130-waymark wholly to [her]101-ida , for the intenser [his]130-waymark feeling grew , the more clearly [he]130-waymark recognised its character . This was not love [he]130-waymark suffered from , but mere desire . To let it have its way would be to degrade [Ida]101-ida . Love might or might not follow , and how could [he]130-waymark place [her]101-ida at the mercy of such a chance as that ? [Her]101-ida faith and trust in [him]130-waymark were absolute ; could [he]130-waymark take advantage of it for [his]130-waymark own ends ? And , for all these fine arguments , [Waymark]130-waymark saw with perfect clearness how the matter would end . [Self]219-self would triumph , and [Ida]101-ida , if the fates so willed it , would be sacrificed . It was detestable , but a fact ; as good already as an accomplished fact .

And on the following morning [Ida]101-ida 's note reached [him]130-waymark . It was final . [Her]101-ida entreaty that [he]130-waymark would merely send money had no weight with [him]130-waymark for a moment ; [he]130-waymark felt that there was a contradiction between [her]101-ida words and [her]101-ida wishes . This note explained the strangeness [he]130-waymark had noticed in [her]101-ida on [their]2084-their last evening together . [He]130-waymark pitied [her]101-ida , and , as is so often the case , pity was but fuel to passion . [He]130-waymark swept from [his]130-waymark mind all obstinate debatings . Passion should be a law unto itself . Let the future bring things about as it would .

[He]130-waymark had risen late , and by the time [he]130-waymark had finished a hasty breakfast it was eleven o'clock . Half an hour after [he]130-waymark went up [the stairs of [the lodging - house]2086-the lodging - house]2085-the stairs of the lodging - house and knocked at the familiar door .

But [his]130-waymark knock met with no answer . [Ida]101-ida [herself]101-ida had left [home]3157-home an hour before . Upon waking , and recalling what [she]101-ida had done , [she]101-ida foresaw that [Waymark]130-waymark would [himself]130-waymark come , in spite of [her]101-ida request . [She]101-ida could not face [him]130-waymark . For all that [her]101-ida exhaustion was so great that walking was slow and weary , [she]101-ida went out and strayed at first with no aim ; but presently [she]101-ida took the direction of [Chelsea]48-chelsea , and so came to [Beaufort Street]47-beaufort street . [She]101-ida would go in and see [Harriet]216-harriet , who would give [her]101-ida something to eat . [She]101-ida cared little now for letting it be known that [she]101-ida had left [her]101-ida employment ; with the step which [she]101-ida had at last taken , [her]101-ida position was quite changed ; [she]101-ida had only kept silence lest [Waymark]130-waymark should come to know . [Harriet]216-harriet was at first surprised to see [her]101-ida then seemed glad .

" [I]216-harriet 've only a minute ago sent a note , asking [you]101-ida to be sure to come round to - night . [I]216-harriet wanted [you]101-ida to help [me]216-harriet with this new hat ; [you]101-ida have such good taste in trimming . "[216-harriet]

[Ida]101-ida would have been astonished at another time ; for [Harriet]216-harriet to be paying compliments was indeed something novel . There was a flush on [the latter]425-the latter 's usually sallow face ; [she]101-ida did not sit down , and kept moving aimlessly about .

" Give [me]101-ida [your]101-ida hat and jacket , "[101-ida] [she]101-ida said , " and let [me]101-ida take them into [the other room]2061-the other room . "[101-ida]

[She]101-ida took them away , and returned . [Ida]101-ida was not looking at [her]101-ida ; otherwise [she]101-ida must surely have noticed that weird pallor which had all at once succeeded to the unhealthy flush , and the unwonted gleaming of [her]101-ida eyes . Of what passed during those next two hours [Ida]101-ida had afterwards no recollection . [They]2089-they ate together , and [they]2089-they talked , [Ida]101-ida as if in a dream , [Harriet]216-harriet preoccupied in a way quite out of [her]101-ida habit . [Ida]101-ida explained that [she]101-ida was out of employment , news which could scarcely be news to [the listener , who would in that case have heard it with far less composure]2090-the listener , who would in that case have heard it with far less composure . There were long silences , generally brought to an end by some outburst of forced merriment from [Harriet]216-harriet . [Ida]101-ida was without consciousness of time , but [her]101-ida restless imagination at length compelled [her]101-ida to go forth again . [Harriet]216-harriet did not urge [her]101-ida to stay , but rose and watched [her]101-ida as [she]101-ida went into [the other room]2061-the other room to put [her]101-ida things on . In a few moments [they]2089-they had parted .

The instant [Harriet]216-harriet , from the head of the stairs , heard the front - door close , [she]216-harriet ran back into [[her]216-harriet bed - room]1502-her bed - room , put on [her]216-harriet hat , and darted down . Opening the door , [she]216-harriet saw [Ida]101-ida moving away at a short distance . Turning [her]216-harriet eyes in the opposite direction , [she]216-harriet perceived [a policeman]1119-a policeman coming slowly down [the street]340-the street . [She]216-harriet ran towards [him]1119-a policeman .

" [I]216-harriet 've caught [her]101-ida at last , "[216-harriet] [she]216-harriet exclaimed , as [she]216-harriet met [him]1119-a policeman , pointing eagerly after [Ida]101-ida . " [She]101-ida 's taken a brooch of [mine]1119-a policeman . [I]216-harriet put it in a particular place in [[my]216-harriet bed - room]4299-my bed - room , and it 's gone . "[216-harriet]

" Was [she]101-ida alone in [the room]255-the room ? "[2095-the constable] inquired [the constable]2095-the constable , looking keenly at [Harriet]216-harriet , then down [the street]340-the street .

" Yes , [she]101-ida went in alone to put [her]101-ida things on . Be quick , or [she]101-ida 'll be off ! "[2095-the constable]

" [I]216-harriet understand [you]2095-the constable give [her]101-ida in charge ? "[216-harriet]

" Of course [I]2095-the constable do . "[2095-the constable]

A brisk walk of two or three minutes , and [they]2097-they had caught up [Ida , who turned at the sound of the quick footsteps]2098-ida , who turned at the sound of the quick footsteps , and stood in surprise .

" [This lady]4301-this lady charges [you]101-ida with stealing some articles of [hers]4301-this lady , "[2095-the constable] said [the constable]2095-the constable , looking from face to face . " [You]101-ida must come with [me]2095-the constable to [the station]4086-the station . "[2095-the constable]

[Ida]101-ida blanched . When [the policeman]2100-the policeman had spoken , [she]101-ida turned to [Harriet]216-harriet , and gazed at [her]216-harriet fixedly . [She]101-ida could neither speak nor move . [The constable]2095-the constable touched [her]101-ida arm impatiently . [Her]101-ida eyes turned to [him]2095-the constable , and [she]101-ida began to walk along by [his]2095-the constable side .

[Harriet]216-harriet followed in silence . There were [not many people on the way to [the police - station]2103-the police - station in [King 's Road]76-king 's road]2102-not many people on the way to the police - station in king 's road , and [they]2104-they reached [it]2103-the police - station speedily . [They]2104-they came before [the inspector]2105-the inspector , and [the constable]2095-the constable made [his]2095-the constable report .

" Have [you]101-ida got this brooch ? "[2105-the inspector] asked [the inspector]2105-the inspector , looking at [Ida]101-ida .

[Ida]101-ida put [her]101-ida hand into one of [her]101-ida jacket - pockets , then into the other , and from the second brought out the object in question . It was of gold , and had been given by [Julian]118-julian to [[his]118-julian wife]505-his wife just after [their]2109-their marriage . As [she]101-ida laid it before [her]101-ida on the desk , [she]101-ida seemed about to speak , but [her]101-ida breath failed , and [she]101-ida clutched with [her]101-ida hands at the nearest support .

" Look out , "[2105-the inspector] exclaimed [the inspector]2105-the inspector . " Do n't let [her]101-ida fall . "[2105-the inspector]

Five or six times , throughout the day and evening , [Waymark]130-waymark had knocked at [Ida]101-ida 's door . About seven o'clock [he]130-waymark had called at [the Castis]2111-the castis ' , but found neither of [them]2109-their at [home]3157-home . Returning thence to [Fulham]72-fulham , [he]130-waymark had walked for hours up and down , in vain expectation of [Ida]101-ida 's coming . There was no light at [her]101-ida window .

Just before midnight [he]130-waymark reached [home]3157-home , having on [his]130-waymark way posted a letter with money in it . As [he]130-waymark reached [his]130-waymark door , [Julian]118-julian stood there , about to knock .

" Anything amiss ? "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark asked , examining [[his]130-waymark friend]876-his friend by the light of the street - lamp .

[Julian]118-julian only made a sign to [him]130-waymark to open the door . [They]2109-their went [upstairs]434-upstairs together , and [Waymark]130-waymark speedily obtained a light . [Julian]118-julian had seated [himself]118-julian on the couch . [His]118-julian face was ghastly .

" What 's the matter ? "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark asked anxiously . " Do [you]118-julian know anything about [Ida]101-ida ? "[130-waymark]

" [She]101-ida 's locked up in [the police cells]4303-the police cells , "[130-waymark] was the reply . " [[My]130-waymark wife]3713-my wife has accused [her]101-ida of stealing things from [[our]2109-their rooms]4305-our rooms . "[130-waymark]

[Waymark]130-waymark stared at [him]118-julian .

" [Cacti]220-cacti , what 's the matter with [you]220-cacti ? "[118-julian] [he]118-julian exclaimed , overcome with fear , in spite of [his]118-julian strong self - command . " Are [you]220-cacti ill ? Do [you]220-cacti know what [you]220-cacti 're saying ? "[118-julian]

[Julian]118-julian rose and made an effort to control [himself]118-julian .

" [I]130-waymark know what [I]130-waymark 'm saying , [Waymark]130-waymark [I]130-waymark 've only just heard it . [She]101-ida has come back [home]3157-home from somewhere only just now [she]101-ida seems to have been drinking . It happened in the middle of the day , whilst [I]130-waymark was at [the hospital]3287-the hospital . [She]101-ida gave [her]101-ida in charge to [a policeman in [the street]340-the street]4308-a policeman in the street , and a brooch was found on [her]101-ida . "[130-waymark]

" A brooch found on [her]101-ida ? [[Your]130-waymark wife]4128-your wife 's ? "[118-julian]

" Yes . When [she]101-ida came in , [she]101-ida railed at [me]130-waymark like a fury , and charged [me]130-waymark with the most monstrous things . [I]130-waymark ca n't and wo n't go back [there]3249-there to - night ! [I]130-waymark shall go mad if [I]130-waymark hear [her]101-ida voice . [I]130-waymark will walk about [the streets]3169-the streets till morning . "[130-waymark]

" And [you]130-waymark tell [me]118-julian that [Ida Starr]101-ida is in [custody]4313-custody ? "[118-julian]

" [She]101-ida is . [[My]130-waymark wife]3713-my wife accuses [her]101-ida of stealing several things . "[130-waymark]

" And [you]130-waymark believe this ? "[130-waymark] asked [Waymark]130-waymark , under [his]130-waymark voice , whilst [his]130-waymark thoughts pictured [Ida]101-ida 's poverty , of which [he]130-waymark had known nothing , and led [him]130-waymark through a long train of miserable sequences .

" [I]2116-i do n't know . [I]2116-i ca n't say . [She]101-ida says that [Ida]101-ida confessed , and , gave the brooch up at once . But [her]101-ida devilish malice is equal to anything . [I]2116-i see into [her]101-ida character as [I]2116-i never did before . [Good God]123-god , if [you]4315-you could have seen [her]101-ida face as [she]101-ida told [me]2116-i ! And [Ida]101-ida , [Ida]101-ida ! [I]2116-i am afraid of [myself]2116-i , [Waymark]130-waymark . If [I]2116-i had stayed to listen another moment , [I]2116-i should have struck [her]101-ida . It seemed as if every vein was bursting . How am [I]2116-i ever to live with [her]101-ida again ? [I]2116-i dare not ! [I]2116-i should kill [her]101-ida in some moment of madness ! What will happen to [Ida]101-ida ? "[2116-i]

[He]2116-i flung [himself]2116-i upon the couch , and burst into tears . Sobs convulsed [him]2116-i ; [he]2116-i writhed in an anguish of conflicting passions . [Waymark]130-waymark seemed scarcely to observe [him]2116-i , standing absorbed in speculation and the devising of a course to be pursued .

" [I]130-waymark must go to [the police - station]2103-the police - station , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark said at length , when the violence of the paroxysm had passed and left [Julian]118-julian in the still exhaustion of despair . " [You]118-julian , [I]130-waymark think , had better stay [here]3335-here . Is there any danger of [her]101-ida coming to seek [you]118-julian ? "[130-waymark]

[Julian]118-julian made a motion with [his]118-julian hand , otherwise lay still , [his]118-julian pale face turned upwards .

" [I]130-waymark shall be back very quickly , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark added , taking [his]130-waymark hat . Then , turning back for a moment , " [You]118-julian must n't give way like this , [old fellow]4318-old fellow ; this is horrible weakness . Dare [I]130-waymark leave [you]118-julian alone ? "[130-waymark]

[Julian]118-julian stretched out [his]118-julian hand , and [Waymark]130-waymark pressed it .

CHAPTER XXIV

JUSTICE

[Waymark]130-waymark received from [the police]2117-the police a confirmation of all that [Julian]118-julian had said , and returned [home]3157-home . [Julian]118-julian still lay on the couch , calmer , but like one in despair . [He]118-julian begged [Waymark]130-waymark to let [him]118-julian remain where [he]118-julian was through the night , declaring that in any case sleep was impossible for [him]118-julian , and that perhaps [he]118-julian might try to pass the hours in reading . [They]2119-they talked together for a time ; then [Waymark]130-waymark lay down on the bed and shortly slept .

[He]130-waymark was to be at [the police court]3579-the police court in the morning . [Julian]118-julian would go to [the hospital]3287-the hospital as usual .

" Shall [you]118-julian call at [home]3157-home on [your]118-julian way ? "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark asked [him]118-julian .

" No . "[130-waymark]

" But what do [you]118-julian mean to do ? "[130-waymark]

" [I]130-waymark must think during the day . [I]130-waymark shall come to - night , and [you]118-julian will tell [me]130-waymark what has happened . "[130-waymark]

So [they]2119-they parted , and [Waymark]130-waymark somehow or other whiled away the time till it was the hour for going to [the court]1401-the court . [He]130-waymark found it difficult to realise the situation ; so startling and brought about so suddenly . [Julian]118-julian had been the first to put into words the suspicion of [them]2119-they both , that it was all a deliberate plot of [Harriet]216-harriet 's ; but [he]118-julian had not been able to speak of [his]118-julian own position freely enough to let [Waymark]130-waymark understand the train of circumstances which could lead [Harriet]216-harriet to such resoluteness of infamy . [Waymark]130-waymark doubted . But for the unfortunate fact of [Ida]101-ida 's secret necessities , [he]130-waymark could perhaps scarcely have entertained the thought of [her]101-ida guilt . What was the explanation of [her]101-ida being without employment ? Why had [she]101-ida hesitated to tell [him]130-waymark , as soon as [she]101-ida lost [her]101-ida work ? Was there not some mystery at the bottom of this , arguing a lack of complete frankness on [Ida]101-ida 's part from the first ?

The actual pain caused by [Ida]101-ida 's danger was , strange to say , a far less important item in [his]130-waymark state of mind than the interest which the situation inspired . Through the night [he]130-waymark had thought more of [Julian]118-julian than of [Ida]101-ida . What [he]130-waymark had for some time suspected had now found confirmation ; [Julian]118-julian was in love with [Ida]101-ida , in love for the first time , and under circumstances which , as [Julian]118-julian [himself]118-julian had said , might well suffice to change [his]118-julian whole nature . [Waymark]130-waymark had never beheld such terrible suffering as that depicted on [[his]130-waymark friend]876-his friend 's face during those hours of talk in the night . Something of jealousy had been aroused in [him]130-waymark by the spectacle ; not jealousy of the ordinary gross kind , but rather a sense of humiliation in the thought that [he]130-waymark [himself]130-waymark had never experienced , was perhaps incapable of , such passion as racked [Julian]118-julian in every nerve . This was the passion which [Ida]101-ida was worthy of inspiring , and [Waymark]130-waymark contrasted it with [his]130-waymark own feelings on the previous day , and now since the calamity had fallen . [He]130-waymark had to confess that there was even an element of relief in the sensations the event had caused in [him]130-waymark . [He]130-waymark had been saved from [himself]130-waymark ; a position of affairs which had become intolerable was got rid of without [his]130-waymark own exertion . Whatever might now happen , the old state of things would never be restored . There was relief and pleasure in the thought of such a change , were it only for the sake of the opening up of new vistas of observation and experience . Such thoughts as these indicated very strongly the course which [Waymark]130-waymark 's development was taking , and [he]130-waymark profited by them to obtain a clearer understanding of [himself]130-waymark .

The proceedings in [the court]1401-the court that morning were brief . [Waymark]130-waymark , from [his]130-waymark seat on the public benches , saw [Ida]101-ida brought forward , and heard [her]101-ida remanded for a week . [She]101-ida did not see [him]130-waymark ; seemed , indeed , to see nothing . The aspect of [her]101-ida standing there in [the dock]2125-the dock , [her]101-ida head bowed under intolerable shame , made a tumult within [him]130-waymark . Blind anger and scorn against all who surrounded [her]101-ida were [his]130-waymark first emotions ; there was something of martyrdom in [her]101-ida position ; [she]101-ida , essentially so good and noble , to be dragged [here]3335-here before [these narrow - natured slaves of [an ignoble social order]2128-an ignoble social order]2127-these narrow - natured slaves of an ignoble social order , in all probability to be condemned to miserable torment by [men who had no shadow of understanding of [her]101-ida character and [her]101-ida circumstances]2129-men who had no shadow of understanding of her character and her circumstances .

[Waymark]130-waymark was able , whilst in [court]2130-court , to make up [his]130-waymark mind as to how [he]130-waymark should act . When [he]130-waymark left [he]130-waymark took [his]130-waymark way northwards , having in view [St. John Street Road]7-st. john street road , and [[Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock 's house]2131-mr. woodstock 's house .

When [he]130-waymark had waited about half an hour , [the old man]1383-the old man appeared . [He]130-waymark gave [his]130-waymark hand in silence . Something seemed to be preoccupying [him]130-waymark ; [he]130-waymark went to [his]130-waymark chair in a mechanical way .

" [I]130-waymark have come on rather serious business , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark began . " [I]130-waymark want to ask [your]115-abraham advice in a very disagreeable matter a criminal case , in fact . "[130-waymark]

[Abraham]115-abraham did not at once pay attention , but the last words presently had their effect , and [he]130-waymark looked up with some surprise .

" What have [you]130-waymark been up to ? "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark asked , with rather a grim smile , leaning back and thrusting [his]130-waymark hands in [his]130-waymark pockets in the usual way .

" It only concerns [myself]130-waymark indirectly . It 's all about [a girl]469-a girl , who is charged with a theft [she]469-a girl is perhaps quite innocent of . If so , [she]469-a girl is being made [the victim of a conspiracy , or something of the kind]4321-the victim of a conspiracy , or something of the kind . [She]469-a girl was remanded to - day at [Westminster]34-westminster for a week . "[130-waymark]

" [A girl]469-a girl , eh ? And what 's [your]130-waymark interest in the business ? "[114-mr. woodstock]

" Well , if [you]115-abraham do n't mind [I]130-waymark shall have to go a little into detail . [You]115-abraham are at liberty ? "[130-waymark]

" Go on . "[114-mr. woodstock]

" [She]469-a girl is [a friend of [mine]130-waymark]4323-a friend of mine . No , [I]130-waymark mean what [I]130-waymark say ; there is absolutely nothing else between [us]4324-us , and never has been . [I]130-waymark should like to know whether [you]115-abraham are satisfied to believe that ; much depends on it . "[130-waymark]

" Age and appearance ? "[114-mr. woodstock]

" About twenty not quite so much and strikingly handsome . "[130-waymark]

" H'm . Position in life ? "[114-mr. woodstock]

" A year ago was on [the streets]3169-the streets , to put it plainly ; since then has been getting [her]469-a girl living at laundry - work . "[130-waymark]

" H'm . Name ? "[114-mr. woodstock]

" [Ida Starr]101-ida . "[130-waymark]

[Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock had been gazing at the toes of [his]114-mr. woodstock boots , still the same smile on [his]114-mr. woodstock face . When [he]114-mr. woodstock heard the name [he]114-mr. woodstock ceased to smile , but did not move at all . Nor did [he]114-mr. woodstock look up as [he]114-mr. woodstock asked the next question .

" Is that [her]469-a girl real name ? "[114-mr. woodstock]

" [I]114-mr. woodstock believe so . "[114-mr. woodstock]

[The old man]1383-the old man drew up [his]1383-the old man feet , threw one leg over the other , and began to tap upon [his]1383-the old man knee with the fingers of one hand . [He]1383-the old man was silent for a minute at least .

" What do [you]130-waymark know about [her]469-a girl ? "[1383-the old man] [he]1383-the old man then inquired , looking steadily at [Waymark]130-waymark , with a gravity which surprised [the latter]425-the latter . " [I]1383-the old man mean , of [her]469-a girl earlier life . Do [you]130-waymark know who [she]469-a girl is at all ? "[1383-the old man]

" [She]469-a girl has told [me]1383-the old man [her]469-a girl whole story a rather uncommon one , full of good situations . "[1383-the old man]

" What do [you]130-waymark mean ? "[1383-the old man]

The words were uttered with such harsh impatience that [Waymark]130-waymark started .

" What annoys [you]130-waymark ? "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark asked , with surprise .

" Tell [me]449-the other something of the story , "[449-the other] said [the other]449-the other , regaining [his]449-the other composure , and apparently wishing to affect indifference . " [I]449-the other have a twinge of that damned rheumatism every now and then , and it makes [me]449-the other rather crusty . Do [you]130-waymark think [her]469-a girl story is to be depended upon ? "[449-the other]

" Yes , [I]1383-the old man believe it is . "[1383-the old man]

And [Waymark]130-waymark linked briefly the chief points of [Ida]101-ida 's history , as [he]130-waymark knew it , [the old man]1383-the old man continually interrupting [him]130-waymark with questions .

" Now go on , "[115-abraham] said [Abraham]115-abraham , when [he]1383-the old man had heard all that [Waymark]130-waymark knew , " and explain the scrape [she]469-a girl 's got into . "[115-abraham]

[Waymark]130-waymark did so .

" And [you]130-waymark mean to tell [me]115-abraham , "[115-abraham] [Abraham]115-abraham said , before the story was quite finished , " that there 's been nothing more between [you]130-waymark than that ? "[115-abraham]

" Absolutely nothing . "[115-abraham]

" [I]115-abraham do n't believe [you]1383-the old man . "[115-abraham]

It was said angrily , and with a blow of the clenched fist on the table . [The old man]1383-the old man could no longer conceal the emotion that possessed [him]1383-the old man . [Waymark]130-waymark looked at [him]1383-the old man in astonishment , unable to comprehend [his]1383-the old man behaviour .

" Well if [you]1383-the old man do n't believe [me]130-waymark , of course [I]130-waymark can offer no proof ; and [I]130-waymark know well enough that every presumption is against [me]130-waymark . Still , [I]130-waymark tell [you]1383-the old man the plain fact ; and what reason have [I]130-waymark for hiding the truth ? " What help can [I]115-abraham give ? "[115-abraham] asked [Woodstock]115-abraham , again cooling down , though [his]1383-the old man eyes had in them a most unwonted light . [He]1383-the old man spoke as if simply asking for information .

" [I]1383-the old man thought [you]1383-the old man might suggest something as to modes of defence , and the like . The expenses [I]1383-the old man would somehow or other meet [myself]1383-the old man . It appears that [she]316-the girl will plead not guilty . "[1383-the old man]

[Waymark]130-waymark was silent , looking at [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock , and reflecting .

" What are [your]1383-the old man intentions with regard to [the girl]316-the girl ? " [I]114-mr. woodstock have no intentions . "[114-mr. woodstock]

" [I]114-mr. woodstock 've never heard anything of this . "[114-mr. woodstock]

" [I]114-mr. woodstock could scarcely talk of a matter so uncertain . "[114-mr. woodstock]

There was silence . A sort of agitation came upon [the old man]1383-the old man ever and again , in talking . [He]1383-the old man now grew absorbed in thought , and remained thus for several minutes , [Waymark]130-waymark looking at [him]1383-the old man the while . [Waymark]130-waymark went straight to [Fulham]72-fulham . Reaching [the block of tenements which had been [Ida]101-ida 's [home]3157-home]2141-the block of tenements which had been ida 's home , [he]130-waymark sought out [the porter]2143-the porter . When the door opened at [his]130-waymark knock , the first face that greeted [him]130-waymark was that of [Grim]169-grim , who had pushed between [the man]491-the man 's legs and was peering up , as if in search of some familiar aspect .

From [the porter]2143-the porter [he]130-waymark learned that [the police]2117-the police had made that afternoon an inspection of [[Ida]101-ida 's rooms]2147-ida 's rooms , though with what result was not known . [The couple]2148-the couple had clearly formed [their]2148-the couple own opinion as to [Waymark]130-waymark 's interest in [the accused girl]2149-the accused girl , but took the position in a very matter - of - fact way , and were eager to hear more than [they]2148-the couple succeeded in getting out of [the police]2117-the police .

" [My]130-waymark main object in coming , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark explained , " was to look after [her]101-ida cat . [I]130-waymark see [you]448-the woman have been good enough to anticipate [me]130-waymark . "[130-waymark]

" [The poor thing]4329-the poor thing takes on sadly , "[448-the woman] said [the woman]448-the woman . " Of course [I]448-the woman should n't have known nothing if [the hofficers]4330-the hofficers had n't come , and it ' ud just have starved to death . " And [you]130-waymark would promise [me]130-waymark to be kind to it ? [I]130-waymark do n't mind the expense ; keep it well , and let [me]130-waymark know what [you]130-waymark spend . And of course [I]130-waymark should consider [your]130-waymark trouble . "[130-waymark]

So that matter was satisfactorily arranged , and [Waymark]130-waymark went [home]3157-home .

[Julian]118-julian spent [his]118-julian day at [the hospital]3287-the hospital as usual , finding relief in fixing [his]118-julian attention upon outward things . It was only when [he]118-julian left [his]118-julian work in the evening that [he]118-julian became aware how exhausted [he]118-julian was in mind and body . And the dread which [he]118-julian had hitherto kept off came back upon [him]118-julian , the dread of seeing [[his]118-julian wife]505-his wife 's face and hearing [her]505-his wife voice . When [he]118-julian parted with [Waymark]130-waymark in the morning , [he]118-julian had thought that [he]118-julian would be able to come to some resolution during the day as to [his]118-julian behaviour with regard to [her]505-his wife . But no such decision had been formed , and [his]118-julian overtaxed mind could do no more than dwell with dull persistency on a long prospect of wretchedness . Fear and hatred moved [him]118-julian in turns , and the fear was as much of [himself]118-julian as of the object of [his]118-julian hate .

As [he]118-julian approached the door , [a man]1260-a man came out whom [he]118-julian did not know , but whose business [he]118-julian suspected . [He]118-julian had little doubt that it was [a police officer in plain clothes]2156-a police officer in plain clothes . [He]118-julian had to stand a moment and rest , before [he]118-julian could use [his]118-julian latchkey to admit [himself]118-julian . When [he]118-julian entered [the sitting - room]290-the sitting - room , [he]118-julian found the table spread as usual . [Harriet]216-harriet was sitting with sewing upon [her]216-harriet lap . [She]216-harriet did not look at [him]118-julian .

[He]118-julian sat down , and closed [his]118-julian eyes . There seemed to be a ringing of great bells about [him]118-julian , overpowering every other sound ; all [his]118-julian muscles had become relaxed and powerless ; [he]118-julian half forgot where and under what circumstances [he]118-julian was , in a kind of deadly drowsiness . Presently this passed , and [he]118-julian grew aware that [Harriet]216-harriet was preparing tea . When it was ready , [he]118-julian went to the table , and drank two or three cups , for [he]118-julian was parched with thirst . [He]118-julian could not look at [Harriet]216-harriet , but [he]118-julian understood the mood [she]216-harriet was in , and knew [she]216-harriet would not be the first to speak . [He]118-julian rose , walked about for a few minutes , then stood still before [her]216-harriet .

" What proof have [you]216-harriet to offer , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian said , speaking in a slow but indistinct tone , " that [she]216-harriet is guilty of this , and that it is n't a plot [you]216-harriet have laid against [her]216-harriet ? "[118-julian]

" [You]118-julian can believe what [you]118-julian like , "[216-harriet] [she]216-harriet replied sullenly . " Of course [I]216-harriet know [you]216-harriet 'll do [your]216-harriet worst against [me]216-harriet . "[216-harriet]

" [I]118-julian wish [you]216-harriet to answer [my]118-julian question . "[118-julian]

" What proof have [you]118-julian that [she]216-harriet took those other things ? "[118-julian]

" Quite enough , [I]216-harriet think . At all events , [they]4335-they 've found a pawn - ticket for the spoon at [[her]216-harriet lodgings]4253-her lodgings , among a whole lot of other tickets for things [she]216-harriet ca n't have come by honestly . "[216-harriet]

[Julian]118-julian became silent , and , as [Harriet]216-harriet looked up at [him]118-julian with eyes full of triumphant spite , [he]118-julian turned pale . [He]118-julian could have crushed the hateful face beneath [his]118-julian feet .

[Waymark]130-waymark could not but observe peculiarities in [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock 's behaviour during the conversation about [Ida]101-ida . " [You]130-waymark have been kind . [I]114-mr. woodstock thank [you]130-waymark for everything . Try to think kindly of [me]114-mr. woodstock , whatever happens ; [I]114-mr. woodstock shall be conscious of it , and it will give [me]114-mr. woodstock strength .[114-mr. woodstock]

The week went by , and [Ida]101-ida again appeared in [court]2130-court . [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock went with [Waymark]130-waymark , out of curiosity , [he]114-mr. woodstock said . What [Harriet]216-harriet had said about the discovery of the pawn - ticket for [her]216-harriet silver spoon was true . [Ida]101-ida 's face was calm , but paler yet and thinner . When [she]101-ida caught sight of [Harriet Casti]216-harriet , [she]101-ida turned [her]101-ida eyes away quickly , and with a look of trouble . [She]101-ida desired to ask no question , simply gave [her]101-ida low and distinct " Not guilty . "[101-ida] [She]101-ida was committed for trial .

[Waymark]130-waymark watched [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock , who was examining [Ida]101-ida all the time ; [he]130-waymark felt sure that [he]130-waymark heard something like a catching of the breath when [the girl]316-the girl 's face first became visible .

[Julian Casti]118-julian was ill . With difficulty [he]118-julian had dragged [himself]118-julian to [the court]1401-the court , and [his]118-julian sufferings as [he]118-julian sat there were horribly evident on [his]118-julian white face . [Waymark]130-waymark met [him]118-julian just as [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock walked off ; and [the two]273-the two went [home]3157-home together by omnibus , not speaking on the way .

" [She]876-his friend will be convicted , "[118-julian] was [Julian]118-julian 's first utterance , when [he]118-julian had sat for a few minutes in [[Waymark]130-waymark 's room]2178-waymark 's room , whilst [Waymark]130-waymark [himself]130-waymark paced up and down . [The latter]425-the latter turned , and saw that tears were on [[his]130-waymark friend]876-his friend 's hollow cheeks .

" Did [you]876-his friend sleep better last night ? "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark asked .

" Good God , no ! [I]425-the latter never closed [my]425-the latter eyes . That 's the third night without rest . " What will [[your]130-waymark wife]4128-your wife say ? "[425-the latter]

" What do [I]118-julian care what [she]4128-your wife says ! " Do n't use that word ' [wife]3838-wife , ' it is profanation ; [I]118-julian ca n't bear it ! [He]118-julian sank beck in exhaustion .

" [Julian]118-julian , "[130-waymark] said [Waymark]130-waymark , using [[his]130-waymark friend]876-his friend 's first name by exception , " if this goes on , [you]118-julian will be ill . What the deuce shall [we]4362-we do then ? "[130-waymark]

" No , [I]118-julian shall not be ill . It will be all right if [I]118-julian can get sleep . "[118-julian]

[He]118-julian was silent for a little , then spoke , with [his]118-julian eyes on the ground .

" [Waymark]130-waymark , is this true [they]4363-they say about [her]4128-your wife about the former time ? "[118-julian]

" Yes ; it is true . "[130-waymark]

[Waymark]130-waymark in turn was silent .

" [I]118-julian suppose , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian continued presently , " [I]118-julian owe [you]130-waymark an apology . "[118-julian]

" None . It was right of [you]130-waymark to act as [you]130-waymark did . "[118-julian]

[He]118-julian was going to say something else , but checked [himself]118-julian . [Waymark]130-waymark noticed this , watched [his]118-julian face for a moment , and spoke with some earnestness .

" But it was in that only [I]130-waymark misled [you]118-julian . Do [you]118-julian believe [me]130-waymark when [I]130-waymark repeat that [she]4128-your wife and [I]130-waymark were never anything but [friends]562-friends ! "[130-waymark]

[Julian]118-julian looked up with a gleam of gratitude in [his]118-julian eyes .

" Yes , [I]118-julian believe [you]130-waymark ! "[118-julian]

" And be sure of this , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark went on , " whether or not this accusation is true , it does not in the least affect the nobility of [her]4128-your wife character . [You]130-waymark and [I]130-waymark are sufficiently honest , in the true sense of the word , to understand this . "[130-waymark]

[Waymark]130-waymark only saw [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock once or twice in the next fortnight , and very slight mention was made between [them]2182-them of the coming trial . [He]130-waymark [himself]130-waymark was not to be involved in the case in any way ; as [a witness on [Ida]101-ida 's side]2183-a witness on ida 's side [he]130-waymark could do no good , and probably would prejudice [her]101-ida yet more in the eyes of [the jury]2184-the jury . It troubled [him]130-waymark a little to find with what complete calmness [he]130-waymark could await the result ; often [he]130-waymark said to [himself]130-waymark that [he]130-waymark must be sadly lacking in human sympathy . [Julian Casti]118-julian , on the other hand , had passed into a state of miserable deadness ; [Waymark]130-waymark in vain tried to excite hope in [him]118-julian . [He]130-waymark came to [[his]130-waymark friend]876-his friend 's every evening , and sat there for hours in dark reverie .

" What will become of [her]101-ida ! "[118-julian] [Julian]118-julian asked once . " In either case what will become of [her]101-ida ! "[118-julian]

" [Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock shall help [us]4365-us in that , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark replied . " [She]101-ida must get a place of some kind . "[130-waymark]

" How dreadfully [she]101-ida is suffering , and how dark life will be before [her]101-ida ! "[118-julian]

And so the day of the trial came . [The pawnbroker]2186-the pawnbroker 's evidence was damaging . The silver spoon had been pledged , [he]2186-the pawnbroker asserted , at the same time with another article for which [Ida]101-ida possessed the duplicate . The inscriptions on the duplicates supported [him]2186-the pawnbroker in this , and [he]2186-the pawnbroker professed to have not the least doubt as to [the prisoner]2172-the prisoner 's identity . Pressed in cross - examination , [he]2186-the pawnbroker certainly threw some suspicion on the trustworthiness of [his]2186-the pawnbroker assertions . " [You]2188-the cross - examiner positively swear that these two articles were pledged by [the prisoner]2172-the prisoner , and at the same time ! "[2188-the cross - examiner] asked [the cross - examiner]2188-the cross - examiner . " Well , "[2188-the cross - examiner] was the impatient reply , " there 's the same date and name , and both in [my]2188-the cross - examiner writing . "[2188-the cross - examiner] But even thus much of doubt [he]2186-the pawnbroker speedily retracted , and [his]2186-the pawnbroker evidence could not be practically undermined .

[Harriet]216-harriet 's examination was long and searching , but [she]216-harriet bore it without the slightest damage to [her]216-harriet credit . Plain , straightforward , and stubborn were all [her]216-harriet replies and assertions ; [she]216-harriet did not contradict [herself]216-harriet once . [Waymark]130-waymark marvelled at [her]216-harriet appearance and manner . The venom of malice had acted upon [her]216-harriet as a tonic , strengthening [her]216-harriet intellect , and bracing [her]216-harriet nerves . Once [she]216-harriet looked directly into [Ida]101-ida 's face and smiled .

[Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl had been summoned , and appeared in all the magnificence of accumulated rings , bracelets , necklaces , and watch - chains . [Helter]221-helter hoped to make good use of [her]153-mrs. sprowl .

" Did [you]153-mrs. sprowl on a certain occasion go to [the person in whose employ [the prisoner]2172-the prisoner]4367-the person in whose employ the prisoner was , and , by means of certain representations with regard to [the prisoner]2172-the prisoner 's antecedents , become the cause of [her]2172-the prisoner dismissal ? "[216-harriet]

" [I]153-mrs. sprowl did . [I]153-mrs. sprowl told all [I]153-mrs. sprowl knew about [her]2172-the prisoner , and [I]153-mrs. sprowl consider [I]153-mrs. sprowl 'd a right to do so . "[153-mrs. sprowl]

[Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl was not to be robbed of [her]153-mrs. sprowl self - assurance by any array of judicial dignity .

" What led [you]153-mrs. sprowl to do this ? "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" A good enough one , [I]153-mrs. sprowl think . [She]2172-the prisoner 'd been imposed on [Mr. Casti]116-mr. casti and [[his]116-mr. casti wife]505-his wife as a respectable character , and [she]2172-the prisoner was causing trouble between [them]4371-them . [She]2172-the prisoner had to be got rid of somehow , and this was one step to it . "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" Was [Mrs. Casti]187-mrs. casti aware of [your]153-mrs. sprowl intention to take this step ? "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" No , [she]187-mrs. casti was n't . "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" But [you]153-mrs. sprowl told [her]187-mrs. casti when [you]153-mrs. sprowl had done it ? "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" Yes , [I]153-mrs. sprowl did . "[153-mrs. sprowl]

The frankness of all this had its effect , of course . The case was attracting much interest in court , and the public seats were quite full . [Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl looked round in evident enjoyment of [her]153-mrs. sprowl position . There was a slight pause , and then the examination continued .

" Of what nature was the trouble [you]153-mrs. sprowl speak of , caused by [the prisoner between [this lady]4301-this lady and [her]4301-this lady husband]4372-the prisoner between this lady and her husband ? "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" [Mr. Casti]116-mr. casti began to pay a good deal too much attention to [her]187-mrs. casti . "[153-mrs. sprowl]

There was a sound of whispers and a murmuring .

" Did [Mrs. Casti]187-mrs. casti impart to [you]153-mrs. sprowl [her]187-mrs. casti suspicions of [the prisoner]2172-the prisoner as soon as [she]187-mrs. casti missed the first of these articles alleged to be stolen ? "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" Yes , [she]187-mrs. casti did . "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" And did [you]153-mrs. sprowl give any advice as to how [she]187-mrs. casti should proceed ? "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" [I]153-mrs. sprowl told [her]187-mrs. casti to be on the look - out . "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" No doubt [you]153-mrs. sprowl laid stress on the advantage , from a domestic point of view , of securing [this prisoner]4375-this prisoner 's detection ? "[153-mrs. sprowl]

" Certainly [I]153-mrs. sprowl did , and [I]153-mrs. sprowl hoped and prayed as [she]187-mrs. casti might caught ! "[153-mrs. sprowl]

[Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl was very shortly allowed to retire . For the defence there was but [one witness]2189-one witness , and that was [the laundress who had employed [Ida]101-ida]2190-the laundress who had employed ida . Personal fault with [Ida]101-ida [she]153-mrs. sprowl had [one at all to find]2191-one at all to find ; the sole cause of [her]153-mrs. sprowl dismissal was the information given by [Mrs. Sprowl]153-mrs. sprowl .
