There 's a good deal more than five pound ' ere now , [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark ; [I]2388-i 've reckoned it up in [[my]2388-i ' cad]4464-my ' cad . What d ' [you]130-waymark think [I]2388-i 'm a - goin' for to do with it ? "[2388-i]

[He]2388-i asked this question after a pause , with [his]2388-i head bent forward , [his]2388-i countenance screwed into the most hideous expression of cunning and gratified desire .

" [I]2388-i 'm a - goin' , "[2388-i] [he]2388-i said , with the emphasis of a hoarse whisper , " [I]2388-i a - goin' to drink [myself]2388-i dead ! That 's what [I]2388-i 'm a - goin' to do , [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark . [[My]2388-i four friends]4465-my four friends ai n't what [they]4465-my four friends used for to be , an ' 'cos [I]2388-i ai n't got enough of 'em . It 's unsatisfaction , that 's what it is , as brings the burnin ' [i]2388-i ' th ' inside , an ' the devils in the ' cad . Now [I]2388-i 've got money , an ' for wunst in [my]2388-i life [I]2388-i 'll be satisfied an ' ' appy . And then [I]2388-i 'll go where there 's real burnin ' , an ' real devils an ' let ['em]4466-'em make the most o ' [Slimy]156-slimy ! "[2388-i]

[Waymark]130-waymark felt [his]130-waymark blood chill with horror . For years after , the face of [Slimy]156-slimy , as it thus glared at [him]130-waymark , haunted [him]130-waymark in dreamful nights . [Dante]135-dante saw nothing more fearful in [any circle of hell]2389-any circle of hell .

" Well , [I]156-slimy 've said [my]156-slimy say , "[156-slimy] [Slimy]156-slimy remarked , rising from [his]156-slimy seat . " An ' now , [I]156-slimy 'm sorry [I]156-slimy 'll ' ave to ill - convenience [you]130-waymark , [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark . [You]130-waymark 've behaved better to [me]156-slimy than most has , and [I]156-slimy would n't pay [you]130-waymark in ill - convenience , if [I]156-slimy could help it . But [I]156-slimy must have time enough to get off clear . [I]156-slimy 'll ' ave jist to keep [you]130-waymark from ' ollerin ' this way , see but [I]156-slimy wo n't hurt [you]130-waymark ; the nose is good enough for breathin ' . [I]156-slimy 'll see as [some one]3153-some one comes to let [you]130-waymark out before to - morrow mornin ' . An ' now [I]156-slimy 'll say good - bye , [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark . [You]130-waymark wo n't see [Slimy]156-slimy in [this world]3446-this world again , an ' if [I]156-slimy only knowed ' ow to say a prayer , why , [I]156-slimy 'd pray as [you]130-waymark might n't never see [him]156-slimy in the next . "[156-slimy]

With one more look , a look at once of wild anticipation and friendly regret , [Slimy]156-slimy disappeared .

The relief consequent upon the certainty that no worse could happen had brought [Waymark]130-waymark into a state of mind in which [he]130-waymark could regard [his]130-waymark position with equanimity . The loss of the money seemed now to be the most serious result of the affair . [Slimy]156-slimy had promised that release should come before the morning , and would doubtless keep [his]156-slimy word [Waymark]130-waymark had a certain confidence in this , which [a less interested person]2390-a less interested person would perhaps have deemed scarcely warrantable . In the meantime , the discomfort was not extreme to lie gagged and bound on a garret - floor for some few hours was , after all , a situation which [a philosopher]2391-a philosopher might patiently endure , and to [an artist]1848-an artist it might well be suggestive of hints . Breathing , to be sure , was not easy , but became more so by degrees .

But with the complete recollection of [his]156-slimy faculties came back the thought of what was involved in the question of release before the following day . Early in the morning [he]156-slimy had to be at the door of [Tothill Fields ' Prison]78-tothill fields prison . How if [his]156-slimy release were delayed , through [Slimy]156-slimy 's neglect or that of [the agent [he]156-slimy might employ]2393-the agent he might employ ? As the first hour passed slowly by , this became the chief anxiety in [Waymark]130-waymark 's mind . It made [him]130-waymark forgetful of the aching in [his]130-waymark arms , caused by the bind ing together of [his]130-waymark hands behind [him]130-waymark , and left no room for anticipation of the other sufferings which would result from [his]130-waymark being left thus for an indefinite period . What would [Ida]101-ida do , if [she]101-ida came out and found [no one]3702-no one to meet [her]101-ida ?

[His]130-waymark absence would make [no one]3702-no one anxious , at all events not till more than a day had gone by . Hitherto [he]130-waymark had always taken [his]130-waymark rents at once to [[Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock 's office]2396-mr. woodstock 's office , but [the old gentleman]1375-the old gentleman was not likely to be disturbed by [his]130-waymark non appearance ; it would be accounted for in some simple way , and [his]130-waymark coming expected on the following morning . Then it was as good as certain that [no one]3702-no one would come to [[Slimy]156-slimy 's room]2399-slimy 's room . And , by the by , had not there been a sound of the turning of a key when [Slimy]156-slimy took [his]156-slimy departure ? [He]156-slimy could not be quite sure of this ; just then [he]156-slimy had noticed all things so imperfectly . Was it impossible to free a limb , or to ungag [his]156-slimy mouth ? [He]156-slimy tried to turn [his]156-slimy head , but it was clear that throttling would be the only result of any such effort ; and the bonds on hands and feet were immoveable . No escape , save by [Slimy]156-slimy 's aid .

[He]156-slimy determined not to face the possibility of [Slimy]156-slimy 's failing in [his]156-slimy word ; otherwise , anxiety would make [him]156-slimy desperate . [He]156-slimy recognised now , for the first time fully , how much it meant to [him]156-slimy , that meeting with [Ida]101-ida . The shock [he]156-slimy had experienced on hearing [her]101-ida sentence and beholding [her]101-ida face as [she]101-ida left [the court]1401-the court had not , apparently , produced lasting results ; [his]156-slimy weakness surprised [him]156-slimy when [he]156-slimy looked back upon it . In a day or two [he]156-slimy had come to regard the event as finally severing [him]156-slimy from [Ida]101-ida , and a certain calm ensuing hereupon led to the phase which ultimately brought [him]156-slimy to [Maud]103-maud once more . But [Waymark]130-waymark 's introspection was at fault ; [he]156-slimy understood [himself]156-slimy less in proportion as [he]156-slimy felt that the ground was growing firmer under [his]156-slimy feet . Even when [he]156-slimy wrote the letter to [the prison]2401-the prison , promising to meet [Ida]101-ida , [he]156-slimy had acted as if out of mere humanity . It needed a chance such as the present to open [his]156-slimy eyes . That [she]101-ida should quit [the prison]2401-the prison , and , not finding [him]156-slimy , wander away in blank misery and hopelessness , most likely embittered by the thought that [he]156-slimy had carelessly neglected to meet [her]101-ida , and so driven to despair such a possibility was intolerable . The fear of it began to goad [him]156-slimy in flesh and spirit . With a sudden violent stringing of all [his]156-slimy sinews , [he]156-slimy wrenched at the bonds , but only with the effect of exhausting [himself]156-slimy and making the walls and ceiling reel before [his]156-slimy eyes . The attempt to utter cries resulted in nothing but muffled moaning . Then , mastering [himself]156-slimy once more , [he]156-slimy resolved to be patient . [Slimy]156-slimy would not fail [him]156-slimy .

[He]156-slimy tried not to think of [Ida]101-ida in any way , but this was beyond [his]156-slimy power . Again and again [she]101-ida came before [his]156-slimy mind . When [he]156-slimy endeavoured to supplant [her]101-ida by the image of [Maud Enderby]103-maud , [the latter]425-the latter 's face only irritated [him]156-slimy . Till now , it had been just the reverse ; the thought of [Maud]103-maud had always brought quietness ; [Ida]101-ida [he]156-slimy had recognised as the disturbing element of [his]156-slimy life , and had learned to associate [her]101-ida with [his]156-slimy least noble instincts . Thinking of this now , [he]156-slimy began to marvel how it could have been so . Was it true that [Maud]103-maud was [[his]156-slimy good angel]2404-his good angel , that in [her]103-maud [he]156-slimy had found [his]156-slimy ideal ? [He]156-slimy had forced [himself]156-slimy to believe this , now that [he]156-slimy was in honour bound to [her]101-ida ; yet [she]101-ida had never made [his]156-slimy pulse quicken , as it had often done when [he]156-slimy had approached [Ida]101-ida . True , that warmth of feeling had come to represent merely a temptation to [him]156-slimy ; but was not that the consequence of [his]156-slimy own ambiguous attitude ? Suppose [he]156-slimy had not known [Maud Enderby]103-maud , how would [he]156-slimy then have regarded [Ida]101-ida , and [his]156-slimy relations to [her]101-ida ? Were these in very deed founded on nothing but selfish feeling ? Then [he]156-slimy reviewed all [his]156-slimy acquaintanceship with [her]101-ida from the first , and every detail of the story grew to a new aspect .

Thinking of [Ida]101-ida , [he]156-slimy found [himself]156-slimy wondering how it was that [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock appeared to take so much interest in [her]101-ida fate . Several times during the past six months [the old man]1383-the old man had referred to [her]101-ida , generally inquiring whether [Waymark]130-waymark had written to or heard from [her]101-ida . And , only two days ago , [he]1383-the old man had shown that [he]1383-the old man remembered the exact date of [her]101-ida release , in asking whether [Waymark]130-waymark meant to do anything . [Waymark]130-waymark replying that [he]130-waymark intended to meet [her]101-ida , and give [her]101-ida what assistance [he]130-waymark could , [the old gentleman]1375-the old gentleman had signified [his]130-waymark strong approval , and had even gone on to mention [a house in [the neighbourhood of [the office]2409-the office]2408-the neighbourhood of the office]2407-a house in the neighbourhood of the office , where [Ida]101-ida could be lodged at first . [A room]561-a room had accordingly been secured beforehand , and it was arranged that [Waymark]130-waymark should take [her]101-ida directly thither on the Tuesday morning . In reviewing all this , [Waymark]130-waymark found it more significant than [he]130-waymark had imagined . Why , [he]130-waymark wondered , had [Mr. Woodstock]114-mr. woodstock grown so philanthrophic all at once ? Why had [he]114-mr. woodstock been so particular in making sure that [Waymark]130-waymark would meet [the girl]316-the girl ? Indeed , from the very beginning of this affair , [he]130-waymark had behaved with regard to it in a manner quite unlike [himself]130-waymark . [Waymark]130-waymark had leisure now to ponder these things , but could only conjecture explanations .

The hours went by ; a church clock kept [him]130-waymark aware of [their]2412-their progress . The aching in [his]130-waymark arms became severe ; [he]130-waymark suffered from cold . The floor was swept by a draught which seemed strong and keen as a blast of east wind ; it made [his]130-waymark eyes smart , and [he]130-waymark kept them closed , with some slight hope that this might also have the effect of inducing sleep . Sleep , however , held far aloof from [him]130-waymark . When [he]130-waymark had wearied [his]130-waymark brain with other thoughts , [his]130-waymark attention began to turn to sounds in [the court below]2413-the court below . There , just as it grew dusk , [some children]3844-some children were playing , and [he]130-waymark tried to get amusement from [their]3844-some children games . One of [them]3844-some children was this . [A little girl]266-a little girl would say to [the rest]258-the rest : " [I]266-a little girl sent [[my]266-a little girl daughter]4469-my daughter to [the oil - shop]4470-the oil - shop , and the first thing [she]4469-my daughter saw was C ; "[266-a little girl] and the task was to guess for what article this initial stood . " Carrots ! "[318-one] cried [one]318-one , but was laughed to scorn . " Candles ! "[921-another] cried [another]921-another , and triumphed . Then there were games which consisted in the saying of strange incantations . [The children]253-the children would go round and round , as was evident from the sound of [their]253-the children feet , chanting the while : " [Sally]105-sally , [Sally Wallflower]105-sally , Sprinkle in a pan ; Rise , [Sally Wallflower]105-sally , And choose [[your]105-sally young man]4471-your young man . Choose for the fairest one , Choose for the best , Choose for the rarest one , That [you]105-sally love best ! "[253-the children] Upon this followed words and movements only half understood ; then at length broke out a sort of hymeneal chorus : " Here stands [a young couple , Just married and settled]4472-a young couple , just married and settled : [[Their]4472-a young couple , just married and settled father]4473-their father and [mother]375-mother [they]4472-a young couple , just married and settled must obey . [They]4472-a young couple , just married and settled love [one another]257-one another like [sister]3426-sister and [brother]3425-brother . So pray , [young couple]4478-young couple , come kiss together ! "[253-the children] Lastly , laughter and screams and confusion . This went on till it was quite dark .

Pitch dark in [[Slimy]156-slimy 's room]2399-slimy 's room ; only the faintest reflection on a portion of the ceiling of lamplight from without . [Waymark]130-waymark 's sufferings became extreme . The rope about [his]130-waymark neck seemed to work itself tighter ; there were moments when [he]130-waymark had to struggle for the scant breath which the gag allowed [him]130-waymark . [He]130-waymark feared lest [he]130-waymark should become insensible , and so perhaps be suffocated . [His]130-waymark arms were entirely numbed ; [he]130-waymark could not feel that [he]130-waymark was lying on them . Surely [[Slimy]156-slimy 's emissary]2421-slimy 's emissary would come before midnight .

" One , two , three , four twelve ! "[130-waymark] How was it that e had lost all count of the hours since eight o'clock ? Whether that had been sleep or insensibility , [Waymark]130-waymark could not decide . Intensity of cold must have brought back consciousness ; [his]130-waymark whole body seemed to be frozen ; [his]130-waymark eyes ached insufferably . Continuous thought had somehow become an impossibility ; [he]130-waymark knew that [Ida]101-ida was constantly in [his]130-waymark mind , and [her]101-ida image clear at times in the dark before [him]130-waymark , but [he]130-waymark could not think about [her]101-ida as [he]130-waymark wished and tried to do . Who was it that seemed to come between [her]101-ida and [him]130-waymark ? some one [he]130-waymark knew , yet could not identify . Then the hours sounded uncertainly ; some [he]130-waymark appeared to have missed . There , at length , was seven . Why , this was morning ; and [Slimy]156-slimy had promised that [he]130-waymark should be set free before this . What was it that tortured [his]130-waymark struggling brain so ? A thought [he]130-waymark strove in vain for a time to grasp . The meaning flashed upon [him]130-waymark . By a great effort [he]130-waymark regained complete consciousness ; mind alone seemed to be left to [him]130-waymark , [his]130-waymark body was dead . Was [he]130-waymark , then , really to be prevented from keeping [his]130-waymark promise to [Ida]101-ida ? All the suffering of [his]130-waymark previous life amassed was nothing to what [Waymark]130-waymark endured during the successive quarters of this hour . [His]130-waymark brain burned : [his]130-waymark eyes had no power to gather the growing daylight . That one name was [his]130-waymark single perception ; the sound of it , uttered incessantly in thought , alone seemed to keep [him]130-waymark conscious . [He]130-waymark could feel something slightly warm on [his]130-waymark cheeks , but did not know that it was the streaming of tears from [his]130-waymark darkened eyes . Then [he]130-waymark lost consciousness once more .

The clock struck eight .

CHAPTER XXIX

[FREEDOM

Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock was not so indifferent with regard to [Waymark]130-waymark 's failure to bring the rents as [the young man]818-the young man supposed . Under ordinary circumstances [he]130-waymark probably would have waited without any anxiety till the following day ; already on a previous occasion [Waymark]130-waymark had collected on Tuesday instead of Monday , though not without notice of [his]130-waymark intention to do so . But [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock had quite special reasons for wishing to see [[his]233-mr. woodstock agent]2423-his agent before the following morning ; [he]233-mr. woodstock desired to assure [himself]233-mr. woodstock once more that [Waymark]130-waymark would not fail to be at [the prison]2401-the prison punctually . When the afternoon passed without the usual visit , [he]233-mr. woodstock grew uneasy ; [he]233-mr. woodstock was incapable of attending to matters of business , and walked up and down [[his]233-mr. woodstock office]2425-his office with impatient step . Such a mood was extraordinary in [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock ; [he]233-mr. woodstock had often waxed restive in this or that business difficulty ; was , indeed , anything but remarkable for equanimity under trial ; but [his]233-mr. woodstock state of mind was quite different at present , and exhibited itself in entirely different ways . [He]233-mr. woodstock neither swore nor looked black ; [his]2426-his was the anxiety of [a man who has some grave interest at stake wherein the better part of [his]130-waymark nature]2427-a man who has some grave interest at stake wherein the better part of his nature is concerned .

At five o'clock [he]233-mr. woodstock took [a cab]648-a cab , and went off to [[Waymark]130-waymark 's lodgings in [Chelsea]48-chelsea]2429-waymark 's lodgings in chelsea . Here [he]233-mr. woodstock learned that [Waymark]130-waymark had left [home]3157-home at the usual time , and had not yet returned . Just as [he]233-mr. woodstock was speaking with [the landlady at the door]2431-the landlady at the door , [another gentleman]1918-another gentleman came up on the same errand . [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock remembered [Julian Casti]118-julian , and held out [his]233-mr. woodstock hand to [him]118-julian . [Casti]118-julian looked ill ; [his]118-julian handsome features had wasted , and [his]118-julian fair complexion was turned to a dull , unhealthy , yellowish hue . It was a comparatively warm day for the season , but [his]118-julian thin frame was closely muffled up , and still [he]118-julian seemed to be shrinking under the air .

" Have [you]118-julian any idea where [he]130-waymark can be ? "[233-mr. woodstock] [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock asked , as [they]2433-they turned away together .

[Julian]118-julian looked surprised , but assented . [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock tried to pooh - pooh [his]233-mr. woodstock own uneasiness ; yet , totally improbable as it seemed that [Waymark]130-waymark should disappear at such a juncture , the impatience of the afternoon had worked [him]233-mr. woodstock into a most unwonted fit of nervousness . Doubts and suspicions which would ordinarily never have occurred to [him]233-mr. woodstock filled [his]233-mr. woodstock mind . Then [he]118-julian sat idly through the evening , for the most part staring into the glowing coals , occasionally taking up a book for a few minutes , and throwing it aside again with a sigh of weariness . At six o'clock [Julian]118-julian arose . It was still quite dark when [he]118-julian left [the house]288-the house , and the air was piercing . But [he]118-julian did not mind the weather this morning . [Abraham]115-abraham did not devote much attention to the news . [He]233-mr. woodstock sat before the fire , a cup of coffee within reach on the mantel piece , [his]233-mr. woodstock legs fully stretched out before [him]233-mr. woodstock , [his]233-mr. woodstock favourite attitude when thinking . In spite of [his]233-mr. woodstock fresh complexion and active limbs , [you]2471-you would have seen , had [you]2471-you watched [him]233-mr. woodstock in [his]233-mr. woodstock present mood , that [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock was beginning to age . Outwardly [he]233-mr. woodstock was well - preserved few men of [his]233-mr. woodstock years anything like so well . But let [the inner man]2472-the inner man become visible during a fit of brooding , and [his]233-mr. woodstock features made evident the progress of years . [His]233-mr. woodstock present phase of countenance was a recent development ; the relaxed lines brought to light a human kindliness not easily discoverable in the set expression of wide - awake hours . At present there was even tenderness in [his]233-mr. woodstock eyes , and something of sad recollection . [His]233-mr. woodstock strong mouth twitched a little at times , and [his]233-mr. woodstock brows contracted , as if in self - reproach . When [he]233-mr. woodstock returned to [himself]233-mr. woodstock , it was with a sigh . [He]233-mr. woodstock sat for about an hour ; then [the woman]448-the woman presented [herself]448-the woman again , and told [him]233-mr. woodstock that [Miss Starr]189-miss starr had been persuaded to lie down . It seemed likely [she]448-the woman might sleep .

" Very well , "[233-mr. woodstock] said [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock , rising . " [I]233-mr. woodstock 'll go to [the office]2409-the office . Send some one round when [she]448-the woman 's stirring , will [you]101-ida ? "[233-mr. woodstock]

[Ida]101-ida , to get rid of [her]101-ida [troublesome though well - meaning attendant]2474-troublesome though well - meaning attendant , had promised to lie down , but [she]101-ida had no need of sleep . Alone , [she]101-ida still kept [her]101-ida chair by the fire , sitting like one worn out with fatigue , [her]101-ida hands upon [her]101-ida lap , [her]101-ida head drooping , [her]101-ida eyes fixed on vacancy . [She]101-ida was trying to think , but thoughts refused to come consecutively , and a dull annoyance at this inability to reason upon [her]101-ida position fretted [her]101-ida consciousness . Not with impunity can the human mind surrender itself for half a year to unvaried brooding upon one vast misery ; the neglected faculties revenge [themselves]2475-themselves by rusting , and will not respond when at length summoned . For months [Ida]101-ida 's thoughts had gone round and round about one centre of anguish , like a wailing bird circling over a ravaged nest . The image of [her]101-ida mental state had been presented by an outward experience with which [she]101-ida became familiar . Waking long before daylight , [she]101-ida would lie with [her]101-ida eyes directed to the little barred window , and watch till there came the first glimmer of dawn . Even so was it [her]101-ida sole relief in the deep night of [her]101-ida misery to look forward for that narrow gleam of hope [her]101-ida ultimate release . As the day approached , [she]101-ida made it the business of [her]101-ida thoughts to construct a picture of the events it would bring . Even before hearing from [Waymark]130-waymark , [she]101-ida had been sure that [he]130-waymark would meet [her]101-ida ; [Waymark]130-waymark and freedom grew identical images ; to be free meant to see [him]130-waymark awaiting [her]101-ida and to put [herself]101-ida absolutely in [his]130-waymark hands . Now that everything had turned out differently from what [she]101-ida had grown to anticipate with certainty , [she]101-ida found [herself]101-ida powerless to face the unexpected . Why had [Waymark]130-waymark failed [her]101-ida ? [she]101-ida could do no more than repeat the question a thousand times , till the faculty of self - communing forsook [her]101-ida . It was as though the sun should fail one morning to rise upon [the world]622-the world , and [men]3195-men should stand hopeless of day for ever .

[She]101-ida wondered vaguely whither [she]101-ida had been brought . At one moment [she]101-ida seemed to have been waiting an eternity in [this unknown room]2478-this unknown room , [Julian]118-julian 's face and voice unspeakably remote ; then again [she]101-ida would look round and wonder that [she]101-ida no longer saw the hare walls and barred window of [[her]101-ida cell]2479-her cell , the present seeming only a dream . All the processes of [her]101-ida mind were slow , sinewless . [She]101-ida tried to hope for something , to expect that something would happen , but could not summon the energy . Resentment , revolt , bitterness of spirit , of these things [she]101-ida knew just as little . They had been strong enough within [her]101-ida at first , but how long ago that seemed ! [She]101-ida had no thought of time in the present ; to sit waiting for an hour meant as little as to wait five minutes ; such was the habit that had become impressed upon [her]101-ida by interminable days and nights . When at length [she]101-ida heard a knock at the door it filled [her]101-ida with fear ; [she]101-ida started to [her]101-ida feet and looked with unintelligent eyes at [the woman who again presented [herself]2480-the woman who again presented herself]2480-the woman who again presented herself .

" Do [you]233-mr. woodstock feel better , ' m ? "[386-the landlady] [the landlady]386-the landlady asked . " Have [you]233-mr. woodstock rested [yourself]233-mr. woodstock ? "[386-the landlady]

" Yes , thank [you]233-mr. woodstock . "[233-mr. woodstock]

[The woman]448-the woman went away ; then came another knock , and [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock entered [the room]255-the room . [He]233-mr. woodstock closed the door behind [him]233-mr. woodstock , and drew near . [She]101-ida had again started up , and did not move [her]101-ida eyes from [his]233-mr. woodstock face .

" Have [you]101-ida any recollection of [me]115-abraham ? "[115-abraham] [Abraham]115-abraham asked , much embarrassed in [her]101-ida presence , [his]233-mr. woodstock voice failing to be as gentle as [he]233-mr. woodstock wished through [his]233-mr. woodstock difficulty in commanding it .

[Ida]101-ida had recognised [him]233-mr. woodstock at once . [He]233-mr. woodstock had undergone no change since that day when [she]101-ida saw [him]233-mr. woodstock last in [Milton Street]6-milton street , and at this moment it was much easier for [her]101-ida to concentrate [her]101-ida thoughts upon bygone things than to realise the present .

" [You]233-mr. woodstock are [Abraham Woodstock]4495-abraham woodstock , "[101-ida] [she]101-ida said very coldly , the resentment associated with the thought of [him]233-mr. woodstock being yet stronger than the dead habit which had but now oppressed [her]101-ida .

" Yes , [I]101-ida am . And [I]101-ida am [a friend of [Osmond Waymark]129-waymark]4496-a friend of osmond waymark . [I]101-ida should like to talk a little with [you]233-mr. woodstock , if [you]233-mr. woodstock 'll let [me]101-ida . "[101-ida]

[The old man]1383-the old man found it so hard to give expression to the feelings that possessed [him]1383-the old man . [Ida]101-ida concluded at once that [he]233-mr. woodstock came with some hostile purpose , and the name of [Waymark]129-waymark was an incentive to [her]101-ida numbed faculties .

" How can [you]1383-the old man be [a friend of [Osmond Waymark]129-waymark]4496-a friend of osmond waymark ? "[101-ida] [she]101-ida asked , with cold suspicion .

" Did n't [he]129-waymark ever mention [my]101-ida name to [you]1383-the old man ? "[101-ida]

" Never . "[101-ida]

[Waymark]129-waymark had in truth always kept silence with [Ida]101-ida about [his]129-waymark occupations , though [he]129-waymark had spoken so freely of them to [Maud]103-maud . [He]129-waymark could not easily have explained to [himself]129-waymark why [he]129-waymark had made this difference , though it had a significance . [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock was almost at a loss how to proceed . [He]233-mr. woodstock coughed , and moved [his]233-mr. woodstock foot uneasily .

" [I]233-mr. woodstock have known [him]233-mr. woodstock all [his]233-mr. woodstock life , for all that , "[233-mr. woodstock] [he]233-mr. woodstock said . " And it was through [him]233-mr. woodstock [I]233-mr. woodstock found [you]101-ida . "[233-mr. woodstock]

" Found [me]233-mr. woodstock ? "[233-mr. woodstock]

" It 'll seem very strange , what [I]233-mr. woodstock have to tell [you]101-ida . [You]101-ida were [a little girl]266-a little girl when [I]233-mr. woodstock saw [you]101-ida last , and [you]101-ida refused to come with [me]233-mr. woodstock . Had [you]101-ida any idea why [I]233-mr. woodstock asked [you]101-ida ? "[233-mr. woodstock]

" [I]233-mr. woodstock had n't then . "[233-mr. woodstock]

" But [you]101-ida have thought of it since ? "[233-mr. woodstock]

[Ida]101-ida looked at [him]233-mr. woodstock sternly , and turned [her]101-ida eyes away again . The belief that [he]233-mr. woodstock was [[her]101-ida father]514-her father had always increased the resentment with which [she]101-ida recalled [his]233-mr. woodstock face .

" [I]115-abraham am [[your]101-ida grandfather]4499-your grandfather , "[115-abraham] [Abraham]115-abraham said gravely . " [[Your]101-ida mother]3184-your mother was [[my]115-abraham daughter]4469-my daughter . "[115-abraham]

A change came over [her]101-ida countenance ; [she]101-ida gazed at [him]233-mr. woodstock with wonder .

" Who did [you]101-ida think [I]233-mr. woodstock was ? "[233-mr. woodstock] [he]233-mr. woodstock asked .

[She]101-ida hesitated for a moment , then , instead of replying , said :

" [You]233-mr. woodstock behaved cruelly to [[my]101-ida poor mother]4502-my poor mother . "[101-ida]

" [I]1383-the old man wo n't deny it , "[1383-the old man] [the old man]1383-the old man returned , mastering [his]1383-the old man voice with difficulty . " [I]1383-the old man ought to have been more patient with [her]4502-my poor mother . But [she]4502-my poor mother refused to obey [me]1383-the old man , and [I]1383-the old man ca n't help [my]1383-the old man nature . [I]1383-the old man repented it when it was too late . "[1383-the old man]

[Ida]101-ida could not know what it cost [him]1383-the old man to utter these abrupt sentences . [He]1383-the old man seemed harsh , even in confining [his]1383-the old man harshness . [She]101-ida was as far from [him]1383-the old man as ever .

" [I]233-mr. woodstock ca n't do anything for [her]4502-my poor mother , "[233-mr. woodstock] [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock continued , trying to look [her]101-ida in the face . " But [you]101-ida are [[her]4502-my poor mother child]524-her child , and [I]233-mr. woodstock want to do now what [I]233-mr. woodstock ought to have done long ago . "[233-mr. woodstock]

" [I]101-ida do n't feel to [you]101-ida as [a child]378-a child ought , "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida said , [her]101-ida voice changing to sadness . " [You]101-ida 've left it too late . "[101-ida]

" No , it is n't too late ! "[449-the other] exclaimed [the other]449-the other , with emotion [he]449-the other could not control . " [You]101-ida must n't think of [yourself]101-ida , but of [me]449-the other . " No right ! no right ! "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida interrupted [him]449-the other almost passionately .

" Then [you]101-ida have a duty , "[115-abraham] said [Abraham]115-abraham , with lowered voice . " [My]115-abraham mind is n't at ease , and it 's in [your]101-ida power to help [me]115-abraham . "[115-abraham]

There was pathos in the speech , and [Ida]101-ida felt it .

" Do [you]115-abraham know where [I]101-ida came from this morning ? "[101-ida] [she]101-ida asked , when [both]771-both had been silent for some moments .

" [I]115-abraham know all about it . [I]115-abraham was at the trial , and [I]115-abraham did [my]115-abraham best for [you]101-ida then . "[115-abraham]

" Do [you]115-abraham believe that [I]101-ida robbed [that woman]3521-that woman ? "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida asked , leaning forward with eager eyes and quickened breath .

" [He]129-waymark said that ? "[101-ida] [she]101-ida exclaimed . Then , as if suddenly becoming clearer about [her]101-ida position : " Where is [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark ? Why did n't [he]129-waymark meet [me]101-ida as [he]129-waymark promised ? "[101-ida]

[Abraham]115-abraham hesitated , but speedily made up [his]2489-his mind that it would be best to speak the truth .

" [I]101-ida know as little as [you]101-ida do . [He]129-waymark ought to have come to [me]101-ida yesterday , but [he]129-waymark did n't , and [I]101-ida ca n't discover [him]129-waymark . [I]101-ida got [Mr. Casti]116-mr. casti to meet [you]101-ida instead . "[101-ida]

The keenest trouble manifested itself on [Ida]101-ida 's countenance . [She]101-ida asked questions in rapid succession , and thus elicited an explanation of all the circumstances hitherto unknown to [her]101-ida .

[She]101-ida stopped , overcome by sudden weakness , and sank into the chair .

" [He]129-waymark may turn up at any moment ; all sorts of unexpected things may have happened . " No , no ; that 'll never do , [Ida]101-ida . "[1383-the old man]

[She]101-ida was as weak as water , and would have sunk to the ground if [Abraham]115-abraham had not given [her]101-ida [his]1383-the old man support just in time . " [We]2493-they are losing time ! "[101-ida] [she]101-ida exclaimed , forcing [herself]101-ida into an appearance of calmness . " Come at once . "[101-ida]

CHAPTER XXX

[ELM COURT]46-elm court

In [Beaufort Street]2492-beaufort street [they]2493-they only learnt that [Waymark]130-waymark had not yet been [home]3157-home . Thence [they]2493-they drove to the east , and stopped at [a police - station]2495-a police - station , where [Abraham]115-abraham saw [the inspector]2105-the inspector . [The latter]425-the latter suggested that [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock should go through [all the houses which [Waymark]130-waymark would have visited]2498-all the houses which waymark would have visited ; if that search proved fruitless , [the police]2117-the police would pursue the matter . [Ida]101-ida insisted on being allowed to accompanying [him]130-waymark when [the cab]2318-the cab stopped at the end of [Litany Lane]45-litany lane . [She]101-ida gazed about [her]101-ida like one who had been suddenly set down in [a new country]2501-a new country ; this squalor and vileness , so familiar to [her]101-ida of old , affected [her]101-ida strangely under the present conditions . The faces of people at whom [she]101-ida looked remained fresh in [her]101-ida memory for years after ; the long confinement and the excitement which now possessed [her]101-ida resulted in preternatural acuteness of observation . [Abraham]115-abraham spoke first with [several people whom [he]130-waymark had already questioned about [Waymark]130-waymark]2502-several people whom he had already questioned about waymark , but [they]2502-several people whom he had already questioned about waymark had heard nothing since .

" Are [you]101-ida strong enough for this ? "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark asked [Ida]101-ida . " Had n't [you]101-ida better go back to [the cab]2318-the cab and wait for [me]130-waymark ! "[130-waymark]

" Do n't ask [me]101-ida to do that ! "[101-ida] [she]101-ida entreated earnestly . " [I]101-ida must be active . [I]101-ida have strength now for anything . "[101-ida]

Just as [she]101-ida spoke , [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock became aware of a disturbance of some kind in [[a duty little tobacconist]2503-a duty little tobacconist 's shop]2504-a duty little tobacconist 's shop close at hand . There was [a small crowd at the door]2505-a small crowd at the door , and the sound of wrangling voices came from within . Such an occurrence was too ordinary to suggest any special significance , but [Abraham]115-abraham would not pass without making some inquiry . Begging [Ida]101-ida to stand where [he]130-waymark left [her]101-ida , [he]130-waymark pushed [his]130-waymark way into [the shop]361-the shop and listened to what was going on . [A lad]2507-a lad , well known in these parts as " [Lushy Dick]236-lushy dick , "[2507-a lad] was , it appeared , charging [the tobacconist]2508-the tobacconist with cheating [him]2508-the tobacconist ; [he]2507-a lad alleged that [he]2507-a lad had deposited half a sovereign on the counter in payment for a cigar , and [the shopman]2509-the shopman had given [him]2507-a lad change as if for sixpence , maintaining stoutly that sixpence had been the coin given [him]2507-a lad , and no half - sovereign at all . When [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock entered , the quarrel had reached a high pitch .

" Arf a quid ! "[2508-the tobacconist] [the tobacconist]2508-the tobacconist was exclaiming contemptuously . " [I]2508-the tobacconist 'd like to know where such as [you]233-mr. woodstock 's likely to git arf a quid from . "[2508-the tobacconist]

[Lushy Dick]236-lushy dick , stung to recklessness by a succession of such remarks , broke out in vehement self - justification .

" Would [yer]233-mr. woodstock like to know , [y]233-mr. woodstock ' old ! Then [yer]233-mr. woodstock shall , soon ! "[2508-the tobacconist]

" And how came [Slimy]156-slimy to give [you]693-the boy half a sovereign ? "[233-mr. woodstock] [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock at once interposed , speaking with authority .

" Is that [you]233-mr. woodstock , [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock ? "[693-the boy] exclaimed [the boy]693-the boy , turning round suddenly at the sound of the voice . " Now , look ' ere , [I]693-the boy 'm a - goin' to make a clean breast of it . [The lad]1132-the lad had clearly been drinking , but had not yet reached the incoherent stage . [He]1132-the lad spoke in great excitement , repeating constantly [his]1132-the lad determination to be revenged upon [the tobacconist]2508-the tobacconist at all costs . " Why [Slimy]156-slimy give it [me]233-mr. woodstock ? Well , [I]233-mr. woodstock 'll jist tell [yer]693-the boy , [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock . "[233-mr. woodstock]

" And why the devil did n't [you]2514-you come ? "[115-abraham] exclaimed [Abraham]115-abraham , looking at [him]2514-you in angry surprise .

"[115-abraham]

[Abraham]115-abraham was out of [the shop]361-the shop again on the instant .

" [I]2514-you 've found [him]156-slimy , "[2514-you] [he]2514-you said to [Ida]101-ida . " [A house round there in [the court]1401-the court]4522-a house round there in the court . "[2514-you]

[She]101-ida walked quickly by [his]2514-you side , [a cluster of [people]3402-people]2516-a cluster of people following [them]2518-them . As soon as [they]2518-them got inside , [the old man]1383-the old man begged [Ida]101-ida to remain in [a room on [the ground floor]1405-the ground floor whilst [he]1383-the old man went [upstairs]434-upstairs]2524-a room on the ground floor whilst he went upstairs , and this [she]101-ida consented to do . Reaching [the garret]2527-the garret , [he]1383-the old man tried the handle of the door , without effect . Knocking and calling produced no response , and within all was perfectly quiet . Hesitating no longer , [he]1383-the old man drew back as far as the wall would allow [him]1383-the old man , and ran with [his]1383-the old man foot against the door . The rotten woodwork cracked , and a second onset forced the lock away . In the middle of [the floor]2528-the floor [Waymark]130-waymark lay , just as [Slimy]156-slimy had left [him]130-waymark nearly twenty - four hours ago . [Abraham]115-abraham scarcely ventured to draw near ; there was no motion in the fettered body , and [he]1383-the old man dreaded to look closely at the face . Before [he]1383-the old man could overcome this momentary fear , there was a quick step behind [him]1383-the old man , and , with a smothered cry , [Ida]101-ida had rushed into [the room]255-the room . [She]101-ida was on [her]101-ida knees beside [Waymark]130-waymark , [her]101-ida face close down to [his]1383-the old man .

" [He]130-waymark is alive ! "[101-ida] [she]101-ida cried . " [His]130-waymark eyes have opened . A knife ! Cut these cords ! "[101-ida]

That was soon accomplished , but [Waymark]130-waymark lay motionless ; [he]130-waymark showed that [he]130-waymark understood what was going on , but [he]130-waymark was quite blind , [his]130-waymark voice had all but gone , and [a dead man]2530-a dead man could as soon have risen . [Ida]101-ida still knelt by [him]130-waymark , chafing one of [his]130-waymark hands ; when [he]130-waymark tried to speak , [she]101-ida gently raised [his]130-waymark head and let it rest upon [her]101-ida lap . In a few minutes [Abraham]115-abraham had procured a glass of spirits , and , after drinking this , [Waymark]130-waymark was able to make [himself]130-waymark understood .

" Who is touching [me]130-waymark ? "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark asked in a hoarse whisper . " It is all dark . Whose hand is this ? "[130-waymark]

" It 's [Ida]101-ida , "[115-abraham] [Abraham]115-abraham said , when [she]101-ida [herself]101-ida remained silent . " [She]101-ida and [I]115-abraham have had a rare hunt for [you]130-waymark . "[115-abraham]

" [Ida]101-ida ? "[101-ida]

[He]130-waymark endeavoured to raise [himself]130-waymark , but in vain . All [he]130-waymark could do was to press [her]101-ida hand to [his]130-waymark heart . In the meantime [the policeman]2100-the policeman had come up , and with [his]2100-the policeman help [Waymark]130-waymark was carried [downstairs]445-downstairs , out into [the court]1401-the court , and thence to the end of [Litany Lane]45-litany lane , where [the cab]2318-the cab still waited .

Four days after this the following paragraph appeared in the morning papers :

" [The man wanted on a charge of robbery with violence]4524-the man wanted on a charge of robbery with violence in [the East End]4525-the east end , and who appears to be known only by the nickname of [Slimy]156-slimy , was yesterday afternoon discovered by [the police]2117-the police in [a cellar in [Limehouse]84-limehouse]4527-a cellar in limehouse . [He]4524-the man wanted on a charge of robbery with violence seems to have been in hiding [there]3249-there since the perpetration of the crime , only going out from time to time to purchase liquor at [public - houses in [the neighbourhood]297-the neighbourhood]4529-public - houses in the neighbourhood . Information given by [the landlord of [one of [these houses]4533-these houses]4532-one of these houses]4531-the landlord of one of these houses led to [his]4524-the man wanted on a charge of robbery with violence arrest . [He]4524-the man wanted on a charge of robbery with violence was found lying on the stone floor , with empty bottles about [him]4524-the man wanted on a charge of robbery with violence , also a quantity of gold and silver coins , which appeared to have rolled out of [his]4524-the man wanted on a charge of robbery with violence pocket . [He]4524-the man wanted on a charge of robbery with violence was carried to [the police - station]2103-the police - station in an insensible state , but on being taken to [the cell]2233-the cell , came to [himself]4524-the man wanted on a charge of robbery with violence , and exhibited symptoms of delirium tremens . [Two officers]4536-two officers remained with [him]4524-the man wanted on a charge of robbery with violence , but the assistance of [a third shortly]4537-a third shortly became necessary , owing to the violence of [his]4524-the man wanted on a charge of robbery with violence struggles . Towards midnight [his]4524-the man wanted on a charge of robbery with violence fury lessened , and , after a very brief interval of unconsciousness , [the wretched creature]4538-the wretched creature expired . "[233-mr. woodstock]

CHAPTER XXXI

NEW PROSPECTS

[[Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock 's house at [Tottenham]62-tottenham]2535-mr. woodstock 's house at tottenham was [a cheerful abode]2536-a cheerful abode when the months of early summer came round , and there was thick leafage within the shelter of the old brick wall which shut [it]2537-it off from [the road]1271-the road .

For the first time in [his]233-mr. woodstock life [he]233-mr. woodstock understood the attractions of domesticity . During the early months of the year , slippers and the fireside after dinner ; now that the sunset - time was growing warm and fragrant , a musing saunter about the garden walks ; these were the things to which [his]233-mr. woodstock imagination grew fond of turning . Nor to these only ; blended with such visions of bodily comfort , perchance lending to [them]2539-them [their]2539-them chief attraction , was the light of a young face , grave always , often sad , speaking with its beautiful eyes to those simpler and tenderer instincts of [his]233-mr. woodstock nature which had hitherto slept . In the presence of [Ida]101-ida who was now known , by [his]233-mr. woodstock wish , as [Miss Woodstock Abraham]115-abraham 's hard voice found for itself a more modest and musical key .

[He]233-mr. woodstock began novel sensation to look upon [himself]233-mr. woodstock as [a respectable old gentleman]2540-a respectable old gentleman ; the grey patches on [his]233-mr. woodstock head were grateful to [him]233-mr. woodstock from that point of view . If only [he]233-mr. woodstock had been able to gather round [[his]233-mr. woodstock granddaughter]2541-his granddaughter and [himself]233-mr. woodstock [a circle of [equally respectable friends]2543-equally respectable friends and [acquaintances]1676-acquaintances]2542-a circle of equally respectable friends and acquaintances , [he]233-mr. woodstock would have enjoyed complete satisfaction . Two or three at most there were , whom [he]233-mr. woodstock could venture to bring over with [him]233-mr. woodstock from the old life to the new . For [Ida]101-ida [he]233-mr. woodstock could as yet provide no companionship at all .

But [Ida]101-ida did not feel the want . Since the day of [her]101-ida coming to [the new house]2545-the new house [her]101-ida life had been very full ; so much was passing within , that [she]101-ida desired to escape , rather than discover , new distractions in [the world around [her]101-ida]2546-the world around her . For the week or so during which [Waymark]130-waymark had lain ill , [her]101-ida courage had triumphed over the sufferings to which [she]101-ida was [herself]101-ida a prey ; the beginning of [his]130-waymark recovery brought about a reaction in [her]101-ida state , and for some days [she]101-ida fell into a depressed feebleness almost as extreme as on the first morning of [her]101-ida freedom . It distressed [her]101-ida to be spoken to , and [her]101-ida own lips were all but mute . [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock sometimes sat by [her]101-ida whilst [she]101-ida slept , or seemed to be sleeping ; when [she]101-ida stirred and showed consciousness of [his]233-mr. woodstock presence , [he]233-mr. woodstock left [her]101-ida , so great was [his]233-mr. woodstock fear of annoying [her]101-ida , and thus losing the ground [he]233-mr. woodstock had gained . Once , when [he]233-mr. woodstock was rising to quit [the room]255-the room , [Ida]101-ida held out [her]101-ida hand as if to stay [him]233-mr. woodstock . [She]101-ida was lying on a sofa , and had enjoyed a very quiet sleep .

" [Grandfather]237-grandfather , "[101-ida] [she]101-ida murmured , turning to face [him]233-mr. woodstock . It was the first time [she]101-ida had addressed [him]233-mr. woodstock thus , and [the old man]1383-the old man 's eyes brightened at the sound .

" Are [you]101-ida better for the sleep , [Ida]101-ida ? "[233-mr. woodstock] [he]233-mr. woodstock asked , taking the hand [she]101-ida had extended .

" Much ; much better . How the sun shines ! "[101-ida]

" Yes , it 's a fine day . Do n't [you]101-ida think [you]101-ida could go out a little ? "[101-ida]

" [I]101-ida think [I]101-ida should like to , but [I]101-ida ca n't walk very far , [I]101-ida 'm afraid . "[101-ida]

" [You]101-ida need n't walk at all , [[my]101-ida dear]3165-my dear . [[Your]101-ida carriage]4540-your carriage shall be [here]3335-here whenever [you]101-ida like to order it . "[101-ida]

" [[My]101-ida carriage]4542-my carriage ? "[101-ida]

The exclamation was like [a child]378-a child 's pleased wonder . [She]101-ida coloured a little , and seemed ashamed .

" How is [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark ? "[101-ida] was [her]101-ida next question .

" Nothing much amiss now , [I]101-ida think . [His]130-waymark eyes are painful , [he]130-waymark says , and [he]130-waymark must n't leave [the room]255-the room yet , but it wo n't last much longer . Shall [we]4544-we go together and see [him]130-waymark ? "[101-ida]

[She]101-ida hesitated , but decided to wait till [he]2550-he could come down .

" But [you]2550-he 'll go out , [Ida]101-ida , if [I]101-ida order [the carriage]4545-the carriage ? "[101-ida]

" Thank [you]2550-he , [I]101-ida should like to . "[101-ida]

That first drive had been to [Ida]101-ida a joy unspeakable . To - day for the first time [she]101-ida was able to sweep [her]101-ida mind clear of the dread shadow of brooding , and give [herself]101-ida up to simple enjoyment of the hour .

[Abraham]115-abraham went and told [Waymark]130-waymark of all this as soon as [they]2551-they got back . In the exuberance of [his]2550-he spirits [he]2550-he was half angry with [the invalid]2552-the invalid for being gloomy . [Waymark]130-waymark had by this time shaken off all effects of [his]130-waymark disagreeable adventure , with the exception of a weakness of the eyes ; but convalescence did not work upon [him]130-waymark as in [Ida]101-ida 's case . [He]130-waymark was morose , often apparently sunk in hopeless wretchedness . When [Abraham]115-abraham spoke to [him]2550-he of [Ida]101-ida , [he]2550-he could scarcely be got to reply . Above all , [he]2550-he showed an extreme impatience to recover [his]2550-he health and go back to the ordinary life .

" [I]2550-he shall be able to go for the rents next Monday , "[2550-he] [he]2550-he said to [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock one day .

" [I]2550-he should have thought [you]233-mr. woodstock 'd had enough of that . [I]2550-he 've found [another man]4546-another man for the job . "[2550-he]

" Then what on earth am [I]130-waymark to do ? "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark exclaimed impatiently . " How am [I]130-waymark to get [my]130-waymark living if [you]115-abraham take that work away from [me]130-waymark ? "[130-waymark]

There was something in [the young man]818-the young man 's behaviour which puzzled [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock ; but the key to the puzzle was very shortly given [him]818-the young man . " [I]130-waymark do n't see that it made any difference , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark replied gloomily .

[The old man]1383-the old man was silent . [He]1383-the old man had been , it seemed , under a complete delusion , and could not immediately make up [his]1383-the old man mind whether [he]1383-the old man had indeed ground of complaint against [Waymark]130-waymark .

" Some three months perhaps more . "[425-the latter]

" Well , [I]130-waymark think it would have been better if [you]101-ida 'd been straightforward about it , that 's all . [I]130-waymark do n't know that [I]130-waymark 've anything more to say . [We]4551-we know what [we]4551-we 're about , and there 's an end of it . "[130-waymark]

So saying , [the old man]1383-the old man went out of [the room]255-the room . There was a difference in [him]1383-the old man henceforth , something which [Ida]101-ida noticed , though [she]101-ida could not explain it . On the following day [he]1383-the old man spoke with [her]101-ida on a matter [she]101-ida was surprised to hear [him]1383-the old man mention , [her]101-ida education . [He]1383-the old man had been thinking , [he]1383-the old man said , that [she]101-ida ought to learn to play the piano , and be taught foreign languages . Would n't [she]101-ida like [him]1383-the old man to find [some lady who could live in [the house]288-the house and teach [her]101-ida all these things]2564-some lady who could live in the house and teach her all these things ? [Ida]101-ida 's thoughts at once ran to the conclusion that this had been suggested by [Waymark]130-waymark , and , when [she]101-ida found that [[her]101-ida grandfather]2566-her grandfather really wished it , gave a ready assent . A week or two later [the suitable person]2567-the suitable person had been discovered [a lady of some thirty years of age]2568-a lady of some thirty years of age , by name [Miss Hurst]238-miss hurst . [She]101-ida was agreeable and refined , endowed , moreover , with the tact which was desirable in one undertaking an office such as this . [Ida]101-ida found [her]101-ida companionship pleasant , and [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock con gratulated [himself]233-mr. woodstock on having taken the right step .

At the same time that [the governess]1194-the governess came to [the house]288-the house , [Waymark]130-waymark left [it]288-the house . [He]130-waymark returned to [[his]130-waymark old lodgings]2571-his old lodgings , and , with an independence which was partly [his]130-waymark own impulse , partly the natural result of the slight coolness towards [him]130-waymark which had shown itself in [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock , set to work to find a means of earning [his]130-waymark living . This [he]130-waymark was fortunate enough to discover without any great delay ; [he]130-waymark obtained a place as assistant in [a circulating library]2572-a circulating library . The payment was small , but [he]130-waymark still had [his]130-waymark evenings free .

[Ida]101-ida did not conceal [her]101-ida disappointment when [Abraham]115-abraham conveyed this news to [her]101-ida ; [she]101-ida had been hoping for better things . [Her]101-ida intercourse with [Waymark]130-waymark between [his]130-waymark recovery and [his]130-waymark leaving [the house]288-the house had been difficult , full of evident constraint on both sides . It was the desire of both not to meet alone , and in [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock 's presence [they]2574-they talked of indifferent things , with an artificiality which it was difficult to support , yet impossible to abandon . [They]2574-they shunned [each other]459-each other 's eyes . [Waymark]130-waymark was even less at [his]130-waymark ease than [Ida]101-ida , knowing that [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock observed [him]130-waymark closely at all times . With [[her]101-ida grandfather]2566-her grandfather [Ida]101-ida tried to speak freely of [[their]2574-they friend]2577-their friend , but [she]101-ida too was troubled by the consciousness that [the old man]1383-the old man did not seem as friendly to [Waymark]130-waymark as formerly .

" This will of course only be for a time ? "[101-ida] [she]101-ida said , when told of [Waymark]130-waymark 's new employment .

" [I]115-abraham do n't know , "[115-abraham] [Abraham]115-abraham replied indifferently . " [I]115-abraham should think it will suit [him]130-waymark as well as anything else . "[115-abraham]

" But [he]130-waymark is clever ; [he]130-waymark writes books . Do n't [you]115-abraham think [he]130-waymark will make [himself]130-waymark known some day ? "[115-abraham]

" That kind of thing is n't much to be depended on , it seems to [me]115-abraham . It 's a doubtful business to look forward to for a living . "[115-abraham]

[Ida]101-ida kept silence on the subject after that . [She]101-ida did not seem to brood any longer over sad thoughts , yet it was seldom [she]101-ida behaved or spoke light - heartedly ; [her]101-ida face often indicated an absent mind , but it was the calm musing of [one whose thoughts look to the future and strengthen themselves with hope]2579-one whose thoughts look to the future and strengthen themselves with hope . Times there were when [she]101-ida drew away into solitude , and these were the intervals of doubt and self - questioning . With [[her]101-ida grandfather]2566-her grandfather [she]101-ida was reconciled ; [she]101-ida had become convinced of [his]2566-her grandfather kindness to [her]101-ida , and the far - off past was now seldom in [her]101-ida mind . The trouble originated in the deepest workings of [her]101-ida nature . When [she]101-ida found [herself]101-ida comparing [her]101-ida position now with that of former days , it excited in [her]101-ida a restive mood to think that chance alone had thus raised [her]101-ida out of misery , that the conscious strength and purity of [her]101-ida soul would never have availed to help [her]101-ida to the things which were now within [her]101-ida grasp . The old sense of [the world]622-the world 's injustice excited anger and revolt in [her]101-ida heart . [Chance]239-chance , [chance]239-chance alone befriended [her]101-ida , and the reflection injured [her]101-ida pride . What of [those numberless struggling creatures to whom such happy fortune could never come , who , be [their]2582-those numberless struggling creatures to whom such happy fortune could never come , who , be their aspirations and capabilities what they might aspirations and capabilities what [they]2582-those numberless struggling creatures to whom such happy fortune could never come , who , be their aspirations and capabilities what they might might]2582-those numberless struggling creatures to whom such happy fortune could never come , who , be their aspirations and capabilities what they might , must struggle vainly , agonise , and in the end despair ? [She]101-ida had been lifted out of hell , not risen therefrom by [her]101-ida own strength . Sometimes it half seemed to [her]101-ida that it would have been [the nobler lot]2583-the nobler lot to remain as [she]101-ida was , to share the misery of [that dread realm of darkness]2584-that dread realm of darkness with [those poor disinherited ones]2585-those poor disinherited ones , to cherish that spirit of noble rebellion , the consciousness of which had been as a pure fire on the altar of [her]101-ida being . What was to be [her]101-ida future ? Would [she]101-ida insensibly forget [her]101-ida past self , let [her]101-ida strength subside in refinement it might be , even lose the passion which had made [her]101-ida what [she]101-ida was ?

But hope predominated . Forget ! Could [she]101-ida ever forget those faces in [the slums]2586-the slums on the day when [she]101-ida bade farewell to poverty and all its attendant wretchedness ? [Litany Lane]45-litany lane and [Elm Court]1399-elm court were names which already symbolised a purpose . If ever [she]101-ida still looked at [[her]101-ida grandfather]2566-her grandfather with a remnant of distrust , it was because [she]101-ida thought of [him]2566-her grandfather as drawing money from such a source , enjoying [his]2566-her grandfather life of ease in disregard of the responsibilities laid upon [him]2566-her grandfather . The day would come when [she]101-ida could find courage to speak to [him]2566-her grandfather . [She]101-ida waited and prepared [herself]101-ida .

Prepared [herself]101-ida , for that , and for so much else . [Waymark]130-waymark 's behaviour would have cost [her]101-ida the bitterest misery , had [she]101-ida not been able to explain it to [her]101-ida own satisfaction . There could be but one reason why [he]130-waymark held aloof from [her]101-ida , and that an all - sufficient one . In [her]101-ida new position , it was impossible for [him]130-waymark to be more than just friendly to [her]101-ida . If that had been [his]130-waymark attitude in the old days , how could [his]130-waymark self - respect allow [him]130-waymark to show the slightest change ? In [his]130-waymark anxiety not to do so , [he]130-waymark had even fallen short of the former kindness . No forgiveness was needed , when [she]101-ida felt that [she]101-ida understood [him]130-waymark so well . But all the more did it behove [her]101-ida to make [herself]101-ida worthy of [him]130-waymark in all things . [She]101-ida had still so much to learn ; [she]101-ida was so far [his]130-waymark inferior in culture and understanding . [Her]101-ida studies with [Miss Hurst]238-miss hurst were fruitful . Nor were [her]101-ida domestic duties forgotten . [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock had supplied [her]101-ida with [a good housekeeper]2589-a good housekeeper , to help [her]101-ida inexperience , but [Ida]101-ida took an adequate burden on [her]101-ida own shoulders . This again was a new and keen joy .

[Waymark]130-waymark dined with [them]2590-them one Sunday in June , and , in the course of the evening , went with [Abraham]115-abraham to [the smoking - room]2591-the smoking - room for some private conversation .

" Do [you]233-mr. woodstock remember , "[233-mr. woodstock] [he]233-mr. woodstock began , " once offering to buy those shares of [mine]233-mr. woodstock ? "[233-mr. woodstock]

" Now , look here , "[1383-the old man] [he]1383-the old man said , " there 's something in all this [I]1383-the old man ca n't make out . Is this engagement a serious one ? "[1383-the old man]

[Waymark]130-waymark collected [himself]130-waymark , and spoke gravely .

" [I]449-the other , of course , understand why [you]130-waymark press so for this explanation . [You]130-waymark take it for granted that [Ida]101-ida regards [me]449-the other as something more than [a friend]3409-a friend . [You]130-waymark [yourself]130-waymark will grant so much , [I]449-the other believe . " The plain English of all which , "[115-abraham] cried [Abraham]115-abraham angrily , " is , that , as far as [you]130-waymark are concerned , [you]130-waymark would be quite willing to let [the girl]316-the girl live on false hopes , just to have the pleasure of [her]101-ida society as long as [you]130-waymark care for it . "[115-abraham]

" Not so , not so at all ! [I]233-mr. woodstock value [Ida]101-ida 's friendship as [I]233-mr. woodstock value that of [no other woman]4563-no other woman , and [I]233-mr. woodstock am persuaded that , if [I]233-mr. woodstock were free with [her]101-ida , [I]233-mr. woodstock could reconcile [her]101-ida entirely to [our]4564-our connection remaining one of friendship , and nothing more . "[233-mr. woodstock]

[Waymark]130-waymark , in [his]130-waymark desperate straits , all but persuaded [himself]130-waymark that [he]130-waymark told the truth . [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock gazed at [him]130-waymark in doubt . [He]130-waymark would give [him]130-waymark to the end of [July]241-july to make up [his]130-waymark mind ; by that time [Waymark]130-waymark must either present [himself]130-waymark as [a free man]2597-a free man , or allow [Ida]101-ida to be informed of [his]130-waymark position . In the meanwhile [he]130-waymark must come to [Tottenham]62-tottenham not oftener than once a week . To this [Waymark]130-waymark agreed , glad of any respite .

[He]130-waymark returned to [[his]130-waymark lodgings]1020-his lodgings in a state of nervous misery . Fortunately , [he]130-waymark was not left to [his]130-waymark thoughts ; in a few minutes a knock at [his]130-waymark door announced [a visitor]1377-a visitor in the person of [Mr. O'Gree]142-o'gree . [The Irishman]1000-the irishman exhibited [his]1000-the irishman wonted liveliness , and at once began to relate an incident to the disadvantage of [[his]1000-the irishman archenemy]2601-his archenemy .

" [Faith]242-faith , "[1000-the irishman] [he]1000-the irishman cried , " [I]1000-the irishman 'd have given a trifle if [ye]4565-ye could have heard the conversation between [Tootle]141-dr. tootle and [me]1000-the irishman , just after breakfast yesterday . [The boys]3483-the boys were filing out of [the room]255-the room , when , ' [Mr. O'Gree]142-o'gree ! ' cries [Pendy]243-pendy . ' [Sir]3257-sir ! ' [I]1000-the irishman reply . ' [The boys]3483-the boys were called late this morning , [I]1000-the irishman hear . ' ' No such thing , [sir]3257-sir , ' [I]1000-the irishman assure ' um . ' Half - past six to the minute , by [my]1000-the irishman watch . ' ' Oh , [your]142-o'gree watch , [Mr. O'Gree]142-o'gree , ' cries [the old reprobate]4571-the old reprobate . ' [I]1000-the irishman fear [your]142-o'gree watch does n't keep very good time . ' ' Sure , [you]142-o'gree 're in the right , [sir]3257-sir , ' said [I]1000-the irishman ; ' it 's been losing a little of late ; so only last night [I]1000-the irishman stopped it at half - past six , to make sure it would show [me]1000-the irishman the right calling - time this morning . ' And , when [I]1000-the irishman 'd said that , [I]1000-the irishman just nod [my]1000-the irishman head , as much as to say , ' There 's one for [ye]142-o'gree , [[me]1000-the irishman boy]4573-me boy ! ' and walk off as jaunty as [a Limerick bantam]4574-a limerick bantam . "[1000-the irishman]

Then , after a burst of merriment , [O'Gree]142-o'gree suddenly fixed [his]142-o'gree face in a very grave expression .

" [I]142-o'gree 'm resolved , [Waymark]130-waymark , [I]142-o'gree 'm resolved ! "[142-o'gree] [he]142-o'gree exclaimed . " At midsummer [I]142-o'gree break [my]142-o'gree chains , and stand erect in the dignity of [a free man]2597-a free man . [I]142-o'gree 've said it often , but now [I]142-o'gree mean it . [Sally]105-sally urges [me]142-o'gree to do ut , and [Sally]105-sally never utters a worrud that is n't pure wisdom . "[142-o'gree]

" Well , [I]142-o'gree think [she]105-sally 's right . [I]142-o'gree [myself]142-o'gree should prefer [a scavenger]4576-a scavenger 's existence , on the whole . But have [you]142-o'gree thought any further of the other scheme ? "[142-o'gree]

" The commercial undertaking ? [We]4577-we were talking it over the other night . [Sally]105-sally says : Borrow the money and risk ut . And [I]142-o'gree think [she]105-sally 's in the right . If [you]142-o'gree enter the world of commerce , [you]142-o'gree must be prepared for speculation . [We]4577-we looked over the advertisements in a newspaper , just to get an idea , and [we]4577-we calculated the concern could be set afloat for seventy - five pounds . Out of that [we]4577-we could pay a quarter 's rent , and stock [the shop]361-the shop . [Sally]105-sally 's been behind the counter a good bit of late , and [she]105-sally 's getting an insight into that kind of thing . [Wonderful girl]4579-wonderful girl , [Sally]105-sally ! Put [her]105-sally in [Downing Street]85-downing street for a week , and [she]105-sally 'd be competent to supplant [the Premier]4580-the premier ! "[142-o'gree]

" [You]142-o'gree have decided for [a chandler]3853-a chandler 's ? "[142-o'gree]

" Yes ; [we]4577-we neither of [us]4577-we know much about tobacco , and tobacco perhaps is n't quits the thing for [a man of education]4582-a man of education . But to be [a chandler]3853-a chandler is something worthy of [any man]3690-any man 's ambition . [You]142-o'gree supply at once the solids and the luxuries of life ; [you]142-o'gree range from boiled ham and pickles to mixed biscuits and preserves . [You]142-o'gree are the focus of [a whole street]4585-a whole street . [The father]1878-the father comes to [you]142-o'gree for [his]1878-the father mid - day bread and cheese , [the mother]403-the mother for [her]403-the mother half - ounce of tea , [the child]320-the child for [its]320-the child farthing's - worth of sweets . For years [I]142-o'gree 've been leading a useless life ; once let [me]142-o'gree get into [[my]142-o'gree shop]4589-my shop , and [I]142-o'gree become [a column of the social system]4590-a column of the social system . Faith , it 's as good as done ! "[142-o'gree]

" From whom shall [you]142-o'gree borrow the cash ? "[142-o'gree]

" [Sally]105-sally 's going to think about that point . [I]142-o'gree suppose [we]4591-we shall go to a loan office , and make some kind of arrangement . [I]142-o'gree 'm rather vague on these things , but [Sally]105-sally will find it out . "[142-o'gree]

" [I]130-waymark understand , "[130-waymark] said [Waymark]130-waymark , checking [his]130-waymark amusement , that [you]130-waymark are perfectly serious in this plan ? "[130-waymark]

" As serious as [I]142-o'gree was in the moment of [my]142-o'gree birth ! There 's no other chance . "[142-o'gree]

" Very well , then , suppose [I]130-waymark offer to lend [you]130-waymark the money . "[130-waymark]

" [You]130-waymark , [Waymark]130-waymark ? "[142-o'gree]

" No less [a person]4592-a person . "[130-waymark]

And [he]130-waymark went on to explain how it was that [he]130-waymark was able to make the offer , adding that any sum up to a hundred pounds was at [[his]130-waymark friend]876-his friend 's disposal .

" [Ye]142-o'gree mean it , [Waymark]130-waymark ! "[142-o'gree] cried [O'Gree]142-o'gree , leaping round [the room]255-the room in ecstasy . " [Bedad]147-bedad , [you]147-bedad are [a man]1260-a man and [a brother]4594-a brother , and no mistake ! [Ye're]147-bedad the first that ever offered to lend [me]142-o'gree a penny ; [ye're]147-bedad the first that ever had faith in [me]142-o'gree ! [You]147-bedad shall come with [me]142-o'gree to see [Sally]105-sally on Saturday , and tell [her]105-sally this [yourself]147-bedad , and [I]142-o'gree should n't be surprised if [she]105-sally gives [you]147-bedad a kiss ! "[142-o'gree]

[O'Gree]142-o'gree exhausted [himself]142-o'gree in capering and vociferation , then sat down and began to exercise [his]142-o'gree luxuriant imagination in picturing unheard - of prosperity .

" [We]4595-we 'll take [a shop in [a new neighbourhood]4597-a new neighbourhood]4596-a shop in a new neighbourhood , where [we]4595-we shall have the monopoly . [The people]3247-the people 'll get to know [Sally]105-sally ; [she]105-sally 'll be like a magnet behind the counter . [I]142-o'gree shall go to [the wholesale houses]4599-the wholesale houses , and impress [them]4599-the wholesale houses with a sense of [my]142-o'gree financial stability ; [I]142-o'gree flatter [myself]142-o'gree [I]142-o'gree shall look [the prosperous shopkeeper]4600-the prosperous shopkeeper , eh ? Who knows what [we]4595-we may come to ? Why , in a few years [we]4595-we may transfer [our]4595-we business to [Oxford Street]19-oxford street or [Piccadilly]86-piccadilly , and call [ourselves]4595-we [Italian warehousemen]4601-italian warehousemen ; and bedad , [we]4595-we 'll turn out in the end another Crosse and [Blackwell]244-blackwell , see if [we]4595-we do n't ! "[142-o'gree]

At the utmost limit of the time allowed [him]2604-i by the rules of [The Academy]87-the academy , [the future man of business]2605-the future man of business took [his]2604-i leave , in spirits extravagant even for [him]2604-i .

" [Faith]242-faith , "[2604-i] [he]2604-i exclaimed , when [he]2604-i was already at the door , " who d'ye think [I]2604-i saw last Sunday ? As [I]2604-i was free in the afternoon , [I]2604-i took a walk , and , coming back , [I]2604-i went into [a little coffee - shop]4602-a little coffee - shop for a cup of tea . [A man in an apron]4603-a man in an apron came up to serve [me]2604-i , and , by [me]2604-i soul , if it was n't [poor old Egger]149-egger ! [I]2604-i 've heard not a word of [him]4603-a man in an apron since [he]4603-a man in an apron left last Christmas . [He]4603-a man in an apron was ashamed of [himself]4603-a man in an apron , [poor devil]4604-poor devil ; but [I]2604-i did [my]2604-i best to make [him]4603-a man in an apron easy . After all , [he]4603-a man in an apron 's better off than in the scholastic line . "[2604-i]

[Waymark]130-waymark laughed at this incident , and stood watching [O'Gree]142-o'gree 's progress down [the street]340-the street for a minute or two . Then [he]130-waymark went to [[his]130-waymark room]979-his room again , and sitting down with a sigh , fell into deep brooding .

CHAPTER XXXII

A VISION OF [SIN

Maud Enderby]103-maud 's life at [home]3157-home became ever more solitary . Such daily intercourse as had been established between [[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother and [herself]103-maud grew less and less fruitful of real intimacy , till at length it was felt by [both]771-both to be mere form . [Maud]103-maud strove against this , but there was no corresponding effort on the other side ; [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby showed no dislike for [[her]204-mrs. enderby daughter]542-her daughter , yet unmistakably shunned [her]542-her daughter . If [she]542-her daughter chanced to enter [the sitting - room]290-the sitting - room whilst [Maud]103-maud was [there]3249-there , [she]542-her daughter would , if possible , retreat unobserved ; or else [she]542-her daughter would feign to have come in quest of something , and at once go away with it . [Maud]103-maud could not fail to observe this , and its recurrence struck a chill to [her]103-maud heart . [She]103-maud had not the courage to speak to [[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother ; a deadweight of trouble , a restless spirit of apprehension , made [her]103-maud life one of passive endurance ; [she]103-maud feared to have the unnatural conditions of [[their]2615-their home]2616-their home openly recognised . Very often [her]103-maud thoughts turned to the time when [she]103-maud had found refuge from [herself]103-maud in the daily occupation of teaching , and , had [she]103-maud dared , [she]103-maud would gladly have gone away once more as [a governess]2328-a governess . But [she]103-maud could not bring [herself]103-maud to propose such a step . To do so would necessitate explanations , and that was what [she]103-maud dreaded most of all . Whole days , with the exception of meal - times , [she]103-maud spent in [[her]103-maud own room]1931-her own room , and there [no one]3702-no one ever disturbed [her]103-maud . Sometimes [she]103-maud read , but most often sat in prolonged brooding , heedless of the hours .

[[Her]103-maud father]514-her father was now constantly away from [home]3157-home . [He]514-her father told [her]103-maud that [he]514-her father travelled on business . It scarcely seemed to be a relief to [him]514-her father to rest awhile in [his]514-her father chair ; indeed , [Paul]203-paul had grown incapable of resting . Time was deepening the lines of anxiety on [his]514-her father sallow face . [His]514-her father mind seemed for ever racked with painful calculation . [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby , too , spent much time away from [the house]288-the house , and [Maud]103-maud knew nothing of [her]103-maud engagements . One thing , however , [Maud]103-maud could not help noticing , and that was that [[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother was clearly very extravagant in [her]377-her mother mode of living . New and costly dresses were constantly being purchased , as well as articles of luxury for [the house]288-the house . [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby had of late provided [herself]204-mrs. enderby with [a femme de chambre]2625-a femme de chambre , [a young woman who arrayed [herself]2625-a femme de chambre with magnificence in [her]2625-a femme de chambre mistresses castoff dresses , and whose appearance and demeanour had something the reverse of domestic]2626-a young woman who arrayed herself with magnificence in her mistresses castoff dresses , and whose appearance and demeanour had something the reverse of domestic . [Maud]103-maud almost feared [her]2625-a femme de chambre . Then there was [a hired brougham]2627-a hired brougham constantly in use . Whenever [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby spent an evening at [home]3157-home , [company]2629-company was sure to be entertained ; [noisy and showy people]2630-noisy and showy people filled [the drawing - room]2631-the drawing - room , and remained till late hours . [Maud]103-maud did not even see [their]2630-noisy and showy people faces , but the voices of [one or two men]2632-one or two men and [women]3771-women became only too familiar to [her]103-maud ; even in the retirement of [[her]103-maud room]2268-her room [she]103-maud could not avoid hearing these voices , and they made [her]103-maud shudder . Especially [she]103-maud was conscious of [Mr. Rudge]208-mr. rudge 's presence ; [she]103-maud knew [his]208-mr. rudge very step on the stairs , and waited in feverish apprehension for the first notes of an accompaniment on the piano , which warned [her]103-maud that [he]208-mr. rudge was going to sing . [He]208-mr. rudge had a good voice , and it was often in request . Sometimes the inexplicable dread of [his]208-mr. rudge singing was more than [she]103-maud could bear ; [she]103-maud would hurry on [her]103-maud walking - attire , and , stealing like a shadow down the stairs , would seek refuge in pacing about [the streets of [the neighbourhood]297-the neighbourhood]2635-the streets of the neighbourhood , heedless of weather or the hour .

[Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby never came down to breakfast . One morning , when [Paul]203-paul happened to be at [home]3157-home , [he]203-paul and [Maud]103-maud had finished that meal in silence , and [Maud]103-maud was rising to leave [the room]255-the room , when [[her]103-maud father]514-her father checked [her]103-maud . [He]203-paul leaned over the table towards [her]103-maud , and spoke in an anxious undertone .

" Have [you]103-maud noticed anything a little a little strange in [[your]103-maud mother]3184-your mother lately , [Maud]103-maud ? Anything in [her]3184-your mother way of speaking , [I]203-paul mean [her]3184-your mother general manner ? "[203-paul]

[The girl]316-the girl met [his]203-paul look , and shook [her]316-the girl head . The approach to such a conversation affected [her]316-the girl as with a shock ; [she]316-the girl could not speak .

" [She]3184-your mother has very bad nights , [you]103-maud know , "[203-paul] [Paul]203-paul went on , still in a tone just above a whisper , " and of late [she]3184-your mother has been taking chloral . It 's against [my]203-paul wish , but the relief makes it an irresistible temptation . [I]203-paul fear [I]203-paul am afraid it is having some deleterious effect upon [her]3184-your mother ; [she]3184-your mother seemed to be a little just a little delirious in the night , [I]203-paul thought . "[203-paul]

There was something horrible in [his]203-paul voice and face as [he]203-paul uttered these words ; [he]203-paul shuddered slightly , and [his]203-paul tongue seemed to labour for utterance , as though [he]203-paul dreaded the sound of [his]203-paul own speech .

[Maud]103-maud sat unmoving and silent .

" [I]203-paul thought , also , "[203-paul] [Paul]203-paul went on , " that [she]103-maud appeared a little strange last evening , when [the people]3247-the people were [here]3335-here . [You]103-maud were n't in [the drawing - room]2631-the drawing - room ? "[203-paul]

[Maud]103-maud shook [her]103-maud head again .

" Do [you]103-maud do [you]103-maud think , "[203-paul] [he]203-paul asked , ' [she]103-maud is having too much excitement ? [I]0-i know [she]103-maud needs a life of constant variety ; it is essential to [her]103-maud . [I]0-i 'm sure [you]103-maud understand that , [Maud]103-maud ?
