[You]103-maud [you]103-maud do n't misjudge [her]103-maud ? "[103-maud]

" No , no ; it is necessary to [her]103-maud , "[316-the girl] said [the girl]316-the girl mechanically .

" But , "[514-her father] [[her]103-maud father]514-her father pursued , with still lower voice , " there is always the danger lest [she]103-maud should over - exert [herself]103-maud . Last night [I]514-her father [I]514-her father thought [I]514-her father noticed but it was scarcely worth speaking of ; [I]514-her father am so easily alarmed , [you]103-maud know . "[514-her father]

[Maud]103-maud tried to say something , but in vain .

" [You]103-maud [you]103-maud wo n't desert [her]103-maud quite [Maud]103-maud ? "[514-her father] said [[her]103-maud father]514-her father in a tone of pleading . " [I]514-her father am obliged to be so muck away [God]123-god knows [I]514-her father ca n't help it . And then [I]514-her father [I]514-her father wonder whether [you]103-maud have noticed ? [I]514-her father seem to have little influence with [her]103-maud . "[514-her father]

[He]514-her father stopped , but the next moment forced [himself]514-her father to utter what was in [his]514-her father mind .

" Ca n't [you]103-maud help [me]514-her father a little more , [Maud]103-maud ? Could n't [you]103-maud induce [her]103-maud to live a little more more restfully at times ? "[514-her father]

[She]103-maud rose , pushing the chair back behind [her]103-maud .

" [Father]902-father , [I]103-maud ca n't ! "[103-maud] [she]103-maud cried ; then burst into a passion of tears .

" God help [us]2645-they ! "[514-her father] [[her]103-maud father]514-her father breathed , rising and looking at [her]103-maud in blank misery . But in a moment [she]103-maud had recovered [herself]103-maud . [They]2645-they faced [each other]459-each other for an instant , but [neither]2321-neither ventured to speak again , and [Maud]103-maud turned and left [him]514-her father .

[Waymark]130-waymark came as usual , but now [he]130-waymark seldom saw [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby . [Maud]103-maud received [him]130-waymark alone . There was little that was lover - like in these hours spent together . [They]2645-they kissed [each other]459-each other at meeting and parting , but , with this exception , the manner of both was very slightly different from what it had been before [their]2645-they engagement . [They]2645-they sat apart , and talked of art , literature , religion , seldom of [each other]459-each other . It had come to this by degrees ; at first there had been more warmth , but passion never . [Waymark]130-waymark 's self - consciousness often weighed upon [his]130-waymark tongue , and made [his]130-waymark conversation but a string of commonplaces ; [Maud]103-maud was often silent for long intervals . [Their]2645-they eyes never met in a steady gaze .

[Waymark]130-waymark often asked [himself]130-waymark whether [Maud]103-maud 's was a passionless nature , or whether it was possible that [her]103-maud reserve had the same origin as [his]130-waymark own . The latter [he]130-waymark felt to be unlikely ; sometimes there was a pressure of [her]103-maud hands as [their]2645-they lips just touched , the indication , [he]130-waymark believed , of feeling held in restraint for uncertain reasons . [She]103-maud welcomed [him]130-waymark , too , with a look which [he]130-waymark in vain endeavoured to respond to a look of sudden relief from weariness , of gentle illumination ; it smote [him]130-waymark like a reproach . When the summer had set in , [he]130-waymark was glad to change the still room for the open air ; [they]2645-they walked frequently about [Regent 's Park]5-regent 's park , and lingered till after sunset .

One evening , when it was dull and threatened rain , [they]2645-they returned to [the house]288-the house sooner than usual . [Waymark]130-waymark would have taken [his]130-waymark leave at the door , as [he]130-waymark ordinarily did , but [Maud]103-maud begged [him]130-waymark to enter , if only for a few minutes . It was not quite nine o'clock , and [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby was from [home]3157-home .

[He]130-waymark seated [himself]130-waymark , but [Maud]103-maud remained standing irresolutely . [Waymark]130-waymark glanced at [her]103-maud from under [his]130-waymark eyebrows . [He]130-waymark did not find it easy to speak ; [they]2645-they had both been silent since [they]2645-they left [the park]600-the park , with the exception of the few words exchanged at the door .

" Will [you]130-waymark let [me]103-maud sit here ? "[103-maud] [Maud]103-maud asked suddenly , pushing a footstool near to [his]130-waymark chair , and kneeling upon it .

[He]130-waymark smiled and nodded .

" When will [they]4610-they begin the printing ? "[103-maud] [she]103-maud asked , referring to [his]130-waymark book , which was now in the hands of [the publisher who had undertaken it]2653-the publisher who had undertaken it .

" Not for some months . It ca n't come out till the winter season . "[103-maud]

" If it should succeed , it will make a great difference in [your]130-waymark position , wo n't it ? "[103-maud]

" It might , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark replied , looking away .

[She]103-maud sat with [her]103-maud eyes fixed on the ground . [She]103-maud wished to continue , but something stayed [her]103-maud .

" [I]130-waymark do n't much count upon it , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark said , when [he]130-waymark could no longer endure the silence . " [We]4611-we must n't base any hopes on that . "[130-waymark]

[He]130-waymark rose ; the need of changing [his]130-waymark attitude seemed imperative .

" Must [you]130-waymark go ? "[103-maud] [Maud]103-maud asked , looking up at [him]130-waymark with eyes which spoke all that [her]103-maud voice failed to utter .

[He]130-waymark moved [his]130-waymark head affirmatively , and held out [his]130-waymark hand to raise [her]103-maud . [She]103-maud obeyed [his]130-waymark summons , and stood up before [him]130-waymark ; [her]103-maud eyes had fixed themselves upon [his]130-waymark ; [he]130-waymark could not avoid [their]2654-their strange gaze .

" Good - bye , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark said .

[Her]103-maud free hand rose to [his]130-waymark shoulder , upon which it scarcely rested . [He]130-waymark could not escape [her]103-maud eyes , though to meet them tortured [him]130-waymark . [Her]103-maud lips were moving , but [he]130-waymark could distinguish no syllable ; they moved again , and [he]130-waymark could just gather the sense of [her]103-maud whisper .

" Do [you]130-waymark love [me]103-maud ? "[103-maud]

An immense pity thrilled through [him]130-waymark . [He]130-waymark put [his]130-waymark arm about [her]103-maud , held [her]103-maud closely , and pressed [his]130-waymark lips against [her]103-maud cheek . [She]103-maud reddened , and hid [her]103-maud face against [him]130-waymark . [Waymark]130-waymark touched [her]103-maud hair caressingly , then freed [his]130-waymark other hand , and went from [the room]255-the room .

[Maud]103-maud sat in thought till a loud ring at the door - bell made [her]103-maud start and flee [upstairs]434-upstairs . [The room in which [she]103-maud and [Waymark]130-waymark sat when [they]2658-they were by [themselves]2658-they]2657-the room in which she and waymark sat when they were by themselves was in no danger of invasion , but [she]103-maud feared the possibility of meeting [[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother to - night . [[Her]103-maud father]514-her father was away from [home]3157-home , as usual , but the days of [his]514-her father return were always uncertain , and [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby might perchance open the door of [the little sitting - room]2662-the little sitting - room just to see whether [he]514-her father was [there]3249-there , as it was here [he]514-her father ordinarily employed [himself]514-her father when in [the house]288-the house . From [[her]103-maud bedroom]2665-her bedroom [Maud]103-maud could hear [several people]3969-several people ascend the stairs . It was ten o'clock , but an influx of [visitors at such an hour]2667-visitors at such an hour was nothing remarkable . [She]103-maud could hear [[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother 's laugh , and then the voice of [a man]1260-a man , a voice [she]103-maud knew but too well that of [Mr. Budge]224-mr. budge .

[Her]103-maud nerves were excited . The night was close , and there were mutterings of thunder at times ; the cloud whence they came seemed to [her]103-maud to spread its doleful blackness over this one roof . An impulse seized [her]103-maud ; [she]103-maud took paper and sat down at [her]103-maud desk to write . It was a letter to [Waymark]130-waymark , a letter such as [she]103-maud had never addressed to [him]130-waymark , and which , even in writing it , [she]103-maud was conscious [she]103-maud could not send . [Her]103-maud hand trembled as [she]103-maud filled the pages with burning words . [She]103-maud panted for more than [he]130-waymark had given [her]103-maud ; this calm , half - brotherly love of [his]130-waymark was just now like a single drop of water to [one dying of thirst]2670-one dying of thirst ; [she]103-maud cried to [him]130-waymark for a deeper draught of the joy of life . The words came to [her]103-maud without need of thought ; tears fell hot from [her]103-maud eyes and blotted what [she]103-maud wrote .

The tears brought [her]103-maud relief ; [she]103-maud was able to throw [her]103-maud writing aside , and by degrees to resume that dull , vacant mood of habitual suffering which at all events could be endured . From this , too , there was at times a retreat possible with the help of a book . [She]103-maud had no mind to sleep , and on looking round , [she]103-maud remembered that the book [she]103-maud had been reading in the early part of the day was [downstairs]445-downstairs . It was after midnight , and [she]103-maud seemed to have a recollection of hearing [the visitors]662-the visitors leave [the house]288-the house a little while ago ; it would be safe to venture as far as [the sitting - room below]2674-the sitting - room below .

[She]103-maud began to descend the stairs quietly . There was still a light in [the hall]2675-the hall , but the quietness of [the house]288-the house reassured [her]103-maud . On turning an angle of the stairs , however , [she]103-maud saw that the door of [the drawing - room]2631-the drawing - room was open , and that just within stood two figures [[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother and [Mr. Rudge]208-mr. rudge . [They]2679-they seemed to be whispering together , and in the same moment [their]2679-they lips met . Then [the man]491-the man came out and went [downstairs]445-downstairs . [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby turned back into [the drawing - room]2631-the drawing - room .

[Maud]103-maud stood fixed to the spot . Darkness had closed in around [her]103-maud , and [she]103-maud clung to the banisters to save [herself]103-maud from the gulf which seemed to yawn before [her]103-maud feet . The ringing of a bell , the drawing - room bell summoning [[Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby 's maid]2683-mrs. enderby 's maid , brought [her]103-maud back to consciousness , and with trembling limbs [she]103-maud regained [[her]103-maud room]2268-her room . It was as though some ghastly vision of the night had shaken [her]103-maud soul . The habit of [her]103-maud mind overwhelmed [her]103-maud with the conviction that [she]103-maud knew at last the meaning of that mystery of horror which had of late been strengthening its hold upon [her]103-maud imagination . The black cloud which lowered above [the house]288-the house had indeed its significance ; the voices which wailed to [her]103-maud of sin and woe were the true expression of things amid which [she]103-maud had been moving unconsciously . That instinct which made [her]103-maud shrink from [[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother 's presence was not without its justification ; the dark powers which circled [her]103-maud existence had not vainly forced their influence upon [her]103-maud . [Her]103-maud first impulse was to flee from [the house]288-the house ; the air breathed pestilence and death , death of the soul . Looking about [her]103-maud in the anguish of conflicting thoughts , [her]103-maud eyes fell upon the pages [she]103-maud had written . These now came before [her]103-maud as a proof of contagion which had seized upon [her]103-maud own nature ; [she]103-maud tore the letter hastily into fragments , and , striking fire with a match , consumed them in the grate . As [she]103-maud watched the sparks go out , there came a rustling of dresses past [her]103-maud door . [She]103-maud flung [herself]103-maud upon [her]103-maud knees and sought refuge in wild , wordless prayer .

A fortnight after this [Maud]103-maud went late in the evening to [the room where [she]103-maud knew [[her]103-maud father]514-her father was sitting alone]2688-the room where she knew her father was sitting alone . [Paul Enderby]203-paul looked up from [his]203-paul papers in surprise ; it was some time since [Maud]103-maud had sought private conversation with [him]203-paul . As [he]203-paul met [her]103-maud pale , resolute face , [he]203-paul knew that [she]103-maud had a serious purpose in thus visiting [him]203-paul , and [his]203-paul look changed to one of nervous anticipation .

" Do [I]103-maud disturb [you]203-paul , [father]902-father ? "[103-maud] [Maud]103-maud asked . " Could [you]203-paul spare [me]103-maud a few minutes ? "[103-maud]

[Paul]203-paul nodded , and [she]103-maud took a seat near [him]203-paul .

" [Father]902-father , [I]103-maud am going to leave [home]3157-home , going to be [a governess]2328-a governess again . "[103-maud]

[He]203-paul drew a sigh of relief ; [he]203-paul had expected something worse than this . Yet the relief was only for a moment , and then [he]203-paul looked at [her]103-maud with eyes which made [her]103-maud soul fail for very compassion .

" [You]103-maud will desert [me]203-paul , [Maud]103-maud ? "[203-paul] [he]203-paul asked , trying to convey in [his]203-paul look that which [he]203-paul could not utter in words .

" [Father]245-father , [I]203-paul can be of no help , and [I]203-paul feel that [I]203-paul must not remain [here]3335-here . "[203-paul]

" Have [you]203-paul found a place ? "[203-paul]

" This afternoon [I]203-paul engaged [myself]203-paul to go to [Paris]88-paris with [a French family]4617-a french family . [They]4617-a french family have been in [England]15-england some time , and want to take back [an English governess for [[their]4617-a french family children]4619-their children]4618-an english governess for their children . "[203-paul]

[Paul]203-paul was silent .

" [I]2690-her leave the day after to - morrow , "[2690-her] [she]2690-her added ; at first [she]2690-her had feared to say how soon [she]2690-her was to go .

" [You]2690-her are right , "[514-her father] [[her]2690-her father]514-her father said , shifting some papers about with a tremulous hand . " [You]2690-her are right to leave [us]4620-us . [You]2690-her at least will be safe . "[514-her father]

" Safe ? "[2690-her] [she]2690-her asked , under [her]2690-her breath .

[He]514-her father looked at [her]2690-her in the same despairing way , but said nothing .

" [Father]245-father , "[2690-her] [she]2690-her began , [her]2690-her lips quivering in the intensity of [her]2690-her inward struggle , " can [you]245-father not go away from here ? Can [you]245-father not take [mother]375-mother away ? "[2690-her]

[They]2692-they gazed at [each other]459-each other , each trying to divine what it was that made [the other]449-the other so pale . Did [[her]2690-her father]514-her father know ? [Maud]103-maud asked [herself]103-maud . Did [Maud]103-maud know something more than [he]514-her father [himself]514-her father ? was the doubt in [Paul]203-paul 's mind . But [they]2692-they were thinking of different things .

" [I]2696-the wretched man ca n't , [I]2696-the wretched man ca n't ! "[2696-the wretched man] [the wretched man]2696-the wretched man exclaimed , spreading out [his]2696-the wretched man arms on the desk . " Perhaps in a few months but [I]2696-the wretched man doubt . [I]2696-the wretched man can do nothing now ; [I]2696-the wretched man am helpless ; [I]2696-the wretched man am not [[my]2696-the wretched man own master]4622-my own master . O God , if [I]2696-the wretched man could but go and leave it all behind [me]2696-the wretched man ! "[2696-the wretched man]

[Maud]103-maud could only guess at the meaning of this . [He]514-her father had already hinted to [her]103-maud of business troubles which were crushing [him]514-her father . But this was a matter of no moment in [her]103-maud sight . There was something more terrible , and [she]103-maud could not force [her]103-maud tongue to speak of it .

" [You]203-paul fear for [her]103-maud ? "[203-paul] [Paul]203-paul went on . " [You]203-paul have noticed [her]103-maud strangeness ? "[203-paul] [He]203-paul lowered [his]203-paul voice . " What can [I]203-paul do , [Maud]103-maud ? "[203-paul]

" [You]514-her father are so much away , "[103-maud] [she]103-maud said hurriedly , laying [her]103-maud hand on [his]514-her father arm . " [Her]103-maud visitors [she]103-maud has so many temptations "[103-maud]

" Temptations ? "[203-paul]

" [Father]245-father , help [her]103-maud against [herself]103-maud ! "[103-maud]

" [My]203-paul help is vain . There is a curse on [her]103-maud life , and on [mine]203-paul . [I]203-paul can only stand by and wait for the worst . "[203-paul]

[She]103-maud could not speak . It was [her]103-maud duty , clearly [her]103-maud imperative duty , yet [she]103-maud durst not fulfil it . [She]103-maud had come down from [[her]103-maud room]2268-her room with the fixed purpose , attained after nights of sleepless struggle , of telling [him]514-her father what [she]103-maud had seen . [She]103-maud found [herself]103-maud alone again , the task unfulfilled . And [she]103-maud knew that [she]103-maud could not face [him]514-her father again .

CHAPTER XXXIII

[A GARDEN - PARTY]2698-a garden - party

[Waymark]130-waymark received with astonishment [Maud]103-maud 's letter from [Paris]88-paris . [He]514-her father had seen [her]103-maud only two days before , and [their]2699-they conversation had been of the ordinary kind ; [Maud]103-maud had given [him]514-her father no hint of [her]103-maud purpose , not even when [he]514-her father spoke to [her]103-maud of the coming holiday season , and the necessity of [her]103-maud having a change . [She]103-maud confessed [she]103-maud was not well . Sometimes , when [they]2699-they had both sat for some minutes in silence , [she]103-maud would raise [her]103-maud eyes and meet [his]514-her father gaze steadily , seeming to search for something . [Waymark]130-waymark could not face this look ; it drove [him]514-her father to break the suspense by any kind of remark on an indifferent subject . [He]130-waymark remembered now that [she]103-maud had gazed at [him]514-her father in that way persistently on the last evening that [they]2699-they were together . When [he]514-her father was saying good - bye , and as [he]514-her father bent to kiss [her]103-maud , [she]103-maud held [him]514-her father back for a moment , and seemed to wish to say something . Doubtless [she]103-maud had been on the point of telling [him]514-her father that [she]103-maud was going away ; but [she]103-maud let [him]514-her father leave in silence .

It was not a long letter that [she]103-maud wrote ; [she]103-maud merely said that change had become indispensable to body and soul , and that it had seemed best to make it suddenly .

" [I]103-maud hope , "[103-maud] [she]103-maud wrote in conclusion , " that [you]514-her father will see [[my]103-maud father]3353-my father as often as [you]514-her father can ; [he]3353-my father is very much in need of friendly company , and [I]103-maud should like [you]514-her father to be able to send [me]103-maud news of [him]3353-my father . Do not fear for [me]103-maud ; [I]103-maud feel already better . [I]103-maud am always with [you]514-her father in spirit , and in the spirit [I]103-maud love [you]514-her father ; [God]123-god help [me]103-maud to keep [my]103-maud love pure ! "[103-maud]

[Waymark]130-waymark put away the letter carelessly ; the first sensation of surprise over , [he]130-waymark did not even care to speculate on the reasons which had led [Maud]103-maud to leave [home]3157-home . It was but seldom now that [his]130-waymark thoughts busied themselves with [Maud]103-maud ; the unreal importance which [she]103-maud had for a time assumed in [his]130-waymark life was only a recollection ; [her]103-maud very face was ghostlike in [his]130-waymark mind 's eye , dim , always vanishing . If the news of [her]103-maud departure from [England]15-england moved [him]130-waymark at all , it was with a slight sense of satisfaction ; it would be so much easier to write letters to [her]103-maud than to speak face to face . Yet , in the days that followed , the ghostlike countenance hovered more persistently before [him]130-waymark than was its wo nt ; there was a far - off pleading in its look , and sometimes that shadow of reproach which [our]2701-our uneasy conscience will cast upon the faces of those [we]2701-our have wronged . This passed , however , and another image , one which had ever grown in clearness and persistency of presentment in proportion as [Maud]103-maud 's faded away , glided before [him]130-waymark in the hours of summer sunlight , and shone forth with the beauty of a rising star against the clouded heaven of [his]130-waymark dreams .

[Waymark]130-waymark 's mood was bitter , but , in spite of [himself]130-waymark , it was no longer cynical . [He]130-waymark could not indulge [himself]130-waymark in that pessimistic scepticism which had aided [him]130-waymark in bearing [his]130-waymark poverty , and the restless craving of sense and spirit which had accompanied it . [His]130-waymark enthusiasm for art was falling away ; as a faith it had failed [him]130-waymark in [his]130-waymark hour of need . In its stead another faith had come to [him]130-waymark , a faith which [he]130-waymark felt to be all - powerful , and the sole stay of [a man]1260-a man 's life amid the shifting shadows of intellectual creeds . And it had been revealed too late . Led by perverse motives , now no longer intelligible , [he]130-waymark had reached a goal of mere frustration ; between [him]130-waymark and the true end of [his]130-waymark being there was a great gulf fixed .

To [Ida]101-ida , in the meanwhile , these weeks of early summer were bringing health of body and cheerfulness of mind . [She]101-ida spent very much of [her]101-ida time in the open air . Whenever it was possible [she]101-ida and [Miss Hurst]238-miss hurst took [their]2703-their books out into [the garden]747-the garden , and let the shadows of the rose - bushes mark the hours for [them]2703-their . [Ida]101-ida 's natural vigour throve on the strength - giving properties of sun and breeze the last traces of unwholesome pallor passed from [her]101-ida face , and exercise sent [her]101-ida [home]3157-home flushed like the dawn .

One afternoon [she]101-ida went to sit with [[her]101-ida grandfather]2566-her grandfather on a bench beneath an apple - tree . [The old man]1383-the old man had [his]1383-the old man pipe and a newspaper . [Ida]101-ida was quiet , and glancing at [her]101-ida presently , [Abraham]115-abraham found [her]101-ida eyes fixed upon [him]2566-her grandfather .

" [Grandfather]237-grandfather , "[101-ida] [she]101-ida said , in [her]101-ida gentlest voice , " will [you]237-grandfather let [me]101-ida give a garden - party some day next week ? "[101-ida]

" A party ? "[233-mr. woodstock] [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock raised [his]233-mr. woodstock brows in astonishment . " Who are [you]101-ida going to invite ? "[101-ida]

" [You]237-grandfather 'll think it a strange notion . [I]233-mr. woodstock wonder whether [I]233-mr. woodstock can make it seem as delightful to [you]237-grandfather as it does to [me]233-mr. woodstock . Suppose [we]4624-we went to [those houses of]4625-those houses of [yours]237-grandfather , and got together [as many poor little girls as [we]4624-we could]4626-as many poor little girls as we could , and brought [them]4626-as many poor little girls as we could all here to spend an afternoon in [the garden]747-the garden . Think what an unheard - of thing it would be to [them]4626-as many poor little girls as we could ! And then [we]4624-we would give [them]4626-as many poor little girls as we could some tea , and take [them]4626-as many poor little girls as we could back again before dark . "[233-mr. woodstock]

The proposal filled [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock with dismay , and the habitual hardness of [his]233-mr. woodstock face suggested a displeasure [he]233-mr. woodstock did not in reality feel .

" As [you]237-grandfather say , it 's a strange notion , "[233-mr. woodstock] [he]233-mr. woodstock remarked , smiling very slightly . " [I]233-mr. woodstock do n't know why [you]237-grandfather should n't have [your]237-grandfather own way , [Ida]101-ida , but it 'll cost [you]237-grandfather a good deal of trouble , [you]237-grandfather know . "[233-mr. woodstock]

" [You]237-grandfather are mistaking [me]2708-her , [grandfather]4628-grandfather . [You]237-grandfather think this a curious whim [I]2708-her have got into [my]2708-her head , and [your]237-grandfather kindness would tempt [you]237-grandfather to let [me]2708-her do a silly thing just for the sake of having [my]2708-her way . It is no foolish fancy . It 's not for [my]2708-her sake , but for [the children]253-the children 's . "[2708-her]

[Her]2708-her eyes were aglow with earnestness , and [her]2708-her voice trembled .

" Do [you]2708-her think [they]253-the children 'd care for it ? "[2708-her] asked [[her]2708-her grandfather]2566-her grandfather , impressed by something in [her]2708-her which [he]2566-her grandfather had never seen before .

" Care for it ! Imagine a poor little thing that has been born in [a wretched , poverty - stricken , disorderly home]4630-a wretched , poverty - stricken , disorderly home , [a home that is no home]4631-a home that is no home , and growing up with no knowledge of anything but those four hateful walls and [the street outside]4632-the street outside . No toys , no treats , no change of air ; playing in the gutter , never seeing a beautiful thing , never hearing of the pleasures which [[rich people]4633-rich people 's children]4634-rich people 's children would pine and die without And [a child]378-a child for all that . "[2708-her]

[Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock cleared [his]233-mr. woodstock throat and smoothed the newspaper upon [his]233-mr. woodstock knee .

" How will [you]2708-her get [them]253-the children [here]3335-here , [Ida]101-ida ? "[233-mr. woodstock]

" Oh , leave that to [me]233-mr. woodstock ! Let [us]4637-us choose a day ; would n't Saturday be best ! [I]233-mr. woodstock will go [there]3249-there [myself]233-mr. woodstock , and pick out [the children]253-the children , and get [[their]253-the children mothers]4640-their mothers to promise to have [them]253-the children ready . Then [I]233-mr. woodstock 'll arrange to have [one of those carts [you]101-ida see]4641-one of those carts you see at Sunday - school treats . Why , the ride here , that alone ! And [you]101-ida 'll let [me]233-mr. woodstock have tea for [them]253-the children , just bread and butter and a bun , it will cost not half as much as [my]233-mr. woodstock new dress this week , not half as much "[233-mr. woodstock]

" Come , come , [I]115-abraham ca n't stand this ! "[115-abraham] growled out [Abraham]115-abraham , getting up from the seat . " [I]115-abraham 'd give [them]253-the children [the garden]747-the garden , for good and all , rather than see [you]101-ida like that . Say Saturday , if it 's fine ; if not , Monday , or when [you]101-ida like . "[115-abraham]

On the following morning the details were arranged , and the next day [Ida]101-ida went to [Litany Lane]45-litany lane . [She]101-ida preferred to go alone , and on this errand [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock would have found a difficulty in accompanying [her]101-ida . [Ida]101-ida knew exactly the nature of the task [she]101-ida had taken in hand , and found it easier than it would have been to [the ordinary young lady]2710-the ordinary young lady . [She]101-ida jotted down the names of [some twenty little girls , selecting such as were between the ages of eight and twelve]2711-some twenty little girls , selecting such as were between the ages of eight and twelve , and obtained promises that all should be ready at a fixed hour next Saturday . [She]101-ida met with doubts and objections and difficulties enough , but only failed in one or two instances . Then followed fresh talks with [[her]101-ida grandfather]2566-her grandfather , and all the details were arranged .

There was rain on the Thursday and Friday , but when [Ida]101-ida drew up [her]101-ida blind at six o'clock on Saturday morning , the sky gave promise of good things . [She]101-ida was walking in [the garden]747-the garden long before breakfast - time , and gladdened to rapture as [she]101-ida watched the sun gain power , till it streamed gloriously athwart cloudless blue . By one o'clock [she]101-ida was at the end of [Litany Lane]45-litany lane , where [the cart]2714-the cart with long seats was already waiting ; [its]2714-the cart arrival had become known to [the little ones]2715-the little ones , and [very few needed summoning]2716-very few needed summoning . Of course there were disappointments now and again . In spite of [mothers]3229-mothers ' promises , [half the children]2718-half the children had [their]2718-half the children usual dirty faces , and showed no sign of any preparation . Five or six of [them]2718-half the children had nothing to put on [their]2718-half the children heads ; two had bare feet . It was too late to see to these things now ; as they were , [the children]253-the children clambered , or were lifted , on to [the cart]2714-the cart , and [Ida]101-ida took [her]101-ida seat among [them]253-the children . Then a crack of [the driver]2721-the driver 's whip , and amid the shouts of [envious brothers]2722-envious brothers and [sisters]1066-sisters , and before the wondering stare of [the rest of [the population]2725-the population]2724-the rest of the population , off [they]253-the children drove away .

" Who 'd like an apple ? "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida asked , as soon as [they]253-the children were well clear of [the narrow streets]2726-the narrow streets . There was a general scream of delight , and from a hamper by [her]101-ida side [she]101-ida brought out apples and distributed them . Only for a minute or two had there been anything like shyness in [Ida]101-ida 's presence ; [she]101-ida knew how to talk and behave to [these poor little waifs]2727-these poor little waifs . [Her]101-ida eyes filled with tears as [she]101-ida listened to [their]253-the children chatter among [themselves]253-the children , and recognised so many a fragment of [her]101-ida own past life . [One child]2728-one child , who sat close by [her]101-ida , had been spending the morning in washing vegetables for the Saturday - night market . Did not that call to mind something ? so far off ; so far , yet nearer to [her]101-ida than many things which had intervened . How [they]253-the children all laughed , as [the big , black houses]2729-the big , black houses gave way to [brighter streets]2730-brighter streets , and these again began to open upon glimpses of [field]2731-field or [garden]2732-garden ! Not one of [them]253-the children had the slightest conception of whither [they]253-the children were being taken , or what was to happen to [them]253-the children at length . But [they]253-the children had confidence in " [the lady]262-the lady . "[253-the children] [She]101-ida was [a sorceress]2733-a sorceress in [their]253-the children eyes ; what limit could there be to [her]101-ida powers ? Something good and joyous awaited [them]253-the children ; that was all [they]253-the children knew or cared ; leagues of happiness , stretching away to the remote limits of the day 's glory ; a present rapture beyond knowledge , and a memory for ever .

[Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock stood within the gate of [the garden]747-the garden , [his]233-mr. woodstock hands in [his]233-mr. woodstock pockets , and as [the vehicle]2320-the vehicle came in sight [he]233-mr. woodstock drew just a little back .

[They]253-the children streamed along [the carriage - drive]2736-the carriage - drive , and in a minute or two were all clustered upon [the lawn behind [the house]288-the house]2737-the lawn behind the house . What was expected of [them]253-the children ? Had [an angel]2739-an angel taken [them]253-the children by [he]2739-an angel hand and led [them]253-the children straight from [Litany Lane]45-litany lane through the portals of [paradise]2740-paradise , [they]253-the children could not have been more awed and bewildered . Trees and rose - bushes , turf and beds of flowers , seats in the shade , skipping - ropes thrown about on the open and there , hark , a hand - organ , a better one than ever [they]253-the children danced to on the pavement , striking up to make [them]253-the children merry . That was the happiest thought ! It was something not too unfamiliar ; the one joyful thing of which [they]253-the children had experience meeting [them]253-the children here to smooth over the first introduction to [a new world]2741-a new world . [Ida]101-ida knew it well , the effect of that organ ; had it not lightened [her]101-ida heart many and many a time in the by - gone darkness ? [Two of [the girls]373-the girls]2742-two of the girls had caught [each other]459-each other by the waist at the first sounds . Might [they]2742-two of the girls ? Would " [the lady]262-the lady "[2742-two of the girls] like it ?

[Miss Hurst]238-miss hurst had come out as soon as the music began , and [Ida]101-ida ran to talk with [her]238-miss hurst . There was whispering between [them]2742-two of the girls , and pointing to one and another of [the children]253-the children , and then [the governess , with a pleased face]2746-the governess , with a pleased face , disappeared again . [She]2746-the governess , with a pleased face was away some time , but on [her]2746-the governess , with a pleased face return [two of [the children]253-the children]2747-two of the children were called into [the house]288-the house . Bare - footed [they]2747-two of the children went in , but came forth again with shoes and stockings on , hardly able to comprehend what had happened to [them]2747-two of the children . Then were summoned those who had nothing on [their]2747-two of the children heads , and to each of these a straw hat was given , a less wonderful possession than the shoes and stockings , but a source of gladness and pride .

In the meantime , however , marvels had accumulated on [the lawn]2750-the lawn . Whilst yet the organ was playing , there appeared [two men]2751-two men , one of [them]2751-two men carrying a big drum , [the other hidden under a Punch and Judy show]2752-the other hidden under a punch and judy show . Of a sudden there sounded a shrill note , high above the organ , a fluting from the bottom to the top of the gamut , the immemorial summons to [children]3150-children , the overture to the primitive drama . It was drowned in a scream of welcome , which , in its turn , was outdone by thunderous peals upon the drum .

[Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock said little during the whole afternoon . Perhaps [he]233-mr. woodstock thought the more .

Tables had been fixed in one part of [the garden]747-the garden , and as the drama of Punch drew to an end , its interest found a serious rival in the spectacle of piled plates of cake . But there was to intervene nearly half - an - hour before the tea - urns were ready to make an appearance . The skipping - ropes came into requisition outside , but in [the house]288-the house was proceeding simultaneously a rather more serious pastime , which fell to [Ida]101-ida 's share to carry out . Choosing [the little girl whose face was the dirtiest and hair the untidiest of any]2756-the little girl whose face was the dirtiest and hair the untidiest of any [she]101-ida could see , [she]101-ida led [her]2756-the little girl whose face was the dirtiest and hair the untidiest of any gently away to [a place where a good bowl of warm water and plenty of soap were at hand]2757-a place where a good bowl of warm water and plenty of soap were at hand , and , with the air of bestowing the greatest kindness of all , fell to work to such purpose that in a few minutes [the child]320-the child went back to [the garden]747-the garden a resplendent being , positively clean and kempt for the first time in [her]320-the child life .

" [I]101-ida know [you]2760-the astonished maiden 'll feel uncomfortable for a little , [dear]3177-dear , "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida said , dismissing [the astonished maiden]2760-the astonished maiden with a kiss , " but the strangeness will wear off ; and [you]2760-the astonished maiden 'll see how much nicer it is . "[101-ida]

One after another , all were dealt with in this way , presently with [a good - natured servant - girl]2761-a good - natured servant - girl 's assistance , as time pressed . The result was that [a transformed company]2762-a transformed company sat down to tea . The feeling wore off , as [Ida]101-ida said , but at first cleanliness meant positive discomfort , taking the form of loss of identity and difficulty of mutual recognition . [They]2762-a transformed company looked at [their]2762-a transformed company hands , and were amazed at the whiteness that had come upon [them]2762-a transformed company ; [they]2762-a transformed company kept feeling [their]2762-a transformed company faces and [their]2762-a transformed company ordered hair . But the appetite of one and all was improved by the process .

" How [I]101-ida wish [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark was [here]3335-here ! "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida said to [[her]101-ida grandfather]2566-her grandfather , as [they]2762-a transformed company stood together , watching the feast . " [He]130-waymark would enjoy it . [We]2762-a transformed company must give [him]130-waymark a full account to - morrow , must n't [we]2762-a transformed company ? "[101-ida]

" [I]449-the other forgot , "[449-the other] replied [the other]449-the other . " [I]449-the other had a note from [him]130-waymark this morning , saying [he]130-waymark thought [he]130-waymark should n't be able to come . "[449-the other]

The first shadow of disappointment which this day had brought fell upon [the girl]316-the girl 's countenance . [She]101-ida made no reply , and presently went to help one or [the youngest children]2766-the youngest children , who had spilt [her]101-ida tea and was in evident distress .

After tea the organ struck up again , and again there was dancing on [the lawn]2750-the lawn . Then a gathering of flowers by [Ida]101-ida and [Miss Hurst]238-miss hurst , and one given to [each of [the children]253-the children]2768-each of the children , with injunctions to put it in water on reaching [home]3157-home , and keep it as long as possible in memory of the day . Already the sun was westering , and [Litany Lane]45-litany lane must be reached before dusk .

" [Poor children]4647-poor children ! "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida sighed to [herself]101-ida . " If [they]4647-poor children had but homes to go to ! "[101-ida] And added , in [her]101-ida thought , " [We]4648-we shall see , [we]4648-we shall see ! "[101-ida]

Every bit as joyous as the ride out was the return to [town]901-town . With foresight , [Ida]101-ida made [the two youngest]1195-the two youngest sit on each side of [her]101-ida ; soon the little heads were drooping in [her]101-ida lap , subdued by the very weariness of bliss . [Miss Hurst]238-miss hurst had offered to accompany [Ida]101-ida , that [she]101-ida might not have to come back alone , but [Ida]101-ida wanted [[her]101-ida friends]520-her friends all to [herself]101-ida , and was rewarded by the familiarity with which [they]520-her friends gossipped to [her]101-ida all the way .

" Hands up , all those who have n't enjoyed [themselves]520-her friends ! "[101-ida] [she]101-ida exclaimed , just as [they]520-her friends were entering [the noisy streets]2774-the noisy streets .

There was a moment 's doubt , then a burst of merry laughter .

" Hands up , [all those who would like to come again]4649-all those who would like to come again ! "[101-ida]

[All]2775-all held up both arms except [the two children who were asleep]2776-the two children who were asleep .

" Well , [you]2777-the children of litany lane and elm court 've all been good , and [I]2775-all 'm very pleased with [you]2777-the children of litany lane and elm court , and [you]2777-the children of litany lane and elm court shall come again ! "[2775-all]

It was the culmination of the day 's delight . For the first time in [their]520-her friends lives [the children of [Litany Lane]45-litany lane and [Elm Court]46-elm court]2777-the children of litany lane and elm court had something to look forward to .

CHAPTER XXXIV

A LATE REVENGE

[Ida]101-ida clung to the possibility of [Waymark]130-waymark 's paying [his]130-waymark usual visit on the Sunday , but [she]101-ida was disappointed . This absence had no reason beyond [Waymark]130-waymark 's choice . It was the last Sunday but one of the month ; a week more , and [he]130-waymark must keep [his]130-waymark word with [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock . The evil day had been put off , and to what purpose ? There had been some scarcely confessed hope . [Maud]103-maud 's sudden departure from [England]15-england , and [her]103-maud strange letter , might perhaps mean a change in [her]103-maud which would bring about [his]130-waymark freedom ; [he]130-waymark [himself]130-waymark might possibly be driven by [his]130-waymark wretchedness to the point of writing to [her]103-maud in a way which would hasten [her]103-maud decision , if indeed [she]103-maud were doubting .

All was over between [Ida]101-ida and [himself]130-waymark , so why undergo the torment of still seeing [her]103-maud . In sending [his]130-waymark note to [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock , [he]130-waymark was on the point of surrendering the week that remained , and begging that [Ida]101-ida might be told at once , but [his]130-waymark hand refused to write the words . Through the week that ensued [he]130-waymark had no moment 's rest . At night [he]130-waymark went to places of amusement , to seek distraction ; [he]130-waymark wished and dreaded the coming of the Sunday . How would [Ida]101-ida receive the revelation ? Should [he]130-waymark write to [her]103-maud and try to make [her]103-maud understand [him]130-waymark ? Yet in that [he]130-waymark could scarcely succeed , and failure would bring upon [him]130-waymark [her]103-maud contempt . The only safety lay in never seeing or communicating with [her]103-maud again .

Even on Saturday night [he]130-waymark had not made up [his]130-waymark mind how to act . [He]130-waymark went to [the theatre]1025-the theatre , but left before the play was half over , and walked slowly homewards . As [he]130-waymark drew near to [[his]130-waymark lodgings]1020-his lodgings , [some one]3153-some one hastened towards [him]130-waymark with both hands held out . It was [Maud Enderby]103-maud .

" Oh , [I]103-maud have waited so long ! [I]103-maud wanted to see [you]130-waymark to - night . "[103-maud] [She]103-maud was exhausted with fatigue and distress , and still held [his]130-waymark hands , as if needing [their]2781-their support . To [Waymark]130-waymark , in [his]130-waymark then state of mind , [she]103-maud came like [an apparition]2782-an apparition . [He]130-waymark could only look at [her]103-maud in astonishment .

" Last night , "[103-maud] [she]103-maud said , " [I]103-maud had a telegram from [father]902-father . [He]902-father told [me]103-maud to come back at once ; [he]902-father had had to leave , and [mother]375-mother was alone . [I]103-maud was to call for a letter at [a place in [the city]463-the city]4652-a place in the city . [I]103-maud was in time to catch [the night boat]4654-the night boat , and when [I]103-maud got [his]902-father letter it told [me]103-maud dreadful things . Something has happened which compelled [him]902-father to leave [England]15-england at once . [He]902-father could do nothing , make no arrangements . [Mother]126-mother , [he]902-father said , had a little money ; [we]4655-we must sell everything and manage to live somewhere for a little ; [he]902-father would try to send [us]4655-we what [he]902-father could . Then [I]103-maud went [home]3157-home . There was [a police - officer]4657-a police - officer in [the house]288-the house , and [mother]375-mother had gone away , [I]103-maud ca n't tell where . [Father]245-father has done something , and Oh , what shall [I]103-maud do ? [You]103-maud can help [me]103-maud , ca n't [you]103-maud ? "[103-maud]

[Waymark]130-waymark , whom this news overwhelmed with blank despair , could at first say nothing ; but the very greatness of the blow gradually produced in [him]130-waymark the strength to bear it . [He]130-waymark saw that fate had taken the future out of [his]130-waymark hands ; there was no longer even the appearance of choice . To [Maud]103-maud [he]130-waymark must now devote [himself]130-waymark , aiding [her]103-maud with all [his]130-waymark strength in the present and through the days to come .

" Shall [I]130-waymark go back [home]3157-home with [you]103-maud ? "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark asked , pressing [her]103-maud hands to comfort [her]103-maud , and speaking with the calmness of one who had made up [his]130-waymark mind .

" Yes ; perhaps [mother]375-mother will have returned . But what shall [we]4662-we do ? What will happen to [father]902-father ? Do [you]103-maud know anything of all this ? "[130-waymark]

" Nothing whatever . Walk with [me]103-maud to the top of [the street]340-the street , and [we]4662-we will take [a cab]648-a cab . "[103-maud]

[She]103-maud hung upon [his]130-waymark arm , trembling violently ; and during the drive to [Paddington]80-paddington , [she]103-maud lay back with [her]103-maud eyes closed , holding [Waymark]130-waymark 's hands in [her]103-maud own , which burned with fever . On alighting , [they]2783-they found that [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby had indeed returned ; [the servant]289-the servant told [them]2783-they so , and at the same time whispered something to [Maud]103-maud . [They]2783-they went up into [the drawing - room]2631-the drawing - room , and there found [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby lying upon the couch . [She]204-mrs. enderby could not understand when [she]204-mrs. enderby was spoken to , but nodded [her]204-mrs. enderby head and looked at [them]2783-they with large , woebegone , wandering eyes . Every effort to rouse [her]204-mrs. enderby was vain .

It was a dreadful night .

The early dawn was in the sky when [Waymark]130-waymark reached [Beaufort Street]47-beaufort street . With no thought of sleep , [he]130-waymark sat down at once and wrote to [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock , relating what had happened . " So , [you]103-maud see , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark concluded , " with the end of July has come the decision of [my]130-waymark fate , as [we]2783-they agreed it should . If [I]130-waymark had seen [you]103-maud to - morrow , as [I]130-waymark proposed , [I]130-waymark know not what folly [I]130-waymark might have been guilty of . Tell [Ida]101-ida everything at once ; [I]130-waymark shall never see [her]101-ida again . But do [you]103-maud , if [you]103-maud can , be [[my]130-waymark friend]3429-my friend still . [I]130-waymark need [your]103-maud help in this horrible situation . Meet [me]130-waymark will [you]103-maud ? at [the office]2409-the office to - morrow night , say at eight o'clock . "[130-waymark]

This letter would reach [Tottenham]62-tottenham on Monday morning . [Waymark]130-waymark went to [the office]2409-the office at the hour [he]130-waymark had mentioned , and waited till ten o'clock . But [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock had not been in [St. John Street Road]7-st. john street road that day , and the waiting was in vain .

The garden - party had not been without its effect upon [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock . On the following day , when [he]233-mr. woodstock was sitting again with [Ida]101-ida in [the garden]747-the garden , [he]233-mr. woodstock recurred to the conversation of a week ago , and seemed desirous of leading [the girl]316-the girl to speak freely on the subjects which had such power to stir [her]101-ida . [Ida]101-ida had been waiting for this ; [she]101-ida rejoiced at the promise it held out , and unburdened [her]101-ida heart . Would [he]233-mr. woodstock not do yet more for [the poor people in [[his]233-mr. woodstock houses]2790-his houses]2789-the poor people in his houses [I]0-i could not [[their]2789-the poor people in his houses homes]3317-their homes in some way be made more fit for [human beings]2792-human beings ? With careful observation of [his]233-mr. woodstock mood , [she]101-ida led [him]233-mr. woodstock on to entertain thoughts [he]233-mr. woodstock had never dreamt of , and before [they]2793-they parted [she]101-ida had all but obtained a promise that [he]233-mr. woodstock would go over the whole of [[his]233-mr. woodstock property]1451-his property and really see what could be done . [Ida]101-ida 's influence over [him]233-mr. woodstock had by this time become very great ; [the old man]1383-the old man was ready to do much for the sake of pleasing [her]101-ida .

On the following Tuesday [he]233-mr. woodstock went down into [Litany Lane]45-litany lane in company with [a builder]2796-a builder , and proceeded to investigate [each of [the houses]1394-the houses]2797-each of the houses . In many instances the repairs , to be of any use , would have to be considerable ; there would be a difficulty in executing them whilst [the tenants]2799-the tenants remained in possession . One possibility occurred to [him]233-mr. woodstock in the course of examination , and [he]233-mr. woodstock determined to make use of it ; [he]233-mr. woodstock would create room by getting rid of [the worst tenants]2800-the worst tenants , all those , in fact , whose presence was pollution to [the neighbourhood , and whom it was hopeless to think of reforming]2801-the neighbourhood , and whom it was hopeless to think of reforming . In this way [he]233-mr. woodstock would be able to shift about [the remaining lodgers]2802-the remaining lodgers without too great a loss to [himself]233-mr. woodstock , and avoid the necessity of turning [helpless people]2803-helpless people into [the street]340-the street .

[Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock had considerably more knowledge of the state of [[his]233-mr. woodstock property]1451-his property , and of [the tenants inhabiting [it]1451-his property]2806-the tenants inhabiting it , than is usual with [landlords of [his]233-mr. woodstock kind]2807-landlords of his kind ; for all that , the present examination brought to light not a few things which were startling even to [him]233-mr. woodstock . Since [Waymark]130-waymark had ceased to act as [[his]233-mr. woodstock collector]2808-his collector , [the office]2409-the office had been filled by [an agent of the ordinary kind]2810-an agent of the ordinary kind , and [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock had , till just now , taken less interest in [the property]2209-the property than formerly . Things had got worse on the whole . Whereas [Waymark]130-waymark had here and there been successful in suppressing the grosser forms of uncleanliness by threats of expulsion , and at times by the actual enforcement of [his]130-waymark threat , no such supervision had of late been exercised . There were very few houses in which the air was at all tolerable ; in many instances the vilest odours hung about the open door - ways . To pass out of [Elm Court]46-elm court into [the wider streets]2812-the wider streets around was like a change to the freshness of woods and fields . And the sources of this miasma were only too obvious .

[The larger houses which made up [Litany Lane]45-litany lane]2813-the larger houses which made up litany lane had [underground cellars]2814-underground cellars ; in [the court]1401-the court there were fortunately no such retreats . On entering [one of [these former houses]2817-these former houses]2816-one of these former houses , [the two]273-the two were aware of an especially offensive odour rising from below the stairs . Pursuing , however , [their]273-the two plan of beginning at [the garrets]2819-the garrets , [they]273-the two went up together . In [the room at the top]2820-the room at the top [they]273-the two came upon a miserable spectacle . On something which , for want of another name , was probably called a bed , there lay [a woman either already dead or in a state of coma]2821-a woman either already dead or in a state of coma , and on the floor sat [two very young children]2822-two very young children , amusing [themselves]2822-two very young children with a dead kitten , [their]2822-two very young children only toy . [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock bent over [the woman]448-the woman and examined [her]448-the woman . [He]233-mr. woodstock found that [she]448-the woman was breathing , though in a slow and scarcely perceptible way ; [her]448-the woman eyes were open , but expressed no consciousness . The slightly - parted lips were almost black , and here and there on [her]448-the woman face there seemed to be a kind of rash . [[Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock 's companion]2824-mr. woodstock 's companion , after taking one glance , drew hastily back .

" Looks like small - pox , "[2824-mr. woodstock 's companion] [he]2824-mr. woodstock 's companion said , in an alarmed voice . " [I]2824-mr. woodstock 's companion would n't stand so near , [sir]3257-sir , if [I]2824-mr. woodstock 's companion was [you]3257-sir . "[2824-mr. woodstock 's companion]

" Is n't there any one to look to [her]448-the woman ? "[115-abraham] said [Abraham]115-abraham . Then turning to [one of [the children]253-the children]2825-one of the children , " Where 's [[your]2825-one of the children father]3840-your father ? "[233-mr. woodstock] [he]233-mr. woodstock asked .

" [Dono]246-dono , "[2827-the little fellow] was [the little fellow]2827-the little fellow 's indifferent reply .

" Are [you]2825-one of the children alone ? "[3216-a woman]

" [Dono]246-dono . "[3216-a woman]

[They]2828-they went down to the floor below , and there found [a woman]3216-a woman standing at [her]3216-a woman door .

" What 's the matter with [her]448-the woman up there ? "[233-mr. woodstock] asked [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock .

" [She]448-the woman 's very bad , [sir]3257-sir . [[Her]448-the woman [Susan]247-susan]4671-her susan 's gone to get a order for [the parish doctor]4672-the parish doctor , [I]3216-a woman b'lieve . [I]3216-a woman was just a - goin' to look after [the children]253-the children when [you]3257-sir came up . [I]3216-a woman 've only just come ' ome [myself]3216-a woman , [you]3257-sir see . "[3216-a woman]

" What 's that horrible stench down below ? "[3216-a woman]

" [I]448-the woman did n't notice nothink , [sir]3257-sir , "[448-the woman] said [the woman]448-the woman , looking over the banisters as if the odour might be seen .

" [Any one living in [the kitchen]3999-the kitchen]4675-any one living in the kitchen ? "[3216-a woman]

" There was [some one]3153-some one , [I]3216-a woman b'lieve , [sir]3257-sir , but [I]3216-a woman do n't exac'ly know if [they]3153-some one 's [there]3249-there yet . "[3216-a woman]

Presently [they]2831-they reached [the region below]2832-the region below . In absolute darkness [they]2831-they descended steps which were covered with a sort of slime , and then , by striking a light , found [themselves]2831-they in front of a closed door . Opening this , [they]2831-they entered a vile hole where it could scarcely be said to be daylight , so thickly was the little window patched with filth . Groping about in the stifling atmosphere , [they]2831-they discovered in one corner a mass of indescribable matter , from which arose , seemingly , the worst of the effluvia .

" What is it ? "[233-mr. woodstock] asked [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock , holding a lighted match .

" Rotten fish , it seems to [me]449-the other , "[449-the other] said [the other]449-the other , holding [his]449-the other nose .

[Abraham]115-abraham turned away ; then , as if [his]233-mr. woodstock eye had suddenly caught something , strode to another corner . There lay the body of [a dead child , all but naked , upon a piece of sacking]2834-a dead child , all but naked , upon a piece of sacking .

" [We]2831-they 'd better get out of this , [sir]3257-sir , "[2835-the builder] said [the builder]2835-the builder . " [We]2831-they shall be poisoned . Wonder [they]2831-they have n't the plague here . "[2835-the builder]

" Seems to [me]233-mr. woodstock [they]2831-they have , "[233-mr. woodstock] returned [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock .

[They]2831-they went out into [the street]340-the street , and hailed [the first policeman in sight]2837-the first policeman in sight . Then , giving up [his]233-mr. woodstock investigations for that morning , [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock repaired to [the police - station]2103-the police - station , and after a good deal of trouble , succeeded in getting the attendance of [a medical man]2839-a medical man , with the result that [the woman [they]2831-they had seen up in [the garret]2527-the garret]2840-the woman they had seen up in the garret was found to be in truth dying of small - pox . If the contagion spread , as probably it had by this time begun to , there would be a pleasant state of things in [Litany Lane]45-litany lane .

In the evening , before going [home]3157-home , [Abraham]115-abraham had a bath . [He]233-mr. woodstock was not [a nervous man]2843-a nervous man , but the possibilities of the risk [he]233-mr. woodstock had run were not agreeable to contemplate . Two or three days went by without any alarming symptoms , but as [he]233-mr. woodstock learnt that another case of small - pox had declared itself in [the Lane]1392-the lane , [he]233-mr. woodstock postponed [his]233-mr. woodstock personal activity there for the present , and remained a good deal at [home]3157-home . On the Sunday morning when [Waymark]130-waymark 's letter had already been posted [he]233-mr. woodstock awoke with a headache , continued from the night before . It grew worse during the day , and [he]233-mr. woodstock went to bed early with a dull pain across the forehead , which prevented [him]233-mr. woodstock from sleeping . On the following morning the headache still remained ; [he]233-mr. woodstock felt a disinclination to rise , and now , for the first time , began to be troubled with vague fears , which blended themselves with [his]233-mr. woodstock various pre - occupations in a confusing way . The letter which arrived from [Waymark]130-waymark was taken up to [him]233-mr. woodstock . It caused [him]233-mr. woodstock extreme irritation , which was followed by uneasy dozing , the pain across [his]233-mr. woodstock forehead growing worse the while . [A doctor]3151-a doctor was summoned .

The same day [Ida]101-ida and [Miss Hurst]238-miss hurst left [the house]288-the house , to occupy [lodgings hard by]2848-lodgings hard by ; it was done at [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock 's peremptory bidding . [Ida]101-ida at once wrote to [Waymark]130-waymark , begging [him]130-waymark to come ; [he]130-waymark arrived early next morning , and learnt the state of things .

" [The doctor]3154-the doctor tells [me]101-ida , "[101-ida] said [Ida]101-ida , " there is a case in [Litany Lane]45-litany lane . It is very cruel . [Grandfather]237-grandfather went to make arrangements for having [the houses]1394-the houses repaired . "[101-ida]

" There [I]130-waymark recognise [your]101-ida hand , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark observed , as [she]101-ida made a pause .

" Why have [you]130-waymark so deserted [us]2849-us ? "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida asked . " Why do [we]2849-us see [you]130-waymark so seldom ? "[101-ida]

" It is so late every evening before [I]101-ida leave [the library]4683-the library , and [I]101-ida am busy with all sorts of things . "[101-ida]

[They]2849-us had little to say to [each other]459-each other , [Waymark]130-waymark promised to communicate at once with [a friend of [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock 's]2851-a friend of mr. woodstock 's , [a man of business]3254-a man of business , and to come again as soon as possible , to give any help [he]2851-a friend of mr. woodstock 's could . Whether [Ida]101-ida had been told of [his]130-waymark position remained uncertain .

For [Ida]101-ida [they]2853-they were sad , long days . Troubles which [she]101-ida had previously managed to keep in the background now again beset [her]101-ida . [She]101-ida had attached [herself]101-ida to [[her]101-ida grandfather]2566-her grandfather ; gratitude for all that [he]2566-her grandfather was doing at [her]101-ida wish strengthened [her]101-ida affection , and [she]101-ida awaited each new day with fear . [Waymark]130-waymark seemed colder to [her]101-ida in these days than [he]130-waymark had ever been formerly . The occasion ought , [she]101-ida felt , to have brought [them]2855-them nearer together ; but on [his]130-waymark side there appeared to be no such feeling . The time hung very heavily on [her]101-ida hands . [She]101-ida tried to go on with [her]101-ida studies , but it was a mere pretence .

Soon , [she]101-ida learnt that there was no hope ; [the sick man]2856-the sick man had sunk into a state of unconsciousness from which [he]2856-the sick man would probably not awake . [She]101-ida haunted [the neighbourhood of [the house]288-the house]2857-the neighbourhood of the house , or , in [[her]101-ida lodging]2859-her lodging , sat like [one who waits]2860-one who waits , and the waiting was for [she]101-ida knew not what . There was once more to be a great change in [her]101-ida life , but of what kind [she]101-ida could not foresee . [She]101-ida wished [her]101-ida suffering had been more acute ; [[her]101-ida only relative]2861-her only relative was dying , yet no tear would come to [her]101-ida eyes ; it was heartless , and to weep would have brought relief to [her]101-ida . [She]101-ida could only sit and wait .

When [Waymark]130-waymark came , on the evening of the next day , [he]130-waymark heard that all was over . [Ida]101-ida saw [him]130-waymark , but only for a few minutes . In going away , [he]130-waymark paused by the gates of [the silent house]2862-the silent house .

" [The slums]2586-the slums have avenged [themselves]2586-the slums , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark said to [himself]130-waymark sadly , " though late . "[130-waymark]

CHAPTER XXXV

HOUSE - WARMING

On a Sunday afternoon in October , when [Abraham Woodstock]2863-abraham woodstock had lain in [[his]2863-abraham woodstock grave]2864-his grave for three months , [Waymark]130-waymark met [Julian Casti]118-julian by appointment in [Sloane Square]89-sloane square , and [they]2865-they set forth together on a journey to [Peckham]90-peckham . [They]2865-they were going thither by invitation , and , to judge from the laughter which accompanied [their]2865-they talk , [their]2865-they visit was likely to afford [them]2865-they entertainment . The merriment on [Julian]118-julian 's side was not very natural ; [he]118-julian looked indeed too ill to enjoy mirth of any kind . As [they]2865-they stood in [the Square]2866-the square , waiting for an omnibus , [he]118-julian kept glancing uneasily about [him]118-julian , especially in the direction whence [they]2865-they had come . It had the appearance of a habit , but before [they]2865-they had stood much more than a minute , [he]118-julian started and exclaimed in a low voice to [[his]118-julian companion]1325-his companion

" [I]118-julian told [you]1325-his companion so . [She]1325-his companion is just behind [there]3249-there . [She]1325-his companion has come round by [the back streets]4686-the back streets , just to see if [I]118-julian 'd told [her]1325-his companion the truth . "[118-julian]

[Waymark]130-waymark glanced back and shrugged [his]130-waymark shoulders .

" Pooh ! Never mind , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark said . " [You]1325-his companion 're used to it . "[130-waymark]

" Used to it ! Yes , "[118-julian] [Julian]118-julian returned , [his]118-julian face flushing suddenly a deep red , the effect of extraordinary excitement ; " and it is driving [me]118-julian mad . "[118-julian]

Then , after a fit of coughing

" [She]1325-his companion found [my]118-julian poem last night , and burnt it . "[118-julian]

" Burnt it ? "[118-julian]

" Yes ; simply because [she]1325-his companion could not understand it . [She]1325-his companion said [she]1325-his companion thought it was waste paper , but [I]118-julian saw , [I]118-julian saw . "[118-julian]

[The ' bus [they]2869-they waited for]2868-the ' bus they waited for came up , and [they]2869-they went on [their]2869-they way . On reaching [the neighbourhood of]2870-the neighbourhood of [Peckham]90-peckham , [they]2869-they struck off through [a complex of small new streets]2871-a complex of small new streets , apparently familiar to [Waymark]129-waymark , and came at length to [a little shop]2872-a little shop , also very new , the windows of which displayed a fresh - looking assortment of miscellaneous goods . There was half a large cheese , marked by the incisions of the tasting - knife ; a boiled ham , garlanded ; a cone of brawn ; a truncated pyramid of spiced beef , released from its American tin ; also German sausage and other dainties of the kind . Then there were canisters of tea and coffee , tins of mustard , a basket of eggs , some onions , boxes of baking - powder and of blacking ; all arranged so as to make an impression on [the passers - by]2873-the passers - by ; everything clean and bright . Above the window stood in imposing gilt letters the name of [the proprietor]2874-the proprietor : [O'Gree]142-o'gree .

[They]2869-they entered . [The shop]361-the shop was very small and did not contain much stock . The new shelves showed a row of biscuit - tins , but little else , and from the ceiling hung balls of string . On the counter lay an inviting round of boiled beef . Odours of provisions and of fresh paint were strong in the air . Every thing gleamed from resent scrubbing and polishing ; the floor only emphasised [its]2876-its purity by a little track where [a child]378-a child 's shoes had brought in mud from [the street]340-the street ; doubtless it had been washed over since the Sunday morning 's custom had subsided . Wherever the walls would have confessed their bareness [the enterprising tradesman]2879-the enterprising tradesman had hung gorgeous advertising cards . At the sound of [the visitors]662-the visitors ' footsteps , the door leading out of [the shop]361-the shop into [the parlour]1100-the parlour behind opened briskly , a head having previously appeared over the red curtain , and [Mr. O'Gree]142-o'gree , in the glory of Sunday attire , rushed forward with eager hands . [His]142-o'gree welcome was obstreperous .

" [Waymark]130-waymark , [you]130-waymark 're a brick ! [Mr. Casti]116-mr. casti , [I]142-o'gree 'm rejoiced to receive [you]130-waymark in [[my]142-o'gree establishment]4687-my establishment ! [You]130-waymark 're neither a minute too soon nor a minute too late . [Mrs. O'Gree]248-mrs. o'gree only this moment called out from [the kitchen]3999-the kitchen that the kettle was boiling and the crumpets at the point of perfection ! [I]142-o'gree knew [your]130-waymark punctuality of old , [Waymark]130-waymark . [Mr. Casti]116-mr. casti , how does it strike [you]130-waymark ? Roaring trade , [Waymark]130-waymark ! Done two shillings and threepence three farthings this Sunday morning . Look here , [[me]142-o'gree boy]4573-me boy , ho , ho ! "[142-o'gree]

[He]142-o'gree drew out the till behind the counter , and jingled [his]142-o'gree hand in coppers . Then [he]142-o'gree rushed about in the wildest fervour from object to object , opening tins which [he]142-o'gree had forgotten were empty , making passes at the beef and the ham with a formidable carving - knife , demonstrating the use of a sugar - chopper and a coffee - grinder , and , lastly , calling attention with infinite glee to a bad halfpenny which [he]142-o'gree had detected on the previous afternoon , and had forthwith nailed down to the counter , in terrorem . Then [he]142-o'gree lifted with much solemnity a hinged portion of the counter , and requested [[his]142-o'gree visitors]2883-his visitors to pass into [the back - parlour]2884-the back - parlour . Here there was the same perfect cleanliness , though the furniture was scant and very simple . The round table was laid for tea , with a spotless cloth , plates of a very demonstrative pattern , and knives and forks which seemed only just to have left [[the ironmonger]2885-the ironmonger 's shop]2886-the ironmonger 's shop .

" [We]4690-we pass , [you]130-waymark observe , [Mr. Casti]116-mr. casti , "[2887-the ex - teacher] cried [the ex - teacher]2887-the ex - teacher , " from the region of commerce to that of domestic intimacy . Here [Mrs. O'Gree]248-mrs. o'gree reigns supreme , as indeed [she]248-mrs. o'gree does in [the other department]4691-the other department , as far as [presiding genius]4692-presiding genius goes . [She]248-mrs. o'gree 's in all places at once , like a birrud ! [Mr. Casti]116-mr. casti , "[2887-the ex - teacher] in a whisper , " [I]2887-the ex - teacher shall have the pleasure of introducing [you]130-waymark to [one of the most remarkable women it was ever [your]130-waymark lot to meet]4693-one of the most remarkable women it was ever your lot to meet ; a phenomenon of "[2887-the ex - teacher]

The inner door opened , and [the lady]262-the lady [herself]262-the lady interrupted these eulogies . [Sally]105-sally was charming . [Her]105-sally trim little body attired in the trimmest of homely dresses , [her]105-sally sharp little face shining and just a little red with excitement , [her]105-sally quick movements , [her]105-sally laughing eyes , [her]105-sally restless hands graced with the new wedding - ring all made up a picture of which [[her]105-sally husband]584-her husband might well be proud . [He]584-her husband stood and gazed at [her]105-sally in frank admiration ; only when [she]105-sally sprang forward to shake hands with [Waymark]130-waymark did [he]584-her husband recover [himself]584-her husband sufficiently to go through the ceremony of introducing [Julian]118-julian . It was done with all stateliness .

" An improvement this on [[the masters]982-the masters ' room]1010-the masters ' room , eh , [Waymark]130-waymark ? "[142-o'gree] cried [Mr. O'Gree]142-o'gree . Then , suddenly interrupting [him]130-waymark self , " And that reminds [me]142-o'gree ! [We]4696-we 've got [a lodger]3267-a lodger . "[142-o'gree]

" Already ? "[142-o'gree]

" And who [d'ye]4698-d'ye think ? Who d'ye think ? [You]130-waymark would n't guess if [you]130-waymark went on till Christmas . Ho , ho , ho ! [I]142-o'gree 'm hanged if [I]142-o'gree tell [you]130-waymark . Wait and see ! "[142-o'gree]

" Shall [I]105-sally call [him]3267-a lodger down ? "[105-sally] asked [Sally]105-sally , who in the meantime had brought in the tea - pot , and the crumpets , and a dish of slices from the round of beef on the counter , and boiled eggs , and sundry other dainties .

[O'Gree]142-o'gree , unable to speak for mirth , nodded [his]142-o'gree head , and presently [Sally]105-sally returned , followed by [Mr. Egger]149-egger . [Waymark]130-waymark scarcely recognised [[his]130-waymark old friend]2890-his old friend , so much had the latter changed : instead of the old woe - begone look , [Egger]149-egger 's face wore a joyous smile , and [[his]149-egger outer man]2891-his outer man was so vastly improved that [he]149-egger had evidently fallen on a more lucrative profession . [Waymark]130-waymark remembered [O'Gree]142-o'gree 's chance meeting with [the Swiss]1013-the swiss , but had heard nothing of [him]142-o'gree since ; nor indeed had [O'Gree]142-o'gree till a day or two ago .

" How do things go ? "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark inquired heartily . " Found [a better school]4699-a better school ? "[130-waymark]

" No , no , [[my]149-egger friend]3429-my friend , "[149-egger] returned [Egger]149-egger , in [his]149-egger very bad English . " At [the school]311-the school [I]149-egger made [my]149-egger possible ; [I]149-egger did till [I]149-egger could no more . [I]149-egger have made like [Mr. O'Gree]142-o'gree ; it is to say , quite a change in [my]149-egger life . [I]149-egger am waiter at [a restaurant]4702-a restaurant . And see [me]149-egger ; am [I]149-egger not the better quite ? No fear ! "[149-egger] This cockneyism came in with comical effect . " [I]149-egger have enough to eat and to drink , and money in [my]149-egger pocket . [The school]311-the school may go to "[149-egger]

[O'Gree]142-o'gree coughed violently to cover the last word , and looked reproachfully at [[his]142-o'gree old colleague]2893-his old colleague . [Poor Egger]191-poor egger , who had been carried away by [his]191-poor egger joyous fervour , was abashed , and glanced timidly at [Sally]105-sally , who replied by giving [him]142-o'gree half a dozen thick rounds of German sausage . On [his]142-o'gree requesting mustard , [she]105-sally fetched some from [the shop]361-the shop and mixed it , but , in doing so , had the misfortune to pour too much water .

" There ! "[105-sally] [she]105-sally exclaimed ; " [I]105-sally 've doubted [the miller]4704-the miller 's eye . "[105-sally]

[O'Gree]142-o'gree laughed when [he]142-o'gree saw [Waymark]130-waymark looking for an explanation .

" That 's a piece of [Weymouth]44-weymouth , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark remarked . " [Mrs. O'Gree]248-mrs. o'gree comes from [the south - west of [England]15-england]4705-the south - west of england , "[142-o'gree] [he]142-o'gree added , leaning towards [Casti]118-julian . " [She]248-mrs. o'gree 's constantly teaching [me]142-o'gree new and interesting things . Now , if [I]142-o'gree was to spill the salt here "[142-o'gree]

[He]142-o'gree put [his]142-o'gree Ii and on the salt - cellar , as if to do so , but [Sally]105-sally rapped [his]142-o'gree knuckles with a fork .

" None of [your]142-o'gree nonsense , [sir]3257-sir ! Give [Mr. Casti]116-mr. casti some more meat , instead . "[105-sally]

It was [a merry party]2895-a merry party . The noise of talk grew so loud that it was only the keenness of habitual attention on [Sally]105-sally 's part which enabled [her]105-sally to observe that [a customer]2896-a customer was knocking on the counter . [She]105-sally darted out , but returned with a disappointed look on [her]105-sally face .

" Pickles ? "[584-her husband] asked [[her]105-sally husband]584-her husband , frowning .

[Sally]105-sally nodded .

" Now , look here , [Waymark]130-waymark , "[142-o'gree] cried [O'Gree]142-o'gree , rising in indignation from [his]142-o'gree seat . " Look here , [Mr. Casti]116-mr. casti . The one drop of bitterness in [our]4707-we cup is pickles ; the one thing that threatens to poison [our]4707-we happiness is pickles . [We]4707-we 're always being asked for pickles ; just as if [the people]3247-the people knew about it , and came on purpose ! "[142-o'gree]

" Knew About what ? "[130-waymark] asked [Waymark]130-waymark , in astonishment .

" Why , that [we]4707-we may n't sell ['em]4709-'em ! A few doors off there 's [a scoundrel of a grocer]4710-a scoundrel of a grocer . Now , [[his]4710-a scoundrel of a grocer landlord]4711-his landlord 's the same as [ours]4707-we , and when [we]4707-we took [this shop]4712-this shop there was one condition attached . Because [the grocer]4713-the grocer sells pickles , and makes a good thing of them , [we]4707-we had to undertake that , in that branch of commerce , [we]4707-we would n't compete with [him]4713-the grocer . [Pickles]249-pickles are forbidden . "[142-o'gree]

[Waymark]130-waymark burst into a most unsympathetic roar of laughter , but with [O'Gree]142-o'gree the grievance was evidently a serious one , and it was some few moments before [he]130-waymark recovered [his]130-waymark equanimity . Indeed it was not quite restored till the entrance of [another customer , who purchased two ounces of butter]2898-another customer , who purchased two ounces of butter . When , in the dead silence which ensued , [Sally]105-sally was heard weighing out the order , [O'Gree]142-o'gree 's face beamed ; and when there followed the chink of coins in the till , [he]130-waymark brought [his]130-waymark fist down with a triumphant crash upon the table .

When tea was over , [O'Gree]142-o'gree managed to get [Waymark]130-waymark apart from the rest , and showed [him]130-waymark a small photograph of [Sally]105-sally which had recently been taken .

" [Sally]105-sally 's great ambition , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark whispered , " is to be taken cabinet - size , and in a snow - storm . [You]130-waymark 've seen the kind of thing in [the shop]361-the shop - windows ? [We]4715-we 'll manage that before long , but this will do for the present . [You]130-waymark do n't see a face like that every day ; eh , [Waymark]130-waymark ? "[130-waymark]

[Sally]105-sally , [her]105-sally housewifery duly accomplished in [the invisible regions]2899-the invisible regions , came back and sat by the fireside . [She]105-sally had exchanged [her]105-sally work - a - day costume for one rather more ornate . Noticeable was a delicate gold chain which hung about [her]105-sally neck , and [Waymark]130-waymark smiled when [he]130-waymark presently saw [her]105-sally take out [her]105-sally watch and seem to compare its time with that of the clock on the mantelpiece . It was a wedding present from [Ida]101-ida .

[Sally]105-sally caught the smile , and almost immediately came over to a seat by [Waymark]130-waymark ; and , whilst [the others]3162-the others were engaged in loud talk , spoke with [him]130-waymark privately .

" Have [you]130-waymark seen [her]105-sally lately ? "[105-sally] [she]105-sally asked .

" Not for some weeks , "[449-the other] [the other]449-the other replied , shaking [his]449-the other head .

" Well , it 's the queerest thing [I]105-sally ever knew , s'nough ! But , there , "[105-sally] [she]105-sally added , with an arch glance , ' [some men]2902-some men are that stupid "[105-sally]

[Waymark]130-waymark laughed slightly , and again shook [his]130-waymark head .

" All a mistake , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark said .
