" Yes , that 's just what it is , [you]105-sally may depend upon it . [I]130-waymark more'n half believe [you]105-sally 're telling [fibs]4716-fibs . "[130-waymark]

Tumblers of whisky were soon smoking on the table , and all except [Casti]116-mr. casti laughed and talked to [their]3162-the others heart 's content . [Casti]116-mr. casti was no kill - joy ; [he]116-mr. casti smiled at all that went on , now and then putting in a friendly word ; but the vitality of the others was lacking in [him]116-mr. casti , and the weight which crushed [him]116-mr. casti night and day could not so easily be thrown aside . [O'Gree]142-o'gree was abundant in reminiscences of academic days , and it would not have been easy to resist altogether the comical vigour of [his]142-o'gree stories , all without one touch of real bitterness or malice .

" [Bedad]147-bedad , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark cried , " [I]130-waymark sent [old Pendy]243-pendy a business prospectus , with [my]130-waymark compliments written on the bottom of it . [I]130-waymark thought [he]243-pendy might perhaps be disposed to give [me]130-waymark a contract for victualling [the Academy]981-the academy . [I]130-waymark wish [he]243-pendy had , for [the boys]3483-the boys ' sake . "[130-waymark]

Then , to bring back completely the old times , [Mr. Egger]149-egger was prevailed upon to sing one of [his]149-egger Volkslieder , that which had been [Waymark]130-waymark 's especial favourite , and which [he]149-egger had sung on an occasion memorable to [Sally]105-sally and [[her]105-sally husband]584-her husband in [the little dining - room at [Richmond]58-richmond]2904-the little dining - room at richmond .

" Die Schwalb'n flieg'n fort , doch sie zieh'n wieder [her]105-sally ; Der Mensch wenn er fortgeht , er kommt nimmermehr ! "[149-egger]

[Waymark]130-waymark was silent for a little after that .

When it was nearly eleven o'clock , [Casti]116-mr. casti looked once or twice meaningly at [Waymark]130-waymark , and [the friends at length]2905-the friends at length rose to take [their]2905-the friends at length leave , in spite of much protest . [O'Gree]142-o'gree accompanied [them]2905-the friends at length as far as the spot where [they]2905-the friends at length would meet [the omnibus]2906-the omnibus , then , with assurances that to - night had been but the beginning of glorious times , sent [them]2905-the friends at length on [their]2905-the friends at length way . [Julian]118-julian was silent during the journey [home]3157-home ; [he]118-julian looked very wearied . For lack of a timely conveyance the last mile or so had to be walked . [Julian]118-julian 's cough had been bad during the evening , and now the cold night - air seemed to give [him]118-julian much trouble . Presently , just as [they]2905-the friends at length turned a corner , a severe blast of wind met [them]2905-the friends at length full in the face . [Julian]118-julian began coughing violently , and all at once became so weak that [he]118-julian had to lean against a palisading . [Waymark]130-waymark , looking closer in alarm , saw that the handkerchief which [the poor fellow]990-the poor fellow was holding to [his]990-the poor fellow mouth was covered with blood .

" [We]2905-the friends at length must have [a cab]648-a cab , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark exclaimed . " It is impossible for [you]118-julian to walk in this state . "[130-waymark]

[Julian]118-julian resisted , with assurances that the worst was over for the time . If [Waymark]130-waymark would give the support of [his]118-julian arm , [he]118-julian would get on quite well . There was no overcoming [his]118-julian resolution to proceed .

" There 's no misunderstanding this , [old fellow]4318-old fellow , "[130-waymark] [he]130-waymark said , with a laugh , when [they]2905-the friends at length had walked a few paces .

[Waymark]130-waymark made no reply .

" [You]130-waymark 'll laugh at [me]118-julian , "[118-julian] [Julian]118-julian went on , " but is n't there a certain resemblance between [my]118-julian case and that of [Keats]128-keats ? [He]128-keats too was [a drug - pounder]4721-a drug - pounder ; [he]128-keats liked it as little as [I]118-julian do ; and [he]128-keats died young of consumption . [I]118-julian suppose [a dying man]4722-a dying man may speak the truth about [himself]4722-a dying man . [I]118-julian too might have been [a poet]1542-a poet , if life had dealt more kindly with [me]118-julian . [I]118-julian think [you]130-waymark would have liked the thing [I]118-julian was writing ; [I]118-julian 'd finished some three hundred lines ; but now [you]130-waymark 'll never see it . Well , [I]118-julian do n't know that it matters . "[118-julian]

[Waymark]130-waymark tried to speak in a tone of hopefulness , but it was hard to give [his]130-waymark words the semblance of sincerity .

" Do [you]130-waymark remember , "[118-julian] [Casti]118-julian continued , " when all [my]118-julian talk used to be about [Rome]14-rome , and how [I]118-julian planned to see it one day see it again . [I]118-julian should say ? Strange to think that [I]118-julian really was born in [Rome]14-rome . [I]118-julian used to call [myself]118-julian [a Roman]3294-a roman , [you]130-waymark know , and grow hot with pride when [I]118-julian thought of it . Those were dreams . Oh , [I]118-julian was to do wonderful things ! Poetry was to make [me]118-julian rich , and then [I]118-julian would go and live in [Italy]13-italy , and fill [my]118-julian lungs with the breath of [the Forum]4725-the forum , and write [my]118-julian great Epic . How good that [we]2909-we ca n't foresee [our]2909-we lives ! "[118-julian]

" [I]130-waymark wish to heaven , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark exclaimed , when [they]2909-we were parting , " that [you]118-julian would be [a man]1260-a man and shake this monstrous yoke from off [your]118-julian neck ! It is that that is killing [you]118-julian . Give [yourself]118-julian a chance . Defy everything and make [yourself]118-julian free . "[130-waymark]

[Julian]118-julian shook [his]118-julian head sadly .

" Too late ! [I]118-julian have n't the courage . [My]118-julian mind weakens with [my]118-julian body . "[118-julian]

[He]118-julian went to [[his]118-julian lodgings]1020-his lodgings , and , as [he]118-julian anticipated , found that [Harriet]216-harriet had not yet come [home]3157-home . [She]216-harriet was almost always out very late , and [he]118-julian had learnt too well what t expect on [her]216-harriet return . In spite of [her]216-harriet illness , of which [she]216-harriet made the most when it suited [her]216-harriet purpose , [she]216-harriet was able t wander about at all hours with [the acquaintances [[her]216-harriet husband]584-her husband did not even know by name]2912-the acquaintances her husband did not even know by name , and [Julian]118-julian had no longer the strength even to implore [her]216-harriet to have pity on [him]118-julian . [He]118-julian absence racked [him]118-julian with nervous fears ; [her]216-harriet presence tortured [him]118-julian to agony . Weakness in [him]118-julian had reached a criminal degree . Once or twice [he]118-julian had all but made up [his]118-julian mind to flee secretly , and only let [her]216-harriet know [his]118-julian determination when [he]118-julian had gone ; but [his]118-julian poverty interposed such obstacles that [he]118-julian ended by accepting them as excuses for [his]118-julian hesitation . The mere thought of fulfilling the duty which [he]118-julian owed to [himself]118-julian , of speaking out with manly firmness , and telling [her]216-harriet that here at length all ended between [them]2914-them that was a terror to [his]118-julian soul . So [he]118-julian stayed on and allowed [her]216-harriet to kill [him]118-julian by slow torment . [He]118-julian was at least carrying out to the letter the promise [he]118-julian had made to [[her]216-harriet father]514-her father , and this thought supplied [him]118-julian with a flattering unction which , such was [his]118-julian disposition , at times even brought [him]118-julian a moment 's solace .

There was no fire in [the room]255-the room ; [he]118-julian sank upon a chair and waited . Every sound in [the street]340-the street below sent the blood back upon [his]118-julian heart . At length there came the fumbling of a latch - key [he]118-julian could hear it plainly and then the heavy foot ascending the stairs . [Her]216-harriet glazed eyes and red cheeks told the familiar tale . [She]216-harriet sat down opposite [him]118-julian and was silent for a minute , half dozing ; then [she]216-harriet seemed suddenly to become conscious of [his]118-julian presence , and the words began to flow from [her]216-harriet tongue , every one cutting [him]118-julian to the quick , poisoning [his]118-julian soul with their venom of jealousy and vulgar spite . Contention was the breath of [her]216-harriet nostrils ; the prime impulse of [her]216-harriet heart was suspicion . Little by little [she]216-harriet came round to the wonted topic . Had [he]118-julian been to see [[his]118-julian friend]876-his friend [the thief]2919-the thief ? Was [she]216-harriet in [prison]2920-prison again yet ? Whom had [she]216-harriet been stealing from of late ? Oh , [she]216-harriet was innocence itself , of course ; too good for this evil - speaking world .

Tonight [he]118-julian could not bear it . [He]118-julian rose from [his]118-julian chair like [a drunken man]2921-a drunken man , and staggered to the door . [She]216-harriet sprang after [him]118-julian , but [he]118-julian was just in time to escape [her]216-harriet grasp and spring down the stairs ; then , out into the night . Once before , not quite a month ago , [he]118-julian had been driven thus in terror from the sound of [her]216-harriet voice , and had slept at [a coffeehouse]2922-a coffeehouse . Now , as soon as [he]118-julian had got out of [the street]340-the street and saw that [he]118-julian was not being pursued , [he]118-julian discovered that [he]118-julian had given away [his]118-julian last copper for the omnibus fare . No matter ; the air was pleasant upon [his]118-julian throbbing temples . It was too late to think of knocking at [the house where [Waymark]130-waymark lodged]2924-the house where waymark lodged . Nothing remained but to walk about [the streets]3169-the streets all night , resting on a stone when [he]118-julian became too weary to go further , sheltering a little here or there when the wind cut [him]118-julian too keenly . Rather this , oh , a thousand times rather , than the hell behind [him]118-julian .

CHAPTER XXXVI

NO WAY BUT THIS

In the early days of October , [Waymark]130-waymark 's book appeared . It excited no special attention . Here and there [a reviewer was found who ventured to hint that there was powerful writing in this new novel]2926-a reviewer was found who ventured to hint that there was powerful writing in this new novel , but [no one]3702-no one dared to heartily recommend it to public attention . By some it was classed with the " unsavoury productions of [the so - called naturalist school]4727-the so - called naturalist school ; "[256-others] [others]256-others passed it by with a few lines of unfavourable comment . Clearly it was destined to bring [the author]1366-the author neither fame nor fortune .

[Waymark]130-waymark was surprised at [his]130-waymark own indifference . Having given a copy to [Casti]118-julian , and one to [Maud]103-maud , [he]130-waymark thought very little more of the production . It had ceased to interest [him]130-waymark ; [he]130-waymark felt that if [he]130-waymark were to write again it would be in a very different way and of [different people]2930-different people . Even when [he]130-waymark prided [himself]130-waymark most upon [his]130-waymark self - knowledge [he]130-waymark had been most ignorant of the direction in which [his]130-waymark character was developing . Unconsciously , [he]130-waymark had struggled to the extremity of weariness , and now [he]130-waymark cared only to let things take their course , standing aside from every shadow of new onset . Above all , [he]130-waymark kept away as much as possible from [the house at [Tottenham]62-tottenham , where [Ida]101-ida was still living]2931-the house at tottenham , where ida was still living . To go [there]3249-there meant only a renewal of torment . This was in fact the commonplace period of [his]130-waymark life . [He]130-waymark had no energy above that of [the ordinary young man who is making [his]130-waymark living in a commonplace way , and [his]130-waymark higher faculties lay dormant .

In one respect , and that , after all , perhaps the most important , [his]130-waymark position]2933-the ordinary young man who is making his living in a commonplace way , and his higher faculties lay dormant . in one respect , and that , after all , perhaps the most important , his position would soon be changed . [Mr. Woodstock]233-mr. woodstock 's will , when affairs were settled , would make [him]130-waymark richer by one thousand pounds ; [he]130-waymark might , if [he]130-waymark chose , presently give up [his]130-waymark employment , and either trust to literature , or look out for something less precarious . A year ago , this state of things would have filed [him]130-waymark with exultation . As it was , [he]130-waymark only saw in it an accident compelling [him]130-waymark to a certain fateful duty . There was now no reason why [his]130-waymark marriage should be long delayed . For [Maud]103-maud 's sake the step was clearly desirable . At present [she]103-maud and [[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother were living with [Miss Bygrave]121-miss bygrave in [the weird old house]2935-the weird old house . Of [Paul]203-paul there had come no tidings . [[Their]2936-their home]2616-their home was of course broken up , and [they]2936-their had no income of [their]2936-their own to depend upon . [Maud]103-maud [herself]103-maud , though of course aware of [Waymark]130-waymark 's prospects , seemed to shrink from speaking of the future . [She]103-maud grew more and more uncertain as to [her]103-maud real thoughts and desires .

And what of [Ida]101-ida ? It was hard for [her]101-ida to realise [her]101-ida position ; for a time [she]101-ida was conscious only of an overwhelming sense of loneliness . The interval of life with [[her]101-ida grandfather]2566-her grandfather was dreamlike as [she]101-ida looked back upon it ; yet harder to grasp was the situation in which [she]101-ida now found [herself]101-ida , surrounded by luxuries which had come to [her]101-ida as if from the clouds , [[her]101-ida own mistress]2939-her own mistress , free to form wishes merely for the sake of satisfying [them]2936-their . [She]101-ida cared little to realise the minor possibilities of wealth . The great purpose , the noble end to which [her]101-ida active life had shaped itself , was sternly present before [her]101-ida ; [she]101-ida would not shirk its demands . But there was lacking the inspiration of joy . Could [she]101-ida harden [herself]101-ida to every personal desire , and forget , in devotion to [others]256-others , the sickness of one great hope deferred ? Did [her]101-ida ideal require this of [her]101-ida ?

Would [he]2566-her grandfather come , now that [she]101-ida was free to give [herself]101-ida where [she]101-ida would , now that [she]101-ida was so alone ? The distance between [them]2941-them had increased ever since the beginning of [her]101-ida new life . [She]101-ida knew well the sort of pride [he]2566-her grandfather was capable of ; but was there not something else , something [she]101-ida dreaded to observe too closely , in the manner of [his]2566-her grandfather speech ? Did [he]2566-her grandfather think so meanly of [her]101-ida as to deem such precautions necessary against [her]101-ida misconstruction ? Nay , could [he]2566-her grandfather have guarded [himself]2566-her grandfather in that way if [he]2566-her grandfather really loved [her]101-ida ? Would it not have been to degrade [her]101-ida too much in [his]2566-her grandfather own eyes ?

[He]2566-her grandfather loved [her]101-ida once . Had [she]101-ida in any way grown less noble in [his]2566-her grandfather eyes , by those very things which [she]101-ida regarded as help and strengthening ? Did [he]2566-her grandfather perchance think [she]101-ida had too readily accepted ease when it was offered [her]101-ida , sacrificing the independence which [he]2566-her grandfather most regarded ? If so , all the more would [he]2566-her grandfather shrink from losing for [her]101-ida [his]2566-her grandfather own independence .

[She]101-ida imagined [herself]101-ida wedded to [him]2566-her grandfather ; at liberty to stand before [him]2566-her grandfather and confess all the thoughts which now consumed [her]101-ida in the silence of vain longing . " Why did [I]101-ida break free from the fetters of a shameful life ? Because [I]101-ida loved , and loved [you]101-ida . What gave [me]101-ida the strength to pass from idle luxury , poisoning the energies of the soul , to that life of lonely toil and misery ? [My]101-ida love , and [my]101-ida love for [you]101-ida . [I]101-ida kept apart from [you]101-ida then ; [I]101-ida would not even let [you]101-ida know what [I]101-ida was enduring ; only because [you]101-ida had spoken a hasty , thoughtless word to [me]101-ida , which showed [me]101-ida with terrible distinctness the meaning of all [I]101-ida had escaped , and filled [me]101-ida with a determination to prove to [myself]101-ida that [I]101-ida had not lost all [my]101-ida better nature , that there was still enough of purity in [my]101-ida being to save [me]101-ida finally . What was it that afflicted [me]101-ida with agony beyond all words when [I]101-ida was made [the victim of a cruel and base accusation]4728-the victim of a cruel and base accusation ? Not the fear of its consequences ; only the dread lest [you]101-ida should believe [me]101-ida guilty , and no longer deem [me]101-ida worthy of a thought . It is no arrogance to say that [I]101-ida am become [a pure woman]4729-a pure woman ; not [my]101-ida own merits , but love of [you]101-ida has made [me]101-ida so . [I]101-ida love [you]101-ida as [a woman]3216-a woman loves only once ; if [you]101-ida asked [me]101-ida to give up [my]101-ida life to prove it , [I]101-ida am capable of doing no less a thing than that . Flesh and spirit [I]101-ida lay before [you]101-ida all [yours]101-ida ; do [you]101-ida still think the offering unworthy ? "[101-ida]

And yet [she]2942-she knew that [she]2942-she could never thus speak to [him]2943-him ; [her]2942-she humility was too great . At moments [she]2942-she might feel this glow of conscious virtue , but for the most part the weight of all the past was so heavy upon [her]2942-she .

Fortunately , [her]2942-she time did not long remain unoccupied . As [[her]2942-she grandfather]2566-her grandfather 's heiress [she]2942-she found [herself]2942-she owner of [the East - end property]2945-the east - end property , and , as soon as it was assured that [she]2942-she would incur no danger , [she]2942-she went over [the houses]1394-the houses in the company of [the builder whom [Abraham]115-abraham had chosen to carry out [his]2566-her grandfather proposed restorations]2947-the builder whom abraham had chosen to carry out his proposed restorations . The improvements were proceeded with at once , greatly to the astonishment of [the tenants , to whom such changes inevitably suggested increase of rent]2948-the tenants , to whom such changes inevitably suggested increase of rent . These fears [Ida]101-ida did [her]101-ida best to dispel . Dressed in the simplest possible way , and with that kind , quiet manner which was natural to [her]101-ida , [she]101-ida went about from room to room , and did [her]101-ida best to become intimately acquainted with [the woman]448-the woman - kind of [the Lane]1392-the lane and [the Court]1401-the court . It was not an easy end to compass . [She]101-ida was received at first with extreme suspicion ; [her]101-ida appearance aroused that distrust which with the uneducated attaches to everything novel . In many instances [she]101-ida found it difficult to get it believed ' that [she]101-ida was really [the " landlord]4731-the " landlord . "[101-ida] But when this idea had been gradually mastered , and when , moreover , it was discovered that [she]101-ida brought [no tracts]2952-no tracts , spoke not at all of religious matters , was not impertinently curious , and showed indeed that [she]101-ida knew a good deal of what [she]101-ida talked about , something like respect for [her]101-ida began to spring up here and there , and [she]101-ida was spoken of as " [the right sort]4732-the right sort . "[101-ida]

[Ida]101-ida was excellently fitted for the work [she]101-ida had undertaken . [She]101-ida knew so well , from [her]101-ida own early experience , the nature of [the people with whom [she]101-ida was brought in contact]2953-the people with whom she was brought in contact , and had that instinctive sympathy with [their]2953-the people with whom she was brought in contact lives without which it is so vain to attempt practical social reform . [She]101-ida started with no theory , and as yet had no very definite end in view ; it simply appeared to [her]101-ida that , as [owner of [these slums]2955-these slums]2954-owner of these slums , honesty and regard for [her]101-ida own credit required that [she]101-ida should make [them]2955-these slums decent human habitations , and give what other help [she]101-ida could to [people obviously so much in need of it]2956-people obviously so much in need of it . The best was that [she]101-ida understood how and when such help could be afforded . To native practicality and prudence [she]101-ida added a keen recollection of the wants and difficulties [she]101-ida had struggled through in childhood ; there was no danger of [her]101-ida being foolishly lavish in charity , when [she]101-ida could foresee with sympathy all the evil results which would ensue . [Her]101-ida only temptation to imprudence was when , as so often happened , [she]101-ida saw [some little girl]2957-some little girl in a position which reminded [her]101-ida strongly of [her]101-ida own dark days ; all such [she]101-ida would have liked to take [home]3157-home with [her]101-ida and somehow provide for , saving [them]2959-them from the wretched alternatives which were all that life had to offer [them]2959-them . So , little by little , [she]101-ida was brought to think in a broader way of problems puzzling enough to wiser heads than [hers]101-ida . Social miseries , which [she]101-ida had previously regarded as mere matters of fact , having never enjoyed the opportunities of comparison which alone can present [them]2959-them in any other light , began to move [her]101-ida to indignation . Often it was with a keen sense of shame that [she]101-ida took the weekly rent , a sum scraped together [Heaven]138-heaven knew how , representing so much deduction from the food of [the family]675-the family . [She]101-ida knew that it would be impossible to remit the rent altogether , but at all events there was the power of reducing it , and this [she]101-ida did in many cases .

[The children [she]101-ida came to regard as [her]101-ida peculiar care]2961-the children she came to regard as her peculiar care . [Her]101-ida strong common sense taught [her]101-ida that it was with these that most could be done . [The parents]2962-the parents could not be reformed ; at best [they]2962-the parents might be kept from that darkest depth of poverty which corrupts soul and body alike . But might not [the girls]373-the girls be somehow put into the way of earning a decent livelihood ? [Ida]101-ida knew so well the effect upon [them]2959-them of the occupations to which [they]2959-them mostly turned , occupations degrading to womanhood , blighting every hope . Even to give [them]2959-them the means of remaining at [home]3157-home would not greatly help [them]2959-them ; there [they]2959-them still breathed a vile atmosphere . To remove [them]2959-them altogether was the only efficient way , and how could that be done ?

The months of late summer and autumn saw several more garden - parties . These , [Ida]101-ida knew , were very useful , but more enduring things must be devised . [Miss Hurst]238-miss hurst was [the only person with whom [she]101-ida could consult]2965-the only person with whom she could consult , and [that lady]305-that lady 's notions were not very practical . If only [she]101-ida could have spoken freely with [Waymark]130-waymark ; but that [she]101-ida could no longer on any subject , least of all on this . As winter set in , [he]130-waymark had almost forsaken [her]101-ida . [He]130-waymark showed no interest in [her]101-ida life , beyond asking occasionally what [she]101-ida was reading , and taking the opportunity to talk of books . Throughout November [she]101-ida neither saw [him]130-waymark nor heard from [him]130-waymark . Then one evening [he]130-waymark came .

[She]101-ida was alone when [the servant]289-the servant announced [him]130-waymark ; with [her]101-ida sat [[her]101-ida old companion]2968-her old companion , [Grim]169-grim . As [Waymark]130-waymark entered , [she]101-ida looked at [him]130-waymark with friendly smile , and said quietly

" Yes ; that was one of [my]101-ida old fancies . [I]101-ida am going right away into [the country]3594-the country , at all events for a year or two . [I]101-ida suppose [I]101-ida shall write novels . "[101-ida]

[He]2969-you could not help showing pleasure , and grew more natural . " [You]2969-you are too good for that ; [I]2969-you should have liked to think of [you]2969-you as far apart from those vile scenes . "[2969-you]

" Too good for it ? "[101-ida] [Her]101-ida voice trembled . " How can [any one]3197-any one be too good to help [the miserable]4739-the miserable ? [He]2970-he only smiled , [his]2970-he lips tortured to hold [their]2971-their peace .

" [I]101-ida had hoped [you]2969-you understood [me]101-ida better than that . Is that why [you]2969-you have left [me]101-ida to [myself]101-ida ? Do [you]2969-you doubt [my]101-ida sincerity ? " Yes ; [I]130-waymark know [you]101-ida well , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark said .

[Ida]101-ida looked steadily at [him]130-waymark . " [I]101-ida had no such thought . [You]130-waymark know how [my]101-ida ideals oppose each other . " [You]130-waymark will not be so for long , "[2972-i] [he]2972-i answered with more cheerfulness . " [My]2974-you wealth ! What is it to [me]2974-you ? What do [I]2974-you care for all the friends it might bring ? [They]562-friends are nothing to [me]2974-you in [my]2974-you misery . But [you]130-waymark ... [I]2974-you would give all [I]2974-you possess for one kind word from [you]130-waymark . "[2974-you]

Flushing over forehead and cheeks , [she]2973-her compelled [herself]2973-her to meet [his]2974-you look . It was [her]2973-her wealth that stood between [her]2973-her and [him]2974-you . [Her]2973-her position was not like that of [other women]4288-other women . Conventionalities were meaningless , set against a life .

" [I]2973-her have tried hard to make [myself]2973-her ever so little worthy of [you]2974-you , "[2973-her] [she]2973-her murmured , when [her]2973-her voice would again obey [her]2973-her will . " Am [I]2973-her still still too far beneath [you]2974-you ? "[2973-her]

" [Ida]101-ida , [I]2974-you am not free . "[2974-you]

[He]2974-you had risen . [Ida]101-ida sprang up , and moved towards [him]2974-you .

" This was [your]2974-you secret ? Tell [me]101-ida , then . Look [I]101-ida am strong ! Tell [me]101-ida about it . [I]101-ida might have thought of this . " [You]2974-you asking for forgiveness ? How [you]2974-you must despise [me]101-ida . "[101-ida]

" Why should [I]101-ida despise [you]2974-you ? " [I]130-waymark had told [[your]2974-you grandfather]4499-your grandfather , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark said in a broken voice . " In a letter [I]130-waymark wrote the very day [he]4499-your grandfather was taken ill , [I]130-waymark begged [him]4499-your grandfather to let [you]2974-you know that [I]130-waymark had bound [myself]130-waymark . "[130-waymark]

As [he]130-waymark spoke [he]130-waymark knew that [he]130-waymark was excusing [himself]130-waymark with a truth which implied a falsehood , and before it was too late [his]130-waymark soul revolted against the unworthiness .

" But it was [my]130-waymark own fault that it was left so long . [I]130-waymark would not let [him]4499-your grandfather tell [you]2974-you when [he]4499-your grandfather wished to ; [I]130-waymark put off the day as long as [I]130-waymark could . "[130-waymark]

" Since [you]130-waymark first knew [me]2977-her ? "[2977-her] [she]2977-her asked , in a low voice .

" No ! Since [you]130-waymark came to live [here]3335-here . [I]130-waymark was free before . "[130-waymark]

It was the part of [his]130-waymark confession which cost [him]130-waymark most to utter , and the hearing of it chilled [Ida]101-ida 's heart . Whilst [she]2977-her had been living through [her]2977-her bitterest shame and misery , [he]130-waymark had given [his]130-waymark love to [another woman]642-another woman , forgetful of [her]2977-her . For the first time , weakness overcame [her]2977-her .

" [I]2977-her thought [you]130-waymark loved [me]2977-her , "[2977-her] [she]2977-her sobbed , bowing [her]2977-her head .

" [I]2977-her did and [I]2977-her do . [I]2977-her ca n't understand [myself]2977-her , and it would be worse than vain to try to show [you]130-waymark how it came about . [I]2977-her have brought a curse upon [my]2977-her life , and worse than [my]2977-her own despair is [your]130-waymark misery . "[2977-her]

" Is [she]2977-her [a good woman [you]130-waymark are going to marry]4752-a good woman you are going to marry ? "[101-ida] [Ida]101-ida asked simply and kindly .

" Only less noble than [yourself]130-waymark . "[2977-her]

" And [she]2977-her loves [you]130-waymark no , [she]2977-her can not love as [I]2977-her do but [she]2977-her loves [you]130-waymark worthily and with all [her]2977-her soul ? "[2977-her]

" Worthily and with all [her]2977-her soul the greater [my]2977-her despair . "[2977-her]

" Then [I]2977-her dare not think of [her]2977-her one unkind thought . [We]4753-we must remember [her]2977-her , and be strong for [her]2977-her sake . [You]2979-you will leave [London]3-london and forget [me]2977-her soon , yes , yes , [you]2979-you will try to forget [me]2977-her . [You]2979-you owe it to [her]2977-her ; it is [your]2979-you duty . "[2977-her]

" Duty ! "[2979-you] [he]2979-you broke out passionately . " What have [I]2979-you to do with duty ? Was it not [my]2979-you duty to be true to [you]2979-you ? Was it not [my]2979-you duty to confess [my]2979-you hateful weakness , when [I]2979-you had taken the fatal step ? Duty has no meaning for [me]2979-you . [I]2979-you have set it aside at every turn . Even now there would be no obligation on [me]2979-you to keep [my]2979-you word , but that [I]2979-you am too great [a coward]4754-a coward to revoke it . "[2979-you]

[She]2980-i stood near to [him]2979-you .

" [Dear]3177-dear , [I]2977-her will call [you]2979-you so , it is for the last time , [you]2979-you think these things in the worst moment of [our]4756-our suffering ; afterwards [you]2979-you will thank [me]2977-her for having been strong enough , or cold enough , to be [your]2979-you conscience . There is such a thing as duty ; it speaks in [your]2979-you heart and in [mine]2977-her , and tells [us]4756-our that [we]4756-our must part . "[2977-her]

" [You]2977-her speak so lightly of parting . If [you]2977-her felt all that [I]2980-i "[2980-i]

" [My]2980-i love is no shadow less than [yours]2979-you , "[2980-i] [she]2980-i said , with earnestness which was well nigh severity . " [I]2980-i have never wavered from [you]2981-you since [I]2980-i knew [you]2981-you first . "[2980-i]

" [Ida]101-ida ! "[2980-i]

" [I]2980-i meant no reproach , but it will perhaps help [you]101-ida to think of that . [You]2981-you did love [her]2980-i , if it was only for a day , and that love will return . "[2980-i]

[She]2980-i moved from [him]2981-you , and [he]2981-you too rose .

" [You]2980-i shame [me]2981-you , "[2981-you] [he]2981-you said , under [his]2981-you breath . " [I]2981-you am not worthy to touch [your]2980-i hand . "[2981-you]

" Yes , "[2980-i] [she]2980-i returned , smiling amid [her]2980-i tears , " very worthy of all the love [I]2980-i have given [you]2981-you , and of the love with which [she]2980-i will make [you]2981-you happy . [I]2980-i shall suffer , but the thought of [your]2981-you happiness will help [me]2980-i to bear up and try to live a life [you]2981-you would not call ignoble . [You]2981-you will do great things , and [I]2980-i shall hear of them , and be glad . Yes ; [I]2980-i know that is before [you]2981-you . [You]2981-you are one of those who can not rest till [they]4757-they have won a high place . [I]2980-i , too , have [my]2980-i work , and "[2980-i]

[Her]2980-i voice failed .

" Shall [we]2982-we never see [each other]459-each other again , [Ida]101-ida ? "[2981-you]

" Perhaps . In a few years [we]2982-we might meet , and be [friends]562-friends . But [I]2981-you dare not think of that now . "[2981-you]

[They]2982-we clasped hands , for one dread moment resisted the lure of eyes and lips , and so parted .

CHAPTER XXXVII

FORBIDDEN

December was half through , and it was the eve of [Maud Enderby]103-maud 's marriage - day . Everything was ready for the morrow . [Waymark]130-waymark had been away in [the South]2983-the south , and [the house to which [he]130-waymark would take [[his]130-waymark wife]505-his wife]2984-the house to which he would take his wife now awaited [their]2982-we coming .

It was a foggy night . [Maud]103-maud had been for an hour to [Our Lady of [the Rosary]91-the rosary]2285-our lady of the rosary , and found it difficult to make [her]103-maud way back . The street lamps were mere luminous blurs upon the clinging darkness , and the suspension of the wonted traffic made the air strangely still . It was cold , that kind of cold which wraps the limbs like a cloth soaked in icy water . When [she]103-maud knocked at the door of [[[her]103-maud aunt]737-her aunt 's house]2988-her aunt 's house , and [it]2989-it was opened to [her]103-maud , wreaths of mist swept in and hung about [the lighted hall]2990-the lighted hall . It seemed colder within than without . Footsteps echoed here in the old way , and voices lost themselves in a muffled resonance along the bare white walls . [The house]288-the house was more tomb - like than ever on such a night as thin To [Maud]103-maud 's eyes the intruding fog shaped itself into ghostly visages , which looked upon [her]103-maud with weird and woeful compassion . [She]103-maud shuddered , and hastened [upstairs]434-upstairs to [[[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother 's room]2994-her mother 's room .

After [[her]103-maud husband]584-her husband 's disappearance , [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby had passed [her]103-maud days in a morbid apathy , contrasting strangely with the restless excitement which had so long possessed [her]103-maud . But a change came over [her]103-maud from the day when [she]103-maud was told of [Maud]103-maud 's approaching marriage . It was [her]103-maud delight to have [Maud]103-maud sit by [her]103-maud bed , or [her]103-maud couch , and talk over the details of the wedding and the new life that would follow upon it . [Her]103-maud interest in [Waymark]130-waymark , which had fallen off during the past half - year , all at once revived ; [she]103-maud conversed with [him]130-waymark as [she]103-maud had been used to do when [she]103-maud first made [his]130-waymark acquaintance , and the publication of [his]130-waymark book afforded [her]103-maud endless matter for gossip . [She]103-maud began to speak of [herself]103-maud as [an old woman]2996-an old woman , and of spending [her]103-maud last years happily in [the country]3594-the country . To all appearances [she]103-maud had dismissed from [her]103-maud mind the calamity which had befallen [her]103-maud ; [[her]103-maud husband]584-her husband might have been long dead for any thought [she]103-maud seemed to give [him]584-her husband . [She]103-maud was wholly taken up with childish joy in trivial matters . The dress in which [Maud]103-maud should be married gave [her]103-maud thoughts constant occupation , and [she]103-maud fretted at any opposition to [her]103-maud ideas . Still , like [a child]378-a child , [she]103-maud allowed [herself]103-maud to be brought round to [others]256-others ' views , and was ultimately led to consent that the costume should be a very simple one , merely a new dress , in fact , which [Maud]103-maud would be able to wear subsequently with little change . Even thus , every detail of it was as important to [her]103-maud as if it had been the most elaborate piece of bridal attire . In talking with [Maud]103-maud , too , [she]103-maud had lost that kind of awe which had formerly restrained [her]103-maud ; it was as though [she]103-maud had been [an affectionate mother]3001-an affectionate mother ever since [[her]103-maud daughter]542-her daughter 's birth . [She]103-maud called [her]103-maud by pet names , often caressed [her]103-maud , and wished for loving words and acts in return . Of [Miss Bygrave]121-miss bygrave 's presence in [the house]288-the house [she]103-maud appeared scarcely conscious , never referring to [her]103-maud , and suffering a vague trouble if [[her]103-maud sister]1806-her sister entered [the room where [she]103-maud was , which [Theresa]206-theresa did very seldom]3005-the room where she was , which theresa did very seldom .

The new dress had come [home]3157-home finished this evening whilst [Maud]103-maud was away . On [the latter]425-the latter 's return , [[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother insisted on seeing [her]103-maud at once in [it]3009-it , and [Maud]103-maud obeyed . [A strange bride , rather as one who was about to [we]3011-we d [herself]3010-a strange bride , rather as one who was about to we d herself to heaven beneath the veil , than preparing to be led to the altar to Heaven beneath the veil , than preparing to be led to the altar]3010-a strange bride , rather as one who was about to we d herself to heaven beneath the veil , than preparing to be led to the altar .

Having resumed [her]103-maud ordinary dregs , [Maud]103-maud went [downstairs]445-downstairs to [the parlour where [[her]103-maud aunt]737-her aunt was sitting]3013-the parlour where her aunt was sitting . [Miss Bygrave]121-miss bygrave laid down a book as [she]121-miss bygrave entered .

" [We]4760-we shall not see [each other]459-each other after tonight , "[206-theresa] [Theresa]206-theresa said , breaking the stillness with [her]206-theresa grave but not unkind voice . " Is there anything more [you]103-maud would like to say to [me]206-theresa , [Maud]103-maud ? "[206-theresa]

" Only that [I]206-theresa shall always think of [you]103-maud , and grieve that [we]4760-we are parted . "[206-theresa]

" [You]103-maud are going into [the world]622-the world , "[3015-the other sadly] said [the other sadly]3015-the other sadly , " [my]3015-the other sadly thoughts can not follow [you]103-maud [there]3249-there . But [your]103-maud purer spirit will often be with [me]3015-the other sadly . "[3015-the other sadly]

" And [your]103-maud spirit with [me]206-theresa . If [I]206-theresa had been permitted to share [your]103-maud life , that would have been [my]206-theresa greatest joy . [I]206-theresa am consciously choosing what [my]206-theresa soul would set aside . For a time [I]206-theresa thought [I]206-theresa had reconciled [myself]206-theresa to [the world]622-the world ; [I]206-theresa found delight in it , and came to look on the promptings of the spirit as morbid fancies . That has passed . [I]206-theresa know the highest , but between [me]206-theresa and it there is a gulf which it may be [I]206-theresa shall never pass . "[206-theresa]

" It is only to [few]4765-few , "[206-theresa] said [Theresa]206-theresa , looking at [Maud]103-maud with [her]206-theresa smile of assured peace , " that it is given to persevere and attain . "[206-theresa]

As [they]3016-they sat once more in silence , there suddenly came a light knock at the house - door . At this moment [Maud]103-maud 's thoughts had wandered back to a Christmas of [her]103-maud childhood , when [she]103-maud had sat just as to - night with [[her]103-maud aunt]737-her aunt , and had for the first time listened to those teachings which had moulded [her]103-maud life . The intervening years were swept away , and [she]103-maud was once more [the thoughtful , wondering child]3018-the thoughtful , wondering child , conscious of the great difference between [herself]103-maud and [[her]103-maud companions]322-her companions ; in spite of [herself]103-maud learning to regard the world in which [they]3016-they moved as something in which [she]103-maud had no part . Of [those school companions]3020-those school companions [a few]3021-a few came back to [her]103-maud mind , and , before all , [the poor girl named [Ida Starr]101-ida , whom [she]103-maud had loved and admired]3022-the poor girl named ida starr , whom she had loved and admired . What had become of [Ida]101-ida , after [she]101-ida had been sent away from [[Miss Rutherford]98-miss rutherford 's school]3023-miss rutherford 's school ? [She]103-maud remembered that last meeting with [her]101-ida in [the street]340-the street , on the evening of Christmas Day , and could see [her]101-ida face .

The house door was opened , and [Maud]103-maud heard a voice outside which held [her]103-maud to the spot where [she]103-maud stood . Then [Theresa]206-theresa re - entered [the room]255-the room , and after [her]206-theresa came [Paul Enderby]203-paul .

[He]203-paul seemed to be wearing a disguise ; at all events [his]203-paul clothing was that of [a working man]3026-a working man , poor and worn , and [his]203-paul face was changed by the growth of a beard . [He]203-paul shivered with cold , and , as [Miss Bygrave]121-miss bygrave closed the door behind [him]203-paul , stood with eyes sunk to the ground , in an attitude of misery and shame . [Maud]103-maud , recovering quickly from the shock [his]203-paul entrance had caused [her]103-maud , approached [him]203-paul and took [his]203-paul hand .

" [Father]245-father , "[103-maud] [she]103-maud said gently . [Her]103-maud voice overcame [him]203-paul ; [he]203-paul burst into tears and stood hiding [his]203-paul face with the rough cap [he]203-paul held . [Maud]103-maud turned to [[her]103-maud aunt]737-her aunt , who remained at a little distance , unmoving , [her]737-her aunt eyes cast down . Before any other word was said , the door opened quickly , and [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby ran in with a smothered cry . Throwing [her]103-maud arms about [[her]103-maud husband]584-her husband , [she]103-maud clung to [him]203-paul in a passion of grief and tenderness . In a moment [she]103-maud had been changed from [the listless , childish woman of the last few months]3029-the listless , childish woman of the last few months to [a creature instinct with violent emotion]3030-a creature instinct with violent emotion . [Her]103-maud mingled excess of joy and anguish could not have displayed itself more vehemently had [she]103-maud been sorrowing night and day for [[her]103-maud husband]584-her husband 's loss . [Maud]103-maud was terrified at the scene , and shrunk to [Theresa]206-theresa 's side . Without heeding either , [the distracted woman]3032-the distracted woman led [Paul]203-paul from [the room]255-the room , and [upstairs]434-upstairs to [[her]3032-the distracted woman own chamber]2343-her own chamber . Drawing [him]203-paul to a chair , [she]103-maud fell on [her]103-maud knees beside [him]203-paul and wept agonisingly .

" [You]203-paul will stay with [me]103-maud now ? "[103-maud] [she]103-maud cried , when [her]103-maud voice could form words . " [You]203-paul wo n't leave [me]103-maud again , [Paul]203-paul ? [We]4766-we will hide [you]203-paul here . No , no ; [I]103-maud am for getting . [You]203-paul will go away with [us]4766-we , away from [London]3-london to a safe place . [Maud]103-maud is going to be married to - morrow , and [we]4766-we will live with [her]103-maud in [[her]103-maud new home]4767-her new home . [You]203-paul have suffered dreadfully ; [you]203-paul look so changed , so ill . [You]203-paul shall rest , and [I]103-maud will nurse [you]203-paul . Oh , [I]103-maud will be [a good wife to [you]203-paul]4768-a good wife to you , [Paul]203-paul . Speak to [me]103-maud , do speak to [me]103-maud : speak kindly , [dear]3177-dear ! How long is it since [I]103-maud lost [you]203-paul ? "[103-maud]

" [I]3036-i dare n't stay , [Emily]207-emily , "[3036-i] [he]3036-i replied , in a hoarse and broken voice . " [I]3036-i should be discovered . [I]3036-i must get away from [England]15-england , that is [my]3036-i only chance . [I]3036-i have scarcely left [the house]288-the house where [I]3036-i was hiding all this time . It would n't have been safe to try and escape , even if [I]3036-i had had any money . [I]3036-i have hungered for days , and [I]3036-i am weaker than [a child]378-a child . "[3036-i]

[He]3036-i sobbed again in the extremity of [his]3036-i wretchedness .

" It was all for [my]3037-i sake ! "[3037-i] [she]3037-i cried , clinging around [his]3036-i neck . " [I]3037-i am [your]3036-i curse . [I]3037-i have brought [you]3036-i to ruin a second time . [I]3037-i am [a bad , wretched woman]4772-a bad , wretched woman ; if [you]3036-i drove [me]3037-i from [you]3036-i with blows it would be less than [I]3037-i deserve ! [You]3036-i can never forgive [me]3037-i ; but let [me]3037-i be [[your]3036-i slave]4773-your slave , let [me]3037-i suffer something dreadful for [your]3036-i sake ! Why did [I]3037-i ever recover from [my]3037-i madness , only to bring that upon [you]3036-i ! "[3037-i]

[He]3038-i could speak little , but leaned back , holding [her]3039-she to [him]3038-i with one arm .

" No , it is not [your]3039-she fault , [Emily]207-emily , "[3038-i] [he]3038-i said . " Only [my]3038-i own weakness and folly . [Your]3036-i love repays [me]3038-i for all [I]3038-i have undergone ; that was all [I]3038-i ever wanted . "[3038-i]

When [she]3039-she had exhausted [herself]3039-she in passionate consolation , [she]3039-she left [him]3038-i for a few moments to get [him]3038-i food , and [he]3038-i ate of it like [a famished man]3040-a famished man .

" If [I]3038-i can only get money enough to leave [the country]3594-the country , [I]3038-i am saved , "[3038-i] [he]3038-i said . " If [I]3038-i stay [here]3335-here , [I]3038-i shall be found , and [they]4776-they will imprison [me]3038-i for years . [I]3038-i had rather kill [myself]3038-i ![3038-i]

" [Mr. Waymark]130-waymark will give [us]4777-us the money , "[3039-she] was the reply , " and [we]4777-us will go away together . "[3039-she]

" That would betray [me]3038-i ; it would be folly to face such a risk . If [I]3038-i can escape , then [you]3038-i shall come to [me]3038-i . "[3038-i]

" Oh , [you]3038-i will leave [me]3041-you ! "[3041-you] [she]3041-you cried . " [I]3041-you shall lose [you]3038-i , as [I]3041-you did before , but this time for ever ! [You]3038-i do n't love [me]3041-you , [Paul]203-paul ! And how can [I]3041-you expect [you]3038-i should ? But let [me]3041-you go as [[your]3038-i servant]4778-your servant . Let [me]3041-you dress like [a man]1260-a man , and follow [you]3038-i . Who will notice then ? "[3041-you]

[He]3042-he shook [his]3042-he head .

" [I]3038-i love [you]3041-you , [Emily]207-emily , and shall love [you]3041-you as long as [I]3038-i breathe . To hear [you]3041-you speak to [me]3038-i like this has almost the power to make [me]3038-i happy . If [I]3038-i had known it , [I]3038-i should n't have stayed so long away from [you]3041-you ; [I]3038-i had n't the courage to come , and [I]3038-i thought the sight of [me]3038-i would only be misery to [you]3041-you . [I]3038-i have lived a terrible life , among [the poorest people]4780-the poorest people , getting [my]3038-i bread as [they]4780-the poorest people did ; oftener starving . [Not one of [[my]3038-i acquaintances]4782-my acquaintances]4781-not one of my acquaintances was to be trusted . [I]3038-i have not seen one face [I]3038-i knew since [I]3038-i first heard of [my]3038-i danger and escaped . But [I]3038-i had rather live on like that than fall into the hands of [the police]2117-the police ; [I]3038-i should never know freedom again . The thought maddens [me]3038-i with fear . "[3038-i]

" [You]3041-you are safe here , love , quite safe ! "[3043-i] [she]3043-i urged soothingly . " Who could know that [you]3041-you are here ? Who could know that [Maud]103-maud and [I]3043-i were living [here]3335-here ? "[3043-i]

There was a tap at the door . [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby started to it , turned the key , and then asked who was there .

" [Emily]207-emily , "[121-miss bygrave] said [Miss Bygrave]121-miss bygrave 's voice , " let [me]121-miss bygrave come in or let [Paul]203-paul come out here and speak to [me]121-miss bygrave . "[121-miss bygrave]

There was something unusual in [the speaker]488-the speaker 's tone ; it was quick and nervous . [Paul]203-paul [himself]203-paul went to the door , and , putting [[his]203-paul wife]505-his wife 's hand aside , opened it .

" What is it ? "[203-paul] [he]203-paul asked .

[She]3043-i beckoned [him]203-paul to leave [the room]255-the room , then whispered :

" Some one [I]3043-i do n't know is at the front door . [I]3043-i opened it with the chain on , and [a man]1260-a man said [he]1260-a man must see [Mr. Enderby]205-mr. enderby . "[3043-i]

" Ca n't [I]203-paul go out by the back ? "[203-paul] [Paul]203-paul asked , all but voiceless with terror . " [I]203-paul dare n't hide in [the rooms]739-the rooms ; [they]3047-they will search [them]739-the rooms all . How did [they]3047-they know that [I]203-paul was [here]3335-here ? O God , [I]203-paul am lost ! "[203-paul]

[They]3047-they could hear the knocking below repeated . [Paul]203-paul hurried down [the stairs]742-the stairs , followed by [[his]203-paul wife]505-his wife , whom [Theresa]206-theresa in vain tried to hold back [He]203-paul knew the way to the door which led into [the garden]747-the garden , and opening this , sprang into the darkness . Scarcely had [he]203-paul taken a step , when strong arms seized [him]203-paul .

" Hold on ! "[505-his wife] said a voice . " [You]203-paul must come back with [me]505-his wife into [the house]288-the house . "[505-his wife]

At the same moment there was a shriek close at hand , and , as [they]3047-they turned to the open door , [Paul]203-paul and [[his]203-paul captor]3051-his captor saw [Emily]207-emily prostrate on the threshold , and [Miss Bygrave]121-miss bygrave stooping over [her]207-emily .

" Better open the front door , [ma'am]3500-ma'am , "[3052-the police officer] said [the police officer]3052-the police officer , " and ask [[my]3052-the police officer friend]3429-my friend there to come through . [We]3047-they 've got all [we]3047-they want . "[3052-the police officer]

This was done , and when [Emily]207-emily had been carried into [the house]288-the house , [Paul]203-paul was led thither also by [[his]203-paul captor]3051-his captor . As [they]3047-they stood in [the hall]2675-the hall , [the second officer]3056-the second officer drew from [his]3056-the second officer pocket a warrant , and read it out with official gravity .

" [You]203-paul 'll go quietly with [us]3047-they , [I]3056-the second officer suppose ? "[3056-the second officer] [he]3056-the second officer then said .

[Paul]203-paul nodded , and [all three]1612-all three departed by the front door .

It was midnight and before [Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby showed any signs of returning consciousness . [Miss Bygrave]121-miss bygrave and [Maud]103-maud sat by [her]204-mrs. enderby bed together , and at length [one of [them]3047-they]3058-one of them noticed that [she]204-mrs. enderby had opened [her]204-mrs. enderby eyes and was looking about [her]204-mrs. enderby , though without moving [her]204-mrs. enderby head .

" [Mother]126-mother , "[103-maud] [Maud]103-maud asked , bending over [her]204-mrs. enderby , " are [you]204-mrs. enderby better ? Do [you]204-mrs. enderby know [me]103-maud ? "[103-maud]

[Emily]207-emily nodded . There was no touch of natural colour in [her]207-emily face , and its muscles seemed paralysed . And [she]207-emily lay thus for hours , conscious apparently , but paying no attention to those in [the room]255-the room . Early in the morning [a medical man]2839-a medical man was summoned , but [his]2839-a medical man assistance made no change . The fog was still heavy , and only towards noon was it possible to dispense with lamp - light ; then there gleamed for an hour or two a weird mockery of day , and again it was nightfall . With the darkness came rain .

[Waymark]130-waymark had come to [the house]288-the house about ten o'clock . But this was to be no wedding - day . [Maud]103-maud begged [him]130-waymark through [[her]103-maud aunt]737-her aunt not to see [her]103-maud , and [he]130-waymark returned as [he]130-waymark came . [Miss Bygrave]121-miss bygrave had told [him]130-waymark all that had happened .

[Mrs. Enderby]204-mrs. enderby seemed to sleep for some hours , but just after nightfall the previous condition returned ; [she]204-mrs. enderby lay with [her]204-mrs. enderby eyes open , and just nodded when spoken to . From eight o'clock to midnight [Maud]103-maud tried to rest in [[her]103-maud own room]1931-her own room , but sleep was far from [her]103-maud , and when [she]103-maud returned to [the sick - chamber]3064-the sick - chamber to relieve [[her]103-maud aunt]737-her aunt , [she]103-maud was almost as worn and ghastly in countenance as the one [they]3066-they tended . [She]103-maud took [her]103-maud place by the fire , and sat listening to the sad rain , which fell heavily upon the soaked garden - ground below . It had a lulling effect . Weariness overcame [her]103-maud , and before [she]103-maud could suspect the inclination , [she]103-maud had fallen asleep .

Suddenly [she]103-maud was awake again , wide awake , it seemed to [her]103-maud , without any interval of half - consciousness , and staring horror - struck at the scene before [her]103-maud . The shaded lamp stood on the chest of drawers at one side of [the room]255-the room , and by its light [she]103-maud saw [[her]103-maud mother]377-her mother in front of the looking - glass , [her]377-her mother raised hand holding something that glistened . [She]103-maud could not move a limb ; [her]103-maud tongue was powerless to utter a sound . There was a wild laugh , a quick motion of the raised hand then it seemed to [Maud]103-maud as if [the room]255-the room were filled with a crimson light , followed by the eternal darkness .

A fortnight later [Miss Bygrave]121-miss bygrave was sitting in the early morning by the bed where [Maud]103-maud lay ill . For some days it had been feared that [the girl]316-the girl 's reason would fail , and though this worst possibility seemed at length averted , [her]103-maud condition was still full of danger . [She]103-maud had recognised [[her]103-maud aunt]737-her aunt the preceding evening , but a relapse had followed . Now [she]103-maud unexpectedly turned to [the watcher]3072-the watcher , and spoke feebly , but with perfect self - control .

" [Aunt]4791-aunt , is madness hereditary ? "[103-maud]

[Miss Bygrave]121-miss bygrave , who had thought [her]103-maud asleep , bent over [her]103-maud and tried to turn [her]103-maud mind to other thoughts . But [the sick girl]3073-the sick girl would speak only of this subject .

" [I]103-maud am quite [myself]103-maud , "[103-maud] [she]103-maud said , " and [I]103-maud feel better . Yes , [I]103-maud remember reading somewhere that it was hereditary . "[103-maud]

[She]103-maud was quiet for a little .

" [Aunt]4792-aunt , "[103-maud] [she]103-maud then said , " [I]103-maud shall never be married . It would be wrong to [him]130-waymark . [I]103-maud am afraid of [myself]103-maud . "[103-maud]

[She]103-maud did not recur to the subject till [she]103-maud had risen , two or three weeks after , and was strong enough to move about [the room]255-the room . [Waymark]130-waymark had called every day during [her]103-maud illness . As soon as [he]130-waymark heard that [she]103-maud was up , [he]130-waymark desired to see [her]103-maud , but [Maud]103-maud begged [him]130-waymark , through [[her]103-maud aunt]737-her aunt , to wait yet a day or two . In the night which followed [she]103-maud wrote to [him]130-waymark , and the letter was this :

" If [I]103-maud had seen [you]130-waymark when [you]130-waymark called yesterday , [I]103-maud should have had to face a task beyond [my]103-maud strength . Yet it would be wrong to keep from [you]130-waymark any longer what [I]103-maud have to say . [I]103-maud must write it , and hope [your]130-waymark knowledge of [me]103-maud will help [you]130-waymark to understand what [I]103-maud can only imperfectly express .[103-maud]

" [I]103-maud ask [you]130-waymark to let [me]103-maud break [my]103-maud promise to [you]130-waymark . [I]103-maud have not ceased to love [you]130-waymark ; to [me]103-maud [you]130-waymark are still all that is best and dearest in [the world]622-the world . [You]130-waymark would have made [my]103-maud life very happy . But happiness is now what [I]103-maud dare not wish for . [I]103-maud am too weak to make that use of it which , [I]103-maud do not doubt , is permitted [us]4794-us ; it would enslave [my]103-maud soul . With a nature such as [mine]103-maud , there is only one path of safety : [I]103-maud must renounce all . [You]130-waymark know [me]103-maud to be [no hypocrite]4795-no hypocrite , and to [you]130-waymark , in this moment , [I]103-maud need not fear to speak [my]103-maud whole thought , The sacrifice has cost [me]103-maud much To break [my]103-maud faith to [you]130-waymark , and to put aside for ever all [the world]622-the world 's joys the strength for this has only come after hours of bitterest striving . Try to be glad that [I]103-maud have won ; it is all behind [me]103-maud , and [I]103-maud stand upon the threshold of peace .[103-maud]

" [You]130-waymark know how from [a child]378-a child [I]103-maud have suffered . What to [others]256-others was pure and lawful joy became to [me]103-maud a temptation . But [God]123-god was not unjust ; if [He]123-god so framed [me]103-maud , [He]123-god gave [me]103-maud at the same time the power to understand and to choose . All those warnings which [I]103-maud have , in [my]103-maud blindness , spoken of so lightly to [you]130-waymark , [I]103-maud now recall with humbler and truer mind . If the shadow of sin darkened [my]103-maud path , it was that [I]103-maud might look well to [my]103-maud steps , and , alas , [I]103-maud have failed so , have gone so grievously astray ! [God]123-god , in [His]123-god righteous anger , has terribly visited [me]103-maud . The most fearful form of death has risen before [me]103-maud ; [I]103-maud have been cast into abysses of horror , and only saved from frenzy by the mercy which brought all this upon [me]103-maud for [my]103-maud good . A few months ago [I]103-maud had also a warning . [I]103-maud did not disregard it , but [I]103-maud could not overcome the love which bound [me]103-maud to [you]130-waymark . But for that love , how much easier it would have been to [me]103-maud to overcome [the world]622-the world and [myself]103-maud .[103-maud]

" [You]130-waymark will forgive [me]130-waymark , for [you]130-waymark will understand [me]130-waymark . Do not write in reply ; spare [me]130-waymark , [I]130-waymark entreat [you]130-waymark , a renewal of that dark hour [I]130-waymark have passed through . With [[my]130-waymark aunt]4424-my aunt [I]130-waymark am going to leave [London]3-london . [We]4801-we shall remain together , and [she]4424-my aunt will strengthen [me]130-waymark in the new life . May [God]123-god bless [you]130-waymark here and hereafter . [MAUD ENDERBY]103-maud . "[130-waymark]

After an interval of a day [Waymark]130-waymark wrote as follows to [Miss Bygrave]121-miss bygrave :

" Doubtless [you]121-miss bygrave know that [Maud]103-maud has written desiring [me]121-miss bygrave to release [her]103-maud . [I]121-miss bygrave can not but remember that [she]103-maud is scarcely yet recovered from a severe illness , and [her]103-maud letter must not be final . [She]103-maud entreats [me]121-miss bygrave not to write to [her]103-maud or see [her]103-maud . Accordingly [I]121-miss bygrave address [myself]121-miss bygrave to [you]121-miss bygrave , and beg that [you]121-miss bygrave will not allow [Maud]103-maud to take any irrevocable step till [she]103-maud is perfectly well , and has had time to reflect . [I]121-miss bygrave shall still deem [her]103-maud promise to [me]121-miss bygrave binding . If after the lapse of six months from now [she]103-maud still desires to be released , [I]121-miss bygrave must know it , either from [herself]103-maud or from [you]121-miss bygrave . Write to [me]121-miss bygrave at the old address . "[121-miss bygrave]

CHAPTER XXXVIII

ORDERS OF RELEASE

[Waymark]130-waymark and [Casti]118-julian spent [their]3076-their Christmas Eve together . [They]3076-their spoke freely of [each other]459-each other 's affairs , saving that there was no mention of [Ida]101-ida . [Waymark]130-waymark had of course said nothing of that parting between [Ida]101-ida and [himself]130-waymark . Of the hope which supported [him]130-waymark [he]130-waymark could not speak to [[his]130-waymark friend]876-his friend .

A month had told upon [Julian]118-julian as months do when the end draws so near . In spite of [his]118-julian suffering [he]118-julian still discharged [his]118-julian duties at [the hospital]3287-the hospital , but it was plain that [he]118-julian would not be able to do so much longer . And what would happen then ?

" [Casti]118-julian , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark exclaimed suddenly , when a hint of this thought had brought both of [them]3076-their to a pause , " come away with [me]130-waymark . "[130-waymark]

[Julian]118-julian looked up in bewilderment .

" Where to ? "[118-julian]

" Anywhere . To [some place where the sun shines]4802-some place where the sun shines . "[130-waymark]

" What an impossible idea ! How am [I]118-julian to get [my]118-julian living ? And how is [she]876-his friend to live ? "[118-julian]

" Look here , "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark said , smiling , " [my]130-waymark will is a little stronger than [yours]118-julian , and in the present case [I]130-waymark mean to exercise it . [I]130-waymark have said , and there 's an end of it . [You]118-julian say [she]876-his friend 'll be away from [home]3157-home to - morrow . Good . [We]4804-we go together , pack up [your]118-julian books and things in half an hour or so , bring them here , and then off ! Sic volo , sic jubeo , sit pro ratione voluntas ! "[130-waymark]

And it was done , though not till [Waymark]130-waymark had overcome the other 's opposition by the most determined effort . [Julian]118-julian understood perfectly well the full significance of the scheme , for all [Waymark]130-waymark 's kind endeavour to put a hopeful and commonplace aspect on [his]118-julian proposal . [He]118-julian resisted as long as [his]118-julian strength would allow , then put [himself]118-julian in [[his]118-julian friend]876-his friend 's hands .

It was some time before [Julian]118-julian could set [his]118-julian mind at rest with regard to the desertion of [[his]118-julian wife]505-his wife . Though [no one capable of judging the situation]3082-no one capable of judging the situation could have cast upon [him]118-julian a shadow of blame , the first experience of peace mingled itself in [his]118-julian mind with self - reproach . [Waymark]130-waymark showed [him]118-julian how utterly baseless any such feeling was . [Harriet]216-harriet had proved [herself]216-harriet unworthy of a moment 's consideration , and it was certain that , as long as [she]216-harriet received [her]216-harriet weekly remittance paid through [an agent in [London]3-london]3083-an agent in london , [she]216-harriet would trouble [herself]216-harriet very little about the rest ; or , at all events , any feeling that might possess [her]216-harriet would be wholly undeserving of respect . [Gradually Julian]118-julian accustomed [himself]118-julian to this thought .

[They]3084-they were in [the Isle of Wight]92-the isle of wight ; comfortably housed , with [the sea]1626-the sea before [their]3084-they eyes , and the boon of sunshine which [Casti]118-julian had so longed for .

[Waymark]130-waymark gave [himself]130-waymark wholly to [the invalid]2552-the invalid . [He]130-waymark had no impulse to resume literary work ; anything was welcome which enabled [him]130-waymark to fill up the day and reach the morrow . Whilst [Julian]118-julian lay on the couch , which was drawn up to the fireside , [Waymark]130-waymark read aloud anything that could lead [them]3084-they to forget [themselves]3084-they . At other times , [Julian]118-julian either read to [himself]118-julian or wrote verse , which , however , [he]118-julian did not show to [[his]118-julian friend]876-his friend . Before springtime came [he]118-julian found it difficult even to maintain a sitting attitude for long . [His]118-julian cough still racked [him]118-julian terribly . [Waymark]130-waymark often lay awake in the night , listening to that fearful sound in [the next room]3088-the next room . At such times [he]130-waymark tried to fancy [himself]130-waymark in [the dying man]3089-the dying man 's position , and then the sweat of horror came upon [his]130-waymark brow . Deeply [he]130-waymark sympathised with the misery [he]130-waymark could do so little to allay . Yet [he]118-julian was doing what [he]118-julian might to make the end a quiet one , and the consciousness of this brought [him]118-julian many a calm moment .

However it might be in those fearful vigils , [Julian]118-julian 's days did not seem unhappy . [He]118-julian was resigning [himself]118-julian to the inevitable , in the strength of that quiet which sometimes ensues upon despair . Now and then [he]118-julian could even be , to all appearances , light - hearted .

With the early May [he]118-julian had a revival of inspiration . Strangely losing sight of [his]118-julian desperate condition , [he]118-julian spoke once more of beginning the great poem planned long ago . It was living within [his]118-julian mind and heart , [he]118-julian said . [Waymark]130-waymark listened to [him]118-julian whilst [he]130-waymark unfolded book after book of glorious vision ; listened , and wondered .

There was a splendid sunset one evening at this time , and [the two]273-the two watched it together from [the room in which [they]273-the two always sat]3091-the room in which they always sat . [Seas of molten gold]3092-seas of molten gold , strands and [promontories of jasper and amethyst]3093-promontories of jasper and amethyst , [illimitable mountain - ranges]3094-illimitable mountain - ranges , [cities of unimagined splendour]3095-cities of unimagined splendour , all were there in that extent of evening sky . [They]273-the two watched it till the vision wasted before the breath of night .

" What shall [I]130-waymark read ? "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark asked , when the lamp was lit .

" Read that passage in the Georgics which glorifies [Italy]13-italy , "[118-julian] [Julian]118-julian replied . " It will suit [my]118-julian mood to - night . "[118-julian]

[Waymark]130-waymark took down [his]130-waymark Virgil .

" Sed neque Medorum silvae , ditissima terra , [Nec pulcher Ganges atque auro turbibus Hermus Laudibus Italiae certent]93-nec pulcher ganges atque auro turbibus hermus laudibus italiae certent , [non Bactra]94-non bactra , neque Indi , Totaque turiferis Panchaia pinguis arenis . "[130-waymark]

[Julian]118-julian 's eyes glistened as the melody rolled on , and when it ceased , [both]771-both were quiet for a time .

" [Waymark]130-waymark , "[118-julian] [Julian]118-julian said presently , a gentle tremor in [his]118-julian voice , " why do [we]273-the two never speak of [her]4805-her ? "[118-julian]

" Can [we]273-the two speak of [her]4805-her ? "[130-waymark] [Waymark]130-waymark returned , knowing well who was meant .

" A short time ago [I]130-waymark could not ; now [I]130-waymark feel the need . It will give [me]130-waymark no pain , but great happiness . ' ,[130-waymark]

" That is all gone by , "[118-julian] [he]118-julian continued , with a solemn smile . " To [me]118-julian [she]4805-her is no longer anything but a remembrance , an ideal [I]118-julian once knew . [The noblest and sweetest woman [I]118-julian have known , or shall know , on [earth]3320-earth]4806-the noblest and sweetest woman i have known , or shall know , on earth . "[118-julian]

[They]771-both talked of [her]3097-her with subdued voices , reverently and tenderly . [Waymark]130-waymark described what [he]130-waymark knew or divined of the life [she]3097-her was now leading , [her]3097-her beneficent activity , [her]3097-her perfect adaptation to the new place [she]3097-her filled .

" In a little while , "[118-julian] [Julian]118-julian said , when [they]771-both had fallen into thought again , " [you]130-waymark will have [your]130-waymark second letter . And then ? "[118-julian]

There was no answer . [Julian]118-julian waited a moment , then rose and , clasping [[his]118-julian friend]876-his friend 's hand , bade [him]118-julian good night .

[Waymark]130-waymark awoke once or twice before morning , but there was no coughing in [the next room]3088-the next room . [He]130-waymark felt glad , and wondered whether there was indeed any improvement in [the invalid]2552-the invalid 's health . But at the usual breakfast - time [Julian]118-julian did not appear . [Waymark]130-waymark knocked at [his]130-waymark door , with no result . [He]130-waymark turned the handle and entered .

On this same day , [Ida]101-ida was visiting [[her]101-ida houses]3101-her houses . [Litany lane]3102-litany lane and [Elm Court]46-elm court now wore a changed appearance . At present it was possible to breathe even in [the inmost recesses of [the Court]1401-the court]3103-the inmost recesses of the court . There the fronts of [the houses]1394-the houses were fresh white - washed ; in [the Lane]1392-the lane [they]1394-the houses were new - painted . Even the pavement and [the road - way]3107-the road - way exhibited an improvement . If [you]3108-you penetrated into [garrets]3109-garrets and [cellars]3110-cellars [you]3108-you no longer found squalor and dilapidation ; poverty in plenty , but at all events an attempt at cleanliness everywhere , as far , that is to say , as [a landlord]3111-a landlord 's care could ensure it . [The stair - cases]3112-the stair - cases had ceased to be rotten pit - falls ; the ceilings showed traces of recent care ; the walls no longer dripped with moisture or were foul with patches of filth . Not much change , it is true , in the appearance of [the inhabitants]1404-the inhabitants ; yet close inquiry would have elicited comforting assurances of progressing reform , results of a supervision which was never offensive , never thoughtlessly exaggerated . Especially in the condition of [the children]253-the children improvement was discernible . Lodgers in [the Lane]1392-the lane and [the Court]1401-the court had come to understand that not even punctual payment of weekly rent was sufficient to guarantee [them]1404-the inhabitants stability of tenure . Under [this singular lady - landlord]3117-this singular lady - landlord something more than that was expected and required , and , whilst [those who were capable of adjusting [themselves]3118-those who were capable of adjusting themselves to the new regime to the new regime]3118-those who were capable of adjusting themselves to the new regime found , on the whole , that things went vastly better with [them]3118-those who were capable of adjusting themselves to the new regime , such as could by no means overcome [their]3118-those who were capable of adjusting themselves to the new regime love of filth , moral and material , troubled [themselves]3118-those who were capable of adjusting themselves to the new regime little when the notice to quit came , together with a little sum of ready money to cover the expenses of removal .

Among [those whom [Ida]101-ida called upon this afternoon]3119-those whom ida called upon this afternoon was [an old woman who , in addition to [her]3120-an old woman who , in addition to her own voluminous troubles , was always in a position to give a compte - rendu of the general distress of the neighbourhood own voluminous troubles , was always in a position to give a compte - rendu of the general distress of [the neighbourhood]297-the neighbourhood]3120-an old woman who , in addition to her own voluminous troubles , was always in a position to give a compte - rendu of the general distress of the neighbourhood . [People]3402-people had discovered that [her]3120-an old woman who , in addition to her own voluminous troubles , was always in a position to give a compte - rendu of the general distress of the neighbourhood eloquence could be profitably made use of in [their]3402-people own service , and not infrequently , when speaking with [Ida]101-ida , [she]3120-an old woman who , in addition to her own voluminous troubles , was always in a position to give a compte - rendu of the general distress of the neighbourhood was in reality holding a brief from this or [that neighbour]3123-that neighbour , marked , not indeed in guineas , but in " twos "[3120-an old woman who , in addition to her own voluminous troubles , was always in a position to give a compte - rendu of the general distress of the neighbourhood] of strong beverage , obtainable at [[her]3120-an old woman who , in addition to her own voluminous troubles , was always in a position to give a compte - rendu of the general distress of the neighbourhood favourite house of call]3124-her favourite house of call . To - day [she]3120-an old woman who , in addition to her own voluminous troubles , was always in a position to give a compte - rendu of the general distress of the neighbourhood held such a brief , and was more than usually urgent in the representation of a deserving case .

" Oh , [Miss Woodstock]115-abraham , [mem]4808-mem , there 's [a poor young ' oman]4809-a poor young ' oman a - lyin ' at the Clock ' Ouse , as it really makes one 's ' art bleed to tell of [her]4809-a poor young ' oman ! For all [she]4809-a poor young ' oman 's so young , [she]4809-a poor young ' oman 's [a widder]4810-a widder , an ' pr'aps it 's as well [she]4809-a poor young ' oman should be , seein ' how shockin ' [her]4809-a poor young ' oman ' usband treated [her]4809-a poor young ' oman afore [he]4811-he was took where no doubt [he]4811-he 's bein ' done as [he]4811-he did by . It 's fair cruel , [Miss Woodstock]115-abraham , [mem]4808-mem , to see [her]4809-a poor young ' oman sufferin 's . [She]4809-a poor young ' oman has fits , an ' falls down everywheres ; it 's a mercy as [she]4809-a poor young ' oman ' asn't been run over in [the public street]4813-the public street long ago . [They]4814-they 're hepiplectic fits , [I]3120-an old woman who , in addition to her own voluminous troubles , was always in a position to give a compte - rendu of the general distress of the neighbourhood 'm told , an ' laws o ' [me]3120-an old woman who , in addition to her own voluminous troubles , was always in a position to give a compte - rendu of the general distress of the neighbourhood ! the way [she]4809-a poor young ' oman foams at the mouth ! No doubt as [they]4814-they was brought on by [her]4809-a poor young ' oman ' usband 's etrocious treatment .
